name: The Derby
address: 233 E Huntington Dr, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews: We went for St. Patrick’s Day, because they have the softest corn beef I’ve ever had along with mustard and cabbage and carrots, and the dinner was just spectacular. And of course, their cheese bread is to literally die for. Our server was quite pleasant and smiling and full of energy. Looks like they won’t be moving until after the first of the year so they’re in that building for the holidays. That made my mom and I very happy. She’s 84 and I’m 58 and we’ve been going to The Derby for decades. Things seem not to change including Quality which is for the better. Never eaten here. I highly recommended at least once, and especially for a first date that sets quite the rich atmosphere and provides for intimacy as well.

I love a good steakhouse and always look for the closest to my travel destination. The building and atmosphere are nice, and I like the history behind it. Our server was efficient but didn't have much charm, and was supported by others so that we didn't have to wait long for any dish. Overall the food was good, but fell a bit short of my expectations for the price point. French onion soup was delicious, and definitely on point. My NY strip was overdone but still acceptable to eat without asking them to redo it. The green beans were of varying texture and also overcooked. Mushrooms were good and the marsala sauce was a flavorful accompaniment to my steak as an alternative to butter. Salmon was cooked well and sauce was a nice pairing. Desserts were a substantial size, and the creme brulee was larger than you'd receive most places. Triple scoop of sorbet was an assortment of flavors and textures - raspberry (my favorite of the three) was creamy and not sharp, passionfruit was vibrant, but the blood orange was weak on flavor. Bread pudding was more like a dense cake than traditional preparation, but tasted good. Overall it was a satisfying dinner, but I've had much better meals at other fine steakhouses and expected a bit more here.

I've loved this place throughout the years. After a great day down the steeet at Santa Anita, a perfect steak and starters is the only way to finish.

Enjoyed the Calamari, Rib-eye and my date had the Prime rib. The Mac n cheese was delicious, almost like scalloped potatoes meets pasta. Wonderful, attentive service.

Very tasty and a little bit expensive! But all cost every dollar! And we took three cocktails and port wine, they increased an amount...
It was my birthday and Derby gifted me a dessert. Very -very-very pretty place!
The best file minion, very good onion soup, very good appetizers and unbelievable tasty fried bread. I want to return only for this bread!
Hot Margarita is really hot spicy 🔥 I needed to drink it with Pina Colada )))
Beautiful place I will go again.

Absolutely amazing service and food. Bobby M made us feel so welcomed , he was very attentive , helpful and friendly. We enjoyed our food very much, the entire staff was so generous and wonderful 😀 We look forward to co.ing back soon!

name: Craft By Smoke and Fire
address: 400 S Baldwin Ave #905, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: We came here to celebrate my husbands bday. Food was cooked to perfection. Customer service was good. The manager is very kind gave us shots and wrote happy bday in it. We ordered the all smoke platter. We have plenty of left overs for dinner and probably the next day. We ordered it with Mac n cheese, Mashed potatoes, Brussel sprouts and waffle fries. We ate during happy hour and the drinks are buy one and get on free of the same drink.

Very busy place on a Friday night, and a nice selection of items on the menu. The pastrami was amazingly good, I'm so glad I chose it over the brisket - tender and full of flavor. The beef short rib was also very good, moist and tender but not fatty, although the rub was excessively salty. Pickles were perfectly pickled and crunchy. Mud pie was the choice of dessert for several at our table and was enjoyed all around. The service was sufficient but not stellar - some hospitality faux pas like serving drinks by holding the rim, and not bussing any dishes from the table until the very end of the meal. I'd definitely return for more of the delicious meat!

When we first survived, we were sat down in the crowded area Not easy to get to our seats!
Then a sworm of Kids came in at least 20 of them. They were so loud people behind us and in front of us were yelling at each other in order to be able to hear their conversation.
So we were brought our menus. 10 min later we were offered to order our drinks. 10-15 min later we ordered our food.
1 hour later were served. Along with burnt shrimp as an appetizer
Only burnt appetizers arrived at our table. So we just ignored it. Then, as you can tell the picture, I didn't have hardly any Avacado lettuce was just thrown on the plate I had four pecans or nuts in it whatever they are in a few cranberries I had to ask for dressing because some of the dressing was already on it, which I've never had it served. That way they usually put it on the side. And I had to ask for the other fixings Avacado was smooshed in there. He was one little piece like the end of the avocado. .Then one of the guest I brought pulled a hair out of the food. After that, it was very disgusting.
I couldn't eat anymore. Neither could anybody else
Let the waiter know what was going on and he apologize for having our food brought up to us late. He stated that the ticket got lost in the kitchen one and two for the Hair He said he would let his manager know.
And apparently the managers went to the office as we patiently waited 15 minutes for them to arrive. According to the waiter, they might be viewing the cameras that's why they're delaying coming to the table.
There was no reason for us to be dishonest, if anything was more humiliating to the guest that I took of the poor service not only that, but the meat was cold
Everything was not acceptable. Then the manager comes over to tell us that she was not gonna charge us for our alcohol drinks to compensate what we have experience I believe her name was Wendy. Yes, that's her name. Poor management If you look at my other yelp reviews for this restaurant, you'll see the difference in the food!!!

Food was amazing.  The birria quessadilla is a great appetizer and you can never go wrong with a pile of meat for food.  Good place to share plates if you want to try everything.  This version is in the mall and is really light and airy.  Looks totally new, which I think it is.  We got there at 6 on a Monday and it was empty bit filled up fast while we were there.  Came back at 6:15 on a Thursday and it was still empty, but filled up quick.

Very, very bad service. Like extremely bad.

Also want to add they charge a 3% service fee. Since I had already waited so long for my server to come back with my change I did not bring it up and ask why. At this point I was very annoyed considering the place was practically empty besides one large party coming in while I was waiting for my change.

I wanted to leave no tip considering the horrible service, but I left a small tip and took the service fee off the tip as well.

It was nice that we received a free quesadilla but it honestly doesn't make up for it, imo.

name: Little Provence Cafe
address: 1326 S Baldwin Ave, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: For some reason, a search on Google Maps for "coffee" didn't put this one on the map, and I was a half block away at the medical buildings. I'm glad that I saw the sign outside for gourmet coffee! (I was resigned to going to a certain big chain....) I pulled over and parked on the street. What a cute place for sandwiches, pastries, wines and....did I mention coffee? I ordered a cappuccino from a friendly welcoming barista. She made it nice and strong and hot. 👍 ☕️ I want to bring my mom back here for lunch. I love the whole French bistro vibe. (Maybe if I put coffee enough in my review it will pop up on the map next time? I don't know how Google Maps search results work. Coffee. ☕️ Coffee. Coffee was great!)

I have ordered here a number of times, generally taking the time to sit down and eat on the patio with either a book or some work. It is a large, gorgeous patio, surrounded by beautiful, greenery, and shades, that they roll up or down depending on the time of the day. You can never go wrong with a ham and cheese sandwich, but I'm also a major fan of the roast beef. My friend loved the meatloaf, and when I took my mother, she was a big fan of the vegetable quiche she had ordered. I also once tried their chicken wings, which were way too delicious and they are introducing pizza but so far nothing I've ordered or had from here has been bad, so I'll definitely check it out.

Always want to try this cafe. Wow! Very impressive. Much better than my imagine. Semi outdoor setting is so relaxing and cozy. The indoor environment is homey.
I tried my regular  Cafe Latte that they use illy coffee. I think my drip illy coffee is better.🤭
The Orange Cranberry Muffin was so big... Actually I prefer a smaller size. 😄
I enjoyed coffee and muffin plus my Bible reading. Definitely I will go back to enjoy my ME time.
Also, very suitable for girls chit chat gathering.😉

Great food it tasted fresh. We ordered the roast beef and turkey sandwich. Cool spot to eat at. Great customer service. We will be coming back and trying other sandwiches.

Update-We ate here again and again it was delicious but this time we had a chance to meet the owner and his daughter they are so nice and welcoming they walked us in the back to show us how fresh the meat is! I wish I took a picture because it looked delicious. So fresh and great service. I look forward to eating here again!

Update- ate here again and once again amazing!! I ordered the roasted turkey with added bacon 😋

I will continue coming back here. I look forward to trying their pizza next 🍕

I heard a lot of hype from family, so I went to check it out. I've been there twice now. The first time was an OK experience. The food was pricey, and the quality was average. The second time, I ordered an extra meat option on the sandwich. I was charged for it, but it seemed like they used less of the first meat, then added a bit of the second option. It was not worth it. For just one sandwich and a drink, I paid over $25. The size was a maybe a 5-inch baguette slice. The service was neither good nor bad. It was a typical order, pay, and receive transaction. The atmosphere had some cool touches, but in the end, it was still in Temple City. Run down buildings and traffic just outside of the patio. I place more value on the food and the cost.

name: Enlighten Bistro 168
address: 820 S Baldwin Ave, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews:
Newly opened dim sum restaurant adds expanding dim sum culinary options in Arcadia. Occupying the former Marie Calendar's restaurant space, Enlighten Bistro 168 is not a typical dim sum restaurant, it tries to differentiate itself with good foods with contemporary vibes.

Once you walk into the restaurant, you're greeted with a fresh and bright dining area with tables spaced out to create a well balanced feel.

With the modern decor comes with the refreshing friendly service. Unlike other typical dim sum restaurants, the waiters here are dressed in the uniform that's typical for high end restaurants for steaks. The services rendered by the waiters match their uniform. When we dined here, we got excellent service.

The foods are hit and missed. Some are very good but others are just ok. I liked their sticky rice in lotus leaf which had good rice and flavorful fillings. So was the fried noodle with soy sauce, crispy and full of wok Hei.

On the other hand, the Shao Mai was just ordinary. The meat was stale and the flavor was bland.

The prices are on the high side but not out of the extraordinary as compared to Chef Tony next door. Will come back again to try their BBQ stuff and fried rice, I saw a lot people order them.

Drove past this location couple weeks ago and saw long lines out the door so I was intrigued. Decided to visit this past weekend and I was let down by the positive reviews on Yelp. Out of the all the dim sum places in the 626 area, I personally do not believe this restaurant elevated the dishes to what seems like a "high class" dim sum restaurant based on their prices. Most dim sum dishes here at $6.88 each, while there are a few cheaper than that and plenty that are more expensive than that.

The prices obviously don't reflect the size of the dishes. The dumplings I ordered were way smaller than other restaurants. While they tasted okay, I felt the dumpling skin was too thick and made more of a chewy texture to it. The three dumplings we ordered was the Scallop Seafood Dumpling, Leek Dumpling, and Shrimp Dumpling. I do not recommend getting the Baked Radish Puff because it came out cold. It was probably made a day ago and they popped it in the oven or microwave. The Egg Yolk Bao was great; the inside was nice and hot and literally creamy. It's smaller than I imagined but still great to order. I also ordered the Curry Eel Fried Rice but after 35 minutes of order, it did not come out yet. I asked one server where it was and she told me the kitchen was working on it. 10 minutes passed and I asked a different server and she told me they haven't even prepared it. That honestly tells me that there's no communication or they just want you to wait so they don't lost money on dishes.

FYI, the dining area is EXTREMELY SMALL so it's packed. If you're not comfortable with such a tight spot, order to-go. Overall, I don't think I would return for $7 dumplings plus $2 tea per person. I'd rather order a meal from another restaurant that will satisfy my cravings than 3 dumplings.
By far one of the better dim sum places in the greater LA area.  Can get busy so arrive promptly.

Tried their Creamy Egg Yolk Bun, Siew Mai, Har Gow, and Crispy German Pork Knuckle. The Buns and Har Gow were pretty good, nothing unique, but the Siew Mais were probably the JUICIEST ones i've had in a while. Other places offer larger ones in size, but this place definitely has the taste, texture, and quality knocked out of the park  only tiny complaint would be that the prices are about a dollar higher than other places.

The Pork Knuckles took a while to come out, but the taste was BOMB. Crispy & Juicy :)

9/10
Ordered to go last weekend, very good package! The food was AMAZING. Do not forget to try Creamy egg yolk bao(That black-gold bun)!

name: Sunday Cafe
address: food court, 400 S Baldwin Ave FC7, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: Nice place that lets you sample drinks! It’s also right in the Santa Anita mall food court. Super friendly workers and food is delicious. I got a cucumber/lemonade mix which was soooo good and refreshing. Hot dog was pretty good except the bun was split :(
Friendly staff and delicious ice cream for our banana split. You can taste test the Aguas (juices) so you  can choose which one you like the most.

While walking around the mall, I saw some people walking around with giant baby bottles. I was immediately intrigued and wanted one as well.

I found them at the food court, and it felt like a party! Everyone was super friendly, and offered everyone samples! They gave me suggestions as to what to mix, which ones were popular and to try flavors I never would have tried! My favorite was the mango and watermelon, it was very refreshing. If you purchase a baby bottle or duck, they even give you a voucher for a free refill!

Their menu consists of a variety of items, ranging from fun festival food to Mexican food. We decided to try the steak fries and the steak fajitas. The steak fries were topped with a generous portion of sliced steak and delicious cheese. The steak fajitas smelled wonderful! I loved how flavorful the meat was, very well seasoned and really good, even the Mexican rice was delicious.

Can’t wait to come back and try the spiral potatoes and the other Aguas Fresca flavors!

Wow! Delicious aqua Fresca in so many flavors. The potato swirl was really yummy too. The free sample really helped decide what flavor. Vanessa was so sweet and kind. She checked and the potatoes and fish are not fried in the same oil. Ten out of ten totally recommend. Forget Starbucks I’ll take aqua Fresca 😋

Their Agua Frescas are really good! Nice selection of flavors too! And fairly affordable! Always a plus in my books! 👍🏻 My friend ordered their Siu Maai & Haa Gow of all things, AFTER having had Dim Sum too! I have yet to ask him how it tastes. BUT even if you don't believe in those items, everything else I've had here has been pretty good, and I can't complain!

name: Marugame Udon
address: 400 S Baldwin Ave STE R02-L, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: The broth on the noodles got thick and the noodles seemed to get overcooked with time.  The flavor was there and I liked the spicyness.  I just did not like the broth getting to thick.  Over all the food was OK, but would not go back.  There are better noodle places for less the cost.  One more thing check your receipts, they tend to make mistakes and overcharge or charge for items you don't actually purchase. It was not much.  But that is not the point.

This place satisfies my udon craving. Didn't see the musubi that they usually have at the glendale location, but the atmosphere here is more relaxing. Can't really get udon at a lot of spots and the cafeteria style line is quick and convenient.

Great place for udon or Asian food lover!
I think their broth and noodles taste pretty authentic! 😋
The vibe is great, the seatings are nice and clean. It is also in the mall, so definitely a good place for people to hang out!

The staff are very nice as well!!❤️
Food was good but too many flies! Plus a lot of trash and napkins everywhere. Probably won't be back.

I love marugame but we went this weekend and it was a bit of a let down. My girlfriend and i always go and our favorite thing to eat there was the shrimp tempura. This time all the shrimp tempura were all shrunken to the size of my pinky. Before it was a considerable size so we were left disappointed. Might go back again just to check if maybe it was just one batch

name: Ramen Nagi
address: 400 S Baldwin Ave Suite D2, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews:
The dishes are called "king", and it is rightly named. Each bowls are flavored packed in balance with each other. Granted you get to customize alot, but that in itself makes each bowl of noodle more tasty. The main soup base is both impressive and tasty.
The karage shouldn't be skipped either. It was crispy, juicy and flavorful.
Overall it was a fantastic experience. And I understand why there there can be a line on a Tuesday night. Deferred worth it.

Awesome place to get some great tasting ramen! The restaurant was nicely decorated, the staff extremely friendly and of course, the food tasted great. We had the veggie king ramen with an egg add on and spice level 3. Very good. I would definitely add a higher spice next time I go. They have a cool custom menu that you fill out while waiting in line to stream line the process. Big fan of the organization! Highly recommend.

Everything is really good, the ramen is so Japanese to the backbone and before have a seat, you will be requested for customizing your own flavor of soup and the texture of noodles. I like it and definitely will revisit.

Staff is very helpful when it comes to understanding how to fill out the order form while waiting in line. Once seated, your order form is taken by the staff and food came shortly after. About 10 minutes wait after seated.

Food was flavorful and presented beautifully.

Love the squid ink broth!
Tried the Basil ramen this time. Fusion bacon and cheese on the top. Choose no salt to get the perfect taste because the soup base and bacon are already salty.

name: Myung Ga Haejangguk
address: 1220 S Baldwin Ave, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: This place has good Korean food. It's a good place to bring your family or friends. Your mother or grandmother will not complain about the food. They give large portions and the side dishes are really good. Services quick and very friendly. Not many people seem to know about this place which is kind of nice because you don't have to wait in line to get a table. There's plenty of parking in the back. Definitely I will come here again especially with my mom.

First visit today. First review:  5 of had lunch after church today.  My friend picked this place and I was eager to try.

PORK CUTLET.  One of the best pork cutlets I've ever had!  The pork cutlet was flakey and crispy on the outside, yet juicy and tasty on the insides. Tender, not tough. It's definitely one the 3 top dishes to order. So many different sauces. One of my favs.

The most popular was the JOKBAL: Pork feet and hock slices. It's a large dish. Very unique. Must try with a large group (4 to 6 people.)

And lastly 2 different soups.  Galbitang: Beef short rib soup with glass noodles. The noodles were nice snd chewy. And the other one was the milky one. Also good on a cold day.

The service staff spoke fluent Chinese and English. Interesting that I didnt hear any Korean spoken. Im sure the staff are multilingual at this Korean restaurant. Good service.

I came here for dinner on a Sunday night at 630pm and there was a short wait, but the turnover is pretty quick. The ladies here work hard to provide seating for the next party. We were just a party of 2 so we ordered a bossam and galbitang soup. We had plenty of leftovers for the bossam. Everything was delicious, the soup was flavorful and the meat fell right off the bones. The bossam was a 4/5 for us. We’ve had better but this is good for the short drive from home!
Clean place and simple decorations. The place specializes in soup based dishes. The bossam dish we had was very good and big portion. The kimchi dishes were good as well.

Delicious and authentic tasting Sullungtang and Galbitang!! Their garlic kimchi was so addicting too!

Parking is plenty, I appreciate how clean the tables and restaurant is inside, and the employees were nice.

The prices are a little high but lots of places are right now with inflation unfortunately.

name: Din Tai Fung
address: 400 S Baldwin Ave #M5, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews:
Best Taiwanese food I have tried!
Frkn Delicious !
Service was great and our server was so sweet.

Putting my name down in the waiting list was the best option. They take reservations. If you go as a walk in, you might be waiting about 1-2 hours, but all worth it

This place is very good, i don't like that it's located in a shopping mall, we had a party of 7 but online they only allow 6,  we made reservations 2 days prior someone told us to come sometime before our 330 reservation and they'd accommodate us. However, once we arrived, they seemed inconvenienced to cater to 7, even though we put it online 2 days prior.
Thankfully, we didn't wait past our reservation time to be seated. We were served by Yanna, who made sure we were well taken care of the entire time of our visit.
The food is AMAZING!! I've never been here nor any place like it. We ordered many things across the board, and nothing disappointed us. The dessert is fabulous, so if you think you only want 1 order double, especially if sharing 😉 for a group of 7 we spent $645 tip included we also ordered 13 alcoholic drinks.

Would have never tried a place like this but TikTok made me do it.   The menu is intimidating but thankfully I watched a few videos before arriving.  I went with family and 2 of them had been there before.  That was also helpful.  We ordered a lot of different items off the menu and nothing was disappointing.   I put the spicy sauce and spicy mixture on pretty much everything.   A total of 7 of us we paid 645.00.  We got many items and a total of 13 adult beverages.   I highly recommend this place

I was so excited to finally try this place out because they are known for the famous Xiao Long Boa and I remember watching an episode where Anthony Bourdain went to in Taiwan and it was amazing! The wait is usually extremely long so I have waited until now. However, I was left so disappointed. We ordered many different versions of their Xiao long bao and what I was looking forward to that thin wrap around a hot pouch of soup with meat stuffing, but that was not the case that day. The wrapper was deliciously thin as known and I loved it. However, the Xiao long bao was barely warm and there was really no soup. Poked the bao to release soup and it was barely a sliver of soup, tired another one -popped the entire thing in my mouth and it was no soup! It was so dry! It was more dry that the cheap stuff I can get at the supermarket! I was so disappointed! The garlic green bean was pretty good, but nothing special. Pretty expensive for the size though.

Overall, I was diaspponted. It was also pretty expensive for mediocre Xiao long bao. Maybe it was just a one off bad experience, maybe it was the location, maybe they have gone down hill since expanding, who knows.

As with most other locations, the line was long but we were able to walk around the shops while we waited. Our favorite bites were definitely the spicy wontons and garlic string beans. If you like sweet and mochi texture then definitely get the chocolate Xiao long bao.

name: 很酒以前 BBQ BAR
address: 168 Las Tunas Dr #101-102, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: Came here for a friend birthday, they have good selection of skewer items, and a verity of Chinese bottled beverages. The food is delicious, they cook at the back and bring it to you. I really like the tin foil clam and glass noddle, and special beef skewer. Plenty of parking in the plaza. Grilled fish is also very tasty, and can be made not spicy at all.

AYCE Chinese dumplings and small dishes during morning and lunch time. The dishes are the traditional Northeast Chinese cuisine including tofu, pig ears, eggplants, pork rib, cucumber... The dumplings are verified with pork, beef, shrimp with napa cabbage or celery. One can DIY for specific needs like vegetarian requirements. Ones should cook themselves with the pot.  Easy to be full.

This place is the only all you can eat AYCE dumpling restaurant I saw in San Gabriel. It's a small hole in a wall mom and pop shop and you can even see an elderly couple making the dumplings when you enter the restaurant.

The place is small. When I came in, no one spoke english. One of the waitress came with a translator machine and that was the first time I communicated with one of the staff. Someone came over and put a pot of boiling water on the portable stove on our table. We are given a big tray with ladle.

The dumplings are on trays of 8 pcs and I thought we have to grab each tray. I was wrong. I grabbed 5 trays of different dumplings so I got full adter eating 40. I didn't know that I need to use the BIG tray that is put on the table with a big ladle. You will use that tray to pick the dumplings you want from the freezer and put it on your tray. You will then boil these dumplings until they float. Wait for a few more minutes to cook the internal of the dumplings. There are also some appetizers like kimchi, eggplant, bean sprouts and fish balls on the other side of the freezer.

There are black, red vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, sesame oil and chili oil that you can mix for the dumpling sauce.

The dumplings are delicious and fresh. We tried their beef, shrimp and vegetable dumplings.

This place is worth it if you have the big appetite to eat dumplings. But they have a limit. Only 1 hour for AYCE dumplings.

They are serving AYCE dumpling here!
It is pretty interesting! And very affordable!
The appitizers are also included. They even give away toy bears!

I heard about this place from my mom and wanted to try it. I’ve always loved skewers and this place had it all. We got lamb, beef, potato, and they even have fried bread (super delicious!) they also have mains like fried rice and innovative dishes like grilled cold noodle. The only thing I wish I could have done is take advantage of their drink specials!

name: XIANG JI
address: 411 E Huntington Dr #101D, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews: This might have been the quickest meal we've had in months. We had the traditional minced pork noodles, the peeled chili pork dumplings, and the coriander pork dumplings. All of which were good. We also enjoyed their "hot and spicy sauce" (it was a bit like a fermented chili paste) and their chili oil, which was dark and a bit smoky. Everything was flavorful and the service from the waitress was friendly and fast.
Their stewed beef noodles were very delicious. The beef was well cooked and flavorful. The broth was tasty. The service was good.

Delicious beef noodle soup.  You can taste the rich flavors and the time preparing the soup base.  The noodle is not the common wide noodles used in other beef noodles.

The side dishes are decent and served warm, though I personally prefer serve cold.

We tried the stinky tofu which comes in its soup base.  It is not deep fried which makes the fermentation flavor stronger and actually more effort to enjoy.

Authentic Taiwanese beef noodle spot. Perfectly balanced soup with tender beef. It’s right next to the famous Lan Zhou noodle house so it was honestly a little hard to find at first. But it’s literally right next to it so it’s easy to miss.

We ordered the braised seaweed, egg, bean curd and garlic cucumber as a starter.

We got the premium beef noodle and just a regular beef noodle. I would recommend the premium more just because it has some tendon on it so it makes it even chewier and for some reason the meat with tendon so much juicer and softer.

I thought the soup base was very well balanced. Often times you can taste either the grossed pack more or the soy sauce but this one was right in the middle and hit the sweet spot. They also have the clear broth beef noodle so I will def try to get that next time as that is a little more difficult to perfect in flavor.

We also go a side of stinky tofu which was also super good. For those risk takers out there this is Taiwans fermented tofu and it’s def acquired taste. But for those who like stink tofu I would highly recommend it!
The noodles will heal your weary soul. Excellent texture and perfect spice level. The staff is attentive And friendly. Thank you

name: Villa Catrina
address: 251 N Santa Anita Ave, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews: The atmosphere and decor are awesome, and the service was outstanding. Plenty of dining space inside and in their covered patio, and the bar is cool. Food was prepared and served very fast the presentation was beautiful. Salsa and guacamole were good an tradtionally prepared. Flavors in the main dishes were a bit lacking for me - the tomato sauce for my steak ranchero was good but primarily a mild tomato sauce. Beans were lacking flavor (maybe because I asked for no cheese and that's where the flavor is) and quite runny. Shredded beef inside the tacquitos was tasty. Would have liked fresh tortillas rather than pre-packaged ones. Overall it was a decent lunch and I'd recommend the place for the service and decor alone.

I don't know -- maybe it was just us when we visited (a sleepy Monday after the lunch rush hour), but the server or the kitchen got a couple of the orders for our party of 9 incorrect, despite coming back after taking the orders to verify each of our orders. My soft tacos were on the mushy side, the enchilada sauce was somewhat sweet, and the rice (normally a highlight for me at Mexican restaurants) was mushy. The inside was also rather dim. Again, maybe it was just me or the particular time of day, but just trying to call it as I experienced it.

Love it here! Taco Tuesday is the best deal. Crispy Chicken Taco or 2 Street Tacos with rice, beans, and your choice of a beer or margarita for $12. Can't beat it! Friendly and attentive staff. Full menu also great, and love their margaritas.

Ordered salmon w/broccoli/cauliflower, white rice with butter wine sauce.  So yummy !Chips and salsa were nice and hot. Chicken 🐔 mole enchiladas looked great too.  I will definitely go back there to eat !

Highly recommend for any type of events , we held my sister xv and it was the best experience  ever . My parents also had their wedding . We have gone through them for a multiple  events already. Thank you so much 💓

name: Shwe Taung Restaurant
address: 305 N Santa Anita Ave Suite A, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews: Wow, what an incredible dining experience! The food at Shwe Taung Restaurant was truly exceptional. Every dish we ordered was expertly prepared, presented, and bursting with flavor. The service was top-notch, with friendly and attentive staff who made sure our every need was met.

The food here was amazing!!! Super affordable price!! I’ve tried most of the food here. Plus, the food itself will take you back as if ur eating in Myanmar. The service was fast and very friendly. Highly recommend to anyone!!  Definitely gonna come back again !!!

Enjoyed their Royal Tea-Leaf salad. Always get this dish at any Burmese restaurant. So many great fresh flavors and textures once all mixed up together.

Beef Briyani was a favorite of my wife. Paratha was light, crispy, and quickly devoured by my kids while still warm. Had to try the Mohinga, unique to Myanmar tradition. All food with comforting home-cooked feel and nicely balanced.

New owner and staff accommodating and friendly. Kept prior Japanese menu so now can travel thru East Asia to South Asia with their varied offerings representing the entire wide region all in one restaurant.

Must eat here if your looking for a delicious place to eat sushi rolls. Service is great, portions are generous. They didn't have crunchy roll in the menu but they made it for me. Just opened like a couple weeks ago so they have 50% off on most food. Highly recommend.

We were a bit nervous about trying Burmese food for the first time but the server was very kind, and explaining which items he liked. He gave us time to think about our orders, and came over once we rang a little bell at the table (neat idea!). The food was excellent! I got some garlic noodles with chicken and it was so damn good. My dad said the teriyaki chicken was the best teriyaki he has had. My brother loved his beef curry and my mom enjoyed her coconut noodle soup! They did have to do some replacements since they ran out of ingredients but that makes sense since it was so tasty! Wonderful experience, would be back and wishing this restaurant success

name: Cabrera's Mexican Restaurant
address: 625 Live Oak Ave, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews: This was an amazing find! Authentic Mexican food and service. I had the Mole Enchiladas, Coconut Margarita, and Churros - all amazing! I especially loved the mole - not too sweet, and with a subtle kick! Recommend 100%

Our dear friends of ours recommended try out the food at Cabrera's Mexican  restaurant in Arcadia.   This is our first time at the restaurant our friends told us the food is amazing good and also their alcoholic drinks   were awesome they say.     We came to the restaurant  at Friday night it kinda pack full of customers enjoy company with friends  and having with a great time.

We got seated right away and one of  waiter hand us the menu and also got our drinks order.  We look at the menu and decided to order the two.or three combination plate.   My order the two item combinations a taquito and a chili renello and I order the three item plate comes with two hard shell chicken tacos and a chili renello.   Then waiter brought us our meal it looks very good then I took some bite of the bean and rice full of flavors in both items the beans have great flavors with cheese  amazing and rice season well with spice that make rice full of flavor.

The chile relleno was one of the best chile relleno I ever eaten.   Throught years I have tasted many version of chile relleno but this chile relleno have so much flavor in one bite.  The hard shell chicken tacos were very good crunchy I enjoy it.   My wife enjoy her meal very much.    Our waitess was very  friendly and also  the staff of the restaurant.    When check with Yelp I received a free flan it was so good we enjoy..
Excellent food and service. Portions are massive and great value. Both indoor and outdoor seating is nice. Unassuming from the outside; this was a really nice surprise.

This place is so nice and clean. And the food is to die for
The people that work here are awesome.
I would come here just for the atmosphere.
Please come and enjoy.
You will not be disappointed

It was really good eating here. The seats are comfortable. The food was really good. The service was great. I really enjoyed my food here. The waitress was very kind. She was very kind to get me a herbal tea bag for my lemon 🍋 tea. I really needed a hot tea. I was very pleased. The price is understandable and fair. If I remember correctly, it was around $50 for 2 people. I would come again with friends or family.

name: BJ's Restaurant & Brewhouse
address: 400 E Huntington Dr, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews:
Came in on Saturday for a quick and simple bday dinner. Turns out our server Kaitlynn made it exceptional with her professional and friendly service!! It was a pretty busy Saturday around 9:40pm and the majority of the restaurant were seated with customers. Kaitlynn still went to all her tables and greet/check on all her customers. She came over apologizing for such a wait and got our orders. We ordered our usual, Avacado Egg Roll, Couscous Mac and Cheese Balls, Prime Rib, Clam Chowder, Strawberry Dream and etc. As soon as we finished ordering, our soup and drink had already arrived. I never experienced such speedy service at any other BJ's before. However, as we were finishing our soup, our Prime Rib dinner came before our appertizer (which was confusing but we were hungry and didn't care anyways!) Later, as we were finishing our Prime Rib, our appertizer came at the same time Kaitlynn came and checked on us. She noticed that our steak came before the appertizer and apologized for the service but we understand that it wasn't her fault anyways. It wasn't a big deal to us anyways as long as we get the foods we ordered. Later we got the famous pizookies and we got both the salted caramel and chocolate chunk. They were both amazing. Kaitlynn lighted a cute candle as she wishes me a happy birthday! At the end, she also wrote a happy birtdhay on my receipt!!

I can't express how Kaitlynn made my day so much better with her cute, friendly and professional service!! She is one of the best server I had experienced at any BJ restaurant!! She pays attention to her guests and noticed all the little details! I rather drive a bit longer to have such an amazing experience than to save on commute time!! Again, thank you Kaitlynn for such an amazing experience!!

Came on Tuesday for the $5 Pizookie deal. The “fresh strawberries” are frozen. You know when you get fresh cut fruit and they have the taste like the onions or vegetables that were chopped on the cutting board before? That’s exactly how they tasted. Maybe the chefs didn’t wash their hands or the cutting board but it was not pleasant. The cookie in the pizookies are all not fully cooked. Very gummy, soft, and undercooked. Not many people in the late afternoon and there is a free parking lot. They have a bar with the games playing. We were greeted walking in by staff. Our server was alright. Nothing extraordinary. He did let us know that if we signed up on the BJ app, all our pizookies would be free though so we did take advantage of that deal. Overall very underwhelming experience.
Such a great place to dine at.  Our waitress Anastasia was so wonderful and made some great food recommendations. I would definitely recommend the avocado rolls and their soups!
Our server Marie, was amazing! Very attentive and friendly. Brought the correct orders and continuously asked us if we needed anything. Food was delicious! Would definitely come back again!

We ate dinner here tonight. This place stays busy but the wait is not long. Looks like a good place to watch a game, get drinks and food.

I had their Weekend Prime Rib dinner. It comes with soup or salad and 2 sides dishes. I selected their Garlic Vegetables and a baked potato. The Prime Rib was a very nice cut - very tender, tasty and good size portion. I’d order it again, it also included their Pazooki for desert. $35

My son had the Fish & Chips (he said it tasted good) but to me: the 4 small/medium fillets were pretty thin and a little over done (in my opinion) My son liked it so that was all that mattered.

My daughter had there Lemon Chicken breast served over mashed potatoes with a side salad. She enjoyed it and said it had good flavor.

We had a nice server who was attentive and knew how to run her station. If you are in the area and want a variety of food choices and drinks - then stop by and visit.

name: Kazu Mori
address: Inside H Mart, 1101 W Huntington Dr, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews:
They make it fresh, so it's best to order first, then get groceries, then pick up your food. Maybe the best katsu I've ever had. The portions are massive! They do not skimp at all. And it was still crisp when I got home.

For vegetarians, the tofu katsu is really good and also a big portion.

After success with the jajiang noodles, I had to try the stall right next door.  Inside the fantastic Hmart market, is Kazu Mori. I’d say Katsu is there specialty with pork and chicken. I had the pork tonkatsu with curry. Huge portions and so good.  I actually thought I was a bit pricey bit after I saw the quality and portions, I reconsider.  Also, not a   Bricks and mortar saves a bit.

I think the key is to get a bunch of people and order two or three items from each stall. The choice are fantastic.

I’ve had the chicken katsu curry here many times and I’ve never been disappointed. It has become a go-to.

Portions are huge, service is quick, and the restaurant is conveniently located inside the h-mart.
One of the best chicken katsu in the area. The pieces of chicken are a decent size and flavorful. The prices have gone up over time, but the flavor she size of the meal hasn't.

Quick Summary
Located inside the H-Mart food court, this curry spot is pretty good, but the excellent boost rating is for the super large portions. Easy parking in the H-Mart plaza

Food- 5 stars
Ordered the pork curry katsu. Food was pretty good and standard. But they probably gave the largest portions I've seen at a curry katsu spot. Extra star for the large portions

Service- n/a
Fast casual restaurant where you order up front and pick up your order when the loudspeaker announces your order number. The public tables can be a bit grimy because there isn't someone who cleans hourly (appears only during closing time)

Bottom Line
Solid curry spot with super large portions. Come in hungry or prepare for leftovers! Would recommend trying multiple spots in the food court and making it family style, so you can try a little bit of everything

name: Shrimp House - Arcadia
address: 4488 Live Oak Ave, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews: I remember when they were in El Monte, and now this is my first visit to this location. The service and food are delicious! The clam chowder is exceptional! There's plenty of seating and parking.
Great place for some seafood. Check out the daily menu that's discounted. Shrimp scampi OMG! I highly recommend going with family and friends.

First time here and the food was really good.

Good crisp on the shrimp and the flavor was the bomb and fried golden brown the way I like it.👍

Very disappointed,  I have been going to shrimp house for 30 years,  El Monte now in Irwindale . Driving from Chino to enjoy Shrimp House unfortunately the shrimp was not the jumbo shrimp i got medium shrimp for the price of jumbo shrimp,  shrimp sauce, hot mustard was rotten and watered down . As well as other customers were disappointed. This used to be the BEST place to eat  Shrimp . I traveled far . NO LONGER.  I did ask waitress ,but all they could say was new owners! Im going to miss the Shrimp House but not the same food.
Amazing! I love this place, the service is great, the food is delicious! Looove the nautical theme! I recommend the Boston Clam Chowder, it’s so thick and creamy!

name: Matt Denny's Ale House Restaurant
address: 145 E Huntington Dr, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews: We had a party of 6 and had a reservation via Google. There was a groovy live blues band playing on the patio as we dined inside. Food and service were excellent. I had not been since pre covid and was worried it might not hold up to my expectations, but I was pleasantly surprised. Excellent dinner!

I used to enjoy having breakfast at Matt Denny's Restaurant because of the good food and friendly service. However, today's experience was quite disappointing. The waitress was rude and discriminatory. She served me coffee without a plate or spoon and didn't ask what type of coffee I wanted. I had to ask for cream separately, while other tables received warm and attentive service.The coffee was cold, the omelette was dry, the steak was overcooked and had an unpleasant smell, and the hash browns were very dry and tasted awful. This was a stark contrast to my previous visits, where the food and service were much better. Unfortunately, this experience has left a negative impression, and I hope the restaurant addresses these issues.

***Green bay Packer Bar****
We attended their St Patty's Day celebration and we had such a great time, good crowd, good people, we loved all the decorations and the effort put forth making this a good event, from the kitchen staff who was busting their butts to bring out all the orders to the waitress's who were making sure all patrons were being tended too! 🍀🍀🍀🍀

***Happy hour nazis.*** Sat down at 6:01 (happy hour is till 6pm) and couldn’t order off the happy hour menu. Bartender was nice and offered me to order off the happy hour menu only after I finished my beer and was leaving but it turned into a thing and didn’t want to eat there anymore.
I get that the happy hour was over and is systemically closed but there should be some leniency especially of an establishment like this that’s been around for years and years.
Good beer selection.

This happened on a Friday about 2 weeks ago. Matt Dennys has always been a favorite of ours. They started having entertainment in the patio. Some of the entertainment have a large following so they are packed! It appears that now the priority is the entertainment area. We came for dinner not interested in the music outside. We obtained a booth inside and after a while obtained a menu from a server who appeared to be frantic. The menu was snatched from us after a short view for use outside, they were short of menus. We waited 25 minutes for the server to take our order. She never came back. I had to go to the Manager and ask if someone could take our order. He said he would send someone over. After awhile the Manager came and said he had to take our order himself. We waited 45 minutes observing the food going out the door to the patio. Finally another server came by and told us she would check on our order. She never came back!! By 8:30pm (we arrived before 7:00pm) I told my boyfriend “Let’s Go!”
The meal I ordered with hopes of eating a hour earlier was now too heavy a meal to eat at this hour. WE WALKED OUT. We did get our glass of wine 🍷!  Matt Denny’s has apparently taken on the hoards of people in the patio without the staff to handle that and the patrons inside. I hope they are making tons of money because that appears to be their focus. This was not the first incidence regarding  poor service but we wanted to give them another try. Not going back.

name: Flavor Fusions
address: 420 S 1st Ave, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews: Service was very good. Owner was nice. I got the chicken katsu donburi 10/10. My SIL got the pork katsu donburi 10/10. A great place to go for great food.

Great little place! Most people do carryout, but we did their outdoor seating. We got udan, their bento, a smoothie, and a lemonade. Everything tasted great, and the workers were super friendly. Prices were very reasonable as well!
Great little eatery - fair prices and good portions. Their lunch bento boxes are great. They have a covered outdoor patio for eating.  Food made quickly.  Will come again!

New place opened after Covid. This is the old location of Bento-Ya where they closed down during Covid. Very excited to see a new restaurant opens up. Flavor Fusions serve fusion Japanese food. Everything on the menu is awesome! I love the outdoor patio for dine-in. Yes they only have outdoor seating, no indoor. Which is nice for the weather lately around 60's to 70's. Well I can't imagine how we can eat there later in the summer when the weather is gonna go up to 90's-100's!

We order two drinks and two food this time:

Drinks:
1. The well-known drink here - Ovaltine Volcano. Taste exactly like what we had when we were little. Sweet and creamy!
2. Passion Fruit Green Tea - I had it less sweet less sugar. Perfect amount of sweetness and very tasty.

Food:
1. Udon Carbonara - Very creamy and greta taste. It's just the size is smaller then a usual dish. But I think with the price you pay, this is valuable.

2. Ebi (shrimp) Katsu Sandwich - The shrimp Katsu is crunchy outside and juicy inside. The white bread they use is not like those store bought loaf bread. Very soft and milky.

A very cute Japanese Fusion place. Very reasonable price without lowering the quality. I would recommend this place to anyone.

This place is a gem! The owner came out and talked to us, he was so sweet with my daughter. The food is fantastic!
We ordered tempura Udon sooooo yummy!!! Tempura and chicken wings were fried perfectly. The teriyaki beef bowl is so yummy! The rice soaked up just the right amount of sauce. All the drink options were awesome, the Thai tea is great. 10/10 recommend this place.

name: Tokyo Wako Arcadia
address: 401 E Huntington Dr, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews: my friends took my here for my birthday and the food is so delicious! The chefs put on an impressive show and everyone is super polite and helpful. Great customer service and super yummy food. loved it all

I am at a loss of how to review it. The food seemed delicious and the chef was friendly and put a nice show. It is expensive but i thought i deserved a nice meal.  Afterwards, about 20-25 min after I left I got really sick to my stomach. I still am, writing this review on the toilet boo.

My son and I were very pleased by the service as we walked in. Staff were so nice and helpful. It was our first time there and it was worth it. The food was delicious and its presentation was beautiful. We will return and try more of the menu.
The restaurant was a bit warm for such a hot day and all the grills on high.  The server was kind, as was the chef.  The food was good.   The soup was extremely tasty. Nice night out.

Came here for an early dinner. Colleague and I were the only ones there, and we got a teppenyaki show all to ourselves. I ended up getting the chicken and shrimp combo. It was a decent teppenyaki. Portions were not as big as what I'm used to at a teppenyaki. I typically have enough for left overs for what I pay. You get rice as part of the meal, but noodles are extra charge. Overall this restaurant was very good.

name: Longitude 118
address: 130 Huntington Dr, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews:
Longitude 118 is a lovely and modern American for all-day dining at Le Méridien Pasadena Arcadia. I came here just for a reg coffee and butter croissant. Both were good. Atmosphere was very relaxing. Female staff is cute, amiable and professional. Prices were economically high. Service was on point.

Overall, I had a good order experience. I recommend it.

Went with a friend to check this place out for happy hour yesterday. It was Wed at 5pm and the bar area was very low key and mellow. It got busier as time went by. There were two bartenders and service for drinks and food was okay. Enjoyed the popcorn tempura appetizer the best (we tried them all). I had the fuschia fascinator and it was good. They didn't have the apple tart available though which was a bummer. However would go back.

name: The Barn
address: 815 W Naomi Ave, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews:
Loved the barn! Had a lifechanging stinky tofu dish and haven’t stopped thinking about it three days later. The sweet potato fries were drizzled in honey yummm

Lots of vegetarian options! Attentive servers! All around great experience

The beef noodle soup is absolutely terrible. They literally dumped a jar of Sichuan sauce in there, you could see a thick layer of the sauce, tingles to your bones.

The skewers are amazing, everything from the seasoning to flavor to quality of meat is PERFECT. they also have wife selection of drinks to choose from.

Service is a little non caring, have to wave them over for anything.

The food is absolutely delicious no doubt about that. Very cultural. I'd recommend trying the smoked chicken heart and fish chin. The service was very friendly and helpful. Very nice staff. The staff was very concerned about their food quality which is always nice. They were willing to go above and beyond to meet our needs.  definitely give this place a try
Tasty and delicious. Really like this place, Japanese drinking foods. My favorite dish is the crispy pork intestine. Also the yakitori is on point and highly recommended.

Don't really understand why so many people lined up for it. The taste of food is around average and some of the dishes was super salty that we had to drink lots of water to dilute it. Beef tongue is not really authentic JP yakitori style but the Korean BBQ AYCE style that cost $10 for around 6 pcs? With the price and food quality, I don't think this is worth the money.

name: Benihana
address: 400 S Baldwin Ave, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews:
There is no doubt that I have selected this place to celebrate Mother's Day.   We have over 10 people, seniors, kids, and adults.

What I love ❤️ is being able to capture the memories together.  They took a group picture for us, printed it out, and gave us 5 copies, which we can share.

Not taking about the price, we all love the onion soup 😋,  it's so yummy.  The steaks, lobsters, scallops, and shrimps were all delicious.  It's very flavor, not so salty, but you can tell the texture has lots of garlic in it.

It's recommended if you're happening to be nearby.  It is the best location to be walking around the shopping mall after you're full.

Came to celebrate my birthday and my daughter’s birthday. What a great time we had Kayla took our order and Holly was our chef. The food and service were outstanding. The rice was cooked and seasoned to perfection. My steak just melted in my mouth bursting with flavor. The salad and soup are a must. The matcha ice cream is not too sweet but the perfect matcha flavor. Monica was super sweet and helped us too. The bathrooms are clean and plenty of parking. Ten out of ten totally recommend. Holly did an amazing job preparing our food and entertaining us. Wonderful location to celebrate.

Our chef Chris was extremely nice and entertaining. It’s like you get a 2 in 1 food and entertainment! Chris was making the table Wow and had even the kids entertained. Service from him was great he was very attentive. I had the filet mignon and chicken with fried rice and it was a 10/10! Be sure to ask for spicy mayo sauce on the side you won’t be disappointed. I will be coming back and asking for the same chef. Our server I believe his name was Edwin, refilled our drinks constantly and also refilled sauces quickly! No complaints here!!

The Chef Kevin was awesome. Great show.
The menue was also great. Prices have been ok.
But the time betrays the check in and the final placing at the table is absolutely unacceptable. We’ve had to wait 1h and we had a reservation.

It’s been a decade since I’ve been to Benihana and the experience is amplified by the cook and the company that you are sat with. We got a good cook bad company. Food was good, but the wow factor is the theatrics from the chef.

name: Mixabowl
address: 400 S Baldwin Ave, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews:
I always order a restaurant's specialty as-is, and this was no exception. I chose the chef's choice bibimbap, which was labeled as the best KBBQ bowl of 2017. I thought the beef bulgogi and kimchi pork paired very well with the rest of the dish.

They also have a beef ramen deal going on for about $8+tax. I ordered it and I’m pretty sure the noodles are just instant ramen. However, it does come with a side of rice, cucumbers, and kimchi, so it’s a good amount of food for that price.

The restaurant was dark and quiet, despite the presence of several groups of people. It was also a bit warm so I decided to eat outside. The restaurant is located right in front of the playground, so if you can tolerate the screams of 20+ children, you can enjoy your meal outside like I did, haha.

Located in the promenade area just outside of Macy's. I go here anytime I'm in the area. You get a ton of food for the money and it all tastes amazing. Especially the bulgogi and kimchi pork! Highly recommended. They can be a bit understaffed at times, so just be patient.

My new favorite spot for a bowl! The woman who worked there was so helpful and incredibly nice. It was my 1st time here and she was offering me so many delicious samples! The flavors of the beef, sauce was so tasty. I will be back :) I created my own bowl and the serving size is huge! Tastes so fresh
We love this place simple, fresh ,good prices , different choices 😋the spice tofu is so good also to mix with the grilled chicken the green sauce mix is great.

Pretty good Americanized Korean food. Pick whatever you want from base to protein. If you don't like it, it's your fault because you chose your mix. Tastes very good and probably would come back every time I come to this mall.

name: Mélange
address: 130 W Huntington Dr, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews:
I really wanted to love this place! Especially since we picked this place to have our mother’s day brunch!

Service: they demand 21% gratuity _ I wouldve expected their service to be better. We waited a long time even to get a glass water. It took even longer for our drinks and ten times longer for our actual meals.
There was only one waiter and no one else checked on us.

Food: for starters we have the avocado toast. This made my husband and I so sick!
My stomach started hurting and thankfully we live 5 minutes away, I had to rush to the bathroom. My husband hasnt left the toilet in over 20 minutes
-main course: Karaage chicken and ube waffles - chicken did not taste fresh, it tasted like reheated chicken and there was NO ube taste in the waffles and barely any fruit
Chilaquiles - it looked like nachos with two sunny side up eggs
American breakfast- nothing special just scrambled eggs and potatoes and bacon

Dessert: a mix of cakes and pastries - the kids loved it of course but I didnt care for it that much

Overall it was not worth $350 especially we were forced to pay $50 for tip

We will not be returning. I’m still sick from brunch

Came here for brunch. Food was excellent! Drinks were amazing (both mock and alcoholic). The gelato was good too! I would recommend the trio sandwich and the poke and hamachi. The charcuterie board was good too.  My wife and kids loved all the cheeses on that board.  Meat and fig jam was good too.  The coffee was excellent too.  Steak was good, but on the thin side. Overall no complaints.  I would definitely come back.  I also recommend all the mock drinks, they were all tasty.

We had mixed feelings about Melange. The place is gorgeous. Our waitress was really great and couteous. The food was hit and miss and took quite a while to arrive. My fish and dumpling dish was great but the steaks for our colleagues were very over done versus the medium order. They have a very good matcha basque cheese cake. Overall it could be better.

Updating for the High tea and Highballs experience!

Wonderful tea time! The service was attentive, the tea was great, we had the earl grey , jasmine and oolong. Two of us had the regular Chinese tea set, one had the hi-ball tea set that came with 2 cute little pancakes topped with caviar, which were delicious, and a very good tea-infused highball cocktail.
Gave the food 4 stars instead of 5 because of the scones, Devonshire cream, and mochi ball skewer. The vanilla and matcha scones looked lovely, but were crumbly, they fell apart when trying to spread the cream and lemon curd on it. Secondly, although the menu said there’d be Devonshire cream, it was actually more like or butter, thicker consistency and not sweet. Lastly, the 3 mochi balls on a pretty skewer were not what was expected. They weren’t actually mochi, they were dango, more densely packed rice balls that had the consistency of hard playdoh. We saw that other tables left only these dango balls on their tea tray as well. But other than these, the rest of the food was wonderful, esp the taro mochi , smoked salmon sandwich , lobster & egg salad sandwich , and shitaki mushroom with truffle aioli sandwich.

We had the DineLA menu and it was such a good value, at $55 per person! The food was absolutely delicious and the service was wonderful. I didn’t post the other courses or dessert, they came out too blurry, but there were several courses , each one was fabulous. I’d love to come back to try their high tea.

I had a wonderful business dinner in their private dining room. It was a great place for it, it offered privacy yet had big windows looking down into the main dining room. The server was fantastic and the food amazing. High recommend the restaurant and if you need a private dining experience their 3 room are perfect.

name: Moxie Izakaya Restaurant & Karaoke
address: Top Floor, 1205 S Baldwin Ave Unit A, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: I visited just a few weeks ago and I can proudly say that this is one of the best Karaoke places I have ever been to. The service is  great and the food arrived fast. While also mainting a high level quality. The projectors showing the visuals also improved the atmosphere along with the music.

Very limited song list. They'd be better off paying two separate services to include not only pop songs. Th food qualify is similar to that of a vending machine. Cocktails are mostly sugar. They booted us out at 9 pm without warning of closing time.

We visited in 2019. We were looking for a place to chill and have food and drink. We were new to the area and after asking around this place was recommended to us. The bouncer was nice but the nice experience ended there. We stood inside near the front for awhile and we were finally approached by a waiter. We let them know we were interested in a table. After waiting 10 minutes as staff passed us by we felt uneasy. It felt as if they did not want us there. It's funny reading the reviews the experience we were expecting everyone else seemed to recieve. We eventually left after feeling we were in a gangster bar and were unwelcomed guest. We were terribly disappointed.

****!!! It's on the second floor of the parking lot stairs right next to Burlington !!!***

So I couldn't find the place so I spent some time just walking looking for it but once I realized to call and ask they picked up the phone right away and directed me and also took me even though there was just 20 minutes left ( I said please 🥺 ) so I quickly ordered from the items available on the menu at that time and the staff was so nice and the food came out so fast and also they helped me charge my phone 📱 I would totally come back and also everything is delicious I highly recommend the onion rings, gyoza, egg rolls , and shumai :-) goes amazing with Sapporo ( they recommended the beer)

This place is amazing! Clean, organized and so much fun! Shout out to the entire staff for being professional, kind, and accommodating. My family and I had an absolute blast tonight.  The food was surprisingly fresh and tasty as well! This is the best karaoke venue I have been to in LA. Much more welcoming and fun than some sketchy places in Ktown. Their hourly and minimums are extremely reasonable. If you want to have an all around great experience, book one of their awesome rooms. Five stars for cleanliness as well! Thank you for a great birthday booking!

name: Garden Café - Arcadia
address: 850 S Baldwin Ave, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: This place has a big menu with various types of food from east to west as it is Hong Kong style. The food portion is big and the meat/seafood dish comes with a lot of protein. You can consider this place cheap given the amount of food. The server is nice and the food taste is quite decent - not super flavorful but moderate good flavor. The secret item we want to try is souffle. Yes the French fancy dessert! But it takes 45 minutes to make. So make sure you order that right when you enter the restaurant. I want to come back to try the souffle!

Small little café selling mostly Hong Kong style comfort foods. However, they also have Japanese and western items.

The service is very friendly and the staff are very helpful. The portion sizes for the prices are very large and reasonable. I would highly regret the mapo tofu, and the Angus Steak and Salmon or the Grilled Filet Mignon and Chicken Steak. Chicken wings and corn soup are also really good.

Been here a few times.
The food is always good since HK Cafe, you can get breakfast even dinner time, with a lot of variety and blend of Asian and American foods.
This morning, it took almost 45 mins to get our food, and they got the order wrong on one plate, sent back, then the correct plate came out.
Other than that, overall like the place and opens late in case in need of late night meal or snack.

The chicken salad was ok here. :)
I needed this.
Lately, I have not been eating enough salad.
The honey and lemon drink 🍋 was ok, too.

I appreciate the service here. 🙏

I know this restaurant since 1997 at valley boulevard and came back again.
The food still amazing, we came for breakfast, we like the pork porridge a lot of pork and came with tasty dumpling.
Also i had porkchop with eggs and sweet honey bread, this is a recommended menu for porkchop lover.
Everything came with coffee and tea with sweet milk.
Overall Great breakfast...

name: Moffett's Family Restaurant & Chicken Pie Shoppe
address: 1409 S Baldwin Ave, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews:
First off, let me state that I thoroughly enjoyed my dining experience.
The two strongest points about this place are the extremely friendly service and the comforting time capsule feel of the place.
That being said, I found the star of my meal, the chicken pot pie, to be nothing truly remarkable.
Before I go any further, I don't like posting reviews that are not super positive unless I actually had a miserable experience, which I didn't.
Would I return to this place?
Yes, absolutely!
Would I drive all the way up from Long Beach to go here, probably not, unless I was meeting a like-minded person who enjoys time capsule dining as much as I do.
You get a lot of food for your money!
The side salad, which comes with green bean salad on top of it was actually quite tasty, though might be off-putting to some.
The dinner rolls were soft, delicious and melted in my mouth.
I would probably try the chicken pot pie again, just perhaps with the gravy on the side.
The mashed potatoes are what really made me sad.
I don't usually get snobbish about food, and I grew up with instant mashed potatoes, but these were really not enjoyable.
Maybe it was just an off day for that batch of potatoes?
I still ate them as I dislike food waste, but I would definitely avoid them next time.
My dinner even came with a choice of dessert.  I picked the rice pudding, which was excellent and my favorite part of the meal by far!
If I'm in the area again I'd love to try this place out for breakfast.
You can truly tell it is beloved by locals, and for good reason!
My only other piece of advice for the owners would be to change out the light bulbs for something a little warmer.  The cool white light bulbs they have in the majority of the fixtures really clash with the vintage 70s vibes, especially the ones over the counter!
This place has been going strong for 49 years. (Since 1975)
I hope they keep going for another 49 at least!

I was staying at a friends house and asked if any of his local places did proper wholesome food and he recommended here! He also said it was family run, which a major plus for me, as I like to support such places if I can.

We went along and after a fun chat with the waitress, placed our orders. We had soup and salad for starters, with absolutely delicious bread!

Then we had Beef Pot Pie, with mashed potato, greens and thick gravy (Just like back in the UK). I have to say, it was delicious and I never thought I'd be able to have a pie and gravy in the states, like back home.

This was all finished with ice-cream and I have to say the Mint choc chip reminded me of the equivalent Viennetta from home. The taste and texture, identical, which was good.

Overall, the experience was excellent and the food hit the mark perfectly. I wish we had a similar place back in the UK near me.

This place has been here for so long. It definitely stands out among all the Asian restaurants. It’s got that old diner feel inside. My dad and I used to pickup their pot pies by the dozen and just keep them in the freezer. My first time actually dining inside haha. The staff are super nice and welcoming. Nothing beats having one of their fresh pot pies. I had the dinner plate with and extra pot pie…I could’ve done without the extra, but I loved it.
This place was great.  Thw chicken pot pie was excellent. Our only regret was that they don't serve breakfast.

Very comfortable family restaurant.  Food is good, dinner includes the entre, soup or salad, and side.  Best thing, it includes a dessert (couple of choices available). The chicken pie is great, the portion could be bigger (should have ordered the second pie for a little bit extra $).

name: Haidilao Hot Pot Arcadia
address: 400 S Baldwin Ave Suite 2015, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: The place has been very popular since opening. We were so excited when we saw it wasn’t too busy Saturday afternoon. The quality of the hot pot is amazing. The presentation is appealing. The service is superb. The price could add up quickly, worth it though!

One of the best hot pot restaurants. Meat quality is great and service is very attentive. Lunch combo was a great value. Though, we probably should have ordered just one between my 11-year old and I to share b/c we ordered other meats, as well.

Was greeted with great service as soon as I entered the door. The clear communication and help provided by the servers was truly spectacular.
I came before 5pm, so I was able to get the $2.99 meat trays. This amazing price is something worth coming here for along. The fried bean curd and sweet dipping donuts are also amazing.
All in all, this place deserves the best ratings possible on any app. This experience is unbeatable compared to any other restaurant in the United States.

This was mine and my husband’s first time experiencing a hot pot meal, and we absolutely loved every minute of it! The experience was 10/10 🌟 our sever was amazing and beyond helpful. I loved how he spoke about a few dishes, sharing stories from his Chinese culture background and how he grew up eating a handful of the dishes in the menu. We will definitely be back!
We came for father's day and very much enjoyed our meal. There's tons of variety in food selection. Their tofu dessert was a great way to book end the experience.

name: Soonheene & Twozone Chicken
address: 1033 S Baldwin Ave, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews:
SOONHEENE is a very famous place in South Korea.
I was so excited that I ordered most of the menu and everything was delicious! In particular, the mung bean pancake, rose tteokbokki, and donkatsu are fantastic. All the staff were friendly and provided good service as well 👍

Not a lot of places do Korean Street food, so this is definitely unique! The physical space is small and the parking lot of also small,  so good luck!

Seat yourself after ordering at the counter.  Water is also self serve.  Disposable utensils and napkins are at the tables. Service was very fast and portions are fair.  The tteokbokki is nice and chewy. The fried chicken is probably the highlight of the menu,  it was super tasty and crunchy! The gimbap was my favorite, the best I've had in a long time.

My wife and I are crazy about Korean fried chicken. Which this place opened near our favorite mochinut place, we knew we would have to check it out - and we were not disappointed! This place definitely ranks in the top two fried chicken places we've been to!

We had a whole chicken - half original and half with their special Onion sauce (slices of onion with an onion mayo dressing). The flavor of the chicken was delicious, flavorful, and was nicely crispy!

We also had their Rose Tteokbokki and Mayak Gimbap. The Mayak was really nice! The Rose Tteokbokki was absolutely delicious!

Everything here is really good. Do know that the service was a little slow, but only because everything is made fresh to order. It's very much worth the wait!

Loved the traditional mung bean pancake and Ttubboki! You can ask them to make your ttubbki mild spicy if you want. The oden soup was okay.  Nothing special. Mayak kimbop was decent. I prefer classic mung bean pancake over seafood one. Seafood one has only shrimp in it and it’s more expensive. Service was okay.

Got wings with hot and spicy sauce. And boneless chicken with yangnyum.
They were so good. The chicken was so crispy and juicy!! Price was reasonable too. They also have Korean street food inside, so we got pork meatball as well. I absolutely love this little neighborhood joint!

name: Mo-Mo-Paradise
address: 56 E Duarte Rd #101, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews:
Mo-Mo Paradise is a restaurant with excellent value for money, perfect for those wanting to experience delicious shabu-shabu and an all-you-can-eat buffet. In addition to unlimited meat, the restaurant offers a self-serve drink station and a variety of other self-serve dishes. A standout feature is the self-serve curry rice, which I enjoy every time I visit.

I always order their beef chunk eye and beef short plate—my favorites! The restaurant also has a free parking lot at the back, making it very convenient.

Overall, I highly recommend Mo-Mo Paradise!
Meat is fresh and good quality. Price went up with 18% service fees. Kids love the noodle and udon. 0-4 years old is free. 5-10 is half price. Curry rice is good.

Food:  Good
Portions: Small
Price: fair
Service: Lagging, only come when asked
Atmosphere: Simple Hotpot design
Accommodations: Very little

Pros: the meats are fresh and soft cut into thin slices. The curry is very good. I love curry.
Con: basically almost no sauce kiosk. No soy sauce or ponsu sauce at kiosk. You have to ask for it
The selection cart is very small. Only a few veggie choices and 2 types of meat balls. Very small selection.
Service are not great. Waiters only come when ask. Soups are almost dry, no one take the initiative to ask for refills.
Meats are fresh, but very small portions, 4 slices in 1 tray. It's all your can eat, but still small portions. We ordered almost 50 trays.

I have to say, I'm not a fans of this place. My 1st time in this place for my nephew's birthday. It was his choice. As a hotpot restaurant, this is poor in my opinion with a very small vegetable station. There are many other places much better with much larger selection and better service.

The service was very smooth and our waiter was fun and polite. When ordering meat there is no limit per round and they will happily give you a whole stack of plates at once. For parties of six or more, there’s an 18% service charge which is separate from the tip.
The meat is high quality, where the fatty cuts are fatty and the leaner cuts are rich in flavor. They slice the meat extra thin so it cooks in an instant, even the pork. The farmers market and sauce bar is pretty small though. I think other Momo locations have more options. Here, there wasn’t even sesame oil or soy sauce.

✨We perfected the art of meat twirling✨ at Mo-Mo-Paradise in Arcadia! With locations throughout Southern California and internationally, everyone can enjoy their traditional Japanese AYCE Shabu Shabu or “hot pot” but with a modern twist.

They offer 4 choices of soup broth (Shabu-Shabu, tomato, tonkatsu, & Sukiyaki- this was our fave!), a wide variety of premium quality meat cuts served to your table, a farmers market that goes beyond just fresh vegetables & noodles, and the standout Drink Garden (sodas, milk teas, fruit teas, & toppings)🧋

name: Kokumi
address: 815 W Naomi Ave Ste F, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: This review is strictly for the $12.99 Shabu deal and the atmosphere. While it is a great and enticing way to lure customers into an inexpensive option for hot pot the portion size is very small and need add-ons for one to become full. I am very unhappy with the outdoor seating. Came here on a Sunday evening and was overwhelmed by mosquitoes. On top of that they dim the lights for whatever reason and was hard to see if the meat was cooked. The actual restaurant was used entirely for kitchen. Restrooms were nowhere to be found. I’d still come back for their cheap shabu options but beware that deal is good for a light snack and not intended to keep you satisfied for long.

Great place for shabu-shabu with reasonable price.  There were multiple soup flavor to choose from and a large sections of different type of meat.  The vegetables are free and you can always ask for more which is great to pair with the meat.  The servers are quiet and always friendly but at time it felt a bit rushed but I can understand given that there are tons of people waiting outside.  Will definitely come back again, but I think it might help if they have a reservation system.

Used to come here before Covid and was pretty awesome all around. Stopped coming because service went down hill and there were so many other Shabu options around to try. Fast forward a few years and wanted to give them another try.

They are exclusively outside dining now. Good for us since we have a pup.

Meat quality was good, not great. Sauces were also good, but have had some better Goma sauces at other establishments.

My gf didn’t love her spicy miso (a little watery) but I enjoyed my fire crab broth. Probably because I was getting tired of the typical miso, tomato and konbu you get everywhere else. They also have Tom Yum, kimchee and a few other options so the variety was a pleasant surprise. I though the price was pretty reasonable as well.

Service was decent, but you do have to flag people down for extra sauce and water. Last but not least, we noticed they had the other garnishes like green onion and garlic at their base station, but didn’t offer it unless you asked. Same with the spice drops. I asked for some and they wouldn’t let me serve myself which was a little annoying.

We will be back because of the outdoor seating/pet friendly and broth variety. Service was good enough and we have a little experience under our belt for next time.
