Terrible outdoor service. Waiters were extremely slow, and they were just chatting around with each other near the entrance. It was not a busy night.

It took about 15-20 min to place our order, another 15-20 min for entrees to arrive, then another 10 minutes for appetizers, then 5 more minutes for a beer that we ordered 30+ minutes ago!! Yes, in that order.

The shabu tasted decent, however I did get sick later. And I never get sick from food (I have an iron tummy usually, lol). I’d avoid the kokumi sushi roll.

Definitely will not return.

Free refills on vegetables and reasonable prices. Very professional and friendly staffs. Great and tasty food with plenty of parking spaces. Also opens till midnight! You won't be disappointed picking this hidden gem.

name: May Mei Cantonese Restaurant
address: 639 W Duarte Rd, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: Delicious authentic Cantonese dishes at reasonable prices.  Assorted preserved meat hot pot rice is well cooked and so is Chow Fun in black bean sauce.  However, service is slow and waiters are not very attentive.

December 2022 - Party of 4, Saturday around 11am, no wait!

Food/Pricing - $83 total with tax, ordered noodle soup, fried noodles, 2 veggie dishes, and meat. Plenty plenty of leftovers!

Portions are generous and food is very yum.

Service/Ambiance - Quick and friendly service! Just fyi, they charge 3% for credit card use. Other than that, we'll be back!

Parking - Located in a plaza with a grocery store. Usually not too difficult to find parking in the lot.
The hot pot rice is comforting. The crunchy bottom bits are so good. The French style beef is tender and buttery. I love the beef and egg chow fun.

Love it! As a Cantonese girl from Guangzhou, May Mei does a really great and authentic job on all their Cantonese dishes.
The 梅菜扣肉 & 枝竹牛肉煲 are super good! :)
Overall, I will say dishes are a little bit oily, but that’s normal for Cantonese dining places.
Highly recommended!
Wonderful authentic Chinese cuisine. We had a party of 6 and were able to sample many delectable dishes such as fried filet of flounder, sweet and sour pork, sautéed eggplant and Chinese vegetables.

name: Izakaya Tonchinkan 呑み屋 とんちんかん
address: 713 W Duarte Rd #H, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: A cozy place, loud conversations with light jazz playing the background. Small portions though they're all pretty appetizing. A neighborhood hidden gem

Food was great.. lots of selection and rarely seen dishes in other yakitori spots. The beef tongue was excellent 👍👍.. highly recommend. Service is great, chef's were fun and engaging. Getting a Reservation is tough, but that's understandable for a location like this. Give it a try if you have a chance.

Here is what we will definitely order again on the next visit
1 Beef Tongue (Perfectly grilled)
2. Yellowtail on top of steam rice (Fish is fresh)
3. Grill veggie (Pumpkin is so good)
This will make a perfect dinner set with fish, beef, and veggies.
Don't forget to  make a reservation as the seats are limited

Amazing! The seafood was all really fresh, and everything was seasoned/cooked perfectly. Since the restaurant is izakaya style, the portions are relatively small, so expect to order more than one dish per person. This place is a bit pricey, but in my opinion, worth the money. In particular, their house-made black sesame ice cream is delicious.

Absolutely love this Izakaya. This unassuming restaurant combines a relaxed atmosphere with delicious food. Tatsu-san (chef) is a hilarious character making your dinner experience that much better. Be sure to make reservations, because it is almost always booked. I usually order the beef tongue, sashimi platter, karaage and a few other dishes. Try this place out!

name: Ding's Garden
address: 733 W Naomi Ave, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: Pretty amazing section style cuisine! The spicy beef noodle soup , Dan Dan noodles, scallion pancakes, and Xiaongnbao were among the very best we've ever had. Okay prices and plenty of parking. Give them a try, you will not be disappointed.

Ordered beef rolls Shanghai style, Shanghai style pan fried noodle, and Steamed Shanghai style dumplings. The beef rolls were a cold style serving, 6 rolls of pretty good size. Beef to roll ratio was good, cilantro was not overpowering, and the hoisin sauce was a good amount (not overdone). If you prefer it served cold, these are great. The noodles were plentiful and the flavor permeated the semi-thick noodles quite well. The dumplings were fine, definitely enough to hit the spot or craving but not the top pick of the meal. Not too busy for a Sunday mid-afternoon, service was fast and easy.

Came here twice and they still didn't disappoint. This time I brought my family to try their beef noodle soup out in the cold raining weather and they simply loved it. My kids kept reminding me to leave them a 5 star since they liked it that much 😂 So here it is 😉.

The food is delicious and the portion is very generous. We ordered the xiao long bao, pan fried pork bun and of course, their beef noodle soup. The total was very reasonable.

So, whenever you are in the area, make sure to stop by and give them a try.

Got take out. It was ready faster than expected. Forgot to take pictures of everything. Braised beef noodles, beef shank, grandma’s drunken fish, beef rolls, green onion pancake were all excellent. Staff was friendly. The interior was clean and nice.

Update: Such great staff and wonderful food!!!!

Why didn't any of my friends tell me about Dan Dan myun?!?!?!! Disgraceful friends!!! Crazy good food here! The Dan Dan myun extra spicy!!! Let's go to battle!!!!

name: Ramen Yukinoya
address: 1423 S Baldwin Ave, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: Very delicious! They make real Ramen here! The noodle tastes like fresh made, very al dente. The soup is also refreshing, I can taste the kombu flavour. And here I also can find Japanese fried noodle, so nice.

Loved it! It was cold outside today and so we wanted something delicious to warm us up. We decided to give this place a try for the first time and we were not disappointed. We tried quite a few things like the Tonkotsu Ramen (regular and spicy) the Tan Tan Ramen that was absolutely so delicious (my favorite) an order of Combo Fried Rice, chicken Karaage and the most delicious homade Yukinoya Gyoza! 😍 Everything was so good! Oh, we also tried the Okinawa Chasu... I may never order regular Chasu again. It was a great dining experience with a kind attentive wait staff that made for a pleasurable time there. We will definitely be returning soon. Oh, and thanking the cooks on the way out for a deliciously prepared meal and their smiles and responses of the kindess words was Priceless! I recommend this place 100%. I hope you enjoy it as much as we did. Many blessings and love!
Very good chewy ramen noodle.  The soup is rich but I think the pork could be better.  The portion was generous. Regular size is $14 and large is $15.
Satisfied my cravings on a raining day! I usually go with large Shio Ramen combo’d with side of Fried Rice. Always hits the spot!

Ordered 7 tonkatsu and 3 order of karage. Every one of my co workers love their ramen and chicken karage. As for service they went out of their way to help me bring the food to my car. Will definitely come back.

name: Hodori BBQ
address: 400 S Baldwin Ave ste 2315, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews:
We went to eat on a weekday night, arriving at 6:30pm, and there were plenty of empty seats.
I ordered a combo. The meat was very good and fragrant after being grilled.
I enjoyed it very much when I was hungry.

The waiter will help with the barbecue and the service is very good.
The environment is also very clean. Will go again in the future.

We came pretty late. Everything was closing, and we were hungry. The Ala Carte portions here are really huge. Had I known, I would have just ordered one item. But honestly, that omelette rice was still good the next day.

Located in Santa Anita Mall. Plenty of free parking but a bit challenging finding a spot.

Restaurant is clean with plenty of indoor seating.
Friendly service but seem a bit understaffed.

They have helper robots that bring some items to your tables.

Meat quality is good but a bit overpriced and portions are a bit less than what you can get at other kbbq places.

The reason we went here is because they accept reservations unlike other kbbq restaurants where it's first come first seated.

It was good, but for the price I'd go elsewhere.

The ambiance exuded warmth, striking a perfect balance between cozy and vibrant. But the true star was undoubtedly the food. The variety of meats impressed, while the side dishes beautifully complemented the main course. The attentive and efficient service ensured our dining experience was seamless. I wholeheartedly recommend this place to anyone yearning for authentic and delectable Korean barbecue.

Came on Mothers day at about 430pm, place was somewhat empty but began filling up by the time we left at 6pm.  Korean bbq but with set prices for meats.  We ordered the small pork  which is a pretty good choice for 2 adults.  Got a side of Bulgogi from a la cart and some shrimp fried rice.  All were amazing.  Waitress kept coming around to help flip the meat.  Got a pint of Sapporo for 3.99 which is a good deal.  Men's bathroom only had 1 toilet and 2 urinalysis which was not enough since the dinning room has a large capacity.  Not bad, will come back to order beef package.

name: The Cheesecake Factory
address: 903-L 400 S Baldwin Ave, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: Really one of the very best locations for The Factory. Beautiful ambiance.  Amazing mall and restaurant location. Spectacular scenes. Food is consistent and tasteful. Service was good; not the best but good. House bread was a little hard to bite as it overbaked a bit. Tropical drink was very nice. A lot to be desired in a prime area. Cheesecake is always the staple.

This review only reflects the visit I made this evening  every other time has been 5 stars.
I ordered the French Dip burger with onions. Sandwich was cut in 3 parts with a small clump of onions in the middle section only. The meat was room temperature with the cold cheese slices  stacked on top unmelted. (as you can see in the attached pictures) We also ordered a bacon burger mayonnaise only that we received it doused in the garlic dip sauce. My son also asked for a cheesecake slice for dessert before we left and the waitress neglected to put in the order and brought us the check instead. The manager was courteous in correcting the mistakes after the fact, but the waiting staff was unapologetic.
Great service every time. Delicious food and drinks. Recommend making reservations online! Atmosphere is great for date night (and getting bread thrown at you by other guests 😂)

Best time to come during the week for lunch.... dining room only half full. Servers are so pleasant and they can actually spend time with you. Their menu is massive but everything is good. My salad, sliders, soup, n pizza Absolutely delicious. I have ordered way too much but had plenty for dinner later. Very happy with our dessert later.

It was okay atmosphere and I would not recommend getting the Chinese Chicken salad. The day after I had a bad stomach ache and got food poisoning from it, been in bed last 6 days sadly, something was off about that dish. The food menu is massive here and they may have let quality slip with that dish. Also, the Chinese Chicken salad,  it was too much dressing on it and the mixer didn't match well. There are plenty of free parking and nice mall locations. The atmosphere is loud, but the lighting is nice. The dessert are more of what they are known for, so better to stick with ordering that like I did last time, then I would have not gotten a tummy ache. Waiter was nice, but he was super forgetful, entire experience was off this time.

name: Cluck2Go
address: 153 E Duarte Rd, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews:
Don’t ever pay online or order anything pre paid here, they charged your money and won’t give you the food.

I paid ahead over the app Fantuan before I arrived but they asked for order number which I never received.

I gave my phone number, showed my credit card charge, my name and my order details.

The old lady was super rude and looked at me like I lied for a freaking $32.31 charge! They finally found my order after 10 min of chaos and I didn’t receive any apology.

I would never come back cuz I felt sorry for my money.

Cluck2Go is the best! I love Hainan Chicken Rice, it is my go to comfort food, my work out meal, and my favorite restaurant. I am so glad they just opened this new arcadia location, right next to my office.  btw. their sauces are amazing!!!
Delicious and tender chicken on rice. What more do needs to be said? The chicken was flavorful and tender. Which was exactly what I was looking for.

February 2022 - Takeout order. We called in ahead of time, so wait wasn't bad! Our family usually goes to the Pasadena location but was excited to hear another location was opening up closer to home!

Food/Pricing:
- Fried Hainan Chicken Rice - $12.25 - Crispy and good!

- Combo A which includes half chicken, spicy cucumber salad, fried peanuts, chicken soup (medium), chicken rice (2) - $25.45 - Not bad for the price. However, as someone who looks forward to the numbing spicy of the cucumber salad, it just tasted like cucumber soaked in water .

Overall, the chicken was good but not as tasty as Pasadena. As this location is much closer, we will definitely give it another try in a few months!

We try to go for chicken rice when we’re visiting SoCal and this hit the spot! It took a while to get there and warning: there’s no washroom and only two tables on site so plan ahead. This place is teeny and out of the way but the chicken and deep fried buns were soooo good, better than some of the other locations. The decor is nothing to write home about but I gave it 5 stars because the counter staff were so friendly, earnest, kind and really welcoming. They kept a tab open for us while we were waiting for our friends to join us which was a nice surprise. I think they just took joy in watching us enjoy the food.

name: Foshan Cantonese King
address: 1228 S Golden W Ave, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: 肠粉steamed roll on first two pictures tastes quite good and authentic since I can’t find any other place serving traditional cantonese rice noodle roll (cooked in a drawer-like machine) in Los Angeles! One plate of steamed rice roll costs $7.5. I’ll rate ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ for this. Other Cantonese noodle dishes are not bad.

A small restaurant in Arcadia and right next to 99 ranch, offering a wide variety of authentic Cantonese dishes! I highly recommend the rice noodle – it's currently my top choice among rice noodles in LA. They offer four sets and only $9.99 lunch specials(and come with 1 free drink) that are fantastic deals for trying more dishes.
Got the combo a and b special. Pork and century egg porridge and beef rice noodle. Ok. Won ton noodle. Meh. Chow mein has not smoky flavor. Service slow

Quaint little place you probably won't notice unless you walk by.  I love that they're open late. I got lo mein which was the traditional way of cooking it...dry noodles with the broth on the side. Not the typical western gross kind. Food was super fresh and hot. Excellent portion. Got a cold soy bean milk that was absolutely delicious. The place is clean and cute inside. Highly recommend this place 👌
Clean and comfortable sit down restaurant serving Canton dishes. Portions lean small but the prices reflect that too.

name: Capital Seafood Restaurant
address: 333 E Huntington Dr, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews:
Randomly found this spot and was in the mood for dim sum, as usual. They had just opened when we arrived. We placed our order and were out within an hour. The prices are reasonable, especially considering the very good quality of the ingredients. Opt for a lunch special and a couple of dim sum items, and you're good to go.
A.    $5.28 B. $6.28 C. $7.28 D. $8.28 K. $9.28
Tea or condiments $1.95/person
Dim Sum is served
Mon-Fri 11am-3pm
Sat-Sun 930am-3pm
We got the…
Turnip Cake
Steamed Spare Rib
Shiu Mai
Baked Bbq Pork
The majority of the items on the menu are either B or C for dim sum D and K are the main items… All the dishes were very good!

Pretty packed place!

Came on a Saturday noontime and there was a line out the door!

Thankfully my relatives came early and got us a spot inside already. We had two big tables.

I was looking around for a waiter cause we really needed water (100 degrees today) and I asked a worker nearby. He was awesome and brought water over after he finished the task he was working on!

The food was delish!!

Parking is plenty and there is even a shaded parking structure.

I did see some flies roaming around but those are inevitable.

Place pickup order online. Order was successful and confirmed to be ready at 8:13pm. Posted hours say they close at 9:00. I walked to get the food from my hotel room to find they were closed early. Kept walking further away and found a good alternative that wanted to do business. Better call this restaurant before you place an order to make sure they are really open

There’re tons of dim sum Cantonese seafood restaurants in the San Gabriel valley area. While Chef Tony in Arcadia, on Michelin guide, and Harbor Seafood Restaurant in Rosemead, a Michelin star, are champions, they don’t have the almond milk pastry which this restaurant proudly serves. It’s exotic and delicious.

I really like this place - food was excellent and service was fast.

They don’t do carts here - you fill out a sheet and they’ll bring out your order.

Parking lot is pretty big but shared with a bunch of other businesses.

We got tripe, Shu Mai, spare ribs, chicken feet, shrimp balls and salted egg yolk custard buns (my personal favorite) - delish.

name: Five Five Noodles
address: 838 S Baldwin Ave, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: Pretty solid noodle house with yummy broth and a good variety of choices to order from. We ordered the Crabmeat Tomato Basil Noodles and House Special with Mixed Noodles. We thought the flavors were good and there was enough to take home for some leftovers. The place wasn’t crowded before noon. This is our second time here and they have specials if you order over $39 worth of food and pay in cash you can get a drink included with your meal. Hope this place stays around. Parking on the street if it’s available.

Came to this restaurant already few times because the food are so delicious and fresh, especially the broth is so flavorful and not greasy at all. The meat no matter chicken or beef are moist and tender. We’ve tried different kinds of rice noodle and rice with chicken leg, love it a lot!! The most important thing is that the amount of food are very large, it’s hard to find other noodle at the same price better than this one. Also this restaurant is very clean and neat. Definitely worth to try, you won’t regret it!!

The most disappointed take out!
The store was recommended by a social media. I ordered No. 1 large.  The portion was small, and the chicken was so dry.  Also No. 5 large, it's the house special. The portion was small, but the quality is not good either.  The fish ball and beef ball were not tasty at all.
I gave the store two stars as I hope the owner/chef be serious about the quality of the food.
Sorry, it's not a store I will come back and recommend to my friends.

Came to this place with my wife for lunch today,  we ordered the Crabmeat Tomato Basil Soup (Bun Rieu) and Special Beef Noodle Soup (Pho Dac Biet).  Both soup base taste bland,  the Beef Noodle Soup has no beef flavor, it has the chicken flavor instead.  The Crabmeat Tomato soup has no flavor at all.   They only give the bean spouts and couple slice of jalepeno.  When I ask the waitress for some basil leaves and vegetables that supposedly come with the shoup and she said they dont have any and rudely pointed to my tomato saying that the vegetable.
Very disappointed experience.  There is better options close by.

It is definitely my favorite place to go for a weekday quick lunch. Food is super delicious and heathy and the staff is very nice, personable and trying to tailor its service to different customers needs. I am simply addictive to the tomato basil crabmeat noodle soup EVERY time and the salted plum with sparking soda is super refreshing and highly recommended too!!! Simply love this place!

name: Eat Fantastic
address: 4466 Live Oak Ave, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews: Outstanding service! Came here super early… between 4-5am I think… it was an Indian male working the drive through… got a Diet Coke and I’m guessing due to the hour I was there, there was a wait for my food (honestly wasn’t even that bad)… he handed me my drink and waiting… then he tells me “drink some… I can give you a refill” with a smile… I respectfully turned it down but honestly out of the 25 years I’ve been in the states, NEVER ever once did a person that works in drive through has ever offered me that… and I’ve worked in restaurants for 10+ years as a server… as a server we have an 60-90 min to convince the customers we give great service… but this guy did it in an drive through (5 min max)… amazing customer service, the burger was really good too… definitely a fan of this place…

Got in for lunch and ordered the City Slicker & Fries. Plenty of flavor and hit the spot. Service was great; everyone was friendly and food came out quick. Loved the outdoor seating and all the other options on the menu...plenty of things I still wanna try. Drop in and explore!

I was in LA for vacation & looked up places to eat near by, this was the first place to pop up. I checked out the reviews and pictures and decided to give them a try. My mind was blown! I ordered the grilled chicken melt and the parmesan fries. Both were so good and fresh. I also am big on presentation & how my food looks determines if I will eat it or not. The presentation of the food was also clean, and neat. I enjoyed my food so much, I went back the next day & I ordered the lunch box for $12 which was the best deal & really a ton of food for lunch. They're pricey, but honestly the quality of the food, presentation of the food, and customer service is what you're paying for! Whenever I am in town, I will definetly be coming back. (Pictured is my lunch box combo, no drink and I added cheese to the burger which came out to $14, still not bad for lunch; fries, 2 tenders, a cheeseburger, and a cookie, ranch for the tenders)

Came here on the weekend cause the huge "EAT" sign in front caught my attention. Decided to check it out, and I'm not gonna lie it did not disappoint! We ordered some cheeseburgers, 1 order of chili cheese fries [good for two people to share], and a chocolate shake. The quality of the hamburgers was phenomenal! The chili cheese fries were amazing as well, they make their chili from scratch every day 😋. We finished off with the chocolate shake, which was just as delicious as everything else. I highly suggest trying this spot out.

Wish I had tried this place sooner. Truly one of the best double cheeseburgers I've ever had!! I ordered 'The Goat.' The cheese is generous and it's actually melted onto the meat not like other burger joints with that rubbery stuff. The burger was made to order very hot off the grill not warm but actually hot which was very nice! The buns go perfect with the meat. Very delicious I will definitely be back. Highly recommend if your looking for a delicious burger!

name: Jazz Cat Restaurant
address: 1088 S Baldwin Ave, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews:
Had some trouble finding the door while driving lol their front door isn't on the main street facing but rather on the side street.

The wait wasn't terrible. The prices seem fair. The food quality was okay, nothing spectacular. The soup base bowls are cute as heck cause cat. I had the hot Mongolian soup base, it's okay, not great, but okay. Honestly, the Little Fat Sheep soup base packages at 99 Ranch are more tasty 😅 but it's a nice place to gather with a small group of friends and family!

Great varieties of soup base to choose from.  Price per pot starting ~$15 and you can also add in any additional side (ex. seafood side: 3 pawns and 4-5 pieces of fish for $4.95).  The food is decent and the service is quick.  Staffs are friendly and attentive.  The decor is nice and clean.  Since almost all the booths and chairs have high back, it provides privacy.  Easy access to Parking and there's plenty of space. Recommended.

Great food as always! Great selection of broths and sauces. I would recommend getting the satay sesame, it's so good! I always get the regular selections of veggies and meat but if your into all meat then you can get the t Rex for no extra cost. We got the thai spicy (very good! Not to spicy but just enough to get that burn) And the coconut (not very special, felt like it was just broth with some coconut cream poured into it)

This was my first first visit at this hot pot spot. I can’t believe I had never been here before. Not only was the atmosphere great but the food was just as delicious!

The staff there always made sure to check up on us if we needed anything from refills, to more beer and just to see how our meal was going.

I will definitely be going back here more often.

Update Feb 2018:
Regular beef -> quality went down
American wagyu -> even better quality than regular beef but not melt in mouth. Little bit chewy

Please increase the beef quality!!

Update Sept 2018: make sure get wagyu beef, it’s worth it. Soft and tender. $22 for 6 oz or $25 for 9 oz

Decent beef quality, many different kind of soup / broth flavors. Staff are friendly, fast service and decent price. Good location with decent parking space. Get early - otherwise waiting could be long time. We ordered t-rex - basically more meat slices than vegetables. Same price as regular order (more varieties of vegetables). Many different dipping sauces, you. An choose 2 at a time but if you don’t like it just ask for different kind and they will accomodate you

name: Fork Over Pork
address: 1431 S Baldwin Ave, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: Best bimbimpap and ox bone soup I’ve ever had. Bulgogi was marinated perfectly. Food was served quickly and waiter is very friendly. Would come back

Food is fresh and delivered in a reasonable amount of time. A little on the pricier side for Korean comfort food but the spicy pork bulgogi is the best I've had compared to a lot of places, including restaurants in K-Town. Also, the boneless beef short ribs were a little too dry and sweet compared to the bone-in ribs.

First time eating here and let me say this amazing. The service is spectacular, it's not busy, the enrviorment is so relaxing.the quality of the food is worth the price. I been going to this other Korean place since I was younger and this place I just tried with family actually topped them off. The food had the right amount of flavor. She refilled the side dishes and lord mercy I think ima have a Korean baby cause jesus... food is great. cute little place most definitely coming back soon when I get some cash. You should try coming to this place to eat worth a shot. You won't get exceptional service anywhere else let me tell ya*)

More than just Pork!
Very clean and nice dining environment. Service is friendly and good.
Parking is good.
Not as busy as some other Korean restaurants in the area; therefore, less waiting time.
Food is very good with lots of ingredient.  This past vist, one dish is a little on the salty side.  Otherwise its excellent.

Clean, well laid out restaurant with reasonably priced Korean fare. It serves a small subset of traditional Korean offerings, but the emphasis is definitely more towards the fusion-y dishes. I got the kimchi fried rice with pork belly. Although the pork belly had bone in it, overall the fried rice was hearty and very tasty to the last scoop

name: Lotus Kitchen- Closed
address: 305 N Santa Anita Ave Suite A, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews: Lotus Kitchen is a delightful addition to LA Myanmar restaurant scene.The flavors of Myanmar truly shine through their dishes, offering a unique and authentic experience. The service here is really friendly, and the ambiance takes me back to Myanmar.The shuffling menu got me really want to check out their facebook page frequently. Recommended!!

I came here after running some errands. The location is easily accessible with a lot of parking. The staff is really friendly and the restaurant is clean. The mohinga was quite traditional and bursting with flavor.

Everything I wanted from a restaurant. I'm coming back again soon.
Parking at the front and on the side. Or behind the restaurant. Service is friendly. Great Burmese food.

Excellent food. Reasonable prices. Friendly service. Military discount. 💕

Located right next to the climbing gym.
Amazing chicken bowl with salad. Very flavorful. Loved it.

name: Zelo
address: 328 E Foothill Blvd, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews:
It's a pity we don't live closer! We stopped by for some takeout to eat at the Tesla charger during a road trip, and it was a real treat.

The cornmeal crust is incredibly unique and tasty, and honestly lends itself to a  pizza category of its own. It has a crunch to the outside, while remaining soft on the inside, and holds the pizza toppings better than any crust I've had. Not only the crust tho, the toppings were well put together and obviously fresh, this is truly gourmet pizza lover's pizza.

My wife is a pasta fanatic and had to try the pasta. We agree the components made by the resto (meatballs/sauce) were good, with the meatballs especially a standout. Tho the pasta noodles themselves were really average. She enjoyed it but prolly wouldn't get it again.

Lastly the homemade Zucotto cake was out of this world, definitely worth checking out 🤤

Can't wait to stop by again when passing through LA! Also made for great leftovers!

Apologize to the kitchen for showing up 45 minuets before they closed but we had a great experience! The staff was welcoming and the food was awesome! They are very unique because they use a cornmeal crust which taste great and holds all the toppings way better than a standard crust.

Will definitely visit again, thanks for the service guys!!

When you only very rarely hive 5 stars, It’s such a please to give this review. I feel so blessed to have been in this awesome little authentic pizzeria. All the staff were so so friendly, talkative, helpful and just so nice to be around. Their pizza was so so amazing. We loved the corn crust and cannot wait to be back there to try their salads, calzone, homemade meatballs and of course more pizza. It’s also so cheap. Such places deserve to be known.

The pizza is amazing.   Salads are OK.   The wait staff is young... and often more interested in socializing with each other than taking care of customers.   On my last visit our waiter forgot a number of things.   Including to put our order in with the kitchen.  We ended up being there for almost two hours.   And no one apologized.

I will definitely be back for the works penne pasta! So good. There isn't much of an atmosphere, waiters are chill, they come around every now and then. But food is served hot. I wish they had a bigger wine selection, but they don't mind if you bring your own bottle. I'm not sure they have a cork fee. We did try the pizza. It was good, but the pasta was better.

name: Kiyosuzu
address: 921 S Baldwin Ave #B, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: Ordered the Rainbow Roll, Ringo Roll, 2 pieces of Sweet Shrimp, and a Yellow Tail Roll. The Rainbow roll has a beautiful assortment of seafood from tuna,  salmon, yellowtail, halibut and shrimp. Each piece had good texture, and was well portioned. The Ringo Roll salmon was very good and interesting using dried apple to add sweetness to the fish. The sweet shrimp was soft and beautifully presented with the shrimp heads being fried separately as the other half of the dish; alternatively the shrimp heads could be offered as part of a soup. The Yellow Tail Roll was also a good pick that was very smooth. The atmosphere is very relaxed and peaceful here with a gradual pace of traffic coming through here. There is a shared parking in the rear of the building that is ample enough.

I was looking for a Japanese restaurant owned by a Japanese proprietor in LA. I arrived late, around 7:40 PM, and found only one table occupied. I hesitated to enter at first. However, right by the entrance, I saw numerous pictures of Olympian figure skater Mirai Nagasu on the wall, which reassured me. I ended up having $100 worth of sushi. Honestly, I have no idea how I'm going to sleep tonight with such a full stomach! While researching Japanese restaurants, I found that most cost over $100. It's quite a large amount of money. Ultimately, I spent the same, but you can adjust according to your budget. I recommend this restaurant.

How could I say I love the restaurant here. Just after shopping at the shops at Santa Anita and searching for the restaurant nearby, it's the first and closest choice. The store is small and might be somewhat old-fashioned, but you could feel the warmth. The decorations are specially designed while the staff are welcoming. The chef responsible for the sushi bar could always talk with the customers sitting at the bar. We ordered the recommended Salmon sashimi, it's fresh enough. The seafood Hotpot is rich in taste and the fish inside might be cod of great taste. It's also a special hand roll of scallops topped with grilled cheese. That's great and might be with the locals' taste.

Very authentic Japanese sushi! The quality is so nice and the price is very reasonable. My personal favorite is their Unagi, squid, and yellowtail. All the fish are super fresh, they are selected by the owner every morning from the fish market.

The space? Good — small, neat, clean.
The owners? Great — pleasant, caring about the place, professional.
The food? Amazing — fresh, flavourful, delicious!
You won't find many sushi places with THIS quality for THESE prices.

name: Noodle St Arcadia
address: 400 S Baldwin Ave Ste M10, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: Went here with my bf as a date. The stir-fried beef noodles were amazing, and so was the service, didn't really like the passion fruit tea drink it was a little to bitter for my taste.Other then that this place is really good, its worth visiting!!

Food is great. Price is very reasonable. Wait time was not that long but it was kind of hard to get a hold of someone to ask for napkins. It is an open food court type of environment and lots of people walking by.
Extremely fast service, fresh noodles, and other dishes. Korean BBQ on rice is excellent. Try the scallion pancakes. Great ice teas. Located in "Food Alley"

We moved through the wait list fairly quickly for a table for 4 on Black Friday @ 6pm.  Total wait time was less than 30 minutes.  We were seated along the walkway between Noodle Street and DTF.  I really wanted to like this place but I think I don’t like the large, open concept/layout and exposure of this restaurant.  I found myself keeping an area on our personal belongings and shopping bags since we felt “exposed” and didn’t want to let our guard down.  The service was quick and efficient with the servers on point to take your order and get things moving.

The soup noodles came quickly followed by the appetizers which was ok since we just wanted to fill out bellies and get out.  The knife cut noodles are nice and chewy which I liked but some may think it’s undercooked since it’s not your normal springy noodle.  That kind of where the good parts end.  The other parts of the dish were just ok, nothing that knocked my socks off.  The beef in the spicy beef noodle soup wasn’t as tender as I’d like and was slightly on the dry side except for the pieces laced with tendon.  The tomato sauce ok (my friend did not finish and opted not to take the leftovers home).  Without leeks and The signature beef and cilantro, the signature beef noodle soup was left colorless!  You do need it!!!  Appetizers - cucumber salad was crispy and refreshing but not any better than those found at other restaurants, we found the fried calamari over fried and too chewy and wasn’t dazzled by the scallion pancakes.  I think if this was the only place with available seating and I was starving - I’d go back.  If not, I’d pass on a return trip.
Nice noodle place in the front of the promenade. Tastes good and not too overpriced.

name: Kai Ramen Arcadia
address: 1130 S Baldwin Ave # 6, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews:
Kai ramen is nestled in a plaza with JJ bakery, phoenix boutique and other stores. The parking lot is shared with other business and can get busy during lunch hours.
It is a small store with beautiful graphics on the walls. Although there was only one server, she was attentive and friendly.
Scan a QR code for the menu and order with the server. Food came out quickly. We ordered the kai white ramen(which was labeled as award winning) and bomb ramen. The kai white ramen was flavorful and had a buttery-ish taste to the soup base. The noodles are thinner compared to the bomb ramen. The bomb ramen had thicker noodles and a lot of flavor from the minced pork. The oil and salt levels are adjustable. They have a variety of broth flavors to chose from including tonkatsu, chicken and shoyu.
The spicy tuna crispy rice was interesting, and the rice was really crispy. The pork chashu buns had thin slices of chashu topped with lots of spring salad, which makes it easier to bite through.
They also have a vegan soup option and rice bowls if youre not feeling ramen.

✨Anyone else slurp their noodles?✨ Our cravings for ramen certainly were satisfied at Kai Ramen, located in Arcadia, California and deep in the SGV. During the height of the pandemic, I found myself relying on @kairamenarcadia as my go-to for those delicious Japanese noodles in soup form.  Then on my recent dine-in visit, I realized the quality and taste of the meals simply was the same🙌🏼

I was finally able to try their Spicy Tuna Crispy Rice after all these years and it did not disappoint!  More happiness was activated with each bite🥰

We had: 🍣Spicy Tuna Crispy Rice, 🍗Chicken Cutlet Bun (chicken katsu in steamed bun mixed with cabbage, slices of cucumber, served with spicy mayo), 🍜Kai White Ramen (salt base, skinny noodles, garlic butter, pork belly, flavored egg, scallions, crispy onion, kikurage), 🍜Maesoba Ramen (thick noodle, house special ground pork, scallions, mild soy based smoke flavor, imami fish powder, garlic, seaweed), and🧋Boba Ice Milk Tea

The place is very relaxed and cozy.
The service was good, except the dumpling took almost half an hour to serve after we finished the ramen bowls.  But nevertheless the 🥟🥟 were really fresh and delicious.
The volcano ramen was really spicy with the freshly cooked pop corn chicken on top making an excellent combo.

I love ramen places specially the ones that are further out the city. But I noticed this place and thought to give it a try. The location is nice, plenty of parking. The inside is clean and staff are nice. So I ordered a kai Yellow and a classic tonkotsu ramen. Kai Yello comes with cheese and corn with pork belly slices. And chives. But I will say, this cheese wasn't authentic cheese. It was more of that processed shaved cheese already pre-packaged. You could just taste the Cleese and know right away, how powdery it taste. I really don't know any other way to describe the flavor of processed cheese but it did take away the flavor of the broth. Had they used natural shredded sheese it would be on point 💯.  And for a dollar more really doesn't feel authentic. But the classic tonkatsu ramen was amazing. Comes with mushroom egg pork belly and chives too. I just hope they can improve on the food quality. The portion size is perfect though. And I also ordered gyosas and they were great.

A nice ramen place but I found that the dumplings are the best item I’ve tried. It’s very fresh, unless frozen dumplings in most restaurants. The meat inside was very delicious. The ramen was ok, I had the award winning ramen but couldn’t figure out which award they won. The server didn’t know anything either. It’s worth a stop by for dumplings though!

name: Dashiwa Ramen
address: 328 E Huntington Dr, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews: I recently ate at Dashiwa Ramen and had a fantastic experience. The udon curry was exceptionally good, with perfectly cooked noodles and rich, flavorful curry sauce.The service was outstanding, especially from a blonde-haired lady who helped clean up when my baby cousin spilled water. Her kindness made our visit special.I highly recommend Dashiwa Ramen for its delicious food and excellent service. We'll definitely be back!

Can't go wrong with eating Ramen here.  Had the two Pepper Red tonkatsu ramen.  Delicious.  It was recommended by the wonderful waiting staff.  Since I had also showed up during Happy hour.  I ordered the premium large Sapporo Beer for $8, small is $6, but worth the price.  For an extra $2, got the chicken Karaage.  Juicy dark meat chicken with a few tempura battered onion rings that tasted good with beer.  Overall, great place to visit and enjoy the wonderful J-Pop and K-pop music playing in the background.  Thanks for making my hour dining experience very Happy. Ill be going back for the chicken cutlet cury next time.

Love love love it here. The service is always great but the food, even better!
Flavors are always strong and super tasty.
We've tried several ramen places in the area and this one has been the best by far.
Have tried all their ramen bowls and they've all been great.
I'm not even a fan of miso but their spicy miso ramen is so tasty.
They also torch their chasu and its so good!
Great smokey flavor and the charred edges are the best part!
Highly recommend! Bring your friends!

I’ve tried all of the ramen and I haven’t had a bad dish yet. The noodles are always perfectly cooked and the soup flavor is better than anywhere else. I recommend getting the tonkatsu black ramen or the beef curry with udon. Amazing food for a reasonable price. I always leave here full.

We ate here after not wanting to wait for BJs and we were blessed because IT WAS SO GOOD!! The garlic edamame was salty and crunchy in the outside with fried garlic. The best I have ever had. We each ordered something different and they all slapped so effing hard after a day at the Ren Faire. And the prices were good too. The service was either sisters or twins and they were so quick! Order the the item from the giant pict. Can't remember the name but it's their specialty. Shout out to the the gyoza and karate chicken which were crunchy and delicious.

name: SinBala
address: 651 W Duarte Rd f, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: This place is comfort food to the max. It is so homey and delicious, offering traditional Taiwanese dishes. The sausage was super tasty and one of their signatures. Pretty affordable too with good value and good portions. The staff are very nice and speak both English and Mandarin. The interior is a bit run down but does not take away from the quality of the food.

With its understated atmosphere and compact tables, this gem invites diners on a culinary journey through Taiwan, delivering an authentic experience from start to finish.

When we walked into La Sin Bala, the cozy environment immediately caught our eye. With limited seating and neatly arranged tables, our anticipation was at its peak as we perused the menu, eager to sample a selection of Taiwanese delicacies.

Our culinary exploration begins with the typical rice, elegantly presented in the style of a traditional Taiwanese bento. Every bite of tender and juicy pork paired with fragrant rice made us feel like we were in a buffet restaurant in Taipei.

Next we had the oyster omelette, a dish that really stole the show. Egg rolls are full of Taiwan's unique flavor, a famous night market snack, harmoniously blending plump oysters with delicious eggs and indispensable vegetables, a perfect match with aromatic spices. Super authentic! A must order meal that left us wanting more with every bite.

We also indulged in chicken rolls accompanied by dipping sauce and a serving of shiitake mushroom and chicken soup, both delivering simple yet gratifying flavors.

These simple yet satisfying dishes are the perfect end to our culinary journey, leaving us feeling nourished and satisfied.

Of note, the highlight of our experience was undoubtedly the oyster omelette, a dish that encapsulates the essence of Taiwanese cuisine. Its authentic flavors and affordable prices highlight La Sin Bala, making it one of the must-go places for food lovers looking for a taste of Taiwan.
Very yummy vegetable dumplings and a wide selection of desserts. I got the iced grass jelly and it was delicious. Definitely a place to experience Taiwanese food

great Taiwanese comfort food
Our favorite:
- Taiwanese Sausage (a la carte or meal)
- Pop Corn Chicken
- Pork Chop rice
- Shaved ice
- Steamed dumpling (15 minutes wait) not as good as DTF but it is good

Most of their food is great.

$20 minimum for credit card purchase

Food/Taste/Flavor: 5/5 - came for an early lunch so there were plenty of tables available. It was a delicious Taiwanese meal 23) Spicy Beef Noodle Soup was delicious with a very salty broth. It was great while eating the noodles but could not finish the soup afterwards.

30) Popcorn Chicken was juicy and well fried. Nicely seasoned with flavors all the way to the center of the chicken.

37) Sticky Rice was as expected. Well seasoned and flavored but a bit oily.

Ambience: 5/5 - clean and more spacious than expected.

Service: 5/5 - friendly and quick. You do need to waive them down for anything needed as they don't check back on the tables

Value for price: 5/5 - good food, quick service, reasonable price

name: Kyodong Noodle
address: 1101 W Huntington Dr, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews:
I missed that this place was located inside of the HMarket 🙄. I’m still looking for a replacement to New Garden (Hacienda Heights) Jajamien noodles. This was a good start.  A small storefront with a few other eateries sharing large tables. Noodles were thick and chewy and the sauce was meaty. I needed a little soy sauce and pepper to punch up the sauce but I love the shredded cucumbers on top.  Good start on my journey for good jajiang noodles.

The HMart is Asian market paradise with every food, snack , produce you can imagine.

I was so surprised once I saw it got 4.9 on Google Maps, then I realized that only 8 reviews.  I will give it a fail score for this restaurant.  It is located inside H Mart, Arcadia, CA.  I love H Mart and always had something to eat after or before the shopping.  I had a spicy seafood noodle soup and fried sweet and sour pork stick set.  I have to say they are good-looking, they can get 4-star if the score is only by looking.
But the taste was awful, it's tasteless. The pork was only sweet without sour, even touch. And the pork stick is full of stalk but with a very tiny pork slice inside and also tasteless. The noodle soup was not spicy even not salted. The seafood portion was a very small and bad smell. My daily eating is very light salted, even though I still feel the foods were tasteless.  Can you imagine how bad the flavor is?

Gosh the sweet n sour pork is terrible. Driest meat I’ve ever taste. Seems like they fry the pork in advance and then just double fried it so the pork inside is super dry. The dipping sauce just takes like a watery, sour syrup. It doesn’t have any flavor aroma. I don’t know how people give this place four and five stars.

Stopped by for some takeout as i was craving haha GM Yun or black bean noodles. Also needed some fruit, so i opted for Kyodong which is located in the HMart supermarket.

Food and service was pretty good and was nice to be able to shop while your waiting for your food. One thing the Korean shops perfected is packing food to go and it was no different here. Neatly packed and in great shape when I got home. The noodles were tasty too, but I’m used to getting some ground meat mixed in the sauce and there wasn’t any in their version. Could have been five stars, but their version isn’t cheap, so I expect to get a little meat at least. Glad I ordered a combo which included the sweet and sour pork, because I am not a vegetarian :). The combo is a great option when your eating alone cause buying the two items separately would set you back way over $30+. Was definitely enough food me with even some left over for about $27 after tip. The sweet and sour pork was also pretty good. You do get one side dish, yellow radish which pairs well with the dishes, just wish they had kimchi as well. All in all a great dinner which hit the spot, but will keep trying other spots for jajangmyun for the next time.

Good:  great value (if take into account of California pricing), noodle was great.  Like the menu item#1 and #2.
Opportunities for improvement:  went there three times.  At least two times, there were no other customers ahead of me, but the chef won't cook my food immediately, instead he took his time to prep/cook other things.

name: Nirvana Indian Cuisine
address: 314 E Huntington Dr, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews: Nice food options. Really liked their appetizers. Ordered veggie pakora and chicken tikka along with naan / curry. Nice food options

We tried their lunch buffet on a weekday, it’s $20 per person. They have plenty of dishes if you like chicken, but no much options for vegetarians.
Wish they had vegetarian options. It would be great if they can add samosa & 1 paneer dish to the buffet (will come back and rate it 5 stars).

It's a small Indian restaurant located within a plaza. There are maybe 8-10 tables, so not a big place but lovely owners. You can tell that there are some very regular customers who often eat there. We ordered the tikka masala, seekh kabob, tandoori paratha, saag paneer and a side of basmati rice. Very flavorful dishes and the paratha bread was warm and crispy.. perfect with the saag paneer.

They have a variety of tasty food options. For great meat dishes to vegetarian dishes yum. People trying the place for the first time. Not knowing what to expect. But happy with the different food dishes. You can customize your food dishes. From mild, spicy (hot) and extra spicy (hot). There is a lunch buffet also. If you are not close by still worth stopping in.

Overall a nice local place to get Indian. We ordered the spicy paneer and chicken dishes. Both had nice flavor, but I wasn't as hit by the spice as I had hoped. The garlic naan also had a great flavor. I only wish they served a lunch buffet on the weekend as well so we can try multiple different dishes!

name: YGF Malatang 杨国福麻辣烫
address: 1311 S Baldwin Ave #A, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews:
I like this place. $13.99 per pound of food. You get to choose all your toppings. I recommend going heavy on the meats and light on the carbohydrates. That’ll be the best bang for the buck. They also have frog meat if that’s your lingo. I tried their beef bone broth and I like it a lot. I’d come back again.

**UPDATE**
Just a heads up. If you can’t eat mild this place won’t be for you. They can’t alter the broth. The only option is the tomato broth which is no spicy.
Not too bad. Easy to order n the place is casual b comfort. Waitress is friendly n prompt to serve.

My wife and I came here for dinner and loved this place! There’s a bar where you pick out all of the veggies and meat that you want (there is quite a wide selection), then you pick a soup base (2 soup options and 1 dry option), and the restaurant cooks it for you. Cost is by weight at $13.99/lb.

Love this concept as you can customize your dish however you want. For example, wife and I like to have a bit more veggies, decent amount of protein, and little to no carbs.

Lastly, the restaurant is very clean and the service is great! Will definitely come back!

I have been wanting to try this hotpot place and finally got to go this weekend. I came around 12pm and there wasn't a wait to get your table. The employee first assigns you a table and then you can grab a bowl and start choosing your hotpot ingredients.

They have lots of options for vegetables, meat, and other hotpot toppings. I would say their noodle options are a bit lacking though. They have beef, lamb, and seafood options. A lot of Asian vegetables and others like mushrooms, baby corn, etc.

After choosing, you give it to the employee to weigh and choose your soup. After that, they give you a key tag with your bowl number. You can also order their drinks and other side dishes here. I got the tomato broth since it is the only non-spicy broth and I wasn't sure how mild their mild is. I also ordered the brown sugar rice cake ($6.5).

Then you walk inside and find your table and make your sauce as the sauce station. They have plenty of tables and the seating area is designed nicely and atmosphere is comfortable.

The food was ready in less than 10 minutes. The broth tasted a lot like tomatoes and wasn't super special. The ingredients I chose were cooked well and did taste alright. I can't tell if the beef slices is good quality but it was quite fatty. And the brown sugar rice cakes were pretty good, not too sweet and fried nicely.

I would consider coming back another time with other family to try another broth and see if that was better. I do like their hotpot system where you pay by weight so you pay for exactly how much you can finish and what it weighs. Their service is also pretty good, employees are friendly with good attitude.
They changed the plates. I was so worried the flavor might be changed but it wasn’t. Always good and clean. Great services!

name: Dumpling House
address: 921 S Baldwin Ave, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews: Food here is authentic Chinese and delicious! We ordered cold pork with garlic (spicy), cumin lamb, pineapple shrimp fried rice and their bean curd sprout dish. Service was quick and staff was accommodating. Totally would come back here.

The dumplings were just so so.  Dumpling skin was on the thick side, especially the pot stickers.  Spicy wonton was sweet which it isn't supposed to be.  On the plus side, noodle soups were decent and the pulled pancake was very good.  Reasonably priced.
I’m a fan of Duck Roll Pancake. It consistently tastes amazing! ❤️

The service was loud, rude and brusque.   The food was a disappointment.  If you like your steamed dumplings and wontons with thick, tough skins you may like this place.  The cold sesame noodles tasted odd.  I never walk away from food but today I did.  The spices and condiments tasted rancid.  We do NOT recommend this place.

I grabbed some lunch at Dumpling House, a smaller sit down/take out location on Baldwin Ave. Menu has an array of options for quick Asian eats like dumplings, hot pot and appetizers.

I enjoyed the food, service was ridiculously quick and very friendly. Dumpling House's table setup was a bit compact, so if you're going to try a variety of dishes here they'll seat you at a 4 top.

The food was tasty and flavorful enough to not need additional condiments. I found the bok choi to be over sauced but still good. Dumpling skin was thicker than some other places. Enjoyed the spring rolls.

Note: No fountain drinks, all drinks except tea and water were canned.

name: No. 1 Express
address: 713 W Duarte Rd # F, Arcadia, CA 91007, USA
reviews:
I was excited to visit. Photos and reviews looked impressive. There are one questionable photo where the chicken looked under cooked.
The eating area design and layout is simple but feels comfortable. However, there are clutter on bar counter and boxes piles by the far table and under the bar counter.
Food was good. The smoke duck and dried green beans stir fry was well made and very flavorful.
I wish service was better. The owner and his translator has no concept of giving customer a piece and quite eating experience. They talked loudly and on speaker phone.

We found this little whole in the wall and are pleasantly surprised how tasty everything is! We order the Shepherd’s Purse, Crispy Fried Pork Rice, and the Braised Pork. DELICIOUS!! Definitely coming back!!

I have changed my five-star review to a one-star. I don't want to be that guy but this last time I ordered there was a huge language barrier, usually not a problem but this time it was just ridiculous. It took about 5 minutes to get my order through (three items) and then when I show up the order just wasn't made at all. Wasted a whole lot of time for nothing. I like this place and I usually order from here at least once a week but that's going to be changing if this is how it's going to be. And now back to my original post...The woman Who provided my dinner was extremely nice. The food came fast.It was hot and it's delicious. I highly recommend, especially for late night eats.

First timer , will definitely be back. I had the side , deep fried pork chop (great) and the deep fried pork balls (good size , 4) ,  and cabbage , a cold drink , tax and tip less than $20 . Took home 3 pork balls and some cabbage. Only thing they don't have is egg rolls

...

Tasty at a very cheap price! The food is fresh, dishes are authentic!
Edited 1: I can't imagine ppl who are complaining too sweet, this is the AUTHENTIC ShangHai style! A pitch of sugar adds extra flavor!

name: Boiling Point
address: 206 S 1st Ave, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews: Taiwanese hotpot place . (Not all you can eat). Always seems to have a group waiting outside the store. Good flavor. Big portions. You may be able to share one pot between 2 persons if you both are not big eaters. Worth to try.

Fun place to eat with friends. I love the variety in a single pot and how big it is! If you are not super hungry, you can share a bowl with another. I ordered the Taiwanese Spicy and the flavor is bold enough, yet not too crazy (well I am Thai so I might have a high heat tolerance). What I appreciate the most though is the variety of ingredients, in my cases, the pork intestine and pork blood. It is quite fulfilling to eat those authentic and difficult-to-cook items like that. In any event, we enjoy this place and would love to come back. Oh if you come here early, you can avoid the crowd.
Great hotpot location in Downtown Arcadia! The food is great, they have deals (last visit free tea) and plenty of parking on the street. However, the wait can be somewhat long but worth it.

I and my friend ordered to go, and I saw there’s a hair in her bowl, which doesn’t belong to any one of us. My friend has really long dark hair, mine is really short. The hair we found was shoulder length and somewhat brown. We called the store and they said they could only make us a new one. Who wants anything more from them after seeing something so disgusting, and they said we can only call customer service for the refund, which we have to wait till (we ordered ob Saturday) Monday when customer services is working.

This is ridiculous that the store cannot make refund directly to the customer. they were making excuses that the front desk who worked in the earlier shift has logged out of the system, therefore the money has been put into the system and not able to refund…. my first time hearing about it.

Definitely not coming back.

I love this all in one hot pot place. Their combinations are just right with the right flavors mixed in. Make your own dipping sauce for the contents, and it takes it to another level! My go-to hot pots are the lamb, beef, and milk curry. I also like the house special. There's lots of stinky tofu and pig blood cubes in it! Yum! If you come to during lunch time, it's cheaper and comes with tea, black or green. The prices have gone up a lot due to the crazy inflation, but it's still one of the best deals around these days for a fulfilling, tasty hot pot combo! Come early and avoid the busy times, or you'll wait a long time here!

name: Santa Anita Bar and Grill
address: 405 S Santa Anita Ave, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews: WOW!  I so wish I'd known about this place SOONER!  What gorgeous golf course views!  The tables were all very clean-looking, and we got served with kindness & smiles!  NOT a very large Menu, but if you're just looking for a quick fix with a view, this place has it!  VERY reasonable prices, great for grabbing a coke or a coffee too.
Come visit this great restaurant and AMAZING food while overlooking the beautiful golf course!!!  Ask for Rosio!!

Who would have known that there's a pretty decent brunch place located amongst the Santa Anita golf courses? I've been coming to the Santa Anita park for years, and never once did I really bother to scope out the golf course, let alone discover the small restaurant located just next to the parking lot before you hit the golf course.

Santa Anita Bar & Grill's exterior is painted identically to the other buildings next to it, so the restaurant itself blends in quite nicely. I used to enter the swimming pool from the building next to the restaurant, which is located to the right of the grill. The dining area of the restaurant seems fairly small, but with so little guests that trickle in and out of here, they really don't need to open the other dining areas. There's also a second floor, but the restaurant takes up just over 1/4 of the entire building. With an open kitchen, several table seats, and booth seating to line the restaurant, the place seems quite accommodating and cozy. I can see golfers coming in after they finish up a game, the wives of golfers sipping on coffee and reading a book as they wait for their husbands, or friends who have the inside knowledge of this restaurant as they enjoy the intimacy that the small café can bring.

The menu is fairly simple. I don't think they open for dinner, so they serve breakfast, brunch, and lunch during the hours they are open (not sure if lunch starts at a later time). My mom raved about the experience she had here with her friends, so I came in with high hopes. For the most part I did leave feeling pretty satisfied.

Coffee: For a refillable cup of coffee, it's a mere $2. Not too bad, but the quality is definitely not comparable to Starbucks. However, I've had my share of bad coffee, and this definitely is a few steps above horrible coffee. It's generic diner coffee.

"Crisp" Homemade Waffles: $5.75 This was a big letdown. From the name of the dish, I expected the waffles to be crisp. Instead, they tasted like frozen waffles that I could have easily made at home. Not crispy, but soggy! And they were super thin. The waffles weren't bad, but because they didn't taste any different from store bought, frozen waffles, this was a pretty big letdown. Chef's Belgium Waffles are definitely 100% better than this.

Eggs Benedict: $8.25 Also another letdown. You can judge the quality of the eggs benedict dish by how the hollandaise sauce tastes, and this sauce was pretty bad. Basically tasted like sour mayonnaise slathered on top of biscuits with bacon and overcooked eggs. It wasn't the worst eggs benedict dish I have tasted - Ugh Café Nano - but it wasn't the best. The sauce wasn't good, and having it cover everything under it made for a pretty bad bite. It came with a side of hash browns. The hash browns were a bit soggy from the oil, but it didn't taste bad.

Blueberry Pancakes: $5.75 This was probably the best dish that we had. These blueberry pancakes really taste homemade, and seeing the amount of blueberries in the pancakes definitely proves it! The pancake batter itself isn't too sweet, and having the slightly sweet, slightly tangy blueberries gives the pancakes an extra kick. Add on some butter and syrup, and the fluffy pancakes melt in your mouth. There's a stack of 3 (although my mom insists she got 4 the first time she came) and we could barely finish 1. Filling, but doesn't feel too heavy. This dish was worth the $5.75 compared to the limp waffles that I had ordered.

Service was mediocre. I mean, I figure they probably don't expect too many customers to come, and if they do - they're probably regulars. If you're lucky to snag a table that gives you a view of the green grassy fields, enjoy it! There are a few tables outside if you want to dine in the fresh air.

tl;dr - Overall, I thought it was a decent place to have breakfast/brunch.
Good service

name: Olive Garden Italian Restaurant
address: 430 E Huntington Dr, Arcadia, CA 91006, USA
reviews: This is the first time tve had such a great server/waiter without knowing his name. He was excellent. The entire staff was nice, professional and welcoming. It was such nice evening with my family and no one had ANY complaints. Awesome job Olive Garden!!!

I loved that place… the food was too close to authenticity, full of flavors.
The plates were full , it’s really obvious how generous they are!!!
Our waiter, Victor was very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. He is one of the most lawful employees I have ever met!!!!
Thank you victor for your hospitality, whenever we are near Pasadena we will make sure to pass by!!!

Service is very good and fast. In my opinion, Zoupa Tuscana is a perfect soup with breadsticks because they are not too heavy. Breadsticks are hot and tasty. The Seafood Alfredo is very good here. The calamari is decent. Prices are good which includes soup/salad, breadsticks (unlimited) and pasta. I will come back to try different types of pasta and soup.
One of the few places I don't mind constantly going back to. Love all their soups and their breadsticks dangerously good. 😄 I miss their mint chocolates, haven't seen them lately.

Danielle provided outstanding service, ensuring our dining experience was top-notch from start to finish. Her warm and friendly demeanor made us feel welcome, and she was impressively attentive throughout our meal. The speed of service was remarkable, with our food and drinks arriving promptly without sacrificing quality. Danielle's efficiency and excellent recommendations made our visit truly enjoyable. Five stars! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

name: Daikokuya Little Tokyo
address: 327 1st St, Los Angeles, CA 90012, USA
reviews:
Feels like back in an restaurant in Japan.  Fantastic ramen and rice bowls with meat.  Fried tofu and gyoza are also excellent.  Draft beer is also very enjoyable.
There can be a queue, but it moves pretty quickly.
Highly recommend the restaurant, and make sure you get recommendations from the supportive staff.  You can make combo and order half sizes to maximise your needs.
Also recommend to bring kids, as the food is not spicy.

It was my wife's birthday. We chose this restaurant because of their noodle story.

We ordered their most popular noodle to try. It was excellent taste combination with pork broth, miso, noodle hardness. The cabbage salad side dish is perfect with noodle. Even cabbage texture was fresh and alive. They must have kept it in ice cold water.

Then their poke bowl was super excellent. Rice temperature, hardness was perfect, amount of sauce was perfect, amount of tuna and salmon was generous.

Fried rice was just normal.

I was very disappointed with their chicken teriyaki bowl. First of all, chicken wasn't pan fried or pan fried enough. It was very steamy texture. Their teriyaki sauce was very soy sauce taste. It wasn't typical or well known teriyaki taste i am used to. I wouldn't order again.

The pork chashu bowl was a decent size and pretty good. I liked how they added ginger to give it a fresh flavor. The vegetable gyoza didn't leave much of an impression (they were okay, but i probably should have gotten the chicken or pork version). It was a cool, old world Japanese vibe inside, but I didn't care for the Dodger-inspired uniforms. Service was typical of small Ramen places - take your order, smile, serve food promptly, smile some more, and hope you leave quickly as they have limited seating.

Great atmosphere! Everyone that were dining seems to really enjoy their food. First sip of the rich broth hit the yummy meter very high! All the plaques and awards reinforced its claims. The chicken karaage was easily the best I ever had. It was crispy, juicy and tender. They were huge pieces of chicken; cooked to perfection. The service was great and food came out fast. Priced reasonably well. The portions were big enough for big eaters like me lol. Everything was delicious! Can't wait to come back and try their other unique dishes. You will see a line outside. Don't get scared It moves pretty fast, even though it is a small restaurant. It's in the middle of Little Tokyo so public parking are everywhere.

My husband was raised in CALI and I never been to CALI, but he always said there is only one spot he will only get ramen and it this place that called DAIKOKUYA. So he took me there after we just landed from the airport and I got a bowl of Ramen and it was the best thing I ever taste🥹.we live
in Nebraska and there is nothing like that so I’m grateful after all this year of saving up so he could introduce me to this only one ramen place he preferred.(I tag them on instagram and they tag me in they instagram story so that was very cool) hopefully we go back before we leave .

name: Marugame Monzo
address: 329 1st St, Los Angeles, CA 90012, USA
reviews: The curry udon was savory and came with the perfect amount of toppings. The Shrimp and scallops tempura could’ve been a little more crispy in my opinion. The braised pork udon broth was perfectly seasoned, the pork could have been cut smaller to make it easier to eat. We also thought it could have been braised a little longer as the fat wasn’t tender enough to eat. We were seated and served quickly, it wasn’t a bad experience and i would definitely come again.

I usually only come here to eat one thing: the uni udon. If you’re coming during normal people hours, you most likely will have to wait in line like a peasant. The food is good and solid, but I did feel the “wow” factor from the first time I’ve had it til’ now has suddenly faded. Maybe if it’s your first time it’s worth a try, but I would be hard pressed to come back here before trying other places. Still a great place to have dinner and the service is great.

One of the best places to have the udon noodles, the broth, noodles and the flavor- absolutely delicious. You will not be disappointed. I tried their spicy tofu udon and the carbonara udon. There is a public parking opposite to the restaurant. Be prepared to wait if you go during the peak hours. Worth the wait. I would recommend this place.

SO good. We were sat pretty quickly, but just be sure that the entire party is there - or they won’t seat you until they are. It is a pretty tight space, but there’s indoor and outdoor seating, and most workers speak both English and Japanese.

The mentai seafood pasta was perfectly creamy, and the noodles were cooked just right. We had 3 pcs takoyaki ( 1 of the takoyaki dont have octopus piece, the filling ), crispy chicken skin was perfect, crunchy and tasty but too much sauce (sour). It would be better if they put the sauce on the side. Everything was great. The only downside is the waiter ( the middle-aged woman with dyed blonde hair and using glasses), we dont even finish our food and dont ask for the bill yet, out of nowhere she put it in our table (at the bar). That was rude. Its not even 20 mins before our food arrived. Please improve the service, other wise you will drive your customer away.

name: Kinjiro
address: 424 E 2nd St, Los Angeles, CA 90012, USA
reviews:
There is a master chef and a master mind behind the scenes in this small, unpretentious, well appointed  Izakaya. If the layout seems a little odd the food and presentation more than makes up for it.
The offerings are all unusual and tempting and if I were a full time resident in L.A. this would be my go to place for any worthy excuse.
I loved every bite that I ordered  and my only regret was finding the urchin risotto in the menu when I was already too full and satisfied. It will have to wait for the next time I am in L.A.
But if you are a full time resident you have no excuse not to eat in this mini paradise.

This was one of our favorite meals during our trip to LA. The uni risotto, thick cut beef tongue, truffle udon, and wasabi potato salad were the absolute stand-outs. Service was great, we loved their sake selection, and the pacing was on point. Definitely try them out.

Absolutely outstanding. Impeccable service and delicious food in a clean and minimalist setting, what more could you ask for? Make sure you make a reservation in advance, when their reservation window opens (secret tip: use the “scheduled send” feature in gmail to make sure your reservation request is perfectly on-time).

My personal favorites were the grilled beef tongue, grilled cod, and sesame mousse. The grilled beef tongue was crispy on the outside and perfectly tender but with just the right amount of bite. The grilled cod was super juicy and savory, skin was crispy - I can eat that with every meal. Lastly, the sesame mousse - mousse has no right to be this delicious. Creamy and lightly sweet, it was so good we ordered another one immediately.

No doubt I’ll be back the next time I’m in LA.

The food is not as good as it used to be and my favorite dish, the beef tongue did come out hot.  A bit disappointed especially when the price went up by quite a bit.  The sukiyaki beef bowl was so chewy.  Just thought the overall food quality used to be better.

The Honda Plaza contains a treasure trove of great eats, and Kinjiro fits in beautifully.

I had the opportunity to try Kinjiro after hearing about the beef tongue nonstop! Everything here was delicious, even the ones that were beyond my comfort zone. I usually don't get potato salad, for example, but this one had a great mix of textures and flavor. We also tried the seared uni, uni risotto, fresh tofu, yuzu chicken, and beef tongue noodle soup.

I know we ordered way too much and we were stuffed, but we still had to order dessert! Their hojicha panna cotta was a perfect way to end off the meal and was the last stop before a fat food coma.

A reservation is required and you don't really need to dress up here. I would avoid casual sandals, graphic tees, and gym clothes, though. The restaurant and staff/owner are super chill. There's a brief wait for your food, but then the dishes start rolling out pretty quickly!

If I ever get the chance to come back, I look forward to trying different dishes!

Parking: Parking is paid, but even then you gotta hunt down a spot. It's every person for themselves here. 😱

name: Izakaya Gazen
address: 362 1st St, Los Angeles, CA 90012, USA
reviews: This is my most favorite Japanese Izakaya style restaurant in DTLA! The dishes are all authentic and taste wonderful, yet reasonably priced (at least from the DTLA standard).  Staff are friendly and helpful!
It is absolutely delicious and a decent price for the number of us that had dinner there. Would highly recommend this spot if in town and hungering for great sushi.

The atmosphere was very relaxed and charming, the food was delicious, and the staff very courteous. I never had natto before and was very excited to try it here, it came with a lot of mix-ins which made it delicious and the ultimate chirasu was exquisite.

The food was very good; fresh and tasty. I had the signature tofu sampler where all three were made in-house. All 3 were very good but I liked the most the black sesame and the creamy one.  The shrimp tempura was very good as well and the black cod was delicious.  I will definitely return next time I am in Little Tokyo.  The quality of the food was superior to some of the restaurants in the village.

We have visited here twice now. They validate parking as well.

We've ordered the tofu sampler, beef tongue, yellowtail green onion cut roll, albacore and tomato, squid somen, grilled baby scallops, tuna and radish pickle cut roll, beef sukiyaki tofu, ume chazuke, corn tempura, cucumber with mentaiko. We enjoyed every dish we've ordered so far.

We also ordered asahi and suntory draft to drink. The service is very attentive. We will continue to come back.

name: Azay
address: 226 1st St, Los Angeles, CA 90012, USA
reviews:
Worse food experience in little Tokyo. I was looking forward for an authentic breakfast experience but after a 1 1/2 hr wait it was more of a lunch. As the menu states there is a French Japanese fusion, we decided to order the kakuni omurice, Nagoya hitsumabushi.

The omurice was an over cooked egg omelet over a rice drenched in ketchup. The egg was so dry and a major disappointment.

The eel bowl was just disappointing because the white rice was wet and not cooked properly. The eel was a bit fishy, and the broth served with it was cold. I’ve had better unagi at its price point.

Duck confit was a very salty flavor and not juicy. The couscous was dried along with stale bread. The veggies were served soggy.

Not only was the food disappointing and lacked quality, but waited long for a water refill or even hot water for the tea.

Service and food experience was so poor, I would definitely not recommend. For a true Japanese experience Gardena and Torrance in South Bay has so many hidden gems at a lower cost.

Save yourself time and visit other nearby spots in little Tokyo that offers better food like sushi gen.

In A Nutshell:

-Azay is a cool spot to grab a Japanese breakfast.
-It's basically a bento box that comes w/ a fresh tofu, tamago (Japanese omelet), miso soup, pickled veggies & you can also add some protein such as Maryland Soft-Shell Blue Crab or Black Cod
-It's a very different style of breakfast you would normally eat in L.A., but something worth trying out b/c it's really good.
-Their green tea/matcha creme brulee was really, really good & I highly recommended trying that too.

Overall, this was a nice find & I didn't have to wait at all on a Sunday morning around 11:30 am.

Absolutely incredible.
I'm so glad we got a reservation for traditional Japanese breakfast!
The service was kind, informative, and outstanding. I wish we were closer and could visit more often.

Omg the Matcha Brulee!!!

Hands down the most enjoyable Japanese and French fusion food in town! The bento box shows authenticity and delicacy of Japanese cuisine at its best. The duck confit is pretty good with the couscous. The grapefruit tart, special dessert of the day, was very impressive too! It feels like we don’t get to find this kind of hearty food at this price anywhere else in LA! Reservation is highly recommended!

Came in with my partner and the interior was small and so it felt a bit tight, but the servers knew how to work around the space well! They were also super friendly without being overbearing and the food that we ordered was so good! I got the omurice and my partner got the hayashi dish. I preferred mine over his and their miso soup was paired really well with the omurice :)

I would come back again to try their breakfast and bento meals

name: Kouraku Japanese Ramen & Grill
address: 314 E 2nd St, Los Angeles, CA 90012, USA
reviews: A Little Tokyo original! I love coming here when I am in need of Japanese comfort food! My all-time favorite at Koraku  is the Tenshin Chahan Ankake! It’s basically a shrimp omelette topped over pork fried rice and gravy! I may not be everybody’s cup of tea, but it’s absolutely delicious! You also can’t go  wrong with their shrimp tempura! The service is fast and efficient, and they even have robots now serving you food!
