I have been here twice within 2 day's during my trip to LA

The food is so delicious. Everything is good

Love it

Open 24 hrs is a huge plus
They offered valet parking here for only 4 dollars at dinner and 2 for lunch. We order no.8 and no.9 soup and extra meat. The amount is quite decent and the soup is great.
The food is good and the staff is friendly. However, the gratuities are calculated on the total, including the sales tax, not just the food portion.

name: Master HA Korean Restaurant
address: 1147 S Western Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90006, USA
reviews:
I took my parents here to celebrate Father's day. We were lucky enough to beat the lunch rush and were seated right away.

Service at our table was not by just one designated server, but by all service staff. They were super kind and coordinated, so we felt very well taken care of.

We ordered the premium marinated crab  & the premium live uni. Pictures do not do them justice.  Presentation was superb, ingredients were fresh and sweet, and we could not stop talking about how delicious it all was.

Price may seem a steep when just looking at numbers, but it was actually worth every penny.

Parking is a bit troublesome, but it's LA. let's be realistic.

It is a kid-friendly restaurant, and has wheelchair accessibility. It also has outdoor seating underneath a large canopy/tent.

I can't wait to go back with more family and friends.

I finally made it to Master Ha’s after hearing so many rave reviews and being pestered by friends to try it out. I decided to dive into the deep end and ordered a marinated raw shrimp along with a Wagyu BBQ beef bowl. Spoiler alert: my taste buds have never been happier!

First, let’s talk about that Wagyu beef. It was like a flavor bomb exploded in my mouth. The meat was so tender it practically melted, leaving me wondering if I had accidentally ordered a bowl of delicious butter. Honestly, I loved the rice bowl so much that the marinated raw crab & shrimp, which was good, took a backseat.

Now, I’m not going to lie, the food here is a bit pricey. But considering the quality, it’s worth it. Think of it as an investment in your taste buds’ happiness. The service was also top-notch; the staff made sure I was well taken care of, almost like they were auditioning for a hospitality award.

If you’re looking for a place that serves incredible food and offers service with a smile, Master Ha’s is the place to be. I can’t wait to go back and see what other culinary delights they have in store. Who knows, maybe next time I’ll try something even more adventurous! 🫶🏼

This place is amazing. We had the large marinated crab and the regular uni rice bowl. The large marinated crab came with 3 crabs and the regular uni rice bowl usually come with 3 uni but they gave us 4 because they said the size of the uni was a bit smaller than usual. Both of them tasted so good and they looked so fancy. The marinated crab came with crab miso soup and rice. The sauce of the marinated crab was perfect, I loved mixing the orange fat/ roe sticked on the shell with rice and the sauce.
The server was super helpful explaining the differences between the options and letting us know different ways to eat with the marinated crab and uni.

I have been eager to experience Master Ha for some time, and it lived up to my expectations. The soy crab and uni were exceptionally well-prepared and presented. We also ordered the short rib and oxtail soup, both of which were delectable. The service was impeccable. The sole drawback was the absence of alcohol; soju would have complemented the raw seafood perfectly.

Finally found a good soy sauce marinated crab place in LA! Even though the size of the crab was smaller than expected, the taste was satisfying. Not too salty, not too blend!

Salmon marinated in soy sauce and pollack roe hand roll were great as well. Tiny, but good.

FYI,

1. I went to this restaurant on a Wednesday but it still had a waiting list. Try to go as early as possible (before dinner time).

2. No alcohol available.

3. The parking lot is usually full, so I recommend to find a street parking.

name: Mapo Kkak Doo Gee
address: 3611 W 6th St, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews: Delicious quality food. The owner is really nice with great service. If you want a variety of authentic Korean food, this will be your best bet. All the dishes down to the banchan was amazing and delicious.

A very chill Korean restaurant that provides comfort Korean dishes. There were not a lot of people when we came so it's nice to not have to wait too long for service but I can imagine it might get overwhelming because there's only one wait staff. The price is reasonable and the portion is ginormous so if you are a small eater you can consider bringing some leftovers home. For parking they provide valet parking that charges $3.

I absolutely love this place. My second time here and I came back to Koreatown on a business day trip to LA all the way from Santa Barbara just for the food here. I love the women who run it and their warmth and care with which they feed us. It’s also extremely similar to what I ate in Seoul itself before. My favourite is the bibimbap and kimchi stew!

I really enjoyed eating at this place. I had been looking for a nice spot in Koreatown to try and this place satisfied the need.

The place was very authentic. And while the waitress didn't know English very well, I was still able to communicate what I wanted.

I ordered the squid and it was very fresh and flavorful. It was served mixed with onions, zucchini and various Korean spices.

The banchan (side dishes) were very good as well. There was kimchi and 3 other plates of things. I think one of the others was tofu and another was zucchini. There was also a small pile of noodles of such.

Overall, this was a great experience trying and I would eat here again.

Great food always, kind service. Our bill was not itemized and it was $5 above what we actually owed—before tipping. It’s still an amazing restaurant and I’m for sure coming back! I would just make sure you calculate your price beforehand so you can adjust your tip accordingly.

name: Yangmani
address: 2561 W Olympic Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90006, USA
reviews: A good place to have bbq after work. Food is great portion! We’re 4 girls and ordered the combo for 2 guys plus one other dish. And we’re all full. The staff is very nice, he mentioned the amount is enough for girls. Not asking us to order more.

Delicious Korean BBQ and they will help you with the cooking of it, so don’t worry!
Get the combo so you get all the yummy little sides like spicy salad and noodle soups. The meats are delicious - we like the thin brisket and marinated rib the best. Mix and match how you like! Don’t forget to try all the condiments. 5pm was a good time to go, by 6pm there was a wait but it didn’t seem too long. Servers are friendly and willing to explain all the tricks of how to order and eat everything you order 😅 if you are unsure.
There was a lot of meat and good quality.  Also the sever who grill meat was the best service. My family  has been  gotten  dinner time here excellent.  Thanks,

The restaurant is tiny with friendly staff. There’s a lot of new side dishes that I have never tried and thought it was interesting the meat was good. We got combo C. More than enough food for 3. Overall experience was good. Except I was sitting in a puddle of grease beneath my feet. I didn’t know where to put my feet because it was just all over the floor was I was sitting. Will come back next time to try other dishes in the menu. We came in late but they were still trying to accommodate us with a big smile which was a plus. Thank you!

The restaurant has very little interior charm or decoration, however the food makes up for this. Meats are very fresh and quality cuts. Ask sides are well done, nicely presented and well spiced. They do the grilling at your table so you don't have to. It's Korea town and parking is very difficult, arrive early to find a spot. Seating indoors and outside. The staff are friendly and helpful. One of the better places for real, non-scene Korean BBQ in LA.

name: Hanbat Shul Lung Tang
address: 4163 5th St, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews:
Hanbat Shul Lung Tang is a cozy Korean restaurant that only serves Shul Lung Tang on their menu. It's a soup with choice of meat in a bone broth that has been stewed for hours upon hours.

Ordered the beef brisket and it was delicious. Put some salt, pepper on the side to dip the meat.

Broth was delicious and this is the type of comfort food you are looking for after a long night.

$20 per bowl including tip so you don't have to worry about the change.

There is free parking in the back.

When we went during lunch, there was no wait.

Original Bone Broth 💯

It’s hard to dispute the fact that Los Angeles’ Koreatown is the mecca for Korean food in the United States

I’ve never lived close enough to explore it well but did this past week sampling soy marinated raw crabs, short rib stews, and multi-colored banchan

My favorite however was the traditional ox bone soup. In the SF Bay Area, I most often order the more flavorful galbi tang (short rib soup) but the sul lung tang is as close to Korea and the go-to in LA

I’ve been wanting to try Han Bat Shul Lung Tang for close to a decade and it did not disappoint

Just a pinch of salt, plentiful scallions and a side of kimchi and rice made the perfect meal combination

The broth is milky white (side note I also tried the clear sul lung tang at Young Dang) and it’s so full of rich beefiness you can easily tell it’s made over hours

Parking isn’t as bad as I’ve always feared in LA with plentiful lots and parking structures in Koreatown that makes it a destination worthy of your time

📷 Salgoki Sul Lung Tang $20 ~ brisket / Seokum $20 ~ mixed / Naejang $20 ~ Intestines, Tripe, Spleen

📍Hanbat Sul Lung Tang (Los Angeles, CA)

Seating is indoor only and limited metered street parking is available nearby.  Credit cards are accepted.

Food is good but overpriced. What is alarming is that their rating is a C for kitchen cleanliness. Which, in most cases increases the probability of the food being unhygienic. This is all the more concerning because the restaurant uses intestines as one of the main ingredients. And intestine, if not stored properly, can be a host for e.coli bacteria.
Delicious, can only order sulung tang pretty much which is when you know it's going to be good! Super fast service and 10/10 quality
Simple Nourishing Bone Broth, Beef Brisket and Tripe; served with Steamed Rice and Kimchi. Season with Salt and thin sliced Scallions. Warm staff, affordable yummy place to eat. Simple and Good.

name: Hae Jang Chon Korean BBQ Restaurant
address: 3821 W 6th St, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews: Good selection of Korean side dishes! Came here on Thursday around 2 pm and there was no wait. You get 4 dips to choose from which is nice. Their specialty is the marinaded squid and they only use USDA choice meats. Service is really great when we visited and the staff helped us flip the meats and clean the pan after each round. I found the squid to not be as chewy as I expect but the beef and pork was excellent.The meat was super tender! The pork shoulder is my favourite! It’s a good balance between fat and meat and paired with the pickled radish is perfect!!

Great experience. We came late and there was a bit of a wait, but the line moved fast. We mostly had the brisket, but the steak was great too. Our servers were very helpful and attentive. Parking was a little tricky but the valet is worth it! Perfect place for late night KBBQ 😀

Absolutely loved my experience at this Korean AYCE BBQ spot! The price is good for the wide selection they offer. The service is good and they take orders pretty promptly. My favorites are the beef brisket and short rib - flavorful and tender, definite must-tries! And to top it off, the Kimchi fried rice at the end was the perfect way to conclude the feast. Highly recommend!

Let me start this review by saying that I LOVE FOOD. BUT.... 2+ hrs. of wait time to try AYCE Korean bbq is definitely not worth it. It was very frustrating. The inaccurate wait time estimates significantly extended our wait, which could have been avoided with better communication. This review factors in the wait time, along with the quality of the food and the service.

Hae Jang Chon definitely lives up to the hype when it comes to the food itself. They offer an all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ experience for both lunch and dinner, with a wide variety of meats to choose from - beef, pork, chicken, and even some seafood options.

The side dishes were plentiful too, going beyond the standard banchan with items like corn cheese, kimchi pancake, and steamed egg. Everything we tried, from the meat options (including the beef brisket, short ribs, bulgogi, and pork belly) to the kimchi pancake and corn cheese, was delicious. They even have four different sauces to complement the flavors.

The staff was fantastic - super attentive and efficient. They cooked the meat for us right at our table, kept our waters refilled, and made sure everything ran smoothly.

Here's the thing, though - the wait was BRUTAL. We got there at 8 pm on a Friday night (party of three), and didn't get seated until close to 10:30 pm. In this day and age, it felt archaic that they didn't take reservations or even phone numbers for the waitlist. You just had to be there physically. To make it worse, they kept giving us inaccurate wait time estimates that kept getting pushed back further. It was frustrating, especially considering the place was packed all night with long lines.

So, the food? It's definitely a 4-star experience. The wait? Not so much. Would I go back? Maybe, but only if I knew I could get seated quickly or they implemented a more user-friendly waitlist system.

I have been here since I was in school (10 yr before) and Hae Jang Chon is always my No.1 choice for AYCE Korean bbq. The quality of the meat are always excellent. Price is pretty reasonable compare to the inflation. I always order marinated short rib, prime steak and beef tone. Don't forget cheese corn and fried rice. Highly recommend if you are craving for Korean bbq.

name: Ahgassi Gopchang
address: 3744 W 6th St, Los Angeles, CA 90005, USA
reviews: Heard about this place because BTS named it one of their favorite restaurants in LA. It truly did not disappoint! The food was delicious and the staff was very attentive. I don't think I've ever had such a thick cut of 삼겹살 (the pork belly) before! Absolutely delicious. The steamed egg dish was fantastic as well. Honestly, there wasn't anything I didn't like! It was also a lot of fun to go through their wall of signatures and see tons of artists I follow and admire. 😊 All in all, great experience! Will definitely be going back whenever I may end up in LA again!

This is a popular spot for Asian/K-pop celebs (a la the photos of autographs adorning their walls). Entrance is in the corner- visible from the street but you have to round a corner in the parking lot to enter the restaurant (refer to photo). Got there around 8:30 pm on a Sunday night after KCON and we literally beat the rush in. Waited no more than 5 minutes and were seated right away. There is a QR code available outside and you can scan and study the menu. So we ordered right away as soon as we sat down. Douglas was our waiter and he was superb! Even when it got busy he made sure to check with us so we got the extra side dishes we wanted and refills on water.

We ordered the Aghassi Combo for 2. It was just the hubby and I and while I wanted to order the gopchang too, we were just too full with the combo. You really need to come with more people to eat more variety. I have had the gopchang before here and it is also good! Between the pork belly and pork jowl we went with the jowl and it did not disappoint! All the meat was of high quality, cooked to melt-in-your-mouth perfection! We also picked the soybean (daengjang) soup. Had a few clams in there and the rice cakes were the perfect consistency. I liked the saltiness of the soup. Warning the peppers in the soup are super spicy, but not noticeable with just the soup. We also ordered the steamed egg.

Side dishes were so good. The potatoes and the white (baek) kimchi were my favorites. I also loved the flavor of the dongchimi. My favorite of the meats was the Jowl- better than the brisket.

We got really lucky and found street parking (free metered spot because it was Sunday). However refer to the photos for the small driveway off of Harvard into the Harvard Plaza parking. There is only valet available in the lot for $4 if you pay cash and $5 if you pay card. The parking lot is one way so when you exit you will exit off of 6th.

My first two dishes were so awful that i could give a rating of 2-3 stars, but the primed marianted short rib was fantastic. The Tongue and Beef with sprout are to be honest 2/5 no cap. I came here because of the review but was quite disappointed.  I know that after reading my reviews its confusing because i gave an overall of 4/5. The reason is because after i met my korean friend and told him about this place and my experience. He told me Ahgassi Gopchang is an INTESTINES specialty restaurant.  My fault for ordering something out of their recommendations.

before i went inside restaurants, there was a group of arabs who came out the shop and said
Person 1:this place taste bad. how come people come here
Person 2: bro, its not even halal. Its not worth it.

Yep, i probably ordered like them, but like i said its our fault for not doing research about the restaurant beforehand.

Was a little worried about being accommodated going solo, but service was phenomenal.

All of the food I had was top notch. Really enjoyed the beef intestines and japchae; table side service for grilling was stellar!
We enjoyed the Korean BBQ. We were overwhelmed by the number of the side dishes! It was a joy eating here. The meat was of premium quality!

name: Seong Buk Dong
address: 3303 W 6th St, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews:
Best Korean restaurant, period. They have a fantastic selection of iconic Korean dishes, such as kalbi-jjim, mackerel-jorim, kuk-bab, and tofu-jjigae.  Hence, grilled fish selection is also highly recommended, as they use super fresh fish.
Kimchi is a barometer of goodness of Korean restaurant.  The house Kimchi is best in town.

The staffs are super friendly. Valet parking is available.

Today with my mom came here and tried their one of the famous food “beef stew” omg! So so so delicious 😭 and the they are so so so kind to us. I will definitely come back and try again. Thank you so much~!!!!!
Wonderful food, ordered the Seongbukdong beef soup, tender chunks of beef, delicious. The banchan was fresh and unique, especially steamed egg.
Really good authentic Korean food, honestly don't want to write I review because I don't want it to get too popular.
Delicious, traditional dishes with fresh ingredients. The staff were very kind as well

name: mdk noodles (Myung Dong Kyoja)
address: 3630 Wilshire Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90010, USA
reviews: Everything at MDK was great. From the service to the food. The dumplings were amazing and better than the ones I tried in Seoul. The wrapper was thin, just enough to hold the delicious and juicy pork filling. We got the cold green noodles. Perfect balance of spicy and noodles were nice and chewy. Definitely will be back.

Another fantastic restaurant in K-town, the food here is made with care and super high quality. If you’re craving a hearty noodle or dumpling dish this is your place.

We ordered their signature noodle soup as well as an order of their homemade dumplings and each plate was big enough to share so family style is recommended here. Our dishes came with a sides of kimchi which paired nicely as the spice complimented the meal well.

The inside was spacious and clean. The staff came around multiple times to refill our cups. There is also plenty of parking nearby in a garage or on the street.

Will definitely be back and keep this place in my K-town rotation.

Highly Highly recommend this place! This is the second time I’ve been, and I will definitely be back. The spicy kimchi is amazing and the cold green chlorella noodles are perfection, especially refreshing on a hot day.

This place is bright and clean with lots of seating. We waited about 5 minutes before we got seated in a party of 5. I def recommend ordering the food family style bc the portions are shareable and huge.

The majority of us couldn’t finish our bowl of noodles. The pan fried dumplings were pretty good. The kimchi is a little bit on the spicy side. So if you get any of the spicy dishes, it’s about the same level of spicy.

I love their noodles so much. It was my first tome trying their spicy menu and woah, no joke, it was soooo spicy that I couldn’t eat much. I’m not saying it is bad, it was amazing actually but I just can’t handle spicy food very well. I’m going to stick to my regular noodle, but I’m glad I tried. Especially Jjolmyeon, try if you can handle their spicy level. It was an amazing one bite for me and my friend finished it and paid for it the next day iykyk lol. Their kimchi pancake is amazing! Not that spicy and perfectly seasoned. Their dumplings are the best in ktown btw in my personal opinion.

name: KingChang-La - Koreatown
address: 3732 W 6th St, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews: Absolutely loved my experience at this Korean BBQ restaurant! The food here is top-notch, and the service is great! We tried the small beef combo, and it was more than enough for two people! The meat was tender and flavorful, and grilling it at the table added to the fun. Daniel's attentive service made our dining experience even more enjoyable. The ambiance was lively, and we had a fantastic time. Highly recommend this place for anyone craving delicious Korean BBQ!

I love this place! I was recommend by my friend that they have really good meat. And I was so obsessed with Korean bbq. We ordered marinated short ribs and it was soooooo good. The size is large and we were so satisfied!! We also had seafood pancake as well as ramen, they were also good. I love how they serve us, the environment was nice at there. Will definitely come back again and try something out different:))

Highly recommended!!
We didn't order a set meal, although the set meals looked quite good, they just weren't what I wanted. So, we decided to order separately. Here's what we ordered:
1. Beef tongue (can be ordered as a half portion)
2. Pork neck meat (can be ordered as a half portion)
3. Fish cake soup (must-order! Extremely refreshing)
4. Beef intestines (very tasty, but a bit fatty for me)
5. Snowflake pork (can be ordered as a half portion)
-
Although the beef intestines were the star, I have to say... their snowflake pork was amazing! So tender! Even someone like me, who isn't particularly fond of beef, thought it was delicious! Highly recommended! The staff grill it for you the whole time, so you just have to wait to eat 🙈

Since ktown's pine crane collapsed, I've found a Korean BBQ that serves grilled beef intestines and barbecue 🥰

🌟Beef combo You can't go wrong with this combo, which has fat and Short ribs and a soup of your choice. Fat cow can dip cheese 🧀, can be shredded. Short ribs are really not too fragrant with garlic. The texture of these ribs is very obvious 😋

🌟 I am most greedy for roast fat sausage, because I want spicy, so I first order this sauce. Sizzling with bean sprouts and scallion oil, it's a real treat. But I still get tired of eating too much. Try it without sauce next time

🌟 seafood cake material really quite a lot, sweet and crisp. Their steamed eggs are cooked on the spot for you in a small stove in front of you, which is the first time I have seen.

🌟 When I come to the store on weekdays, it is always full of people, and on weekends, there is a queue of people. I heard that Korean stars will also come to punch in!

The food and vibe here is amazing. The intestines combo tastes so good! Daniel was very helpful and took good care of our table. Highly recommended the beef stomach and large intestines. The valet parking is kinda weird. I self parked and they charged me 5 bucks and totally self-served unlike other town plaza, which they usually take care of your car when you enter the plaza.

name: Soowon Galbi
address: 856 Vermont Ave B, Los Angeles, CA 90005, USA
reviews:
This place is thriving, but my experience wasn't the best. The decor is outdated with cracked seats, my table had streaks of oil around, with uncleaned grill, and the ventilated air smelled like wet socks. The server kept lowering the heat while the meat was still being cooked, to probably avoid the grill getting charred, the prolonged cooking made the meat very chewy.

The marinated meat was good, but the owner really should invest on the interior. Not the first Korean Barbecue place I would go to, or the second, or the third.

Ordered the Galbi, cold noodles and soup for dinner.  Quality of the Galbi was very good but it was pricy.  Our waiter was an expert at grilling it patiently and cut it up for us.  The hilight for the dinner was the cold noodles.  It was light, refreshing and the noodles were so chewy and delicious.   It's best to eat this as soon as it arrives otherwise the texture of the noodles change as it sits in the broth.  The soup was average.  Parking in the small lot is Valet.

We had the marinated beef and it was so delicious. I loved all the sides and all the different veggies. The service was okay. We were thankful they had valet for parking because the parking was packed. I would come back here and eat again.

Soowon galbi located in koreatown la is the spot to get galbi or short rib. Their combo B is $160 and feeds four people. It comes with 5 incredible meats including brisket, short rib, pork belly and marinated bone in and bone less short rib. They also have spicy cold noodles so I couldn’t resist. My must order is the saam set because I love making lettuce and perilla wraps with the meat. Their meat quality is pretty good and they come out juicy. Also a big plus that they cook for you here and they have a limited parking lot
I came here due to a friend's recommendation and it was amazing! Delicious authentic korean food and great service. For sure I will return here!

name: Park's BBQ
address: 955 S Vermont Ave G, Los Angeles, CA 90006, USA
reviews: Without hesitation, the best Korean restaurant Ive ever been to. The experience was perfect (wish I had taken better pics). So clean, the staff is helpful and attentive, and the food was flawless. The specialty is the beef BBQ but the sides and veggies are all just as worthy of a meal on their own. Its a luxurious treat but I will be back when im in LA again.

Dinner with the family, a treat for my son because he had achieved the Presidential award for excellence in school. This was his reward and our second time here. We were off to a fantastic evening. The wait was short, the atmosphere was great. The food is 5-stars. But come time to wrap up and pay, the young man was not as attentive as he was while cooking the food. It took a little while longer to get the bill. Once I flagged him down to get the check, as soon as he placed it on the table, he disappeared for a long while. The wife went to the restroom, did her thing, returned, and still no signs of the waiter to charge us. We could have left, wondering if he would have even noticed. But I have integrity. I patiently waited. I asked the wife flagged him down. And finally he brought over the CC machine. Yikes, what a terrible ending.

Authentic Korean BBQ! A must visit place. Everything we had was amazingly delicious! Staffs are skillful. He grilled them just RIGHT. Variety of side dishes as well. If you are here, don’t forget to order Japchae, it was so good that I had to order food delivery again the next day.

As we drove into Koreatown we were underwhelmed with the neighborhood. So much trash everywhere.

We had made an early dinner reservation and arrived early and they were beyond accommodating

This place is the real deal. And worth the hype and money

There were 3 of us dining so we got the bbq sampler for 2 and a stewed black cod dish..a specialty of the house.

I did not want to get the cod … but I was outvoted. It was great and an individualized dish. It was great !!!

We finished it all and would without a shadow of a doubt return to Parks BBQ again !!!

Pro Tip - go before the dinner rush and make a reservation. Parking in KTown is bonkers so absolutely use the valet offered by Parks BBQ.  It was $4 and worth every penny

The korean BBQ here is to die for. The meat is melt in your mouth and is very juicy. The banchan is also very delicious. The servers cook the meat for you and they’re very fast too! The seafood pancake wasn’t anything special though and wouldn’t really recommend it. Overall, I really enjoyed my experience here and would definitely come again if I’m in the area.

name: Jin Ju KBBQ
address: 203 N Western Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90004, USA
reviews: Their pork belly and marinated pork ribs we tried were thumbs up! If you prefer soy sauce marinated meat vs. spicy sauce, you will like their ribs. it's not as sweet as ham ji park ribs. their service 6 stars, very prompt and nice.

It's a great place for Korean pork ribs!

They have been doing Korean bbq pork ribs since the 90's.  Food and banchan are tidy, and their soy sauce based marinated pork ribs are definitely on point!  I highly recommend it as it is their main item.

Another bbq meat recommendation is their thick cut samgyupsal - pork belly.

Amazing typical no-frills Korean barbecue restaurant,  food is delicious, both the barbecue and also side dishes. Service is great and owners are friendly. This was my first time and I plan to repeat.
Korean beverage soju comes in different flavours, mango was my favorite.

Great place for samgyupsal!
Their egg soup(계란찜) & soybean paste soup(된장찌개) were so good.
Very good service too. I’ll go back!
Really great spot for Korean BBQ. Excellent staff. Friendly and helped us do some of the cooking. Excellent spot!

name: Prime K BBQ
address: 400 S Western Ave Unit 104, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews:
Great food and service! Lots of side dishes, and got the combo which we loved.

Needed help with our car as well and the staff was super helpful and kind. Really appreciate them going out of their way to help. Would definitely come back again!
Good quality meat, great service. Love all the side dishes. Corn and steam egg are delicious. Comfortable seating and atmosphere.

The service is great! They were very attentive and kind. The meat quality was good. I recommend the short rib - super tender. There was a lot of variety of sides. The complementary salad paired really well with the meat. We were impressed by the lack of smokiness.

Korean BBQ place that will have you thinking you’re a king. This place is amazing. Service is 2nd to none and atmosphere and food are amazing as well. Bring a friend or a few and get one of the big combo platters and just sit back and enjoy. Also this place cooks the food for you in front of you. Highly recommended!!

The service was impeccable, with our waiter being both humorous and knowledgeable. The $4 valet service was convenient. The marinated prime short rib was cooked to perfection, and the delightful variety of side dishes allowed us to explore new flavors. Additionally, the use of metal chopsticks added a touch of elegance to the experience!

name: Bacchus Tables
address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd #200, Los Angeles, CA 90010, USA
reviews:
It's a comfortable place where you can enjoy beer and various snacks with friends.
Parking is not easy on Friday nights. However, they provide validation, so parking is available at a low price.
The owner is friendly, and if you come before busy hours, you'll receive excellent service.
The bossam at Bacchus was among the best I’ve ever had. Perfectly glistening and juicy. We also loved the pineapple fried rice. This is a great place to drink and eat with a group of friends.

Bacchus Tables has a rowdy crowd and good for big groups that want to drink. The server was nice and attentive. He saw us drop chopsticks so he came to bring another pair before we asked. But later in the night it was pretty busy and it was better to just flag him down than to use the button.
They also gave us a complimentary appetizer: a plate of smoked salmon. We ordered a few round of cocktails because they sound and look very nice. The presentation of all their food is really good. I had the honey sugar shrimp, which is like the Chinese food, along with shredded cabbage. I also had the bossam, which was plentiful. It was served kinda warm, but I’m not sure if it’s supposed to be warm or cold. It was very fatty so very filling.

Stop the presses, folks! My flavor adventure at Bacchus Tables left my taste buds doing a happy dance.

Bacchus Tables is an exciting spot for late-night fun in LA! This Trendy Korean Pub/Poncha Restaurant in Koreatown has a fantastic lineup of dishes.

Unearthing a culinary gem in the heart of LA's food scene! Just 3 months young but already stealing the show, Bacchus Tables is where foodie dreams come true. Prepare to be transported to the heart of Korea with every bite of their authentic home-style dishes. The flavors are so mind-blowingly good, you'll wonder why you didn't discover this sooner!

Prepare to be amazed by the flavorful journey these dishes take you on – from the first bite to the last savory morsel. Bacchus Tables has truly mastered the art of bringing out the juiciness, tenderness, and unbeatable flavors in every dish. Get ready for a rollercoaster of deliciousness that will have you coming back for more!

The giant beef bone dish? Oh my stars! It was a flavor explosion like no other, with each bite melting away to reveal tender perfection. The Wangkalbi was one of my favorites!! The Wangkalbi stole the spotlight with its mind-blowing sauce that should be bottled and sold worldwide! And let's not forget those potatoes bathing in that saucy goodness – they were like little flavor bombs exploding in my mouth!

The Jokbal, a symphony of flavors; the Pork Belly Bossam, an explosion of juicy delight; and the Grilled Bulgogi, a tender masterpiece – each dish was like a love letter to our taste buds! The Pineapple Kimchi Fried Rice dances with the tangy sweetness of fresh pineapple.

Sip, sip, hooray for the K-Cocktails at Bacchus Tables! Taeguk: Mixed Soju + Pomegranate juice = Pure perfection! Not only does it taste fabulous, but it's also a visual masterpiece. Every sip is like a mini vacation for your taste buds.

Ap9jung Soju: Brace yourselves for a cool surprise! This cocktail is like a science experiment of flavor. A screwbar popsicle that melts into a refreshing drink – it's basically summer in a glass! Get ready to have your mind blown!

These K-Cocktails are the epitome of creative mixology and will elevate your dining experience to a whole new level. Cheers to Bacchus Tables for concocting these liquid works of art!

Great spot to come with friends and family! 🙌

The vibes, food and drinks are awesome here! Everything we tried was delicious! 🔥

What we had!
•house smoked salmon plate
•pork belly bossam
•jokbal
•fried gizzard
•stir fried garlic gizzard
•stir fried squid
•pineapple kim chi fried rice
•johnson tang (budae-jjigae.. get it with ramen! 🤤 )
•k-cocktails

Can’t wait to come back! Service was great! Very attentive . They checked up on us to make sure everything was good

name: Cassell's Hamburgers
address: 3600 W 6th St, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews: Worth every dollar! We had the happy hour cheeseburger combo and will come back for a shake. Park across the street, 2 hours validated parking for $15, quick and safe area. The onion rings and wedge salad are delicious. Definitely a high quality restaurant with the best in class service.

This restaurant is a pleasant surprise for us.  We came in since it's connected to the hotel we're staying for the night.
We had breakfast.  The specialty coffee was great, latte.  French toast had just a perfect crunch without tasting burnt.  It's not overly sweet but punch with good flavors.
I don't eat breakfast but decided to order over-easy eggs.  Perfectly cooked!  And glad Nick offered me salsa (it was a great salsa) as I enjoyed my eggs even more ❤️ it came with amazingly crunchy toast and jam.
And mom enjoyed her omelet.
What I enjoyed so much about this place is how a simple order (like an egg or a toast) was perfectly executed!
Great service as well!!!
I would have try to come back here for dinner but I live in Florida.
Doing this reviews to let local people know that it's worth a try.

Cassell's Hamburgers impresses with its classic interior design and the lively, friendly service from the staff.

I particularly enjoyed the quarter-pound burger, which uniquely comes with sauce served on the side. The sauce itself is bold and tangy, based on Thousand Island dressing with a distinct pickle flavor.

It's worth trying the burger first without the sauce to truly appreciate the rich flavor of the meat. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a top-notch burger experience!

I really enjoy visiting old and historic places, and I believe that Hotel Normandie is one of the oldest places in LA, Cassell's is located right on the corner.
Unfortunately, finding a parking spot in K Town can be a bit challenging, but once we made it inside Cassell's for breakfast, it was a great experience.
The quality of the ingredients was apparent, and the warm and inviting ambiance of Cassell's added to the overall experience.
It had a classic diner vibe, and the staff were friendly and provided excellent service throughout my visit.

It’s not open for 24 hours as it said.
The burger was great, juicy and full of flavor.
The French fries were horrible, it was soaked in oil and i couldn’t eat it.
I didn’t get the quality for the price and the good tip i paid.
Also try to order from a delivery service because it’s impossible to find a parking lot on the street

name: Ham Ji Park
address: 3407 W 6th St #101, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews: Love love love this place! I had the Korean bbq spare ribs on a food tour years ago and have been a fan ever since! The sides that come along with this order are also very delicious. I always make time to enjoy a sit down dinner here when I am in town. The environment is perfect for family or solo dining and the food never misses! I would recommend this place over and over again. 10/10 🙌🏾

Nestled amidst the unassuming streets of Koreatown, a culinary gem awaits. Forget the grand facades and trendy interiors - this is a hole-in-the-wall haven, radiating pure, unadulterated flavor. Imagine a cozy space, no bigger than 1000 square feet, where an open kitchen throbs with energy. Just one server and two dedicated cooks orchestrate a symphony of sizzling meats and bubbling stews, their passion evident in every dish.

Here, Korean BBQ transcends mere sustenance. It's an experience that ignites the soul. The star of the show is undoubtedly the pork, each morsel grilled to perfection, boasting a symphony of textures - a crisp char yielding to melt-in-your-mouth tenderness, bursting with smoky, savory goodness. Every bite transports you to Korean BBQ nirvana.

But the magic doesn't stop there. This is a flavor feast, and the supporting cast of banchan (side dishes) shines just as brightly. While the absence of kimchi might raise an eyebrow for some, the diverse spread of other delights ensures your palate remains tantalized.

Sure, parking might be a bit of a challenge, but trust me, it's a hurdle worth overcoming. The friendly, no-frills atmosphere and incredibly affordable prices only add to the charm. This is Korean BBQ stripped down to its delicious core, a testament to the power of quality ingredients and culinary passion.

In short:

Hidden gem: Tucked away in Koreatown, offering an authentic experience.
Intimate space: Cozy and casual, with an open kitchen showcasing culinary craftsmanship.
Star of the show: Korean pork BBQ cooked to perfection, bursting with flavor.
Supporting cast: Diverse and delicious banchan side dishes.
Affordable delight: Great value for your money.
Minor quibble: Lack of kimchi, but other options compensate.
Is this a place you'd be eager to try?
Wow! The best Korean BBQ pork ribs, pork neck stew, and stone kimchi fried rice in the world, outside of South Korea. Yes, I said it! In The world outside of South Korea.

Their pork spare rib is amazing with the hint of charcoal grill smell. The soybean paste stew is also delicious and side dishes are pretty good as well. Staffs are okay - not like kinder side and I felt like not being served well but it looks like they are pretty busy. The cleanliness of table and silverwares can also be better. The valet parking is a must with $3.

These ribs are the best ribs ever. The char is perfect and flavor is unmistakable. The layer of raw onion that gets caramelized under the heat of the ribs is genius. The flavor and juices from the ribs makes the onions super delicious, & together, it’s an unbeatable combination. I like that they serve barley tea in place of water. Barley tea has a subtle nutty, almond-like flavor. It’s served cold & is very refreshing. It compliments the ribs & onions very well. The place is a little cramped, but clean & has a nice outdoor patio as well. The service was good, but they’re almost always busy.

name: Katsu Bar
address: 3801 W 6th St, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews: This place has great strawberry sando. I went around 12pm just the right time when the sandoes are out. The strawberries are very fresh. They also have other katsu dishes like rice plate or katsu sando. The desserts here are great too. I just love every menu here! One thing is that parking is valet and it’s not free (unless you do pick up).

Wow. Incredible food. Just what I needed. A bit of sweet and some spice. LARGE portion, I mean take a look at this sandwich! The chicken came out the backside of the bun like an inch.

Fried Mushrooms were 6/10. I thought they could use a new special sauce to really make them stand out being a type of food you don’t normally eat at a casual dine-in spot.
And the waffle fries really have that “fried food” taste to them. Like, greasy. :/ good, but it’s a lot..

Overall though, 9/10. Yup. I’ll be coming a few more times to try different meals because the price is great on top of the fact the meals look great, too.

Fiery Delight from Katsu Bar via Door Dash!

I just ordered the most scrumptious Pork Curry Katsu extra spicy from Katsu Bar, delivered right to my doorstep by DoorDash! This mouth-watering dish came with a delightful assortment of sides, including steamed rice, arugula salad, pickled radish, and macaroni salad.

The curry sauce was the real star of the show - fiery hot and full of flavor! It perfectly complemented the crispy, juicy pork katsu. Each bite was a harmonious balance of spice and savory goodness.

The sides were all delicious and fresh, providing a nice contrast to the richness of the curry. The steamed rice was fluffy, the arugula salad was peppery and crisp, the pickled radish added a nice tang, and the macaroni salad was creamy and sweet.

Overall, I'm thoroughly impressed with Katsu Bar’s Pork Curry Katsu. If you're a fan of spicy food, look no further. Order now and enjoy the flavor explosion!

I love this place! The spicy chicken sandwiches are amazing. Would have given 5 stars but yesterday I got an Apple chili chicken sandwich and found a bit of debris resting on the chicken breast (see images). Seems to be some sort of metal shaving? Anyway I removed it and went on eating and didn’t have any other issues. I suppose this is mostly a note for the staff to check up on kitchen protocols and whatnot.

I'm a big fan of their portobello mushroom sandwich--fresh, huge,  incredibly juicy and flavorful. The best veggie sandwich I've ever had! The Katsu Ramen soup is rich, flavorful, with perfect noodles and spot-on katsu chicken. The curry is creamy and rich, bursting with flavor. The strawberry Sando, has a lot of cream! Super creamy, just the right sweetness for fellow cream lovers  and it tastes incredibly fresh.

Katsubar mixes Japanese and Korean flavors with a modern twist. They use fancy breadcrumbs with rosemary salt to make tastier, healthier katsu. Hand-breaded and cooked perfectly, crispy outside and juicy inside. I was super satisfied with my meal. Can't believe how good they are still.

Service is super sweet, friendly and fast. The decor is very modern, large glass window brought a lot of sunlight in, feels super relaxing dining in. Solid 5 stars, can't wait to come back for their amazing sando again!

name: Soban
address: 4001 W Olympic Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90019, USA
reviews:
We are tourists, this is our first time visiting this restaurant.  I just googled “the best Korean food in LA” then it pop up.
As online reservation requires your credit card pay first, we decided go there by walk-in.  We arrive around 730pm, it was full house.  We waiting about 30 mins to be seated.  The restaurant is cramped but you won’t feel uncomfortable.
We ordered 3 main specialties - short rib, raw crab and black cod.  All the dishes are palatable and fit into our taste.  Although it’s a bit pricey but worth.
BTW, I saw some comments said that there discrimination but I don't think so.  We are Asian but not speak Korean, the servers are very busy but keep friendly.  You just need to be kind and patient.

Soy Crab 💯

People often compare SoCal and NorCal when it comes to food cuisine, price and quality

The truth is that the LA area has a significantly higher population (3.8 million vs 1.5 million for the SF Bay Area) that often leads to increased competition and diversity

One area where there is little argument that LA beats SF is soy marinated raw crabs, a Korean delicacy, with almost no consistent availability in the SF Bay Area

I stopped by Soban, a quaint and low-key restaurant that is frequently named as one of LA’s best Korean spots for raw crab

Their banchan is frequently cited for both the colors and the variety with twelve dishes for our meal

The raw crab was modest in size similar to smaller crabs used in Korea and the flavor was outstanding, extremely fresh without being too salty and perfect with rice

📷 Braised Short Rib $50 ~ Galbi Jjim / Braised Black Cod $50 / Soy Marinated Raw Crab $61

📍Soban (Los Angeles, CA)

Dining is indoor only and reservations are available.  Service is polite and friendly and credit cards are accepted.

I think in the past this restaurant served very well done dishes since I saw a lot of good reviews. Just from the way the banchan was made I can see there is lack of attention to ensure best taste and freshness of ingredients. Basics are missed. Kimchi was quite awful. Other banchan were afterthoughts and were very bland and no flavor. Cod fish dish was good, tofu pancake was dry and the sauce that comes with it was simply too salty to use. Bulgogi was overcooked and it was way too salty. In the end the head hostess didn’t even say bye as we left. This is a major disrespect for Korean culture. Also the dishes are quite expensive and sadly the dishes and service do not justify. I hope things will improve for them.

Amazing Korean restaurant. Super down to earth and incredible food. Friendly staff which you sometimes wouldn’t expect at a little place like this but everything was great. Super good banchan and the braised cod was perfect.

After seeing Soban's enticing Instagram post, I decided to take my friends there for our quarterly outing. Unfortunately, our experience left much to be desired. While I understand that Korean restaurants in downtown Los Angeles are primarily known for their delicious cuisine rather than service, our encounter was exceptionally poor.
The server addressed us solely in Korean, even though only two out of our group of six spoke Korean, and she saw the 2 translating everything she said. Moreover, she was abrupt, impolite, and neglected basic service tasks like refilling our water glasses. When we attempted to capture a group photo, she intervened, citing other customers' aversion to being photographed. Eventually, she reluctantly took the picture, but it had at least five customers next to us, whom I had to manually edit out later.
Regarding the food, we ordered a variety of dishes, including Braised Short Ribs, Braised Black Cod, Mackerel with soybean soup, and Kimchi Stew. While the short ribs were passable, they lacked seasoning. The Black Cod, however, was flavorful. The mackerel was mediocre, and both the soybean soup and kimchi stew were disappointingly bland.
Despite its small size, the restaurant seemed to attract a predominantly non-Korean clientele, which did not surprise us. Suffice it to say, we won't be returning to Soban anytime soon. It appears that placing trust in an Instagram post was a mistake 😕

name: Chunju Han-Il Kwan
address: 3450 W 6th St, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews: I've had oyster jeon before but nothing like this. These were fluffy and savory, so good. I also enjoyed the extra crunchy rice in their stone pot bibimbap. Will be back to try other dishes.

We’ve been coming to this restaurant for many years, and it never disappoints. It’s home style Korean cooking; lots of stews and casseroles. Banchan are always fresh and delicious. We’ve tried various menu items including bibimbap, spicy fish stew (매운탕), and dumpling soup (떡만두꾹), and everything is good. Portions are generous. Soups are large enough to share.

I ordered delivery from UberEats and received my food very quickly. We ordered a couple of things from the menu, one being the braised pork with aged kimchi (묵은지돼지). When we started to eat, we were so very  disappointed to only find 1 (ONE) piece of pork in the entire bowl! We were really looking forward to eating the braised pork together with the kimchi...

Chun Ju Han Il Kwan is a rare gem of a restaurant that truly captures the essence of Chun Ju cuisine. Having tasted Chun Ju Bean Sprout Soup (전주 콩나물국)in Chun Ju, Korea, I instantly fell in love with its distinctive flavor. This restaurant boasts the finest Chun Ju-style menu I've encountered. My last visit was in 2017, and my brother and I ordered the Chun Ju Bean Sprout Soup, scallion pancake (부추전), grilled mackerel, and some makgeolli (막걸리). True to form, the Chun Ju Bean Sprout Soup was exceptional. The rich contents and presentation of the simmering soup tantalized our taste buds, evoking memories of authentic Chun Ju-style cuisine. What's more, the owner, who has been with the restaurant since its inception, warmly recognized my brother, a longtime patron, leaving us deeply impressed. For an authentic taste of Chun Ju cuisine, look no further than Chun Ju Han Il Karan.

Absolute banger, excellent dishes, excellent value for the money with tons of banchan, really liked the japchae.
Kimchi jiggae and yukgaejang were exquisite.
I felt like I was in Korea, 10/10.

name: Bulgogi Hut
address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd #100c, Los Angeles, CA 90010, USA
reviews:
So disappointed with this place. The corn cheese is served in aluminum foil, there was no steamed egg, no sauce plate unless you asked, and the cuts of meat were low quality.

We had a party of five sharing one grill limited to three orders per round. We felt like we were nibbling the whole time.

There are better options and experiences for the price.

When in LA’s Koreatown and you really want that iconically delicious All-You-Can-Eat (AYCE) Korean BBQ experience for a good price, you absolutely need to come to Bulgogi Hut. Bulgogi Hut is a family-owned business in Koreatown that really hits the bullseye for a well-rounded experience in price, wide array of menu options, and of course, deliciousness!

Make sure to also ask for Sandra as your server, as she will really make sure you get the best sampling of everything. She helped us grill all of our meat to perfection and even gave us suggestions on her favorite things to order. You will be walking out of here happily full with a great taste in your mouth (literally) and having had a good time.

I like to talk out-of-town visitors and even local friends here and usually get the Deluxe meal for $36 per person—a steal. But if you really wanna splurge a bit, I highly suggest also going for the Premium menu option for $48 a person! It comes with premium options such as their 21-day aged bone-in short rib and premium ribeye steak.

They have a great selection of Korean side dishes that is the mark of a great spot like cabbage kimchi, cucumber kimchi, japchae, miso soup, tofu soup, steamed egg, and so much more. Pro tip: Don’t order a side of rice because you’ll be wanting to eat everything else and leave room for all that meat, because rice will just fill you up.

I also suggest ordering some of their yogurt soju options, especially the peach flavor, as it’s refreshing and will pair so well with the rich meat. Having gone here many times, my favorite way to end each meal is to order the cinnamon sugar pineapple. It’s the right amount of sweetness and a great finale to the feast!

My fiance and I decided to try a new place other than our usual spot and we weren't impressed. The staff was super nice, and our server was always asking if we needed anything else. So in that sense I gave it 5 stars for service. When it came to the food options it was lacking. We order thin slice beef belly which was good, same with the spicy chicken, but when it came to the pork, it lacked flavor. We got pork belly, and garlic pork which was super salty.

It's a straightforward all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ joint with quick service and seating. While it may not be top-tier, it's definitely a fun experience if you're not too particular. However, parking is scarce and somewhat sketchy. I witnessed a couple of guys devouring food as if they were competing champions, and the server didn't seem to mind if they cleaned out the entire place.
Delicious Korean BBQ in LA. Mets and sides are perfect. We ordered deluxe buffet and never disappointed. I don't like the dark atmosphere but its my personal opinion. The rest is perfect

name: Anju House
address: 234 S Oxford Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90004, USA
reviews: I finally found the restaurant with beautiful views and interior design,and the delicious food! The noodles were just spicy enough. And we all love the cocktails! If you are not in a mood for soju,then please try their cocktails!

This was a great find. We had originally planned to go somewhere else but they weren't able to accommodate a vegetarian. We ended up coming to Anju House and are so happy we did.

The portions are big and for the price I think it's very reasonable. The food was well spiced and tasted good. The atmosphere was also very nice especially the outdoor patio area. It looks like it would be a fun spot to come at night and would definitely be more lively.

Service was also quick and we didn't have to wait too long for our food to come out.

Insta: @TheShahLALand

Nice place to have a dinner date. The outside patio is full of odd decorations ranging from mini records to sports memorabilia. The price of some items are eye opening, but the basic Korean dishes are about average.

It's a quaint and very dog-friendly spot. It has plenty of seating and offers an array of food options. If you've been here before when it was called "Yellow House," you'll notice the similarity in the menu. It's a perfect lunch/dinner for groups and families. My human ordered the Fried Chicken and Green Onion, and it was delicious! It's definitely a must-try! The chicken is crispy, and the green onion salad was very refreshing. The sauce it came with was okay, but you don't need it. Service could improve.

Super quaint and cute spot in ktown!! Valet parking, or street meters. The restaurant is a blue house — at first it was confusing to find the entrance but then you realize it is right in front of you — it’s built like a house and once you go in it’s an open space. The interior is super cute and aesthetic, there’s flies that come out towards the evening but they have fly swatters on the table. The food portion sizes are mid-size, to borderline small but enough to fill you up. I definitely recommend sharing family style so you can try everything on the menu! We had The kimchi bacon pasta and the bulgogi with a side ban Chan - the banchan was two dishes, radishes and kimchi, at $1.95. The bulgogi was sweet and good, as expected taste, and the kimchi bacon pasta was good as well. They didn’t overdo it with the kimchi or bacon so it’s easy to not taste either one if you are sharing. Overall the food was good, the service was good, the atmosphere was amazing and the interior design was amazing so it deserved up to four stars for that. Would recommend coming here for a group hang or catch up!!

name: Here's Looking At You
address: 3901 W 6th St, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews: Went for restaurant week and everything was gluten free. Regular menu can be marked GF if you ask. Drinks are amazing! Server asked about food allergies when we were seated. Highly recommend. It exceeded expectations.

Yes, it is great.  We came for drinks, freaked about the food aromas and came back a week later.  It didn't disappoint.

Chicken liver pate, little gem Caeser, lamb and pork belly were all stellar.  And don't sleep on the cocktails - really creative.

And if you're there at 8:30, look out for a parade of mouth watering cheeseburgers.  Yes, they have a late night happy hour menu.

We're going back.
Had my birthday dinner here and the staff took such good care of us! The atmosphere is excellent --- It feels relaxed, yet still upscale, and the food was fantastic. Highly recommend!
Very good, very attentive. We had a bigger party so we pre ordered everything. Loved the hamachi- but pretty much all the dishes were good. Get the drinks! Loved my fruity cocktails.

Simply stunning experience. Every meal and cocktail is a balanced masterpiece, and the service is expert. Elliot made our meal flow perfectly with memorable recommendations and graceful patience with our pickiness on wine temperature. Highly recommend, will be telling all my friends and coming back!

name: Jeong Yuk Jeom Korean BBQ LA
address: 621 S Western Ave #100, Los Angeles, CA 90005, USA
reviews:
After a day out in Los Angeles, we decided to dine at this restaurant, and it turned out to be a delightful culinary journey. We opted for the Hansang Jeongsik with LA Galbi, Kkotge Doenjang Jjigae, and Grilled Fish, accompanied by an array of delectable banchan (side dishes).

The LA Galbi was a revelation—perfectly grilled, tender, and infused with a savory marinade that made every bite a burst of flavor. The Kkotge Doenjang Jjigae (soybean paste stew with crab) was a standout dish, with a rich and robust broth that perfectly complemented the sweetness of the crab, creating a deeply satisfying flavor profile. The grilled fish was expertly cooked, with a crispy exterior and moist, flaky interior, complemented by a hint of lemon.

The variety of banchan included everything from crisp, fresh greens to pickled delicacies, each adding its unique taste and texture to the meal. Every dish was prepared with care and presented beautifully.

The ambiance of this restaurant is equally impressive. The interior is modern yet cozy, with ample natural light flooding through large windows. The clean, sleek design is enhanced by touches of rustic charm, such as the wooden elements and tastefully arranged décor. The dining area is spacious, providing both comfort and privacy for a relaxed dining experience.

Service was impeccable. The staff were attentive, patient, and eager to ensure we had everything we needed, contributing significantly to our pleasant dining experience.

This Michelin-starred restaurant offers an exotic atmosphere that enhances the culinary delights. It provides not just a meal, but a memorable dining experience, making it a must-visit spot in Los Angeles. Highly recommended for food lovers of all ages!

Came here before watching a movie at cgv cinema and it was totally worth it. Got sat right away and was met with impeccable service. The meat was cooked for us and the side dishes were great. Only downside was the bartender wasn’t available so couldn’t order cocktails. Would recommend and definitely will come again!

Nice interior. Elevated quality. Came here for lunch. There is a special lunch menu for weekdays. The spicy octopus stone pot bibimbap was good, but fairly standard. I’ve heard the beef tartare (yukhoe) bibimbap is good here. Overall, nice meal. A little pricier to match the more upscale interior.

We loved every food we ordered! My favorite is their tartare! When I visit Cali again I will definitely come back here. Their place looks so fancy and I love the kind of ambience they have in their. Service crew were all very nice.

After going to Seoul, we were on the hunt for good quality meat KBBQ. Though pricey the meat quality was good. However the service was not existent.

There were only 3-5 tables with guests at the restaurant. We waited for the server to take orders and he wouldn’t come back despite us wanting to put in more orders. He said they only have one person in the back grabbing food. Would have been nice if he checked in on the guests more since there was several other servers too and guests were trying to wave down the servers for orders. Very odd when the restaurant was practically empty.

name: Jinsol Gukbap 3rd (진솔국밥 3가)
address: 4031 W 3rd St, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews: I decided to try out this location after visiting one in Buena Park. The interior design here was quite similar to the Buena Park location, and it brought back memories of traditional Korean homes, known as 한옥집. The parking situation can be a bit challenging when the restaurant is full. We ordered two servings of pork soup with Korean sausage and rice (순대국밥), a scallion pancake (부추전) to share, and a hot stone bibimbap. As expected, everything was delicious, and the side dishes were even better than those at the Buena Park location. The atmosphere was pleasant, and the service met our expectations.

The menu is very straightforward and that is far from a bad thing. You go in and know exactly what to expect and it is so comforting and delicious!! The variety of banchan is definitely house made and worth it alone for a visit!

Quick to take order after getting a table, which in my mind is one of important qualities to have as Korean restaurant lol. Got the pork soup and pork soup with korean blood sausage. If you like Korean blood sausage, def would recommend the soup with blood sausage. Took me maybe 2 and a half spoons of salt and a bit of 새우젓, but remember to season your soup! Very hearty and tasty. You could taste the bone broth soup is really rich. Oh but their napa cabbage kimchi game was weak.. but their radish kimchi is not bad.
The soon dea soup was so delicious, the broth is flavorful!! I would love it if they have purple rice. I also love the korean style pancakes as well. It was crispy and salty! I give five stars!!
The server recommended yukgaejang to us and honestly, it was the best I’d ever had. I would even say life changing. Really good food and traditional vibes all around!

name: Butnal
address: 954 S Norton Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90019, USA
reviews: A cozy restaurant with nice staff. I enjoy the atmosphere it has as it gave off a warm place to enjoy food and drinks with friends. The gentleman who served us was incredibly nice, and due to the fact that we were new to an establishment like this, he was very helpful in explaining what food items were in the dishes, how the heat level is on them and how the items were shareable here. When my dish came out, I was amazed by the sizes of my dish and my friends. It looked amazing, smelled and tasted amazing. What a lovely experience and I can't wait to experience this lovely place again and try other dishes. I hope anyone who sees this review will also take the time to enjoy this restaurant.
I love all the menus here! The food portion was so good, and they are known for the Korean style pancakes,very savory and delicious and crispy! You can get free ice cream after your meal!

Update with photos:  back in LA, for another round of soju and pork belly.  I saw they have new summer items.  If you wany yo try Korean cold noodles, I'm certain they do it well here.  Will try to get pics next time.

Hole in the wall Korean joint, great for locals, family, and friends.

Food is great, service is friendly.  Typically get the sliced pork dish (bossam, pronounced boh-sahm), or anything fried.  Of course the soju and beer lineup is great.  Also, very clean and welcoming decor with wooden interior.  They have combos to try, but never hesitate to ask the servers their recommendations as they all speak English.  Can't wait to try their budaejigae (soldier's soup).

This restaurant was so cozy and has the best authentic Korean food. Very worth the drive. Definitely bring your friends because the servings are huge and are meant to be shared. Very decently priced for the amount of food you get. You have to push the little button on the wall for service. Highly recommend this place.

Amazing shareable food and drinks. Delicious and authentic Korean comfort food. The service is fast, and efficient. There is a call button to call over your server. The vibes are immaculate, with it's Sakura theme and K-pop playing in the background, it's a perfect place to hangout with friends. I had the army stew, tbbboki, potato pancakes, and the assorted pancake platter along with 1 bottle of soju and 1 bottle of black berry wine for a total of 144$ split between 6 people the meal broke down to $25 pp. And we had leftovers. So worth every penny.

name: Gol Tong Chicken
address: 361 S Western Ave #101, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews: We found this place by chance. When we got the menu I was skeptical of the fruit with the fried chicken. We ordered the soy garlic chicken and was it fantastic. The breading was crispy and the fruit with the sauces balanced well. I would highly recommend this place and can’t wait to come back. Also, one order is enough for two people.

This has to be the perfectly balanced fried chicken I’ve had. The batter for the chicken is very light so it wasn’t overpowering to the taste of the chicken but it still gave the pieces the perfect crunch! The chicken was also still juicy after being fried.

The sauces were amazing, my favorite was the chili sauce, it paired really well with the fruit, especially the strawberries.

Although we arrived before it got busy.
The service is fast! People that would order to go would get their orders within minutes same with people dining in.

This is a place I have to come back soon whenever I feel like having fried chicken.

Awesome food! We got the Director's Cut Special Edition for 4 people to share, and we almost finished it so the portion is super generous. The chicken skin is super crispy and the meat is tender (our favorites were the soy and the mustard). The whole place is run by a single man who was super sweet and did korean hearts to us! You have to try it out!

Ok, so I generally only leave reviews if I’m absolutely wowed by an experience and that’s absolutely what I got here at Gol Tong Chicken! This delightful shop is a labor of love from the proprietor/chef Gol Tong, who is also of note for being the director of several Korean films, the posters of which decorate the space in the restaurant. There is a whole sound booth in here and many other wonderful quirks - it’s really something. The reason why you’ll be back though is his food! It’s out of this world good - incredibly fresh, perfectly seasoned/sauced Korean fried chicken, the best I’ve had in LA and I’ve tried all of them! Go for The Director’s Cut option on the menu and bring at least two friends to split it with, because this is an exceptionally generous portion! It comes with two sublime sauces for dipping and the whole platter is layered with fresh fruit and veggies. It’s a work of art befitting its name! Highly, highly recommended and I’m super excited to come back here again!

After a hike, we went to Gol Tong for late lunch and did not even realize that we stepped into a gem. The founder and owner is the only one managing this place! He cooks and serves the food for everyone which was such an incredible experience. The wings came out fresh with fruits included!!! This is the first time we've had wings with fresh fruits! Haha we got half and half to try both flavors. 10/10 must try

name: Eight Korean BBQ
address: 863 S Western Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90005, USA
reviews: Found this place around the corner from our hotel and enjoyed every bit of it. We did the all you could eat Classic and tried their 8 Pork Belly flavors. The sesame, red pepper and garlic were my favorites, but each were really delicious. The service was very quick and very friendly making sure we had enough water to drink with our meal. Definitely want to come back when we are in town.

Heads up, pork belly fans! Eight Korean BBQ now offers all-you-can-eat pork belly with 8 flavorful options and tasty kimchi stew. The pork has a deliciously different texture and flavor, hitting the spot every time. Shoutout to the attentive servers who ensure your grilling game is on point. However, the water has a strange metallic taste that's a bit off-putting. One round of pork belly is plenty to satisfy your hunger. If you're craving pork belly, this is definitely the spot to check out! 🍖

We got the premium beef combo, and it came with a seafood soup as well as a huge variety of side dishes. The meat was alright, but compared to other KBBQ restaurants in Ktown LA, it is definitely lower in quality.

There wasn’t a wait on a Friday night for our group. The server was great despite our large group. He was quick, to take orders and cooking at our two grills.

However the meat quality was disappointing and the meat tasted frozen and lacked flavor slightly better than the meat quality at Gen. It definitely looks good but unfortunately the meat flavor wasn’t there.

The chairs were stools with no backing which was not comfortable. Completely okay for the authentic experience but wished the meat quality was better as I had high hopes for this place.

One of the best pork belly in K-town! A lot of food and you are enjoying their different flavors of pork belly, such as salty, spicy, curry, and more.  They serve your meats and you cook with your grill. Very entertaining. Satisfied!

name: Magal BBQ
address: 3460 W 8th St, Los Angeles, CA 90005, USA
reviews: Ordered Package #1 & it was more than enough for two people especially with all the banchan. Everything was super tasty & the staff was very friendly. Would come back here & order dishes a la carte if just with one other person.
Great meat , great banchans , amazing vibe and service. One of the best Galbi in town.

Pretty authentic and tasty Korean BBQ! Service is excellent, servers try their best to cook for you which is rare for where I’m from - Vancouver Canada where most restaurants let you cook for yourself and you have to tip them - make no sense for me lol.

Meat is fresh, but I just would like to see more options for dipping sauce.

Had a good dinner here. Valet is $3 FYI - cheap!

Fresh and juicy Beef Combo.  Awesome service.  Friendly staff.  Meat is always top notch.  I recommend trying tea, very interesting taste. The atmosphere invites you to eat delicious food and meet friends.
Honestly my favorite kbbq spot in ktown. High quality meat and banchan. You get a lot of food for the money. And they cook for you!!! Never have to wait for table. It’s so underrated!

name: Hangari Kalguksu
address: 3470 W 6th St Suite 9 and 10, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews:
Like what others said, the soup broth is really delicious. I think the seafood kalguksu is better than the chicken broth, and its more worth the price. I really like spicy soup base but this is only available for seafood. Some of the seafood I am allergic to so I couldn't order that. They gave so much noodles that made it challenging to finish for 1 person. It will be so much better if they could offer a smaller portion than to waste food like that. Taking away a soup noodle won't taste good.

There isn't much atmosphere as the place is extremely noisy to the point that you can't hear the person opposite of you.

It is a very popular place and the dinner lines goes on until they close the restaurant but the waiting time is not very long.

One of the favorites of a New York foodies friend of ours - finally got to try it and absolutely love it! All the items are delicious - bulgogi was rich in flavor and tender in texture, with so much veggie; the clam noodle has a great soup base, chewy noodle and a good amount of clams; pork belly was tender and goes well with the pickled cabbage and spicy kimchi radish. The utensils go well with the table top. The line was descent at 1pm but moved very fast (~15 minutes of wait). They even started taking orders when we were ready, so food was ready shortly after we were seated. Definitely will return and highly recommend!

This place is good. My friend and I got the bossam, and two noodle dishes (one was nengmyung, the other was the spicy seafood soup).

It’s definitely worth the wait, the banchan was on point. Can’t wait to go back!
Oysters are fresh and large. 매생이굴죽 was amazingly perfect taste. 닭칼국수 was also delicious!! All of the Kimch (side dishes) was so delicious too !!! Staffs are kind and friendly :) Good to be here.
Food was great! Parking was $5 usd in the garage across the street, so lots of parking available. Best beef bulgogi I’ve ever had!!! The cold noodles were also insanely good!

name: Surawon Tofu House
address: 2833 W Olympic Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90006, USA
reviews: The service was great, and the food was even better. From the outside, it's not easily noticeable that it's a restaurant. But once inside, the staff are terse but very welcoming. The tables and chairs don't have much flair. It felt like a cafeteria. Every table is close to each other, so it's an intimate dining experience. If you can get past that, the food makes you forget about the sterile like environment. Your taste buds just transport you to another place, a place where bellies are fulfilled and smiles on faces are everywhere.

Fantastic flavours, great service, and reasonable pricing. I see why this place is so highly recommended.

The inside is unassuming, but bustling with many guests.

Of note, the combo soontofu is a small bowl, so if you’re attempting to do family style it may feed 2 people + your main protein. The soontofu is very rich in flavor, and some of the best we’ve had - compared to Toronto. They give a good variety of banchan and will refill as requested. The kimchi was a bit sweet, very fresh, and much less salty/fishy.

They have free parking behind the restaurant that fits close to 20 vehicles and plenty of street parking in front.

This will be a staple whenever we visit LA

Wonderful authentic Korean food. My friend recommended this place and was very glad that I tried it! The establishment isn't flashy and could easily be overlooked, but once you enter, you can tell that the restaurant is very good due to the fact that it was packed in there. There was a constant flow of people entering and exiting. We ordered the bibembop on a hot bowl. The side dishes were amazing and instead of water, we were given a pitcher of cold green tea. Loved that! Service was wonderful and the food was tasty and delicious!

It brings tears to my eyes as I write this review on the eve of my move out of LA. I’ve probably eaten here over 50 times in the last 10 years and can confidently say this is a top 3 favorite restaurant in SoCal for me. Surawon is not your fancy “pinkies up” type of place. It is the home to the most delicious, authentic and welcoming Korean food that only a Korean mom and grandma with decades of excellence, love, and care can produce.

The star is the thick-cut Galbi - smoky, sweet, savory, and incredibly juicy from what can only be premium, highly marbled beef. The other star is the large offering of banchan - each executed perfectly and with a different flavor profile that can balance any meal. Of course the brand is centered on the soondubu, which blends a rich and flavorful broth with generous portion of fresh tofu.

The service is truly 5/5. It didn’t matter if the restaurant was full or empty, the ajummas always served you with a smile and made sure your banchans were replenished.

After so many meals here, I can go on for a very long time about the great memories I’ve had at Surawon. But I’ll stop and let whoever is reading this make their own memories and hope that when I come back in a few years, this wonderful place is still around, unchanged.

I was traveling and wanted to get some soon tofu and this place was excellent.

Coming from Utah, where Korean cuisine has gotten ridiculously expensive for the mid-tier quality, this place was amazing and reasonably priced (though I'm not sure how it compares to the rest of LA).

I thought the service was great too and will be back.

name: Taylor's Steak House
address: 3361 W 8th St, Los Angeles, CA 90005, USA
reviews: I normally make my own steaks because no steak house makes them nearly as good as I do. Went to Taylor's steak house, and they had American Wagyu steak. I must say that I was surprised: the steak met and exceeded my expectations. The steak was moist and cooked exactly how I wanted it (see pics). I had it with Asparagus and wild rice. All was marvelous. The price was very reasonable. The service was no less than great.. I do have to add this comment to my review. The place smelled odd (maybe humid). I am not sure how to describe the smell. However, somehow, you get used to it. They have dry aged steak (see pics) yummy. Valet parking is available ($6 as of 27JUN24). You must make a reservation before you go. This will ensure you are seated almost as soon  as you arrive. They take walk ins. However,  reservations take priority.

A very cute and old timey classic steakhouse located in Koreatown (Los Angeles)!

First off, parking sucks in this part of town and even with valet, the lot was full because it's a very small parking lot. Ended up driving around and finally finding a spot on the streets 10 minutes walk away.

Love the lowlight and classic ambiance of LA past. I ordered an Old Fashioned at the bar, it was not very good. Had some mushed up oranges and maraschino cherries on the bottom, weird but whatever.

We were seated pretty quickly as we had a reservation and waiting for the rest of the party to show up. They have really cute and comfortable victorian-esque chairs. I ordered a blue filet mignon, it was tasty, but far from blue which I expected to get a rare at best, but it was honestly overcooked rare even. Still tasty though!

Overall, it's a pretty good steakhouse! Maybe their La Canada location might be easier for parking. Would recommend for birthdays and dates!

I really love coming to this place. It's got an old-school vibe to it. I guess that is because it is old-school, it's been there since 1953 and the booths are spectacular.
