The food is delicious and the best prices you can imagine for the quality of the fare they offer and you can get a good drink from their bars. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who is not a vegetarian or vegan or a pescatarian. Oh, and friendly service too.

OUR EXPERIENCE IS QUITE SHOCKING!! Our valet gave us our car without the keys. My husband stopped for gas and was unable to restart the car because the keys were not returned to us. Taylors was completely unhelpful and unapologetic, showing absolutely no care in assisting us. They simply said the valet was a different company. Meanwhile, my husband was stranded in the middle of Hollywood at 12 a.m. I am completely appalled at their lack of concern. We spent over $500, and this is the appreciation we receive? "Oh sorry, we can't help you."
We don't live in LA so can't even describe how frightening this experience was. The female manager working never once said she was sorry. So was as cold as ICE. Truly in shock!

Classic Mad Men era steakhouse. The kind of place that makes you WANT to get dolled up for dinner even if you're dining solo but doesn't make you feel out of sorts for showing up in denim and sneakers.

Fairly affordable plates considering that it's steak but its so worth the splurge. Generous portions, great flavor, and even better service. Cocktails and desserts are superb, too! My only gripe is how dark it is inside.

I highly recommended the escargot. They are absolutely worth trying at least once.

name: Enchant LA
address: 681 S Western Ave 1st Floor, Los Angeles, CA 90005, USA
reviews:
Tasty and beautiful!

The menu has a great range of items and everything we got was good. The prices are slightly high, but makes sense considering the restaurant is located in a hotel and the interior was gorgeous. Our mom was a huge fan of the stunning dishes and silverware.

* Breakfast Plate Special: 7/10 - pretty basic
* French Toast: 8/10 - perfect balance of fruits and maple syrup but I didn't receive the ice cream :(
* Fried Calamari: 9/10 - awesome batter
* La La Galbi Set: 8/10 - tasty and loved that it comes with rice

I completely forgot to ask for the ice cream with my French Toast which I assume that the servers also forgot to give to me. Also, they give you the menu and offer to get you drinks when you first sit down. Not really given a chance to look at the prices, my sister ordered bottled water not knowing it was a $4.

There's free underground parking that doesn't require validation which is really appreciated. The servers were really nice, but is expected since there's an 18% service charge included in the bill.

Despite the mishaps, we'll definitely be returning to try their other dishes!

Absolutely ENCHANTED to discover this little hidden gem lounge in Koreatown! Tucked into the unassuming Garden Suite Hotel, this beautiful lounge features floral-oasis inspired decor, and an extensive menu of innovative cocktails and Korean-inspired fusion dishes. We were pleasantly surprised at how well made every dish and cocktail we ordered was, especially the galbi and bulgogi quesadilla dishes, which were definitely some of the BEST we’ve ever had. Definitely make sure to check out one of Koreatown’s best kept secrets for a date or girl’s night out/brunch, and support a well-deserving small Asian owned business!

Featured here:
🌮 bulgogi quesadilla
🍝 seafood cioppino pasta
🥩 la la galbi
🌹 beauty and the beast

Had a fun time dining at this beautifully decorated Garden Cafe and Bar in Ktown. I totally love the aesthetics here, and the lovely presentation of their food and drinks. I really enjoyed the flavors of their Kimchi Pasta and Croffle that's topped with fresh fruits! Really like their selection of dishes, from their delectable desserts to their colorful drinks! Perfect spot to visit during brunch and happy hour!

The ambiance is so cute, food was okay, and service  was very poor.  Our waitress Anna L had a bit of an attitude, she rushed us with the menu, she didn’t once came to the table, was not attentive  one bit. Every time we looked back to get her attention she was always on her phone. Sadly to say. It was so irritating. It was super slow. We had asked a few questions about the food we had ordered and she was so ehhhh about it…. Only good service we had was the food runner. Anna needs to do better with her customer service skills! On top of that if you’re going to add gratuity for table of four, have better service .. ……For that we will not we coming back.!!!

Enchant is a beautiful restaurant in the Garden Suite Hotel in the heart of Koreatown! It has amazing, and helpful staff, and a great selection of foods and drinks that have an Asian fusion theme! Great brunch spot to go with your friends or a significant other! You have to try the Kimchi pasta and it pairs very well with the Born to be Beef!

name: Olivia Restaurant
address: 205 S Vermont Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90004, USA
reviews: Amazing place with an all vegetarian menu (with vegan options available). The staff is super friendly. The chef Mario offers great customisations. The Caprese pizza is to die for! Everything was delicious- from the salad, to appetizers, to the pizza. Service was quick. Food presentation was great.

This little hole in wall is without a doubt the best in Korea town. The service is excellent, so warm, welcoming and attentive. You can really tell they care here and the food is so delicious. Everything tastes amazing also they have so many good options for my vegan brother.

Located in Koreatown, Olivia pays homage to some Korean flavors while also having some unique delicacies. All the food was really good, despite feeling more on the unhealthy side. Had the fried olives, fried “chicken”, and the Anderson pizza and finished with the olive cake and chocolate tart. Our waiter was so nice and accommodating. Would definitely come back!!
Very nice staff and the food is amazing! Get the crispy Brussel pizza even if you are not vegan. You won't be disappointed!

Fantastic upscale vegan/vegetarian restaurant!! Chef Mario is next level. Allergen friendly. Vibes are awesome for date night or girls night. We love the wine happy hour and the cavatelli pasta is next level.

I’m lactose intolerant AND have soy allergies so the MACADAMIA ricotta is such a blessing. Bring all your vegan/vegetarian friends here for an unforgettable night.

Small and loving team based out of Koreatown.

name: Koreatown
address: Koreatown, Los Angeles, CA, USA

name: LEE GA(이가)
address: 698 S Vermont Ave #106, Los Angeles, CA 90005, USA
reviews: Excellent Korean food! Most of the dishes are soups. I had brisket with tripe. Cooked to perfection. The dishes tend to have subtle flavor but they have great condiments. My dish was very lite without all the fat in other cuisines. Parking is an issue but there’s valet parking.

This is a mixed review because what I had was pretty good (mixed cold buckwheat noodles) and the steamed king dumplings was also okay. However the bulgogi set and beef rib soup were just average. They have a large menu so perhaps other dishes are better. Parking here is limited and you have to use the valet service which cost $3. There is street parking but it might be a challenge in the evenings.

Lee Ga is a legit Korean food spot. You can come here for both meat and soups. Their menu is pretty good. Service is great. The people are really nice. They helped me cut my cold noodles.

Parking was so annoying to find even on a weekday night. They have valet parking for $3. The streets around the area have free parking, but it's really hard to find.

I thoroughly enjoyed my meal here. The side dishes were ok. The kimchi radish on the day I visited was not good though. The kimchi cabbage was better.

Small and amazing. The crowning dish is their kalbi cooked over mushrooms and potatoes so as to not burn the meat on the hot cast iron. Sooooo good. Fresh banchan. Their tangy beef rib soup is to die for and I wish I remembered the name but it hand that pickled veggie that gives it an amazing little funk that I love.

Decent food and appreciate that they don't salt the soup much and let you choose the level of salt and condiments to add to it.

Not sure if we ordered the right items, but in terms of food it's just average.

If you're nearby and feel like this type of noodle soup go and give it a try. I wouldn't be driving here just to have dinner as we did this evening.

name: Myung In Dumplings
address: 3109 W Olympic Blvd B, Los Angeles, CA 90006, USA
reviews: This place has great dumplings and fried rice that won't break the bank. Located in a strip mall with an interior that does not have all the bells a whistles. But go with friends, split a Soju, and enjoy.
First time in K town and loved this spot. I got the kimchi dumplings and shrimp fried rice, both came out hot and fresh. Kind service and clean environment. Thanks for the tasty bite!

We had a taste for some authentic dumplings in Koreatown.  After vetting the internet, we chose here and weren't disappointed!

My order of Fried Rice With Shrimp and Vegetables was amazing. As were the Steamed Dumplings, and both the Short Rib and Beef Dumpling Soups. And I felt generally safe parking there with the roving Security Guards present. Recommended for a delicious meal!

Great little spot. Friendly staff and massive portions. Nice to get a mix. Don’t be afraid to ask for some extra chilli sauce.

Good value, would recommend.

Good dumplings, but I was expecting a little more given the hype around this restaurant features on Bourdain’s parts unknown. We got the spicy steam dumplings with pork and shrimp, which are wrapped in dough but not sealed which made the meat taste a little dry. I think I would want to try the boiled dumplings next time. We also got the king steam dumplings with pork and vegetable. The dough was very good, but the filling was a little bland for my taste as there was much more egg & noodle filling than pork

Our favorite part was the free ban chan, really good quick pickled daikon and Kimchi. Also the service was quick and they were very kind and helpful. They do a very nice job. If you like simpler flavorings and food parings this may be better suited to your taste.

It is located in a strip mall but the parking was full when we got there. We were able to find a space on the side streets. We went at noon on a Friday and were able to be seated right away, but I imagine it would be much more crowded on a weekend.

name: Seoul Salon Restaurant & Bar
address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd Ste 100B, Los Angeles, CA 90010, USA
reviews:
I love the fact that Google Maps integration with OpenTable makes reservations really easy here!  Let me say that the decor here is really interesting!  Reminiscent of 1930s settings, it's kinda' cool!  Their food are really modern and unique, so it really stands out compared to foods in the area, just like their decor does.  So this is a nice place to take your date to.  We were very slow, so I want to thank the staff for being very patient with us.  Then again they did tack on an 18% because we were over 5 people. My friend that sat next me complained that went against SB478, so they might want to update their written menus to display that, and give their future patrons a reminder.  Other thing you may want to be aware of is when you split the bill, they can accept up to 3 cards at most, and it has to be split evenly.  If you need everything itemized and separated into different bills, you need to tell them ahead of time.

Also, if you take the receipt to Caffe Concerto, you get a 10% off.  Keep in mind when it comes to paying the bill, you need to make sure you let them know ahead of time that the bill should be separated as well.

Great place with super nice, 1950s vibes, and fantastic decor. Special shooutout to Mini, a great bartender that always displays exceptional customer service and has good language skills in her native Korean, English and even a bit of Spanish. The place is open till late, the food is delicious and the drinks are good. Not much else to say!

✨I was transported back in time at Seoul Salon, located in the heart of Los Angeles’ Koreatown✨

We had: 🫓Bulgogi Quesadilla (tortilla, cheese, beef bulgogi), 🦀Crab Meat Seafood Cream Pasta (crab meat, mussels, shrimp, clams, squid, red onion, heavy cream), 🌶️Spicy Rice Cake Tteokbokki (rice cake, fish cake, cabbage, egg, Korean spicy paste), 🦐Gambas (marinated shrimp, olive oil, lemon, bread), 🍢Skewers (pork belly and sausages/rice cake), 🍗Garlic Popcorn KFC (fried chicken and French fries), 🍟Truffle French Fries, 🍓Strawberry Soju (fresh strawberries, soju, lime juice, lemon juice, simple syrup)

a tavern themed Korean restaurant that has some really excellent crafted drinks you should try. I recommend the yuzu mojito and the miss Korea. They also specialize in Korean Italian fusion dishes like their variety of pastas. I got their crab and seafood pasta and omg it was SO garlicky. Every bite was full of flavor and the pasta was al dente. Their yuzu brisket salad was also tasty and interesting but I would put the dressing on the side. I also got their oven roasted pork belly which I thought fell short. The pork wasn’t too tender and lacked flavor without the soy sauce it would have been too bland. Let me know what you guys think!
Just came for drinks! 20 oz Watermelon soju was super refreshing. Yuzu mojito during happy hour was also delicious! Red dot was great too.

name: Kitchen Sooda
address: 618 Serrano Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90005, USA
reviews:
Us: got the cheese chicken (regular is regular spicy that you can enjoy even you aren't fan of spicy food) and the pasta. Pasta is very good!

Others: the price is a bit out there but worth giving them a solid shot.

Owner: has two ppl wait our table and they were very professional

The most delicious place among Cajun Seafood.
Other menu items such as pasta, chicken wings, etc. are also delicious, so I would like to recommend this place..

Great food in a casual cozy atmosphere.  First off, you can't beat $1 oysters, served during happy hour. The oysters are chef's choice and on the day we went, we had Blue Points.  They were fresh and delicious - so delicious that we ordered another 3 dozen for the 4 of us!  The garlic noodles with shrimp were great.  We also had the happy hour pitcher plus chicken wings for 19.99 - loved the chicken wings!  The uni pasta was a bit whatever for me - I've had better versions.  My fave of the night was the spicy fire chicken (bool dak) served on top of tater tots and oozy melty cheese!  We got a combo of regular spicy and hot, and omg it was so hot, but the flavors were so good, I couldn't stop eating it!  Can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu offerings

My boyfriend super loved what he got - the spicy chicken on tater tots with cheese, so he would've rated it as 5*, but my shrimp pasta wasn't that great, which would've garnered 3*, so we will average it at 4.

My pasta sauce was supposed to be a rosé, but was more tomatoey and not creamy at all. In fact, it was really sour and salty, so a proper rosé with the cream would have really balanced out those flavors.

My friend super highly recommended this place, so I would probably come try again but order something that is more pub food oriented, since this is a gastropub. Their uni cream pasta is one of their most popular dishes, so maybe I should have tried that instead, since I was interested in that too. Next time!

Great place with an awesome menu. The fried squid was really crispy and pretty fresh but they should season the batter or at least after they fry it. Very tasteless and only served with regular mayonaise. The honey nutty butter chicken was incredible though. Will come back to try their other chicken dishes.

name: LA Wangbal, 엘에이 왕발
address: 4251 W 3rd St, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews:
Found this casual eatery with super yummy Korean dishes

I had:
1. Bossam - boiled pork belly with Napa cabbage
2. Gamja Tang - spicy pork short rib soup with potato
3. Banchan

Amazing! Highly recommend the jokbal or pork trotters (feet)! Got the lunch combo available from 11-3 i think which is just under $20.  I typically don't eat a lot of pork but wow they seasoned it so well,  it tasted the best compared to the bossam. Tofu soup was also very delicious with the jokbal! Great banchan. Beef bulgogi was also very good/tasty!! And i normally don't like bulgogi. Parking can be tough.  Street or tiny parking lot.

Loved the food here!
Best bo ssam pork belly I've had. Loved it with the radish. Cabbage was cut a little thick but taste was great.
Chive pancake was also a major win. Super crispy and flavorful.

Highly recommend checking out this new place!

I don't understand the negative reviews, what a bunch of sour Karen's with obviously no taste in authentic good food and portions.(FYI the food photo taken after we started eating it and taken a few pieces, it was present beautifully before this photo and had more) . I went here today with my bf and the food was amazing and authentic as it gets. I've been to Seoul, South Korea myself and I had one of the best foods recommended there and this place is on par with those I've had there. Korean food is one of my favorites and this place does it perfectly. I had the pork soup and bossam to share, the broth was so good and delicious, portions were nice. The kimchi here is truly one of the best kimchi's I've ever had, just perfectly balanced in every way. Honestly, I have had a hard time finding good food here in L.A but on our last day here we are so happy we found this hidden gem.

*****PLEASE READ

While my daughter and I were eating, we found multiple pieces of silica gel in our radish side dish. We bit into around four total. The first few times we thought we had chipped a tooth or it was some kind of spice/seasoning. We ate with caution. The third and fourth time it happened, we spit it out and took pictures. When I fished around in the side dish container, I found one more fully intact.

When we called in hopes of figuring out what was going on, we were met with a rude, dismissive woman. Not a single word even close to "sorry" was said and she told us that next time we come she'd give us a free tray of soondae. When I said that the free tray of soondae wasn't the focus and that I wanted to know if this was some kind of mistake, she got annoyed that I was angry and told me it was probably just a piece of plastic. I get that silica gel is non-toxic but how is this okay? And if its "just a piece of plastic" is it any better? She treated us like we called to complain for some free food and talked to us with insane attitude.

I was excited to try the food as it was a new place in the nighborhood. Never going back there again. I understand mistakes can happen as it's very easy to mess things up in the food industry but the attitude and words I was met with was unbelievable.

name: GamBoJok | 감자탕 보쌈 족발
address: 301 S Western Ave #201, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews: Very low key place but very comfortable, home style place. As you can see, food was amazing and definitely worth every dollar. Had a great experience and would recommend to everyone who wants to try some very traditional Korean food.
I really like the food here. The pork soup is the best! I tried other korean restaurants but still this is so far the best Korean restaurant with pork soup soup and pork feet
accidentally ended up here and had the most delicious meal! We got the cold kimchi noodles and soft tofu soup. 10/10 would recommend and come back again :)

The best taste, price and service too bad the management is changing. Our family was there on their last day. Had Bossam +$9 Gamja tang. So many side dishes, various vegies with bossam. Wow! This was an unforgettable meal. Parking underground was convenient, no valet needed during lunch time. Loved the kpop song selections.
Love this place! Best pork feet in town. Personal favorite is the soy milk noodles in summer time.

name: Wilshire Cooking Mom
address: 3660 Wilshire Blvd UNIT 120, Los Angeles, CA 90010, USA
reviews: I had the beef bulgogi, and I'm pretty sure it's precooked and reheated, so it's hard to justify paying around $18 for something like that. The atmosphere was nice, except for the flies but it is summer. Service was great.

Highly recommend this place.

I got Spicy Chicken Teriyaki for my first time here, and it was delicious. I dined in and the food was brought shortly. The presentation of the food was amazing. The customer service was great, they were kind and ready to help. I would definitely stop by again.

The only thing I thought could be better was to update/improve their menus which have crossed out items. Also, the broken down fridge with drinks inside could be discarded as there’s a weird smell when opened.

Place is located next to the parking and where you enter the building.
People talked about dumplings a lot in the reviews, and cold noodles 쫄면, tteokbokki, and other spicy pork rice were just as good.
Ive been here a couple of times now and they were all good experiences.
It’s good and cheap. Doesn’t really get better than this.

The table was dirty when we first got the seats… and I expected a good quality of the meat but it wasn’t..and my dishes came out really late, i can tell they unfroze the meat in the oven.. and the ban can was so salty…i know it’s cheaper compared to other Korean restaurants, but I would rather pay more and get better quality

I would give 4.5 overall. I had to try this place when I saw their shrimp dumpling picture on Whilshire as I could eat dumplings every day. I personally liked fried dumplings better over steamed. Not sure if it was just that day, but their kimchi dumpling was a bit too spicy. Their kimbap was not bad but wasn't two thumbs up.

name: Toe Bang
address: 3465 W 6th St # 110, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews:
One of my go-to restaurants for a nice night with friends! The vibe here is exciting and casual. Music is loud and fun selection, really setting a mood for an upbeat and fun experience. Usually a good amount of people but still always easy to get a seat. It can get a bit noisy but I love that. The servers are so friendly and the food is always delicious. It's in the Chapman Plaza with several other restaurants so you might not easily see it. Parking might be tough if you're driving but there is a lot there you can pay for.

Overall great Korean place with delicious food and fun vibes!

This wasn’t my first visit, and definitely wasn’t going to be my only visit. I am bringing all my friends back over here for drinks and great food that goes well with my drinks! Try the pork belly! Sojus are great also!

Toe Bang is a great spot for Korean food with a nice vibe. I used to go a lot in the past, and it remains a favorite. The restaurant can get kind of crowded, but the lively atmosphere adds to the experience. The food is delicious and authentic, making it a solid choice for a night out. Highly recommend for anyone looking to enjoy tasty Korean dishes in a bustling setting!

I ate with a friend last night and fun. The atmosphere , the food was perfect a night of a few drinks.
One negative about it, though, is that it is overpriced. The drinks l, the food, but I suppose is expected per the night service
Sometimes you have to go to Saturday's room on an Sunday :) Army stew, fried chicken, and tekbokki all so good. And their beer is ICE cold! Great place to go after a Dodger's game!

name: LA Tofu House
address: 401 S Vermont Ave #3, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews:
this place is bomb. I ordered the seafood Tofu soup and LA Galbi were best compare to BCD.
And my friend ordered the cold noodle Milmyeon was excellent with hot weather like these days.

Like many places in a strip mall, this restaurant looks very unassuming from the outside, but the food was superb. I went out with several friends, and one of them wanted to split two dishes with me which is a great way to vary it up. We got the bulgogi bibimbap and galbi which were both incredibly tasty. I’m a fan of slight char on grilled meats, and the cook did a great job with just the right amount. I would come back in a heartbeat.
Was looking for a late night eat, they close at 4am so convenient. Soups & banchan were delicious. Small place but accommodating.

We came here for the dinner after a show. Such a nice and clean place. The waitress was super sweet and friendly. Took care of us all the time. The menu is great. Easy to make the decisions. We had the tofu soup with pork and also the spicy beef soup. Both very good. Highly recommend the tofu soup. Silky and full flavoured. Just wish the portion of banchans was a little more. Definitely come back again!

The wait was ridiculous for the food. They lacked one staff member but should have more than the staff they had on hand anyway. I think the highlight was the Japchae Noodle dish. The Banchan was okay and the soon soup was also okay. Not a fan but not the worst experience either.

name: hibi.
address: 3121 W Olympic Blvd #103, Los Angeles, CA 90006, USA
reviews: One of the best surprises we have had in a while this restaurant really delivered in all levels. Great vibe, good service, and really unique and tasty food. We tried several things and the only thing that didn’t work for us was the stuffed chicken wings, we were not a fan of the chewy skin. Unfortunately that was the only dish we remembered to photo. Definitely a must-return.

Nestled discreetly in a modest strip mall, this Japanese gem in K-town features a modern, low-lit ambiance with minimalist aesthetic. Light gray walls and dark wood tables adorned with petite lamps create a cool, comfortable vibe. Behind the scenes, culinary maestros with Michelin accolades orchestrate a menu blending Japanese and Korean influences, offering small plates and standout mains. While slightly on the pricier side, the proportions and consistent high quality impress. The crudo, scallop, corn and duck breast emerge as the bench borderline star performers on the menu but let's cut to the chase – the pork katsu steals the show. This main dish is not just great; it's the undisputed superstar of the menu. Reservations are needed as the space is intimate but does not feel cramped once seated. Hibi is a standout destination and proves that good dining can be found in unassuming places.

I’m usually the one to gate keep my favorite restaurants but this place is so good that the people deserve to know!!

The service, the food, the ambiance.. a perfect blend of things to make this experience one of the best in LA. All ingredients sourced locally and the lengths this restaurant goes to romance each ingredient right in front of you had me in a choke hold.

Get the bara uni toast… thank me later lol
Good experience. Each dish was well prepared. Good date restaurant.
Thank you for the delicious meal, every dish was full of flavor and freshness. So glad to have been able to sit in right away, you will have lines out of your door very soon.

name: JAWS TOPOKKI
address: 3807 W 6th St, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews:
Got to come here for the first time! Had a spicy one and rose based one with some deep fries!

Thought we ordered the vegetarian one but rose one came with pork in. But they kindly replaced it with one without.

Honestly, I like the spicy one better with deep fries!

I finally tried this place after seeing photos and videos on social media and it did not disappoint! Their menu consists of a variety of Korean street food and I wasn't sure what to try but the staff recommended her favs, JAWS COMBO and GIMBAP.

The JAWS COMBO came with your choice of spicy rice cakes soup or topokki with 3 sides: fried chicken strips, fried seaweed rolls and fried dumplings. Huge portion and 4 people could easily share it. The topokki soup is loaded with soft and chewy rice cakes, fish cakes, cheese and other stuff. It was spicy ,slightly sweet and I was told you're supposed to dip the fried food in it and gosh, it was sooo good!

I tired the SHRIMP GIMBAP and surprised how big it was. Packed with veggies, shrimp and very little rice. It was really good too. I also got the SOONDAE or blood sausage for my mom because it's her favorite and she liked it a lot!

Service was great, the interior was bright and inviting. Will definitely be back whenever I visit LA.

NOTE: Parking is limited since it's located inside a small business plaza but there's also street parking.
It's the best kimbap I've had in LA. You must dip it in the Topokki sauce for the full experience. The half-size Topbokki is great for trying various menu items. I'll definitely be back for more!

New! Just opened on 11/27.

Review 11/28: overall 4 stars
Got a takeout of just their chicken strip. Has a salty, onion flavor with a good crunch. Decent portion for the price. But it doesn’t come with any sauce or side dishes. Sauce is extra cost. We paid for ours but it was left out from our takeout order.
Service was nice but they just opened so they’re still trying to figure things out so it can be slow when placing orders.
Open space with causal dining in option.
Parking can be a pain but there’s valet or street parking option. Takeout is free parking for limited time.

Will update review when I try their other dishes.
—————————
Updated review 12/09:
Went back today to get their Jaws combo and basic gimbap. Overall 2.5 stars

Tteokbokki: WAY TOO SPICY. Has good toppings like quail egg, fish cake and glass noodles but I had such bad stomach pain from the spice and going to the restroom was hell 🔥💩. They didn’t offer options to make it less spicy. The taste was okay…
Chicken strips: dry and hard
Mandu: soggy and flavorless
Kimmari: crunchy and delicious
Kimbap: big and good but way overpriced

Jaws combo was around $30+ and the basic kimbap was $8+. I think both were too pricy for being fast food. The food is ready within 5-10 minutes as most are pre-made.

I would come to the the other dishes but wound not get the teokkboki again as it was just pure pain. Staff was still nice but they were still working on being trained.
——————
떡볶이 매워서 기절하는줄알앗어요
맛은 특별히 맛있지는안지만 괜찬고, 가격은 분식음식치고는 싸지는아는거같아요
일하시는분들은 친절해요

Got the Jaws topokki, regular spice. I only ate half the platter but I was crying by the end (not good with spicy food ._.) Get the mild spice or other less-spicy option if you're not a glutton for spice. Would rate the taste 8.5/10 with very good portion size.

Also, very clean dining area and restroom.

name: JJAN Korean Gastropub
address: 3328 W 8th St, Los Angeles, CA 90005, USA
reviews: I loved this place! We took a chance and tried a new restaurant and we absolutely enjoyed it! I ordered the pork belly with green onions. I ate everything! The green onions are thinly sliced and tossed in a sweet soy type sauce and the pork was super tender. My bf got spicy pork with kimchi and the portion was nice!! The flavor of the food here is definitely worth the price. Wish we could have gotten more water before the end of our meal though haha we were downing it!!
Had it at midnight and it was ok back then, we order the squid and rice cake then in the morning I started having symptoms of diarrheal, and had to buy medicines for that. Wouldn’t  recommend

JJAN exceeded all my expectations! My friends and I decided to give this place a try, and we were blown away by the amazing flavors and cozy atmosphere. I couldn't resist ordering the spicy chicken wings, pork belly with green onions and let me tell you, they were finger-licking good! The perfect balance of heat and flavor had me craving more with every bite. My friend opted for the beef bulgogi, and it was a hit! The tender beef combined with fresh vegetables and perfectly cooked rice made for a satisfying and delicious meal. We were constantly asking for refills! Overall, JJAN is a must-visit for anyone craving authentic Korean cuisine with a modern twist. Trust me, you won't be disappointed!
Amazing food amazing place and location. Nathan was our waiter he was very nice and welcoming. definitely recommend this place and will be coming back here.

Really awesome vibe and a chill spot. Everything we ordered was tasty. If you get anything doused in cheese you should prob come with at least three people so you can down it fast before the cheese cools down. The chicken and pork were so tender and the flavors were perfect and felt light even though it looked so heavy. I just wish their stools were comfier since my butt was killing me after an hour but that could be exasperated by me being pregnant. Would definitely come again.

name: Chi Chi LA ( 치치 엘에이 )
address: 610 S Berendo St, Los Angeles, CA 90010, USA
reviews: Chi Chi in Koreatown, Los Angeles, is an incredibly fun spot that offers an authentic Korean dining experience. The food is outstanding, with highlights like the bulgogi sliders and ramen that are simply amazing. Ordering is done through a device that also lets you play games with your group of friends or against everyone in the restaurant. The device includes a live game chat feature, so you can interact with others while you play. Winning coins from the games can be used to purchase food and alcoholic beverages, adding an extra layer of fun. The atmosphere is vibrant and energetic, making it the perfect place to visit with a large group. Highly recommended!

One of the best hang out spot in ktown!
Came in right after an early dinner with a few friends, the place was chill and only had a few tables but after an hour the whole spot was crowded and there were lines. Food and vibe was definitely on point, love the different food options and food came out fast and with great service.
Definitely have to go with the bois or friend groups!

If you plan to dine at Chi Chi LA, remember this: Reservation is a must! This place gets incredibly busy on weekends, and it's no wonder why. Chi Chi LA is a restaurant like no other, offering an extraordinary blend of dining and entertainment.

The atmosphere on a weekend night is positively vibrant and bustling. The reason? Well, it's all thanks to the special feature at every table – the personal ordering devices. These nifty gadgets aren't just for placing your food orders; they're a gateway to a world of fun and games.

Each table has its own ordering device, which not only allows you to select your dishes but also provides a variety of interactive games. You can enjoy mini-games by yourself or challenge other tables. There are even spontaneous group challenges initiated by the restaurant. Plus, there's a chat room where you can strike up conversations with diners at other tables.

Now, onto the food. Chi Chi LA offers a tasty menu, though portions are on the smaller side. The flavors are delightful, and I highly recommend trying their flavored Soju cocktails. They come with eye-catching glowing lights and adorable duck decorations that add a cute touch to your dining experience.

The only drawback is that engaging in conversation can be a bit challenging due to the continuous sounds of excitement from people playing games all around you. But if you're here for a fun and interactive dining adventure, this might not bother you too much.

The manager is really nice, he kept coming to play games with us. The food comes out really quickly too.

BUT ABSOLUTELY DO NOT VALET HERE. The valet is “supposed to be” only $4 and then when we came out they gaslit us and bullied us to pay $20. Making up excuses. They are definitely greedy and relying on people being drunk to agree

So sad that they ruined our experience because my group honestly liked the place.

🐓🐔Great Korean bar in Koreatown LA!
There was also a self-order menu, so it was very convenient. The free drinks game was actually a great idea! Second floor had outdoor patio and it was very spacious. Great service with lots of fun people. It’s fun to watch people too.

** I'm an emoji Google local guide in DFW areas if you want more reviews, don't forget to follow my account. 😊  **

name: The Prince
address: 3198 1, 2 W 7th St, Los Angeles, CA 90005, USA
reviews:
When taking the stairs down to the Prince you're both about to enter a cool Korean restaurant as well as the bar where Nick works in "New Girl".

Overall the food was nice and the atmosphere as well. The restaurant is very cozy and well decorated which makes it a nice place to sit for a while.
The service was alright but nothing special.

To sum it up I think The prince is worth a visit! Especially if you are a "New girl" fan :)
Amazing place ! Amazing drinks ! Amazing staff ! Amazing food ! Just amazing all around lol nothing bad to say at all ! Looking to have a great time ? Definitely come here and enjoy your self.

PEOPLE! THIS IS NOT A 5 ⭐️ bar/restaurant. #KoreanFood #Victorian-style
Food was okay, Great vibe, some great staff. Max was really friendly and attentive! Bartender  was a bit impatient and definitely felt it as a first timer (and probably as the only timer), but  made mean drinks! . Bartender  did recommend this beef dish that was pretty decent.
Great parking lot staff!  Arturo was genuine and super friendly. Carlos, the valet guy was helpful and made things easier for customers that were ready to leave. Great prices… good time!  I would come back for unwinding 😏🤭🤫😍😍. Thank you Max for allowing me to be part of your world for a night: too bad not many people understand that. 🙏🏽 I needed tonight! If I ever come back, it would be for Max’s great welcoming personality. Other than that… 👎👎👎👎👎👎… Train your workers… “The Prince”.

This is such a cool bar. The drinks, decor, ambiance, food, and service were top-notch. Food wise, I had the shrimp fried rice and hot wings. So good. I forgot this was the bar used in New Girl too. Would definitely come back for a drink or late snack. The parking though is tough so Uber or left recommended.

Great vibe, good food and I am sure the drinks are great as well.

This is a very unassuming spot in Ktown that is great for an intimate or large group.

I’ve been many times over the years and doesn’t disappoint.

name: The Kimbap
address: 400 S Western Ave #102, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews: I got the Mayo Shrimp first time I came here back in June and l loved it. It was very tasty and everything felt fresh. I went back about a week ago and the taste was the same as last time. Checking out is very easy and the lady that works there packs everything nicely. I wish the restaurant wasn’t only for takeout. I love this place not matter what!

Great spot for a cheap meal!
Very generous portions, especially their tuna mayo kimbap
I talked to the owner there and she was so sweet and helpful
She recommended the tuna mayo, spicy pork, fish cake, and beef
All very yummy, but our fav was the spicy pork 😋

I ordered from old photo showing cup container. They now have cheap plastic containers that's bad for hot food. Chemicals-bpa.  These reviews are misleading. 4.5 stars n big portion n cheap?   I spent $40 very small portions. I know prices went up, still please take all old reviews out. Could have bought market kimbap for $7.50 for 2 rolls. Fried squids were so little.  tukbokki  was
sweet.  No veggies.  Street food that's overcharged.  I wouldn't recommend.

!!TAKE OUT ONLY BEWARE!!
Ordered two spicy Kimbap (spicy pork and spicy squid), spicy tteokboki, udon soup. Food was good, but the level of spice was TOO MUCH. if you’re white, STAY AWAY. I have a high spice tolerance, but both spicy kimbap were way spicier than expected. The tteokboki for sure recommend!! But not combined with the kimbap. Individually, all dishes were good but together the spice was too much to bear. Udon soup is good, but has a lot of fish cake and only two shrimps.

The Kimbap is amazing!

This is my new favorite Korean restaurant. Taste = authentic, ingredients were quality, portions are solid,  great options and awareness of vegetarian/vegan diets, fast turnaround time. It's take out only, which we didn't know as we just stumbled across it, but the packaging made it convenient.

Can't wait to go again next time in LA.

name: YUP DDUK LA
address: 3603 W 6th St, Los Angeles, CA 90020, USA
reviews: My go-to spicy rice cake place. I always get the set B rice cake option with extra mild for the spicy level(because their mild is not mild at all hahaha). The bowl is huge, big enough for three people. I just love the chewiness of the rice cake and all the toppings that come along with it. Making rice balls is also fun! Super attentive staff too!

**Rating: 4.5/5**

YUP DDUK is a must-visit for lovers of spicy Korean cuisine. One of Their signature dish, a big bowl of delicious components: chewy rice cakes, tender fish cakes, and crunchy cabbage, all topped with a generous layer of gooey mozzarella cheese that adds a creamy counterbalance to the heat. is a fiery delight that will satisfy any heat seeker. The noodles are perfectly cooked, soaking up the rich, spicy sauce that's packed with flavor.

Enhance your meal with add-ons like savory sausages, plump dumplings, and crispy fried spam, which provide even more texture and taste. Each element blends harmoniously, creating a deeply satisfying and memorable culinary experience.

The restaurant's vibrant atmosphere and friendly service further enhance the dining experience, making YUP DDUK an excellent choice for those craving a bold and hearty meal.

I love most of the spicy food! But i only can accept the mild one :) it was so chewy and delicious! I hope there is more mozzarella cheese on the menu…it was apparently a small portion besides the rice cakes…😭please have rice ball with yup dduk just in case you can handle spicy food

The spice level at mild was close to when I eat a bunch of buldak noodles. So glad I went with mild. My nose was dripping halfway through the meal. I have a higher spice tolerance than most too. Fresh serranos and bird's eye chilis are my friend. I got the combo with more rice cakes, next time I'll try the one with more fish cakes. The rice balls are needed, trust me.

I love this place. There is nothing not to like except how small the restaurant is. It is very small and very popular so the wait can get long, especially during dinner hours and the lot can become packed with cars so parking is a nightmare.

Beware of spice. My boyfriend and I shared an extra mild and for me it's good. There was sweetness with a little tang. there is no "no spicy"
options so anyone who cannot tolerate an ounce of spice is out of luck.

The options are endless for what you can add-in.  My boyfriend loved their blood sausage, I love the texture but the irony flavor is not for me but he did claim to be the BEST sausage he probably has ever had in his life so I am sure it meant something.

Service is top class. they accidentally placed the neighboring table order on ours for 2 seconds and then gave us free yogurt as an apology. No one was angry but we appreciated the drink!

name: Gogobop Korean Rice Bar
address: 3456 Wilshire Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90010, USA
reviews:
Go Go Bob Korean Rice Bar offers fresh and filling bowls that deliver on value and taste.

I ordered the No Protein Bowl and the Tofu Bowl, and both were packed with lots of vegetables and plenty of sauce. For $40 with delivery, the portions were generous and satisfying. The vegetables were fresh, and the bowls were quite filling even without added protein. I supplemented with some of my own protein, which was a nice option to have. Overall, I have no complaints – the food was tasty, well-portioned, and reasonably priced for what I received. A solid choice for a wholesome and enjoyable meal.

Big portion sizes & modern dining atmosphere.
The gochujang chicken tastes fine but doesn’t have the gochujang spice flavor, same for the dressing.
Great lunch!  Pick all your favorite bi bim bop parts to customize your bowl.  Kids and parents loved it!

Delicious kimbop. If you want only kimbop, you can forgo the lines and pay up front. GOGO bowls are chipotle style where you can choose what toppings you want - loving the green onion mix. So yummy. Also tried their party noodle. Definitely party in your mouth.

Have been here a couple of times with family (my brother was the one who first introduced me to this place) and it has been one of our go-to places ever since.

Their hotteok is so good, especially freshly made

Their bowl sizes are definitely larger than any other restaurants I've been to before.

Have yet to try everything else on the menu but I definitely recommend getting the bulgogi, and pork belly! :)

name: Houston's
address: 2991 Michelson Dr, Irvine, CA 92612, USA
reviews:
This chain of restaurants can never go wrong. Every dish on the menu is completely special. We ordered the artichoke dip that was amazing, the vegetarian burger that was flavorful as well as the Hawaiian steak. The Hawaiian steak is one of the best dishes here, I recommend that you split it with someone else because it is really big.
The service is average but nothing below good, our server was really polite and recommended different dishes, answered our questions and was attentive all the time.
Desserts are average but also great, the apple walnut cobbler 10/10.

I had the pleasure of being served by Denise, and it was the best service experience I've ever had. Not only was the food delicious, but Denise's attention to detail, warmth, and professionalism made the meal even more enjoyable. She went above and beyond to ensure everything was perfect, making my visit memorable. Highly recommend requesting her for exceptional service and a great dining experience!

I had a lunch there few times and was wonderful experience each time.

Food: I had salmon this time and it was cooked to perfection. Moist but cooked well with wonderful sauce. Cappuccino was little bitter— hopefully they up their game on that.

Service: our server was fantastic. Came to check on us but didn’t ask how it was in mid chewing lol

Space: it is always clean here. Plenty of table but recommend reservation.

Parking is the area they have problem time to time. Restrain is in a yuppie area with few upscale restraints so we reserved 11:45 — still it was getting full and had to park far.

Houston’s is a great upscale dining experience. They have really good food and excellent quality. The tuna was amazing with fresh vegetables. I honestly wasn’t impressed with the French dip sandwich, but maybe it’s a different style. It has USDA prime roast, but it was cold and felt basically under cooked. Everything else I’ve had was amazing and it’s a beautiful restaurant.

This used to be an excellent steakhouse but for various reasons no longer deserves my patronage.

First off - there is absolutely no parking. Not in the adjacent lot, not in the lot on the other side and also not in the 4 story lot across the street.  They must offer valet, or diners like me will miss their reservation time as I did. 20 minutes to find parking is ridiculous.

The menu is extremely limited, and lacks many basic commonplace items like Cobb salad, soup, no ribeye steak (only one sized 10 oz fillet), limited side dishes, and limited deserts (no sorbet, no berries...).

The server got our order wrong 3 times. Kitchen fault. Sent her with a pork chop instead of salmon. Missed my rice and black beans until so so so much later than my main dish (fillet) was served, that it missed my entire meal.

The "traditional salad", the French fries and the spicy tuna rolls were all very average. My fillet was excellent (medium) but lacked flavoring. No asparagus, no baked potato, just broccoli (which was excellent).

Absolutely not going back there. For a long time.

name: North Italia
address: 2957 Michelson Dr, Irvine, CA 92612, USA
reviews:
Excellent food! This is one of my friend's most treasured spots that she shared with me!  We went there for her birthday, and her staple favorite is spaghetti and meatballs! It was actually quite good as the sauce absolutely made the dish! We went there at 10:00 p.m. for a great dinner on a Friday night, and even at this hour it was super busy!
Definitely recommend reservations! Very busy, the outdoor seating gives a bit of a less cramped feel. Seating was comfortable and our table definitely accommodated our orders. Their drink menu is pretty vast (I did not order any alcoholic beverages, but my friend absolutely loves wine and had her pick of her favorites).
Our server was absolutely amazing! Great attitude, knew the menu in and out, readily would make recommendations if asked, but not pushy at all!
We will definitely be going back for our friend dates!

This place gets packed!  Make reservations because you’ll want to go here. The food is very good and the service equally good. The setting is slightly upscale casual so you’ll see a wide audience, but clearly everyone is enjoying the company, the food, and the time. I don’t live here but will definitely come back next time I’m in town. For appetizers we got the crispy eggplant Parmesan (so so good) and crispy calamari. For meals, 3 of us ordered the bolognese while one had the spicy rigatoni vodka, which absolutely rocked. For me, that’s a go to dish. Definitely must try this place.

Really good food and service. They even ran someone out to tell us the food was coming in a couple of minutes, though I didn't think it was taking long at all. It's pretty choke though, even on a weekday night so get that reservation in.

Great meal at North Italia.  The truffle bread as a starter was divine!  My bolognese with pappardelle noodles was so good.  Everything was seasoned so well!  It can get noisy on the inside, but they have a really nice outdoor seating area and that was perfect for a relaxing dinner!  Service was efficient and pleasant!!!  Would definitely return!
We went for an after graduation celebration last Friday.  Food is great and service is excellent.  We sat at the patio which is nice and cool.  We love the experience and we will be back.

name: Habana
address: 708 Spectrum Center Dr Suite 708, Irvine, CA 92618, USA
reviews: This place is the GOAT at the Spectrum. Understated, and just so great on the inside. Prefect atmosphere, music is so tasteful of Cuba and at the perfect volume. Bar looks great and is full stocked. Restrooms are clean and befitting of the atmosphere of the restaurant. The service is above-and-beyond, give Carlos a raise. Food is so good, whoever designed the meals knew exactly what they were doing, literally and figuratively cooked. Really, just a great restaurant.

Great dining experience, exquisitely presented food combined with lively warm ambiance makes this restaurant a winner.

The Avocado plantain crusted appetizer was unique.
My grilled shrimp served with a Jamaican rum pepper sauce was a great choice.
The Banana table side flambe was yummy.

I will definitely patroni8 this establishment again.

If you’re looking for a taste of Cuba in the heart of Orange County, Habana Restaurant in Irvine is the place to be. Nestled in the lively Irvine Spectrum Center, Habana delivers an authentic and vibrant Cuban dining experience.

Service at Habana is attentive and friendly, adding to the overall enjoyable experience. Whether you’re a fan of Cuban food or simply looking to try something new, Habana Restaurant is a must-visit. The combination of delicious food, vibrant atmosphere, and excellent service makes it a gem in Irvine’s dining scene.

We came here to celebrate a birthday. They have both indoor and semi-outdoor seating which is very nice on a sunny day. We ordered a few appetizers like Ceviche Tropical and Avocado Frito. For entries, we ordered Paella, Lechon Asado, El Churrasco and Rum Pepper Shrimp. Everything was delicious and we finished all plates lol.

Mixed bag here. Food was mostly okay but for the prices should have been way better. Staff was friendly but not overly attentive. The Mac and cheese we had as a side was the only thing to write home about.

name: Il Fornaio Irvine
address: 18051 Von Karman Ave, Irvine, CA 92612, USA
reviews:
Amazing! Held our Wedding reception dinner in the Sala room. I can't say enough great things about this place. Great food, attentive service, and obvious focus on atmosphere. Steve provided top notch service. This was also the location of our first date and it was so great to bring our family to this restaurant to celebrate.

Highly recommend!
After good food, we played ping-pong outside the restaurant. That was so fun.

Loved everything here. The service was excellent, the food was amazing and delicious, the atmosphere was incredible. My food was so hot I know it was freshly made. This has been the best day I've ever had dining out, I rarely give 5 stars but everything about today was just so magical. Fresh pasta and pizza wow, just everything we ate was so delicious

My cousin took me here for my birthday, everything we ordered was phenomenal delicious, our server was attentive and I got a free chocolate ice cream 🍨 for my birthday, it was really thoughtful. I can’t wait to be back and try other entrees.

Wonderful food, service and atmosphere.  Had an event here many years ago and locked down the whole location. Staff, service food was perfect.  Price was spot on too for what you get.

Just came again lately and had to remind myself to come here more often, it's in the corporate area so you forget, but it's only a few miles away from the residential areas.

Food was still great as well as service.  The venue is just so nice with the amount of windows, it really does remind you hints of Italy.  Made me want to go back to Florence.

name: Solstice Seasonal Kitchen & Bar
address: 18555 Jamboree Rd, Irvine, CA 92612, USA
reviews: I celebrated my birthday at Solstice Restaurant in Irvine, Orange County, and it was an incredible experience. From the moment we arrived, the service was exceptional. The cocktail, appetizers were delicious and set the tone for an amazing meal. Every dish we tried was expertly prepared and bursting with flavor. The staff went above and beyond to ensure we had a memorable celebration. I highly recommend Solstice Restaurant for any occasion!

I've been here a few times for dinner, and the dishes we ordered are always on point. Flavorful but not salty. This time I came in for lunch and most dishes were salty to overly salty. We had to send it back to the kitchen to remake it. It tasted better second time around but still not comparable to dinner. Still enjoyed our food as our waiter made a big difference with our dinning experience. Customer service is definitely top notch.

Very modern restaurant  inside office complex.  Definitely  a place for work lunch and after work happy hour, even if happy hours ends at 5:30pm.  Server was extremely  knowledgeable  friendly  and fast.  Food was good well presented.  Fresh seasonal  ingredients.  We were there to celebrate two birthdays  and they got recognized  with 2 free desserts  and glass of white bubbly wine for everyone  at the table. Nice gesture.

I’ve been here twice. It’s sweet that they give a hand signed card by staff and dessert for special occasions. I enjoy the idea of the seasonal menu. The food and drinks are different and creative, but okay. The flavors are missing something. Cool place, but I wouldn’t come back. Fun to try.

We came here on a recommendation of a friend to celebrate a birthday, and it did not disappoint! The service was amazing. Honestly some of the kindest, most attentive staff I’ve ever experienced at a restaurant, and they even wrote a personalized birthday card! All of our drinks were 10/10 (highly recommend the lavender lemon drop) and the ambiance was so light and bright! The food was mostly amazing as well, though I probably would not order the lobster gnocchi again. Very much enjoyed the rolls, tuna tartare, short rib, burger, crab cakes, and butter cake though! And they brought out a round of champagne for a birthday toast which was very thoughtful. Overall would gladly come back! And though we missed happy hour, it looked like a great time as well

name: Bistango in Irvine
address: 19100 Von Karman Ave, Irvine, CA 92612, USA
reviews:
Extremely nice meal!! Knock on the service because they brought the wrong knife out for the chops.
Excellent wine list, great wine by the glass selection.
There is a live band playing most nights and it is very nice. There is artwork for sale at each station again really a nice touch for local artists.

A vast selection on the menu. But get your dessert soufflé in early!!! Totally worth it.

I will definitely go back here!

Delicious food! The steak was cooked perfectly medium rare! Not many places get the right temperature for food. The 16oz Rib Eye comes with one side of potatoes, we added one mo re side and it was enough for two people! Previously we had had the wedge salad as an appetizer which I did not take a picture off but it was delicious too. We went on a Saturday night and they had live music, very nice location. Service was very flat and we had to wait a long time to have our order taken but it’s definitely a place I would go back for the great food. Parking it’s $8 an hour but they validate your ticket at the end which I was not expecting but was very nice.

Great live music here - I have discovered a few favorite bands here. The menu here is perfection. They are great with preparing lamb, chicken and salmon, but everything here is really delicious. Great cocktails and very friendly and professional staff (with great memories).

We had a party of 9 dine here for lunch which all but one was trying it for the very first time. The restaurant dining area was beautiful! It was decorated beautifully for the Christmas holiday. Our server Eddie was awesome, he tended to our entire table and helped those of us unsure about what to order. My wife ordered a Caesar salad with salmon, and I ordered a chicken sandwich with fries. The food was delicious! The restaurant hit all the right points (food*service*ambiance)! There were no leftovers to take home, at least from our orders. It was a great time! Eddie was also just as good a photographer as he was a server. He took several photos of our group, from all angles of the table. Coffee was good, restrooms were clean, food was reasonably priced for the quality, and their parking was plenty. We had no negatives to report. We look forward to dining here again whenever we're in the Irvine area again.

We had the most wonderful experience. The entire staff were very generous with their time and their smiles. Our server, Eddie, was attentive and well acquainted with the menu and bar. He helped guide us through our meal and drink selections and was the perfect gentleman.

We started with the tuna tartare, my dinner was the fettuccine pasta, my other half enjoyed the king salmon, dessert was the pumpkin cheesecake. All of it was divine. We particularly enjoyed the appetizer and dessert.

Overall, we felt very welcome and hope to be back again soon.

name: Bosscat Kitchen & Libations
address: 18169 Von Karman Ave, Irvine, CA 92612, USA
reviews:
Go for the “sandwiches”. The menu seems to skew towards chicken which is weird but I hear poultry is popular these days. The decor was good but could be dated in a few years. It just seemed like the patio is place to be rather than inside.

The shaved pork chop sandwich was possibly one of the best burgers I’ve had in years. It had the perfect balance of heat, savory and rich tang from the bbq. And the fries were just about perfect.

Only downside was the fried chicken sandwich was overcooked and dry. They can change that but it wasn’t very memorable. There’s probably a better sandwich to try.

Overall, all the foods I tried were quite unique and flavorful. My personal top #1 is portobello mushroom fries. They come little moist, not crispy crispy but the batter itself adds really good flavor to the mushrooms and the sauce as well. The other menus were alright, little salty for regular meal but probably better with alcohol drinks.

The first time I dined here. I was here for the team lunch. Enjoyed the foods and ambience. The Gulf Shrimp & Grits I ordered was amazing as well as the appetizers we ordered. The server was great. I would like to come back for dinner next time.

We made a reservation at 5:45, arrived at 5:40 and were seated immediately.

After a few minutes our waiter came over and took drink orders. Then we didn’t see him again for a while. We placed our food orders and it took a bit to get food. I ordered the sugar barrel steak and did not get a steak knife until I was half way through my meal. Our waiter was friendly, but was seldomly seen.

The steak was amazing! Perfect crunch, the flavor was perfect. The potatoes and green beans were a perfect compliment.

I ordered the chocolate bourbon buttermilk bar, it had a weird flavor and was not as sweet as I expected.

Came for brunch the other day and really enjoyed the food. Everything was so fresh and delicious. Love the area and the atmosphere. We brought our toddler who loved the grassy area outside to run around. Service was pretty slow and our waitress kept forgetting things so that was a bummer. Wish they had a kids menu and more nonalcoholic drinks like fancy coffees...

name: Andrei's Restaurant
address: 2607 Main St, Irvine, CA 92614, USA
reviews: Had an amazing dinner at Andrei's! The lamb lollipops and fish were delicious, and the overall experience was fantastic. Highly recommend!
Excellent dinner. The short ribs and mash were fabulous. Wine .... So good it was gone. Service was attentive and quick. Overall a wonderful place with fantastic food!

Nice place. Excellent service. Pretty much every time I went to drink my iced tea it had been freshly filled. Delt with my strange ordering like it was no big deal. Quiet at lunch and valet was free at lunch.  But the food just didn't do it for me.  Would have been just as happy with an average restraunt chain.

I placed a lunch order to go at 11:31am, right after they opened, and somebody actually picked up the call. Most places are not that prompt.  The lady was polite and asked all the right questions to customize my order. She gave me a good expectation of pick up time and they did not disappoint.

I ordered the lamb burger with fries and it was just phenomenal!!!  It was perfect and I loved every bite. It was huge so I ate half and saved the other for dinner.  This is my new favorite spot!!!
I wanted to grab something close to the hotel I was staying at and tried this spot. The bartender was great!

name: Aria Kitchen
address: 2636 Dupont Dr, Irvine, CA 92612, USA
reviews:
What a great combo... Mexican and Persian good combined! Had the koobideh taco and that was really good. All the food was pretty good. Didn't really like the eggplant dip.

The tables are really small. The booths, the person behind you is very close to your back. If you order a lot, they'll have to bring an extra small table to your side.

Definitely worth a try. I'll be coming back.

The food is amazing, and we love the food. We got their lamb and beef tacos and they both were amazing. The service was great, Deanna L our server was also very friendly and helpful. The manager, Mata, was very welcoming and nice.

Aria is a relatively new comer though it is not the first restaurant operated and owned by the family. Caspian, Irvine Grill and now closed Super Irvine are other establishments belonging to the family.
This is one of its own kind though. The menu is Persian/Mexican fusion. It is located on Jamboree, parking might be struggle depending on the day and time. The decor is very modern and nothing has been spared. The colors, the settings are very charming. The booth tables are small and getting in and out of the booth is a challenge due to its narrow setting. Warm chips with salsa is offered at the beginning and if you ask they refill the chips. Both were very good.
The staff is attentive and service is quick.
We ordered a combination of Persian and Mexican dishes and they were all good and generous in size.
The price is ok for the kind of level they are trying to reach out.
Nothing was impressive with desserts and definitely can benefit from an uplift.
Overtime, I hope they can improve their shortcomings but overall we are very pleased with our dining experience at Aria and wish them best luck.
Also to note almost everything is halal in this restaurant.
Celebrated Cinco de Mayo here and it was a fun experience! Delicious empanadas with live music and fire dance in a modern ambience . Best service!
Great Mexican Persian fusion restaurant! Fun ambiance. Great for big groups. Everything we got was delicious. Recommend the chicken taquito appetizer.

name: Cucina Enoteca Irvine
address: 532 Spectrum Center Dr, Irvine, CA 92618, USA
reviews:
I recently dined here, and it was an exceptional experience. The ambiance is simply stunning, with elegant decorations that create a warm and inviting atmosphere. The vibe is perfect for a relaxing evening out.

The wine selection is impressive, offering a variety of exquisite options that pair beautifully with the dishes. I highly recommend the short ribs pasta, which was cooked to perfection and incredibly flavorful. Another standout dish was the fennel sausages pizza, a delightful combination of textures and tastes that left a lasting impression.
How ever the chicken plate and stuffed squash were amazing too.
About Burrata, I expected little bit more of cheese and tomato (bigger portion) however it was delicious.

A great spot aesthetically speaking. The grilled octopus was great and the sauce was perfect, light, and just Italian. Loved the marinated beans too. The squid ink linguine was delicious. It was perfection from the sauce to the flavors to the clam. The red wine braised short rib mafaldine pasta was also incredible. I would have liked a little more sauce to stick to the pasta, but otherwise everything was well flavored and the textures were on point. We sat outside and the heaters were on and the seats were well cushioned.

People give this place 5 stars must not know what clean plates and silverware look like.
I’ve noticed things are floating in their water they bring (bottom itself isn’t clean either).
So we ordered bottled water. Silverware had streaks of people’s lip mark…. Gross 🤮
Then desert chocolate pudding’s glass cup had lip mark and other dusts (look at the picture I posted).

It’s sad cuz their food isn’t half bad but it makes me wonder if they know how to do dish well or they are not into sanitizing serving dishes. Do they even clean pots and pans????

Our Server was assigned large space and we only saw him to take order and bringing order. We had to sneak in our dessert order when he came to ask us if we need box for leftover. He could’ve gotten 25% tip if he had more time to ask what we needed but 15% was even too much for what he did. I don’t blame him really but management need to figure it out cuz there are many Italian restaurant in the mall.

This large Italian eatery is located in Spectrum Mall in Irvine directly across from Starbucks. We tried several dishes and couple of pizzas and several desserts. Result was mostly great dishes and a few misses. Meatball appetizer is quite good as it comes with tasty polenta sauce. Squid ink linguini in tomato clam sauce was very well done. Short rib pasta was fine but they give you only a bits of shredded rib meat rather than the entire rib. We had Pepperoni and Pineapple pizzas. Both were delicious and their pizza crust was crispy and chewy. Pistachio gelato ordered had no distinctive taste of pistachios. Not sure what it was. Service could have been more attentive and friendly. They have both indoor and outdoor tables. Parking is available in the large parking structures around the mall.

The food was better than I expected - the two of us got pastas and they both had very flavorful sauces. The server was nice and attentive, but she tricked us into getting some bread. We told her we didn’t want any appetizers or cocktails and then she asked if we wanted bread, and said yes assuming it was complimentary, but it came out to be $8.

I enjoyed the meal and the bread, but I really don’t like any surprises on a bill.

name: Ever After Tea Room & Eatery
address: 18090 Culver Dr, Irvine, CA 92612, USA
reviews: I came here with a friend and the ambiance inside was great! We ordered on the kiosk and after getting our drinks we went to get a table and they delivered the food to our table. We got the Taiwanese beef noodle soup and the noodles were perfectly chewy, the beef was tender and the soup was perfectly flavored. We also got the Summer Farm Snow Cake to share and it was amazing! The homemade blueberry jam was so good! The layers within the shaved snow was such a great pairing with the fresh fruit on the outside.

Cute Asian cafe with food and drinks. It’s nicely decorated with floral walls, modern furniture with a little classic accents. The food and drinks were good. Our favorite was the popcorn chicken with the umami sauce and the 4 seasons tea that came with the lunch special. The steak had a weird texture like it was tenderized artificially and I wasn’t particularly fond of the purple rice, it had a healthy herbal scent to it, but it is just a matter of preference. They also have a dog menu but only for outdoor patio seating.

Walked in and you would order on the kiosk or with the person. Tables are first come first serve which can get difficult. Check for tables before ordering because we did not do that. Almost didn’t have a table to sit at. People go there to study or just chat so tables are occupied for long period of hours.We came at 2:30 and it was packed. Lines at the cash register as well.

Menu: lots of options. Drinks. Soup. Rice. Shaved ice. Dog dishes! Dogs have 2 dish options!

Beef noodle soup: I wish their noodles weren’t as soft but it was still good. It didn’t break when I picked it up so it’s still good. The soup is good. Not too oily nor salty. They give LOTS of meat. I had over 9 pcs of meat inside my bowl.

I have to come back when I hungrier! They have lots of options. Lots of shaved ice too!
Parking: it’s in a plaza so there’s lots of parking!

Price: reasonable with the big portions.

Update:
Tried their shaved ice multiple times before posting this review. Must get!! It’s summer so it’s a good spot. I’m sure they can get it to go but it’s so much prettier as well as yummier there.

Popcorn chicken: very dry and isn’t as much as I’d expect. Portion wise for this was a bit less than I’d expect. Don’t think I’ll get this again.

Food was too good. Hooked on first bite. Best popcorn chicken I had in Socal. Very minimal flour was used. All chicken meat used. Not blended with fat or tendons. This is going to be my weekly spot for sure. Dog friendly! Their dog beef bowl was so good, fresh and hot. My dog and I loved it lol. (I tried a bite). Highly recommend this place. Reasonably priced. Plenty seating outside also.

Me and my husband came here around 7-8 pm on a Wednesday and it wasn’t too packed. But the food was great! We will definitely be back for some bingsoo next time! I got the beef soup and it was delicious. We LOVED the sweet potato fries as well.

name: Del Frisco's Grille
address: 772 Spectrum Center Dr, Irvine, CA 92618, USA
reviews: It's a good correlation between price and quality. My friend and I had lunch there - we shared tuna tacos and steak salad and were enjoying every bite (there is a half of dish in the pic)! Steak in the salad was perfect and everything was fresh and delicious. We spent like 30 dollars each and had a perfect time there. Service was fast and friendly.

Food was awesome unfortunately the service was super slow.  We were in this place nearly 3 hrs.  Most of the time I had to get up and hunt down a waiter to take our order.   Too bad, wished I had a better experience.  When you pay $300+  for a dinner for 4,  before tips you expect a better experience.

The Steakhouse Salad is a Keto masterpiece! The steak was grilled to perfection. The bacon, avocado and blend of cheeses added to the protein in an explosion of compliments. The Lemon Horseradish dressing is the perfect selection and Deviled Eggs to boot? Best salad I’ve had, maybe ever!
Special shout out to Brian and Zach for superb service. I will be back!!

Kitchen is open to the restaurant so you hear everything going on. For an up scale steak house one would think that would not be a thing. We saw the server twice/ order taker. We saw the food delivery/server three times.  Load baked potato was not very loaded. Steak was amazing.
We truly enjoyed everything about this restaurant from the decor to the food!!  And the service was spot on, they never left us needing anything, they were on top of it!   Highly recommend!

name: Lazy Dog Restaurant & Bar
address: 13290 Jamboree Rd, Irvine, CA 92602, USA
reviews: 1st time at this restaurant and we loved it. We got seated promptly, Our server, Hector, was great-he explained the menu. The food was awesome. We got the bison meatloaf and grilled trout. Got free garlic waffle chips too.

For what it is, I really like Lazy Dog. The service is consistent and the menu is varied and dependable.

Last night we were served by Mitch (think I'm remembering that correctly) and he was great.

My ahi salad was good but maybe a tad overdressed and underseasoned (the greens themselves, not the ahi).

The edamame is SO GOOD.

The club sandwich is always a hit and the fries are awesome--so crispy.

We also got the brownie dessert and it was delicious--gooey and crunchy on the edges.

And obviously--I love the dog friendly theme of the restaurant.

Had been a bit since I had been in a lazy dog and this location did not disappoint. We had the calamari and wings to start. Wings were my favorite of the night. Calamari is not fried and crunchy a typical, but still delicious!! The bison burger was ok. Fries were bomb! Leave room for the butter cake 🤤

Really all the food was very tasty, the staff was super friendly and the service so fast , I would like to thanks Devin he was
So helpful ,kind and supportive.
The most important thing all my kids love the place and the food.the restaurant and Devin made our Father’s Day special..don’t forget to ask about him 😉.
Really we will come again and again .

I’ve eaten at Lazy Dog Restaurant in different places a number of times. I’ve had the Pot Roast Dip Sandwich, delightful!  I’ve had their bowls, their burgers, several of their apps and salads. I’ve never had a bad meal at any of the Lazy Dog locations and the service is always good.

However, the dish that takes the cake is their Chips and Queso. I have NEVER been a Queso guy but this stuff is AMAZING.  I really wish there was a LD near where I live.

I’ve searched online a number of times and can’t find the recipe.

name: Izakaya Osen Irvine
address: 2000 Main St suite 100, Irvine, CA 92614, USA
reviews: We came in for lunch today for the first time.  The food was alright, and we enjoyed the King Salmon sushi, and the toro was nice. However, the Gyu Don was so-so, and the miso soup smelled really strongly of some unfiltered water/ sanitary cleaning water. We just have some questions why regular shrimp or tako(octopus) sushi is not sold here, when it is most usually sold in most sushi places. Overall, the biggest complaint we have is the tip calculations are based on tax, when another reciept’s calculation is off of the usual bill, making it really obvious that there is something wrong with the POS.  Even if this may be a small thing, it is major in a customer’s perspective. I advise the manager to fix this problem.

Izakaya Osen quickly became my favorite Japanese spot in Irvine. They have convenient free parking nearby, which is a plus! The menu offers a huge variety: sushi, hot pot, skewers, bowls, noodles - and everything I've tried has been super fresh and high-quality.

Don't miss their unique sushi with uni, sweet shrimp, caviar, and truffle, or the decadent toro, uni, and caviar option. These are incredible! The miso crab salmon and unagi hot pot are must-tries as well. The servers are friendly and attentive, and the food arrives fast.

Overall, Izakaya Osen is a must-visit for anyone looking for a delicious Japanese dining experience in Irvine. The fresh ingredients, extensive menu, and excellent service make it a hidden gem!

Made reservations for a Monday lunch date with my husband.  I do eat quite a bit of sushi and omakase so I’m really critiquing it as a person who really enjoys good sushi & sashimi.

Omakase bowl:  Decent 4/5 but the chopped fish didn’t have any real umami taste.  I guess since it’s an “omakase”bowl and it was ordered off the regular menu (not the lunch special), I had a little higher expectation.  I probably wouldn’t order it again.

Bluefin Tuna Don:  Lunch special and 4/5 for the quality of fish and value.

Sushi & Sashimi Hachi Mori:  Lunch special 4/5 for quality of fish and value

Hamachi Kama: 1/5 was super disappointing and terrible.  It looked so good bcs it’s deep fried BUT bcs was deep fried it was so DRY! Kama should be broiled to keep the moisture of the fish. It was not how a good Kama should taste.  PSA, save your money & do NOT order it.

Overall, it’s a solid 4 star restaurant with decent fresh sushi/sashimi but I wouldn’t make a special effort to return.  For me to drive from SGV to the OC, at least 1 dish needs to be a 5 star.

I'm trying Irvine's most popular sushi restaurant so you don't have to. Chances are you've already heard about this spot, but they're an elegant sushi bar with SO many menu options.

First off, we had to start with some yakitori, we got skewered chicken gizzard, bacon enoki mushroom, and pork belly, and their ankimo or monkfish liver appetizer is 100% worth trying.

I was so looking forward to their premium sushi sets because that's how you really judge a sushi restaurant (iykyk), I'm happy to report that they passed the test!

If you like a little spice, definitely get the yellowtail jalapeno, and I absolutely loved the omakase bowl where you can make your own DIY handrolls from, so fun!

Thanks for reading! ^-^

This was our first time at Izakaya and we enjoyed the food very much. We had the Omakase for 4 of us and it was a nice experience.
Our server was also great!
We sat outside and it was good but sometimes heard road noise from loud vehicles.

name: HiroNori Craft Ramen (Irvine)
address: 2222 Michelson Dr #234, Irvine, CA 92612, USA
reviews: The vegan ramen was fantastic! Broth was really rice and flavorful, with a fair amount of veggies and tofu included. Portion size was great and well priced. Save yourself some time and add your name to the wait list once you’re on the way there! The inside is pretty small, so the wait can be fairly long.

This place often has crazy wait times. I added myself to the wait list, and a table was surprisingly ready before I got there. I gave them an ETA, and only had to wait a few minutes for them to finish setting things up. The karaage and pork buns were tasty appetizers. The tonkatsu ramen was awesome! I especially loved the soup. Every spoonful was packed with flavor. They charge 16% tip for every order.

Tonkotsu Ramen was really tasty and did not overly rely on salt. Noodles were fresh and the added vegetables were good too. The infused water was a nice touch and the venue playlist is amazing. Service was great, prompt, and friendly.

It just doesn’t get any better than this. I’m telling you, it’s the best ramen in America. The tonkatsu broth is cooked for 24 hours and you can taste the depth of flavor in every bite.
