The crispy chicken is a perfect starter. Served fresh and hot and super crispy. Edamame is fantastic as well as the pork buns. They add the tip on the total, So be careful not to double tip the server. (Unless you want to!) Strip mall has free parking, but the entire area is busy, so you may have trouble finding a spot.

A really lovely late lunch at HiroNori. We were craving ramen and this delivered. I tried the tonkatsu ramen with its creamy, rich broth and Caty opted for the lighter shoyu one. We also grabbed some edamame (salt and yuzu, just a hint ) and a drink. The pork buns were also delicious, though 11 dollars disappeared quickly 💨. Our server, Athena, was friendly and prompt. She checked in on us and answered questions.

name: Annies Table
address: 16277 Laguna Canyon Rd Ste D, Irvine, CA 92618, USA
reviews: First time here, food came quick and reasonably priced. Food is tasty and you can sense the authenticity of the Korean flavors. I got the spicy pork Bulgogi and a brown sugar boba, which you can adjust the sweetness... not bad and tasty.. Angie, the girl at the register..was very kind and courteous, Will come back again when in the area!

Best (non BBQ) Korean food in Orange County! The food is fantastic! It is made fresh every time, so it is well worth the short wait.

It gets busy for lunch during the week so I would go at slightly off hours. Also, they have great coffee and Boba!

Went and got a Korean style lunch, the gochujjang pork rice bowl. It's was fine. Nothing special and very pricy for what it was. When I got there it was empty but it filled up quickly with blizzard employees. There are Korean side dishes that look homemade in the refrigerators for sale. I thought they were expensive too but ymmv.

Soft open until end of April according to the owners. Food is one of the best I've had (and I've eaten a lot of Korean food). Food is cooked to order so expect a bit of a wait if you come at a busy time. Located in a business park next to Blizzard campus. Kimchi fried rice, Katsu, and bulgogi bowl were amazing! The refresher drinks are really good too (strawberry mojito, trust).
They serve delicious authentic Korean dishes and also have boba! A must try was the fried rice and the honey glaze chicken wings. Definitely coming back

name: The Goldfinch Restaurant
address: 2000 Main St Suite 200, Irvine, CA 92614, USA
reviews: We had a lovely meal and everything exceeded expectations. I tried a seasonal strawberry cocktail which was fresh and well balanced. We shared the poke tacos which were a nice small starter. The star was my lobster roll! I was impressed with the large full pieces of perfectly prepared lobster. The bun was also done very well as they cut off the sides of the bun and grilled it. This was such a great riff as it improved the balance of the sandwich to filling and added flavor. We finished with some lovely desserts and I really enjoyed the pistachio tiramisu. Our server was excellent and we had a lovely evening. First visit tonight but we will definitely be back to try brunch.

Good variety of options on their menu including seasonal options. Enjoyed the poached shrimp and lobster melon salad. It was light and fresh. The artichoke spinach dip appetizer was the best that I have enjoyed with fresh homemade chips. Good size portion of their lobster roll. They chocolate cake was light and had the right amount of frosting. Modern and comfy decor, they are located in a business park right off the 405 freeway. Chose this place looking for an early dinner option before going to the Segerstrom Center theater. This was a great option with a mid price point and only eight minutes away by streets or freeway. They also have a weekend brunch.

Upscale restaurant near John Wayne airport with good food, service, and decor. It’s on the pricier side, but it’s nothing unexpected given the location and menu.

My husband and I went for lunch around 11:30 on a Friday without a reservation. They promptly seated us and only a handful of patrons were there, although things picked up around noon.

We started with the goat cheese and artichoke appetizer. It was on the smaller side (5 pieces) but pretty flavorful. I ordered the crab cake, which was excellent — succulent and flavorful, especially with the sauce. The fennel salad was interesting. I’m not usually a fan of fennel, but it paired nicely with the crab cake and had a nice, firm texture. My husband ordered the prime rib (medium rare, on the rarer side), which was juicy and flavorful. The accompanying mashed potatoes were also tasty.

Other things to note: The service was great. My husband drinks frequently and our server was quick to come by for refills. In addition, they validated for 90 min parking at the adjacent parking garage.

Only coming here cuz our server Nick C made our experience amazing. Very kind server that tried to make our experience there great. We were a group of 7 and he was perfect for us. A couple of us ordered the vanilla bean French toast for brunch, and found it to be lackluster. There’s better options on the menu other than that. But service and the ambience was perfect

Goldfinch offers a trendy and inviting atmosphere perfect for a casual night out. We enjoyed our visit and found the food to be delicious.

The spicy tuna was a standout, with a perfect balance of heat and flavor. It was fresh and satisfying. The artichokes were creamy and rich, a classic comfort food choice that hit the spot.

Overall, Goldfinch is a great option for those looking for a lively spot with tasty food and a stylish ambiance.

name: Postino Park Place
address: 2981 Michelson Dr suite e, Irvine, CA 92612, USA
reviews: I went to Postino Park Place in Irvine to celebrate a friend's birthday and everything was delicious! They have a great atmosphere - especially for a casual get-together. I got a tuna sandwich and a salad, which were both perfect. They also have a great cheese board selection - my friends raved about theirs. Since there was this great $25 cheese board and bottle of wine special on Mondays and Tuesdays after 8 pm a lot of people ended up sharing that. The overall ambiance in the evening gives an intimate yet modern type of vibe. The service was great and it's a great spot for a fun and tasty meal with friends.

Vibrant Ambiance and Delectable Delights at Postino Park Place

As a devoted food blogger and enthusiastic Google reviewer, I recently had the pleasure of experiencing lunch at Postino Park Place, and it was an absolute delight from start to finish.

Upon arrival, we were greeted by an exuberant host whose energy set the tone for our visit.

🍽️Our table, strategically placed for two, offered a prime location within the vibrant and uniquely styled space. Every corner was adorned with colorful details that beckoned attention, enhancing the overall dining experience.

👍I wholeheartedly recommend Postino Park Place for a friendly hangout or gathering. The atmosphere fosters a sense of warmth and camaraderie, making it an ideal spot for connecting over delicious food and drinks.
Speaking of which, the appetizers surpassed expectations, boasting impeccable quality and flavor.

🍕Each bite was a testament to the culinary expertise behind the dishes. And let's talk about the wine and beer—here, you truly experience the essence of each sip, elevating the dining experience to new heights.

💎The service was top-notch, with servers who were not only fluent in the menu but also offered insightful suggestions to enhance our meal. Among the highlights were the fried cauliflower and bruschetta, both bursting with bold flavors and expertly executed.

🍺Our decision to indulge in a pitcher of beer was met with sheer satisfaction—the brew was nothing short of amazing, perfectly complementing the array of flavors on our table. The meatball was a revelation, tender and fresh, while the sweet potato wedges left us craving for more.

💚In conclusion, Postino Park Place exceeded expectations on every front. From the welcoming ambiance to the delectable offerings, it's a culinary destination that warrants repeat visits.

👍Whether you're seeking a casual meal or a memorable gathering with friends, this establishment delivers an unforgettable experience that will leave you coming back for more.

Service is absolutely amazing! Food ingredients are fresh! Roasted Mushroom Fondue and the Bruchetta with the bacon are my faves. Crispy Cauliflower is delicious. My friends enjoyed their Paninis and skewers. Beer selection is fun. The place gets very LOUD so not a good place for date night unless you don't mind conversation where you're yelling the entire time.

Such a cool place for a wine sip and dating. Love the settings and their wine selection.

I had:
1. Wine Perfekt riesling from 2022 Germany
2. Bruschetta: brie, apple & fig spread, fresh mozzarella, tomato & basil
3. Smoked salmon & pesto
4. Salami & pesto

Everything was great! Satisfied! Reasonably priced!

Chose this place for the dog friendly outdoor patio. Was looking for a nice happy hour spot to catch up with a friend. This place did not disappoint!

Parking is ample, easy, free.

Happy hour wine selection was great. Knowledgeable server will guide you if you don’t know exactly what to choose. 🍷

Yummy bruschetta! Bread was so fresh. Delicious flavor combinations and all ingredients were fresh and delicious! We also had the nine iron panini with focaccia bread and side soup of the day (cauliflower, so good). Everything was great!

My friend enjoyed her mocktail, a fruity berry lemonade.

We didn’t feel rushed and all the staff were friendly and helpful!

With all the food and drinks, I think the total bill was more than reasonable. Would go back for sure.

Please excuse my thumb in the photo! 🫣

name: Urban Plates
address: 3972 Barranca Pkwy N, Irvine, CA 92606, USA
reviews:
My favorite go-to spot!! Urban Plates is the place for food cooked from scratch with quality ingredients!!

Their Marinated Beet Salad with house made preserved lemon vinaigrette and added grass fed grilled steak was so vibrant, healthy and delicious!! The beets are firm with a wonderful texture and flavor!! My favorite place to get beets.

Their Grilled Cage Free Chicken plate is filling, juicy and perfect with the Organic Red & White Quinoa with Tomato Pesto. The quinoa is one of my favorite side dishes.

The Roasted Mushrooms with Garlic Parmesan Butter and Gochujang Roasted Broccoli were very tasty sides. I would definitely get them again!!

They have seating both inside and on their patio area. Good customer service!
Good food, you order up front so it may be good to look at the menu first to not hold up the line. Food was brought out fast. I was satisfied with the experience.

First time visiting this place and it did not disappoint! How it works is; you choose your protein and your 2 sides. The desserts are amazing! We ordered a family plan to go! Delicious food. This is how the portion looks when you eat inside. This cost about $65 including 2 drinks and a dessert.
Casual and fairly quiet place for lunch. Yuridia helped me at the register and is lovely. Honest about if the dishes I chose was good and let me try a sample. Will be back

One of my go to spots for my lunch break.  The price is a little high but the quality fantastic.  Moroccan chicken braise is my favorite meal to get but, when I’m feel adventurous Lesley ( one of the cashiers up front) helps me find something new. If you’re looking for healthy food def eat here

name: Yard House
address: 620 Spectrum Center Dr, Irvine, CA 92618, USA
reviews:
Great service, good food and great atmosphere. Met up with a friend from San Diego here at the Irvine Spectrum for a couple drinks and got some seats at the bar. Was still on happy hour so ordered some drinks and food🤙

Black and tans are the best imo here, ordered the happy hour blackened ahi and the Carnivore pizza and the quality never disappoints.

Server was attentive, service was great, this place started getting packed when we left. 5 stars🤙🤙

Happy hour Mon-Fri 3-6pm 50% off
Food is good. Not much veggies options. Music and noise are loud. Kid friendly.

Got seated very quickly, and the waitress took our order very quickly. However, we ended up waiting about 20-30 minutes for our food to come out, and our waitress was almost nonexistent after taking my order. Food was not really that great, I do not recommend their avocado and chicken sandwich. Their Ceasars salad is okay, and so are their fries.

Food was good I do not like how they push you to order on the little kiosk.

Server was good, refilled our drinks promptly , did take a while to come check on us after food was delivered.

Shrimp tacos were well seasoned almost a little too well seasoned very spicy and I like spice !

Great night out! Our server ensured we were able to watch the game and took care of our needs and checked in often. Loved the option to put in our orders ourselves since it let's us look things over and not have the dreaded stare down when you can't make up your mind. Poke nachos were great and guacamole was simple and not over complicated. We opted for a simple burger with added veggies on the side. Burgers were warm, flavorful and came out quickly. My only feedback is that for portions received the price is a bit steep. Ultimately, if you review the menu prior this allows for us to be prepared, but I remember serving sizes being a bit more in the past. Overall great night out and great restaurant.

name: Twenty Eight Restaurant and Bar
address: 19530 Jamboree Rd, Irvine, CA 92612, USA
reviews: Chic and cozy. Super friendly staff and delicious food. Steak was great but fatty. Garlic bone marrow was awesome, highly recommended.

Amazing drinks, and great steaks cooked to perfection. The wagyu hanger steak is a must try cooked over oak charcoal it has a Smokey flavor that pairs great with the pork chops and apple sauce cocktail(fat washed bourbon)

Tons of cool cocktail options, the wagyu is to die for as expected. But those Brussels sprouts are next level!  Liz and Haley were both awesome and very attentive servers, we were very well taken care of. I was visiting from Seattle, and this was a perfect way to experience the area.

Outstanding whiskey list which they'll breakdown into flights. The server and bartender setup the flight of 3 bourbons and 1 rye expertly. Appetizers were excellent. The wagyu steak was phenomenal. Our sever was very helpful and everything she recommended was delicious. I highly recommend Twenty Eight and look forward to returning.

This place is amazing! Cocktails are fantastic, food is delicious 🤌, ambiance/ scenery is elegant, staff goes above and beyond!!!! Highly recommend 😁

I had the sausage croquettes & the roasted mushroom & endives 🤌

Park in the Google parking garage and take the ticket to the hostess for validation.

name: Jopok Topokki Irvine
address: 3825 Alton Pkwy, Irvine, CA 92606, USA
reviews: Delicious. Your dishes are made fresh per order. A little bit of street food. A little bit of traditional. A touch of everything. This shop is adjacent to the HMart in a food court setting. Plenty of seating. Food court staff keeps this area clean.  Come to Jopok!

Go there semi-often and normally get the kimbap (sometimes the tteokboki and sundae), but this time around (a couple of days ago), the kimbap was saltier than normal, the danmuji especially. I hope that was a one-time coincidence and not something that is permanent in the flavoring. Overall, though, the food is good. Aside from this recent experience, I've never had a problem with it.
Jopok Topokki is located inside of HMart, and it is absolutely delicious! I highly recommend their bulgogi topokki. The customer service is amazing as well, the lady who took my order was very kind.

I love this topokki shop most in irvine. I’m korean this is authentic shop and rly famous franchise in korea. The owner is so so kind so I had good time in here try cheese toppoki rly good and kimbap is amazing!!!! Trust me rly good fr

I really love the quality of food here, they are very delicious, fast service and very kind, and it feels like I’m almost in Korea. Korean Sausage and spicy rice cake (Topokki) are my favorite Korean food but I couldn't find anywhere around here that has the good taste and quality I wanted. Now I found a place in Irvine!! I feel so lucky. I usually get Korean Sausage and Topokki but yesterday I tried different menus from there, which were Kimbap, Rose Topokki and a  Fish Cake Udon.

OMG! My friend and I were amazed. First time trying out Rose Topokki. I loved the vienna sausages with cheese in there that really rich the taste of the Topokki and for some reason the taste was less spicy than others but more rich and creamy.
Fish Cake Udon was a kick for us ~ wow~~ you must try this. It doesn’t taste like any other regular udons out there. It is a really good combination with Kimbap and Topokki.
Just LOVE LOVE LOVE their food!

Sometimes I get a little hesitant when I try new menus but I was so glad I did. Known for the Best place for Korean sausage and Toppokki. I strongly recommend you try these two first then try other menus from Jopok, you’ll be glad you try different menus from there, too.

name: Gulliver's Restaurant
address: 18482 MacArthur Blvd, Irvine, CA 92612, USA
reviews: First time here and really was hoping to get a prime rib plate described by others, however, this was not my day. Came for lunch prime rib, sides and check out the interior. The cut was in the thin side, not nearly as tender and flavorful as expected. The sauce helped with that, but it being cooked or served more medium didn’t help. Now, it wasn’t busy when we got there (see photo), around 12:30. Seemed like only one server in the main room. It’s always possible the steak was at medium rare when cut and plated, but, if the waitress is busy with other tables/duties, the steak continues to cook. The German potato salad was ok, nothing stood out. The broccoli was what it was. The atmosphere was old world, but seemed goofy to some degree. Service was very good and she was tipped accordingly.  I won’t be visiting again, but we have it a shot.

Amazing food and service.  Been here a few times and every time it was great. Host and waiters are super friendly and nice and the vibe in the restaurant is chill and casual. The food is massive. The entrees are giant plates.  Appetizers are delicious. The crab cakes are amazing. The prime ribs is delicious and the duck was amazing. The cream corn is delicious and horseradish with the prime rib was perfect.

Love this place! Will def be back soon!!

Recently visited this place and had a really good experience there celebrating my relative's b-day. The restaurant is very beautiful inside, the service was fast and friendly. The food was delicious and the portions were very generous. I shared the chicken with my kid and we still had leftovers. I also tried the other food that my relatives offered and it was good (especially ribeye steak and duck). Only mashed potatoes had some pieces and were not creamy but the rest of the food was good and not overpriced. Paid 652$ including tax and recommended tip for 8 people (3 appetizers, 8 main courses, no dessert) including 2 bottles of wine and 1 alcohol cocktail and everyone had boxes full of leftovers. Thank you.

Old school English fare with a focus on Prime Rib. In its hey day (the 70's to the 90's) Gulliver's was packed most every night. Not so much now. That said, our waitress was very kind and accommodating.  The standout meal for me was the duck. It really over delivered.  Side note: We dined with a couple that has been coming here every year since the late 70's to celebrate their anniversary!
Reasonable price and taste. Recommend grilled steak than prime rib.

name: Oliver's Trattoria
address: 6511 Quail Hill Pkwy, Irvine, CA 92603, USA
reviews: Very fancy place good for dates, I think it's a bit pricey for the types of pastas being made, but that might just be a me thing. Pizzas were of a more reasonable price. Went with a large group and got to see a variety of dishes. I will say the bread and olive tapanade were delicious.

As of end of April 2024 I heard that this restaurant opened four months ago. For the residents of Shady Canyon, this is great because it adds a nice Italian restaurant with great ambience nearby. The food is good. I like the soup enough that I would order it again. Since we are about 20 minutes away, we probably won’t come here again. Though we will drive further than that for great Italian food. Just saying. Nothing wrong with this restaurant and I wish them the best.

So many choices I will need to come back many times. Staff are super attentive and our waiter was a gem. We dined as a party of ten and service was smooth as silk.

One of the specials was wild boar ragu over tagliatelle. I loved it. My wife went with the lasagna and it was a meaty joy with Bechamel as is the standard in Europe. For dessert we went with the classic tiramisu.

Our other guests also enjoyed their meals.

I  ready to go back tomorrow.

Nice place, polite staff.
Service was mediocre.
Waiter, while very nice, polite but between accent and somewhere around Mach 1 or maybe even Warp drive speed of speaking I have no idea at all what the specials were or what the Pizza he was custom making.
Salad, beautiful presentation and tasted, well not sure. It had so much salt it was almost inedible. I didn't bother to finish. That was more salt than any human should consume in a week, maybe more.
Pizza, best thin crispy crust I've had since leaving NY. 40 years ago. Toppings, were a joke, 1 token Artichoke, 5 mushrooms and 3 or 4 blobs of cheese. The rest was just tomato sauce. Tasty sauce though.
Mains,
I had the Lamb Chops. 5 on the plate. 2 were so well done that they were just gray and hard. 1 solid Medium-well. Flavor just okay. Nothing to brag about.
Vegetables,  carrots, and Broccoli. Both were seasoned and warm but not cooked.  I had to use my meat knife to cut the carrot, and the only edible part of the Broccoli was the very tip of the crown/flower. Very disappointing.
Wife had the fish, SeaBass and she said it was excellent.
Desert, I don't know. I asked twice but never got a menu. Waiter never came back to the table. 20 mins.
Server brought a vanilla Ice Cream with candle for my wife's Birthday. Asked for Waiter 3 times so she could order a Espresso Martini but no luck. I got up, went to the Waiter at the register and ask him for an Espresso Martini for my wife and the desert menu but quite honestly I was done at that point. I just wanted to leave.
Such a shame because we ate at their other restaurant in Laguna Beach and it was amazing. We were very excited about going to the new location but a major let down. I think they have only been open a few months so maybe there still working thing out. I'll give it another try in a few months but for now I can't give a very good recommendation. Sorry. I mean at almost $100 per person I expect at least 3-star service and quality.
Update 5/27
As to make my point, manager/owner doesn't seem to care what people think. No response to my review? Clearly they know they have a problem and are shy to reply. Never written a review with detail and pictures with no response. To good or bad review. Some have changed my mind and after returning changed my review.
Oh well, other restaurants to visit all over the O.C.

Took Mom to dinner at @oliverstrattoria in Irvine tonight. Oh my…sorry not sorry no pictures of dinner it was so so good. The gnocchi was beyond excellent so pillow soft and delicious. And this…this is orange egg custard with berries. Talk about heaven! Ambiance was wonderful, the staff was welcoming and attentive….a definite go to for delicious Italian food to splurge on!

name: Eureka!
address: 4143 Campus Dr, Irvine, CA 92612, USA
reviews: So I’m going to this place multiple times usually just to have a beer or a drink and the service is always pretty good because there’s no one really there when I come for lunch but this time I decided to try their burger and fries because every time I’m there for a drink and food always comes out and looks amazing so I went and ordered the burger the server suggested and it was amazing. Sorry I cannot remember the name of the burger and the fries were on point as well. Definitely will go back for a burger. Yes the burger and five combo is $18 but it’s very good.
Definitely cool spot to have some drinks and enjoy with the group of friends! Mac & cheese balls are amazing and the variety of cocktails available.

I love this place, the ambience is amazing! But it honestly comes down to the service and the food.
The food had so much flavor I didn't want to stop eating it. Their truffle fries are one of my favorite things to eat, full of flavor and yumminess. Went with my sister and my daughter, and the bartender was so attentive. Even though he was training someone, he never missed a beat. He made us laugh and was very sweet, we had good conversations. He is single, attractive and a Christian man. In case any woman is interested.  Everything was awesome. A definite place to go and eat. Download the app and you get $10 off your first bill..

we had visited for a late lunch / early dinner on a saturday and were lucky that the restaurant wasn't that busy during our visit. we ordered the truffle fries and they were cooked perfectly and tasted so good especially with the dipping sauce. i ordered the "cowboy" burger and all the ingredients were evenly proportioned so it wasn't too highly stacked or too much of one ingredient. their beer list was also pretty good and we tried a few as well while we ate. i will also confirm that they do have an outside patio area with what looked like a fireplace or a fire pit. there is also plenty of parking due to the shopping center with plenty of other stores that it is attached to.

I visited the place with my work interns for lunch (party of 3). I had the Smash Burger, it was delicious. What I missed in the burger was caramelized onions and a little zing to taste. Maybe next time I should customize and ask for that. The sweet potato fries could be better, crispier. Mac N Cheeze Balls were phenomenal. Never had them before and they were excellent!

name: Paul Martin’s American Grill
address: 534 Spectrum Center Dr, Irvine, CA 92618, USA
reviews: We came here for the first time with a group of about ten people and I would say everyone had a great time. It wasn't very busy on a weekday afternoon so service was very personal feeling and the atmosphere was great. Additionally, the food was better than we anticipated, especially for what I would consider very fair prices. I got the classic burger and it was very good. I'd say that this was one of the few chain style restaurants I've been to where the burger came out cooked to the perfect medium I requested. I'd highly recommend this place to anyone.

Had the most amazing dinner here last week! The drink & wine list was perfect & all of our food was delicious! Service was wonderful and I think the highlights were the ribeye, salt & pepper shrimp and deviled eggs! Will definitely be back again soon!

Our recent visit to Paul Martin's in Irvine exceeded all expectations, thanks to their outstanding service. Initially faced with a last-minute change in plans, the staff seamlessly accommodated our large group, ensuring a smooth and enjoyable celebration.

From the moment we arrived, the team greeted us warmly and provided attentive service throughout the evening. Despite the unexpected circumstances, their professionalism and dedication made our night unforgettable.

Their thoughtful gestures and attention to detail, especially for the birthday celebration, added an extra layer of joy to our experience. Overall, the exceptional service at Paul Martin's turned what could have been a stressful situation into a memorable celebration. We can't wait to return for more remarkable experiences.

On a side note, the biscuits were perfect but the recipe for the butter cake changed a bit. It needed just a tad of salt. Have you had it before? 😋

Celebrating a milestone anniversary with a large group. Service (impatient young man) was initially horrible until we spoke with the manager and requested a new server. The new server (young lady) was more efficient and pleasant.
Great location while staying at the nearby hotel. The food was good (be sure to ask for fresh biscuits - ours were stale and tasted reheated in the microwave), but to be called seafood pasta, there should be more than shrimp in the dish. The braised short ribs were tough/chewy. The portions are very small for the pricing.
The experience was a little choppy. I wished it was a lot smoother. Thank you to the manager on duty on Saturday, February 24th, at 6 pm for trying.

We went to the Bourbon Tasting event last night and it was terrific!  The cocktails, food and service were all great and honestly the value was amazing.  Each cocktail featured a different bourbon (Basil Hayden, Maker's Mark and Knob Creek) and as you'd expect from Paul Martin's they were great, well balanced and delicious.  The food pairings were excellent - each with an interesting twist like the wonderful burrata salad with fried green... tomatillos!  So good!  The chef and the bourbon rep both gave interesting info on the food and drink, but didn't interrupt the flow of the evening.  Very enjoyable - we look forward to the next event!

name: Baekjeong Irvine
address: 14160 Culver Dr, Irvine, CA 92604, USA
reviews:
This place is the bomb! The food is delicious, we ordered 2 briskets, short rib and the flank stake.
The brisket is the best one, super thin cut, it melts in your mouth. The short rib is very good but you need to cut so it is not so chewy. The flank is tasty too.
We had the light beer and it was cold. Bottles are 500 ml.
All the staff is super nice, Frank was our chef and he made sure to cook our meats to our taste, we like it mooing LOL
Beautiful place and welcoming. Not a lot of place for waiting for your table.
This was our second time and we will be back.

Baekjeong Irvine offers an intriguing and immersive Korean BBQ experience that truly stands out. From the moment we entered, we were captivated by the interactive dining concept, where the server expertly grilled the meat right at our table, adding an extra layer of enjoyment to the meal.

One of the highlights of our visit was undoubtedly the outstanding quality of the food. Each cut of meat was impeccably fresh and flavorful, ensuring a memorable dining experience. Additionally, we were pleasantly surprised by the selection of IPA beer available, which complemented the meal perfectly.

The cleanliness of the restaurant was commendable, and the overall pricing was fair considering the high quality of the food and service. The atmosphere was lively and friendly, contributing to a welcoming dining environment.

However, our experience was not without its drawbacks. Visiting on a Saturday noon, we were disappointed to find that there was no bartender available until 5 pm, limiting our drink options. Furthermore, the wait time to be seated was longer than expected, which detracted from the overall experience.
In conclusion, Baekjeong Irvine offers an authentic Korean BBQ experience with exceptional food quality. While there were some minor issues with service availability and wait times, the overall dining experience was enjoyable and memorable.

I would recommend this establishment to anyone looking for a unique and delicious dining experience in Irvine.

I want to give Angie a big thumbs up! She always works efficiently, and the meat she grills is cooked to perfection. The first time I came here, she served us, and today I met her again, which made me very happy. She even greeted us warmly. Angie is truly an organized and meticulous person, and her service always makes us feel warm and delighted!

Every visit to LA/Irvine can’t be complete unless my family visits this Korean BBQ place.
We always get Beef Combo and then order more meat. Servers are always attentive to our needs and the food is excellent. Complimentary steamed eggs and corn with cheese are added plus. Soy bean soup that comes with the beef combo is a must. You can choose from soy bean soup or kimchi stew. Irvine location also has a bar where you can hangout while you wait for your table.

Came before the rush at about 4:30PM and got seated immediately and ordered the Beef S combo! Beef Brisket, Beef Shortrib (or Rib Eye), and Marinated Beef Short Rib w/ so much banchan (side dishes). It also comes with a Kimchi or Soybean paste soup. We ordered the steamed egg into the side of the grill and it was delicious. Service was really good, your host serves and cooks the meats for you. They were really attentive and nice. I came for an early birthday dinner and they were pretty engaging about it.

The meat and banchan were high quality and tasted good and fresh! The kimchi soup was kind of concentrated and spicy, I think I would order the Soybean paste soup next time. We ordered Japchae at the end and the serving size is worth how much it costs. It’s a huge plate. Great experience, would come again!

name: Maldon’s Bistro
address: 2010 Main St Suite 180, Irvine, CA 92614, USA
reviews: Driving home from San Diego to LA, we stopped for a Tesla charge and discovered this AMAZING cafe! We popped in right at closing time and were treated to the kindest, most considerate service I've ever had!! Beautiful cafe, lovely ambiance, the best of folks own and operate this treasure. Let's not forget about their perfect latte - smooth, full bodied without any bitterness or burnt taste. Absolutely perfect! If you're in the neighborhood, you won't regret stopping in and, I can pretty much guarantee, this will be your new go to. I can promise that we'll be stopping in on our next trip down south 💖

It turns out this is a very popular spot for treating yourself to a delicious weekend breakfast. There's parking nearby, and the café offers validation if you stay for no more than 120 minutes.

When we arrived, they asked if we had a reservation. Regardless, we didn't have to wait long, and we found seats easily. However, there was a large line of people afterward, so it's best to make a reservation in advance.

The menu features omelets, sandwiches, sweet and savory pancakes, and beverages. The pancake with Nutella and their jam absolutely won me over. I highly recommend this place.

One thing to note: be attentive when placing your order because, due to the high volume of customers, they sometimes make mistakes or forget some dishes.

There are seating options both outside and inside. The café is located in a lovely area, with beautiful buildings, a fountain, and plenty of places to sit and relax.

Delicious gluten free options! I came on a weekday after a lunch rush and the service was a little slow but I will absolutely be returning. The food is so great and I’m so happy to have found a delicious gluten free restaurant like this! Having Celiac in Orange County is tough because there aren’t a lot of great safe options

Staff here was so helpful and outgoing. I think we met just about every one of them. Practically everything here is gluten free and there's so many amazing sounding dishes it was hard to choose. Per our waiters recommendation I got the BLT and the short rib sandwich on gf sourdough (I know!). They were both impeccable. They cure their own bacon and it's a thick cut that's crunchy, but also melts in your mouth. They also have 3 gf beers on draft that is local, Divine Science, and my family that was with me said you couldn't tell it was gf. All of us (gf and non-gf) wish we had this restaurant back home and plan on trying to stop back here in our way to the airport. There is such attention to detail here from the food down to the spoon for the tea. It's impressive. Great ambiance and food!

Amazing food and adorable place! Good variety of options, and where all delicious. Friendly staff and owner. I personally like my soup really hot, and mine was more warm than hot. So only advice would be to request yours hot if that's what you prefer!

name: Javier's Restaurant - Irvine
address: 536 Spectrum Center Dr, Irvine, CA 92618, USA
reviews: Location is designed well. Great experience. Food was ok. Good presentation, not overly flavorful for the price. But, I think most will overlook as it's a fantastic place to be in. Good staff even if they disappear for too long of a stretch. Location is clean and very good area to relax before or after the meal. I would come back.

Cool atmosphere, tasty food, friendly and knowledgeable wait staff. If you like tequila they have a great and unique selection. We had the octopus ceviche - highly recommend giving it a try! Great heat from habanero peppers 🌶️

Just be expected to pay higher prices due to the area - fancy 🤣 E.g I had a $25 margarita - delicious for sure, but personally a bit pricey.

All in all, a very nice spot! Definitely worth checking out.

We recently celebrated my lovely wife’s birthday at Javier’s, which used to be one of her favorite restaurants. Our evening started off at the Newport Beach location, but it was incredibly crowded. When I asked the front desk for a nice table with a view, we were rudely told that it could take up to two hours to get what we wanted. This lack of customer service was disappointing, so we decided to try our luck at the Irvine location instead.

The Irvine location was much better in terms of service. Check-in was smooth, and we were seated without any waiting time. The ambiance was pleasant, which set a nice tone for the evening. We ordered some drinks and guacamole for an appetizer. For the main entrees, my wife chose her favorite steak Picado, and I opted for the enchiladas de Mariscos.

While the chips and salsa were complimentary, and we appreciated the free flan for my wife’s birthday, the overall dining experience was underwhelming. The portions were small relative to the high prices, which didn’t seem justified. My seafood entree was overly salty and unenjoyable, which was quite disappointing for a place that prides itself on fine dining.

For dessert, we ordered a tres leches cake in addition to the complimentary flan. Both desserts were decent, but not enough to elevate the overall dining experience. The check came to nearly $300 for four people, which seemed excessive given the quality and portion sizes of the food.

In summary, while Javier’s offers a nice ambiance, the food and service at the Newport Beach location left much to be desired. The Irvine location was better in terms of service but still did not meet our expectations for the price. Unfortunately, Javier’s is no longer a highly recommended place on our list. We were left feeling that we were paying more for the experience rather than the quality of the food.

I went during opening and the patio setting was a beautiful atmosphere. It did get a little loud towards the end when more people were getting seated. The staff were very attentive. I recommend the skirt steak because it just melts in your mouth along with the guacamole. The guacamole is $18, but I honestly think it's an experience everyone needs to eat because it's the best guacamole I've ever had. Our server's name was Gabriel and he gave excellent service

Located inside the Irvine spectrum, Javier's is an upscale restaurant and bar that has always been fun, elegant, modern, with a splash of "hipness"
The decor is completely nice and intriguing.  The food is excellent,  but a but pricy, however,  the drinks 🍸 will completely satisfy your taste buds.
Now, I would have given this location a 4.5
But my visit only earned it a 3.5 to 3.75.
One, the reception area was courteous but not attentive
I felt that we were just numbers to them, and waiting 45 min to be seated at around 930pm and after seemed a bit long.
Second,  I felt that walking through the prep area/ kitchen to be seated was not very professional. However, the layout didn't allow for other paths.
Lastly, our server , as nice as she was, seemed a bit distracted, and we felt our service was impersonal .

The location is superb for first dates , excellent for get togethers.

name: Wood Ranch
address: 501 Spectrum Center Dr Suite 501, Irvine, CA 92618, USA
reviews: They have great salads and their Tri tip is excellent.  I also enjoy their salmon dinner and their vegetarian burger is excellent too.  The Western Tri Tip Sandwich is fantastic.  They have a really nice atmosphere, very cozy feel.  They also have a complete bar with a great mixed drinks menu.  They do a mean Martini. The bar is a great place to sit if you are alone and have a cocktail with a great steak or the salmon.  I went there the other day and had a martini with the salmon dinner at the bar. Was a perfect way to unwind from work.  People are really friendly and the wait help is very attentive to your needs.  Lots of business staff frequent this place after work for a good meal so you know it is good.

Hi guys today while driving around town and doing some shopping with the family, we stumbled upon the best steakhouse called Wood Ranch Restaurant. The meal was absolutely amazing - I believe we tried everything on the menu and had no complaints. They also had a great selection of cold beers. I must say, the staff was top-notch. I have to give a shoutout to Joseph, who was our waiter, and Jacob, the manager. Both of them were really great people. This location definitely has my seal of approval.

Solid BBQ options. Decent drinks menu. Great vibe and indoor seating. Would eat here again. It's hard to choose where to eat at the Irvine spectrum, this place is definitely good. Staff was attentive and food came out quick. Appetizers were pretty standard.

What out to celebrate our anniversary. Wow did we pick the right place. Amazing service, our waitress Hailey was super friendly, so bubbly, great energy, food was delicious. Fantastic day thank you for the beautiful anniversary sunday ice cream Hailey.

Wood Ranch is a top restaurant for my friends and I when we are looking to end the week with a solid dinner and drinks. The Irvine spectrum location takes a little more effort to get to, but it’s well worth it in the end. If I’m there for happy hour, I’ll get there, killer wings, a couple, Stella’s, and a side; usually mac n cheese or fries w Ranch. If I’m getting a meal, I will either get the pulled pork, brisket, or half chicken. They have plenty of sides to choose from, and all of them are great. I know they have a happy hour from 3PM-6PM Monday-Friday. If you go on a weekend or Friday night there may be a long wait. For the most part we usually get seated right away.

name: The Kickin' Crab
address: 2740 Alton Pkwy, Irvine, CA 92606, USA
reviews: This place was great! All the workers are super attentive, we were just stopping by for some te lunch, never been here before, but we go to crab boil places a lot in San Diego. Here was super nice, and clean. All the workers check up on us. Alittle pricey compared to other places but I think it’s worth it! This place is also great because it’s not really loud either.

No marinate , tons of empty shells , sure just dumped it in the bag , no taste or flavor whatsoever.

You wanna be a copycat but you’re at least 2000 miles from the original boiling crab quality! Need a lot of improvements.

The menu features an array of sides such as corn on the cob, Cajun fries, and garlic noodles, which complement the main dishes perfectly. The portions are generous, making it a great place for sharing and enjoying a communal meal with friends or family.

The service at Kicking Crab is friendly and attentive, ensuring that diners have everything they need to fully enjoy their meal. Whether you’re a seafood aficionado or just looking to try something new, Kicking Crab at Jamboree in Irvine offers a memorable dining experience with its vibrant atmosphere and mouthwatering dishes.

We ordered the combo #3 last night for dinner and it wasn't great. The shrimp and mussels texture were very bad. We got takeout and were told that the food will be prepared in about 15 minutes, but the food was ready in 6. We were there at 8:05 pm and received the food at 8:12 pm. Seafood should be made fresh and it unfortunately it wasn't. When we got home and was in the process of eating our dinner, the shrimp meat was almost like paste. They were not cleaned and the mussels would almost disintegrate, they fell apart. It was very unfortunate because the dinner was supposed to be for my son's birthday. All I ask for in the future is that we get the food we actually paid for, fresh and worth the $125 plus tip- because it's really unfair for the customer. These pictures are from last night.

I love me some shrimp boil. But in my experience, my recent order was poorly made. The shrimp wasn’t not well cooked, it def still needed some time to cook. Also the corn was over cooked! It did not have a nice crunch as if the corn had been reboiled. Lastly, they have been very stingy with the sauce. It’s less and less in the bad every time! Disappointed.

name: 90 Pacifica Restaurant & Bar
address: 90 Pacifica, Irvine, CA 92618, USA
reviews: Deanne and Jose were fabulous servers. The quiet atmosphere was so nice and refreshing. Happy Hour was great, the food and drinks were a great deal kand we really enjoyed ourselves. The food was good and we will definitely come back to try other options!
Staff is very rude once they know your food is included with your room. They will not even offer you water. If you are paying out of pocket you get a different treatment. I captured it on video 😅.
The fish tacos were tasty along with the mango salsa which was fresh.  The taco shells were covered with fried cheese on the outside which was a nice touch, and the fish was blackened cod.

I can't give 5 stars because some of the food was only okay (the Macadamia Ahi, and cheesecake),  despite kinda high prices of $20-$35 for entrees. But the sliders, club sandwich, and the guava sorbet were absolutely worth the trip!!

And best of all, our server Deanne provided easily the kindest and most superb service I've had in the last 20 years! I'd never even heard of this restaurant before happening upon it via Google "nearby", and yet it felt like going to an old high school friend's house for dinner! I will definitely be coming back!

Overall, an incredibly relaxed and low-key restaurant that doesn't try to be anything wacky to stay interesting. Just "simple" food done extremely well, with by far the nicest staff you could possibly meet late at night on a weekend!

While I didn't make it to this restaurant, I did stay at the Doubletree and it was a very good Hilton. Rooms are comfortable and service is excellent! Make sure you get the warm chocolate chip cookies!! We did get room service and the food was very good. Thus hotel is in a great location making it easy to get around the area.

name: Brio Italian Grille
address: 774 Spectrum Center Dr, Irvine, CA 92618, USA
reviews:
We had the pleasure of dining at Brio Tuscan Grille in Irvine on a Sunday evening as a large party, and it was great from start to finish! The staff went out of their way to accommodate all 15 of us, ensuring that we were comfortable and well taken care of. The ambiance of the restaurant is fantastic – it's a beautiful space with an, inviting atmosphere.

The food was delicious, and the service was amazing. Every member of our group loved their meal and drinks. Although we didn't visit the bar area, it looked GREAT from where we were seated. Another highlight is the super convenient location, right next to the parking lot, making it easy for everyone to get there.

Overall, Brio Tuscan Grille exceeded was great! and we will definitely be returning.

A very nice Italian restaurant in the Irvine Spectrum mall. We went last week to celebrate one of our friend's wedding anniversary. The ambience is really nice and up class. The staff is also very friendly and helpful.

The food has some scope of improvement. We ordered a few dishes; appetizers and main course. The pastas lacked salt. The pizza was too watery due to large tomato slices. The gnocchi and mushroom ravioli were good. Will surely try again.
Went with a large group and service and food were amazing. Good selection of wines and nice desserts, including chocolate.

Had a great experience here! Went for a quick bite and a drink before a movie. Our server Robert was fantastic and friendly. Food was magnificent and the Peroni was cold. Ordered the shrimp and eggplant appetizer which was to die for; the sauce alone on it was perfect with the warm bread served. Prices were fair and the staff friendly. Check this place out for a quick bite at the bar! UPDATE: a few months have gone by and went back to have the shrimp and eggplant appetizer once more. Still easily the best item on the menu and the staff at the bare are phenomenal!

- Expect to spend $30-40 per person
- Reservations are accepted online

We came in around 9 pm so we were a little rushed, but that's understandable because the restaurant was closing soon. Food was good, though be mindful that it can be quite heavy if you order something with a lot of cheese/sauce (as you'd expect with Italian food). We came here for an anniversary celebration but they didn't have that option on the online reservation form, so we chose "Birthday". We weren't offered dessert, which was a little surprising given our selection but understandable because we came in close to Brio's closing hours (on time for our reservation, however). Attached are a few pictures of our food.

Enjoy!

name: Irvine Breakfast Club
address: 216 Technology Dr # B, Irvine, CA 92618, USA
reviews:
Very friendly staff and kind about my kid’s menu requests. Such a delicious breakfast we added a sandwich to go for later.

Good to be aware that they aren’t in a space with a custom restroom.
Fresh and delicious ingredients, incredible customer service. Very fast and easy parking. Had the pastrami sandwich and hazelnut coffee, both were amazing! Highly recommended

THE BEST SANDWICHES WE EVER HAD IN THE STATES

It is our first time writing a review because the foods were so incredibly good.

And the service was nice too.

If you want sandwiches but not sure where to get, this is the place.
First time here earlier. Food was great and is value for money. Owner was very friendly and hospitable.

I've been going to this place since I moved to Irvine in 2021 and it was a simple sandwich shop run by two wonderful older Korean ladies. Delicious food and it made you happy just to see them. When it sold a couple months back I was sad but am happy to say this place is alive and thriving still!!! A very kind man named Mark took it over and has put a breakfast twist to the original concept which is really great. He puts the same care into making excellent quality and delicious food and is just as kind and service minded. Try the breakfast burrito, it is delicious!

name: Irvine Grill
address: 6507 Quail Hill Pkwy, Irvine, CA 92603, USA
reviews: Great place to have sumptuous Mediterranean food. All the ingredients were fresh and delicious. We ordered hummus, bread basket, chicken koobideh, veggie one which came with saffron flavored rice, salad and grilled chicken or grilled veggies on side. It portrayed classic ambiance with both indoor and outdoor seating options. Plenty of parking around. The vegetarian options are limited.  Would totally recommend it. Will come back again

I recently dined at a five-star restaurant renowned for its exquisite kabobs and was absolutely delighted by the experience. The kabobs were perfectly seasoned and grilled to juicy perfection, complemented by fluffy, aromatic rice that was a dish on its own. The standout, however, was the lunch special, priced at an unbeatable $13, which is a steal for the quality and ambiance provided. This restaurant offers not just a meal but a culinary journey that’s both satisfying and surprisingly affordable. Whether you’re a fan of tender, flavorful meats or well-crafted side dishes, this establishment exceeds expectations and leaves you planning your next visit.

Overall, I had a positive experience — good prices $$, fast and professional. We visited on a weekday for lunch, so it wasn’t busy.
The food tasted good, though it was a bit cold and not as fresh as expected. The Beef Koobideh Kabab was average, deserving a 3 out of 5. A nice touch is the option to order a side stew with your kabab plate; the Gheyme was phenomenal in flavor, earning a 5/5, but it was too watery. They offer in-house Dough, which was not outstanding.
The outdoor seating area is great, and there is plenty of shared public parking available.
Overall, this Persian restaurant is 4 stars for its taste and atmosphere, especially considering the reasonable prices$
Recommended for its flavor and ambiance.

Definitely a great lunch special. $13 for a kabob of choice. Plus rice and salad. I ordered the combo with beef and chicken kabobs. Juicy and not dry like a lot I have had.
Would definitely recommend.

Visiting family in OC, with different groups, we had lunch here two days in a row. Having many authentic persian food options in SoCal, I have tried quite a few during the years, but this one is amazingly good. A great variety of options all prepared very well with even in-house baked warm bread. The portions are the largest I have seen served in beautiful plates. The service is very thoughtful, efficient, and friendly. A must try when in town.

name: Heirloom Farmhouse Kitchen
address: 7905 Irvine Center Dr, Irvine, CA 92618, USA
reviews:
I hope I can spare someone their time and money with this review. We were shockingly disappointed by this restaurant. It took 90 minutes to get our food, and the food quality was worse than what you’d expect from bad room service. Caesar salad was iceberg lettuce, no dressing, and croutons (see photo). Pizza looked like pizza from a room service kids menu (see photo). The steak was about 2oz (not even close to an entree portion with an entree portion price tag).

This is marketed as a farm to table restaurant but it most assuredly is not - and trust us, it is not worth your time. We highly recommend going to a restaurant at the Irvine Spectrum and avoiding this establishment.

We had lunch here during our stay at the Marriott. Very fresh and tasty dishes! Our waitress was very nice. Nice wine and cocktail list. We split the Cobb Salad and Seafood Tacos. They have a great espresso martini.

I’ve had the pleasure of dining twice in this restaurant. The first time as hotel guests, we had to wait a long time to get dessert. It felt like the kitchen had to procure the fruit and ice cream first.  Our second visit, we were part of a tasting party for a future event. The appetizers were delicious, the cocktails were light and refreshing. The beef dishes were both well executed and flavorful. The sea bass was respectable but I did not like the rice and corn risotto that came with it. The roasted cauliflower was surprisingly satisfying even for a non vegetarian like me.
The chef heard our input and appropriate accommodations will be made.

I splurged and took myself out for a New Year's Eve lunch at Heirloom Farmhouse. It was a rainy day but I got a warm welcome from the bartenders and enjoyed a By the Slice cocktail while I waited for my Ahi Bowl which was so delicious,  I could have eaten two of them! All the components were so fresh and yummy together! Not cheap at $26 but memorable and I would love to return to have it again.  The menu is limited and the restaurant is on the small side but cozy and friendly and they do have outdoor seating for warmer weather!  Disclaimer- I am a Marriott Associate.

Came here twice whilst staying at the hotel and both times, the food was really good. Both the veggie omelette and the breakfast sandwich were delicious. The chicken apple sausage and breakfast potatoes were also really good. Service wasn’t that quick, but the pool views were great. We were sitting outside and the weather was perfect, so there was no rush on our part either.

name: Texas de Brazil - Irvine
address: 13772 Jamboree Rd, Irvine, CA 92602, USA
reviews:
We have celebrated my son’s birthday here and I have been overwhelmed and overjoyed by the quality of this restaurant!!! 7 stars!!! The food is so fresh and delicious and the servers have been so nice and friendly!!! In eight years of US I can tell by far this is the best restaurant I have been to with best service and atmosphere!!
I will return here with joy and I congratulate the owner for such an outstanding team, service and delicious dinner!!
I strongly recommend this place if you want to have the best dinning experience of your life!!!!

Since it was Father's Day, the place was super busy. We had reservations & were seated within mins. of our time. The wait staff was really hustling due to the volume of customers. However, they were attentive & polite even while slammed. He never waited more than a min.or, so when we were ready for more meat, a plate needed refreshed or water was getting low. The meat was not over cooked, was tender  & tasty. The salad bar was amazing.

Great food and service at the Brazilian steakhouse in Irvine,CA. Tried all kinds of flame-grilled meat brought to our table, including Brazilian sausage, sirloin, flank steak, filet mignon, garlic pork, grilled chicken, and lamb rack were seasoned well, juicy, and delicious.

The buffet salad bar (included with dinner) has a wide variety of selection and includes lobster bisque soup.  Fried banana, mashed potatoes, French fries, and Brazilian cheese balls ( bread) were also brought to our table.

Dessert and drinks were not included.

Note: We used several discounted gift cards purchased from Costco and Sam’s club for the dinner. Unfortunately, gift cards cannot be used for the tip.

I was expecting more from this place, we got food poisoning from one of the meats, which got me and my wife sick! we went on May 2024 and it's the last time I'll set foot in this steak house over priced I don't think it's worth it! I've been to better places than this one!

One of our go-to place every special occasion... I always request the prime rib, fall-out the bone, so tender juicy, melts in your mouth. For me, you can't go wrong. If you you like meat or steak just like I do, just buy that Texas de Brazil gift card  worth $200 for $150 @ Costco. I hope this helps you. Enjoy!

name: Stonefire Grill
address: 3966 Barranca Pkwy, Irvine, CA 92606, USA
reviews:
Overall our family rated this place 6.5 out of 10. Here’s a brief summary.
Service- Great! Everyone was helpful and kind.
Atmosphere- It gives cafeteria vibes. You go in and order your food with a cashier. Once you order, you find a seat and your food is delivered to your table. You fill up your own drink,  grab the  plates, napkins, utensils for yourself as well.
Food- Nothing special. The chicken was seasoned but the skin felt a little rubbery. The Tips were a bit better, but the salmon was the best of all the protein we ordered. The beans are definitely Cowboy style, meaning tastes like chili and we were hoping for a true baked bean. Wish that would be added to their description. Finally, We’d recommend to totally avoid the carrot cake. Either someone forgot what carrot cake is supposed to taste like or someone forgot to add the appropriate ingredients. We each took a bite and tossed the rest.

Stonefire Grill certainly has the potential to be better. This time it was below average, but I gave them 3 stars because it could have been better.

Many reviews talk about the tri tip, so I figured I had to try it. First the good. It was exactly medium-rare, which I had asked for. It was well seasoned so it had good flavor. But it was cold. Not refrigerator cold, but calling it lukewarm would be providing it with more warmth than it actually had. In fact I ended up dipping it in my beans just to give it some semblance of warmth.

With the choice of either salad or several choices of sides, I chose the cowboy beans. When I ask the cashier what kind of beans they were she had to ask a co-worker because she didn't know. Not the actual type of bean mind you, she didn't know they were called cowboy beans. The beans were quite tasty, seasoned well with bits of onion and possibly tri-tip amongst the beans.

The meal was accompanied by two rather doughy breadsticks. Though I might be biased because my boys prepared some fresh breadsticks at home just a couple days ago. Oh, and I also had a beer.

I'd really like to give them another try, but paying 23 bucks for poor service and ill prepared food is a bit of a stretch. Especially when it's essentially served in a fast food environment.

StoneFire grill is so amazing. All of the food is based on a family recipe. This family recipe is too good. Anyone who comes here knows it.

All of the food is freshly made to perfection. It's fresh and made to perfection. It's fresh. Cooked very well. The restaurant is very clean, very welcoming, and staff is very friendly. The service is warm and treat you right away like a family. The prices are so affordable.

We love it because the portions are Soo huge and even though it's just for the 3 of us it's always great for some leftover.  You can dine in or eat outside at the patio.

No wait time. The menu at StoneFire grill has a lot of options to grill from salad, pizza, tri-tip, chicken, and Soo many appetizers. So many good items to list.

What we ordered
- Kids pasta butter and cheese. Oranges.
- family portion for 3-4. Baked chicken (oil, lemon, garlic) tri-tip, StoneFire chopped salads (tri-tip), breadsticks.
- pizza
- tried the spinach artichoke dip. Amazing.

We've been coming for a while now. The manager and staff are so kind and very understanding. We will definitely come back here again and again. Thank you for having us.

The food here is fantastic, with great service and amazing prices to match. Despite my initial expectation of full table service, I wasn't disappointed; you simply place your order at the register, and they bring the food and drinks to your table. They provide plenty of sauce on the side and actual cutlery, enhancing the dining experience. Additionally, they even bring a cold glass for your beer, adding to the overall satisfaction of the visit.

My first time to Stonefire Grill. It was a pleasant surprise. Iike the style. The tri-tip steak was good. Bbq sauce was good. The mashed potato is extremely tasty. I was impressed with the quality customer service of Mr. Maddox; he is very curtious

name: Katsu Bar
address: 15333 Culver Dr #430, Irvine, CA 92604, USA
reviews: The place is super clean. There was only 1 cashier but she was super organized and friendly. The food was very well presented and tasted good but the meat quality is comparable to fast food. The chicken texture is similar to McDonald’s chicken nuggets but it was still good. You have a choice of pork, chicken or beef hamburger for the katsu. The curry was light and flavorful. We will come back to try their large variety of other menu items.

I stopped by for a quick lunch and was blown away by the options and values this restaurant has to offer. The staff was super friendly and attentive! Noticing it was my first time, they even threw in a free banana milk. I really enjoyed the yubu pocket set. Will definitely be back to try more of their specialties!

Katsubar is a culinary paradise where every dish is a masterpiece. Their curry is a symphony of flavors that takes your taste buds on a delightful journey. The donkatsu is crispy perfection, with tender meat coated in a golden crust. And their sandwiches are a work of art, bursting with fresh ingredients and innovative flavors. With top-notch service and unbeatable quality, Katsubar is a must-visit destination for food lovers everywhere
The food was good and the quality of each dish is excellent! I would definitely visit again :)
Very nice place and good food!!! Also nice staff…Everything perfect!!! Wanna go again!!!

name: Yoo's place
address: 2626 Dupont Dr A-20, Irvine, CA 92612, USA
reviews: Very good food with the perfect portion sizes and reasonable prices for the taste. I live on the east coast where you need to pay for parking for many restaurants but here of course it’s free. And if you don’t find a spot in the parking spots by the restaurant, there’s a parking garage hall a block away. This place was very busy so thankfully we were seated right away. It’s very casual inside but looking around, I could tell it is a local favorite. The flavors were delicious. For me, I ordered the spicy pork bulgogi (pretty much the only dish I order when eating Korean because it’s my absolute favorite and am very critical of) and found it to be perfect. I would certainly go back for more next time I’m in town. My wife had her usual bibimbap (one of her favorites), which she couldn’t finish because there was so much food. My daughter had the galbi and soon tofu combo, which she raved about.

Guys if you haven’t checked out this place yet you’re insane!! The food is a solid, homemade five stars family owned business. And we came here for a first time and they brought us complementary dishes. What an awesome place coming back here for sure.

If you are looking for Korean food, This place is for you!
They have a lot of menu choices, so if you are not sure where to go, just come here. You  will also love all of their side dishes :)
I had Maeun Kalbijjim and Tteokbokki. Their size is really big and my husband I couldn’t even finish them. The kalbi in kalbijjim was SUPER SOFT and I really loved it. The tteokbokki was also amazing, just enough to spicy and the sauce has good richness.
The server was very nice, so if you want to get some recommendations, just ask her! She will gladly give you good options.
It can’t be more authentic than food in Korea.

Got the Naengmyeon (cold noodles) and Dolpan Tuna & Kimchi Rice. I loved the naengmyeon especially. The portions are really big and good for sharing. They have unlimited yummy side dishes such as cucumber salad, kimchi, radish kimchi, fish cake, acorn jelly, etc.
The place is run by Korean ladies who were so cute and sweet💞Would definitely come back again!
Insta: @rach.foodie

Very delicious and authentic Korean food. As a Korean, this place is two thumbs up!! I had Tofu soup and hot stone spicy pork&kimchi and it was better than BCD Tofu. The spicy pork & Kimchi was very tasty and love the smoked taste on the pork. Definitely will go back there with family and friends! So happy to find this place near OC!

name: Puesto Park Place Irvine
address: 3311 Michelson Dr, Irvine, CA 92612, USA
reviews: My dad and I come here every time we visit Southern California. We typically always go right at opening and they are not too busy. Dogs allowed on the patio. The tacos are AMAZING! Best shrimp taco I've ever had. I wish I could get the recipe! Guacamole is good.

I recently visited Puesto, a Mexican restaurant known for its beautiful decor and friendly service. The interior design is stunning, creating a vibrant and inviting atmosphere that truly sets the stage for a memorable dining experience.

🍺Upon arrival, I was warmly greeted by the staff, who remained attentive and pleasant throughout my visit. I started with a michelada, but unfortunately, it didn't quite hit the mark, lacking the distinct flavor one expects from this classic Mexican drink.

🍹 I decided to switch to a mojito, which was an improvement but still fell short of being truly satisfying.

🌮We ordered a variety of tacos and ceviches. The tacos were undeniably delicious, with rich flavors and fresh ingredients.

📌However, I did find them to be a bit overpriced, especially considering that they arrived at our table only lukewarm.

The ceviches were enjoyable, though the long wait time for our food was a notable downside.

Another challenge was the parking situation—it was quite difficult to find a spot nearby. Additionally, the cleanliness of the restrooms left something to be desired, which detracted from the overall experience.

📌In summary, Puesto has a lot of potential with its gorgeous decor and friendly staff, but there are areas that need improvement, such as food temperature, drink quality, and overall service speed.

Ratings:

Service: 3/5
Atmosphere: 4/5
Food: 3/5

With a few tweaks, Puesto could truly shine. I hope to see these improvements on my next visit.

The food was good, but very pricey. Service was great and we had window seats to see the tortillas being made. Ask about parking validation, it said it was complimentary for two hours and then charged 10.

Taco Tuesday is amazing! My go-to tacos are the filet mignon and shrimp. They're half off on Tuesdays and "Snacks and Shares" are also half off. Our server was Maria and she was incredibly kind and attentive. Definitely coming back soon!

This place is fantastic! Really great upscale Mexican food in Irvine. There are limited vegan options on the menu, but it’s pretty easy to modify the vegetarian dishes to become vegan. My favorite tacos were the mushroom- there’s a stone fruit salsa on them that is SO so good!

name: DonerG Turkish & Mediterranean Grill - Irvine
address: 3800 Barranca Pkwy, Irvine, CA 92606, USA
reviews: This is my first time I tried such a Mediterranean cuisine. In general, food was great. But they didn’t have a doner bomb because they were out of special buns for it. Well, if you have something popular on your menu make sure you don’t break supply chain.

I love DonerG but this specific location is kinda bad.. I ordered doner saltado, the fried egg is still raw, the fries i mean i saw them fried it before serving to me, but it was fried too quick that is still cold in the middle, the rice is overcooked, kinda lost my appetite. For 15$ it should atleast be ok. But this location kinda ruins it. Also ordered beef pita sandwich, and the beef is cold, kinda disappointed i spent 30$ and honestly not worth it.

The food prepared by Pati and Colton was phenomenal. I was hesitant to try this place but the crew welcomed me in and recommended to try the wrap which was delicious. Very professional and kind customer service.
Delicious food! Try a Fladenbrot! It’s a weird name but super tasty BETTER version of a pita bread.
My family and I came to California for vacation from Texas and we decided to eat here and it has one of the best döner

name: Benny and Mary's
address: 18420 Von Karman Ave #100, Irvine, CA 92612, USA
reviews:
It’s strange to have a nice dining establishment in the middle of an office park but it’s Benny and Mary’s. They did an awesome job with the atmosphere with super high ceilings and attention to detail. Only problem is may feel dated in a few years.

The food was excellent. The oysters were decent but not recommended. They have better options. Same with the burger, they have better options unless you have to have a burger. But all other dishes were well prepared, relatively create and very good.  If you have a date you want to impress, I would take her here.

Nothing but an excellent service and exceptional warm Vibes.

Our first time and it will not be the last one. Since this is a first visit, we asked Victoria (one of amazing team) to pick for us. All plates were her choice and I can tell that Victoria NAILED IT!!!

The place has a unique decorative theme that i never seen anywhere else.
There are multiple sections, we sat at the Library theme wall. There was a hidden room behind the books like secret locations but it was for private groups events.
There a  patio and very decorative bar.

Forgot to mention, that when we called the call went to VM due to line been busy. Couple of minutes after we received a call from the restaurant to return our call!!! That was very respectful to me, I really appreciate it.

This is a MUST TRY  experience.

Thank you team.

This is a super cute spot for brunch. The restaurant is clean and staff is helpful and so friendly. We ordered the Benny eggs, green chilaquiles and Açaí waffles. They were all so good and perfectly seasoned. For dessert we ordered the lemon meringue cheesecake which was a little too sweet for our liking. My friend mentioned it to our waitress and she has no problem taking it back and off our check. The staff and beautiful restaurant made it such a pleasant lunch that we will be coming back.

First time here for brunch and not a bad experience. The food was quite good, and they had a great menu of brunch offerings. Enjoyed a mimosa and a michelada with some chilaquiles and chicken and waffles. Everything was very tasty. My only complaint was that the type of beer they used for the michelada was really bitter. Service overall was good, although I think we were helped by around six different people in the time we were there, and we weren't quite sure who our waiter was. Nevertheless everyone was very friendly. A little on the pricey said as most things are these days, just over $100 for two people, but the portions were generous enough.

Our second time at Benny and Mary’s and really enjoyed our food. Service and atmosphere. The menu has changed since April. We ordered the brussel sprouts and the shrimp ceviche for appetizers and just like last time the brussel sprouts is the best I have ever tasted. Very nice and crispy great flavor SNA stehe goat cheese takes it to the next level. The shrimp ceviche was very nice and my wife who is a big fan of ceviches said this was one of the best she has had. For main courses we ordered the bacon cheeseburger 5 stars, the osobuco short ribs 5 star, the salmon was amazing, well cooked and the fried rice and bok Choy accompanying the dish were so flavorful and complimented the salmon so nicely. Best entree from my view. We also got the 18oz ribeye. It was cooked well but I wasn’t crazy about the black garlic butter sauce. I would give the steak a 4 star. The side mushrooms are sweet so a bit different than the side mushrooms that you get at other steakhouses. The restesraunt was bustling on this Saturday night with a private party. Our server was John C, who was awesome.  Very attentive to our needs and knowledgeable about the menu and recommended great cocktails.  I didn’t realize last time that we were here that there is also a speakeasy hidden in the library. I took a picture when a couple entered it. Pretty cool.

name: The Winery Restaurant & Wine Bar
address: 2647 Park Ave, Tustin, CA 92782, USA
reviews: Went for a quick drink and appetizer before a movie. We sat at the bar and enjoyed a glass of wine and charcuterie board. My friend had allergies to gluten and the bartender was accommodating and served us an additional side of cucumbers. Great ambiance. Good quality wine and food. Prices were reasonable. Friendly staff. Parking varies on day and time.

My wife and I had dinner here for the first time. I like the ambient. It's good for private conversation between family. Our waitress was super nice. The entrée was fine, but not as good as I expected. We ordered lamb rack with sautéed mushroom and slow toasted beef shortrib. The waiting time between soup and main courses was a little long. The ribs was really good, juicy, tasty. The lamb was somewhat dry in my opinion. The mushroom was the problem. It was toooooo salty. I drank two and half glasses of water to handle it. Hope it will be better in next time.

I had such a great experience at The Winery Restaurant & Wine Bar! The food was excellent as well as the service. The staff consistently checked in on my group to make sure we were always refreshed with drinks and/or anything we needed. Donnie the manager was always making his rounds to double check on everything and made our experience a one to remember. I’ll definitely refer this place to my family/friends and be back to enjoy it myself.

We went for Thanksgiving and enjoyed the meal thoroughly from the appetizer to the main and the dessert. The salad (without the blue cheese) was excellent, while the short rib was a real standout. Definitely on the pricey side, but really the service was great and the overall hospitality was outstanding.

I had lunch here today and I must say it was a delightful experience. The highlight of my visit was undoubtedly the carne asada tacos. They were absolutely fantastic - the meat was tender, flavorful, and perfectly cooked.  At $20, I think it makes going out for lunch affordable.

The restaurant's decor was also a feast for the eyes. The ambiance was warm and inviting, with a beautiful blend of rustic and modern elements. The music was like lounge R&B at nice volume. I'd make it a bit more global but it wasn't bad.

The staff was attentive and professional. I was told that wine tastings are not available any longer which is disappointing.

I am hoping to come back and taste some of the other dishes. Perhaps during happy hour.

Thank you for your hospitality.

name: A&J Restaurant
address: 14805 Jeffrey Rd, Irvine, CA 92618, USA
reviews:
- Atmosphere is very family friendly (& very clean!)
- Came by Sunday at 2 pm and was seated right away. First time trying Taiwanese food and it was absolutely delicious.
- And it was all reasonably priced! Highly recommend!
Had the following :
4.5⭐️ Spicy Beef Noodle Soup - delicious but it wasn’t spicy at all. For that I take half a Star
5⭐️ Pan fried beef bun - just do it! This was my favorite of all the items.
4⭐️ Vegetarian Delight - this was good and had a really complex flavor profile.
3⭐️ Pickled Cabbage - honestly I think we had cooked cabbage not pickled. It was ok but I wouldn’t get again
4.5 ⭐️ Thousand Layer pancake

Quick service, food was served within 7 minutes and was hot and delicious. I ordered steak with fat noodles and slurped everything down. Not a fancy restaurant, mom and pop feel. Would return for a quick no fuss meal. FYI they don’t serve beer or other alcoholic beverages.
We’ve been going to A&J for years. Most of the dishes I’ve had over the years have flavor. Noodles are made daily! Portions can be bigger, but enough for lunch time.
Beef noodle soup seemed freshly cooked, but should’ve gotten the spicy version as it needed a bit more flavor. Beef roll with chives was ok. Pork over rice was not bad.
Been coming here for 10+ years and the quality has remained top notch. Beef noodles are elite even by Taiwanese standards. Highly recommend the xiao long bao and garlic chili cucumber as well!

name: Nice to Meet You Skewer Hot Pot - Now AYCE
address: 15361 Culver Dr, Irvine, CA 92604, USA
reviews: This hot pot restaurant is very interesting. They use bamboo sticks to skewer the ingredients, which is very unique. We ate a lot. The ingredients are quite rich, including seafood and various types of meat. The all-you-can-eat price includes all the food, so we felt very satisfied and it was worth the money. Also, the dining environment is great.

Ate here 2x before writing this review. This is a skewer hot pot place and there is definitely a learning curve the first time. There were so many selections on skewers that it was difficult to choose. The fridge had several levels that I didn't get a chance to notice them all until my 2nd time around. It's definitely a scavenger hunt each visit.

There are some rare finds here that are generally not offered at other shabu places. Like duck blood, duck feet, bamboo fungus (pith), giant prawns, crab meat, etc. Nice To Meet You have it all in one easy to access fridge.
