We noticed more selections on weekends than weekdays, especially the duck blood. It really fresh and runs out fast.

For the non-spicy people, there are definitely choices here. The broth comes with 2 choices (or you can go with one, same price) and we loved the beef and tomato broth, both are non-spicy. For meat choices we order off the menu AND we get skewered meat. The kids prefer Flat Iron Steak. Ribeye is pretty good too.

Eating with skewers is fun. Definitely an experience. The Brown Sugar Sticky Rice Cake also hits the spot for sweet tooth lovers. Reminds me of the sticky rice cake at Night Markets.

The seats are spacious and can accommodate large parties.

If everyone in your party can eat spicy, then this is definitely a worthy spot to visit. But this is an awesome place for non-spicy people too.

See my pictures for more tips.

The Nice To Meet You Skewer HotPot truly shines with its exceptional hotpot offering. The broth was rich and aromatic, creating a delectable base for cooking the skewers. The balance of spices and seasoning was impeccable, resulting in a truly unforgettable flavor experience. Additionally, the variety of ingredients provided ample options for customization, ensuring each diner's preferences were met. It's evident that great care and attention to detail went into crafting this remarkable hotpot.

We visited Nice to Meet You last Saturday for my boyfriend's birthday. The restaurant is located in a plaza with plenty of parking. Our party had 10 adults and 3 kids. We were greeted by the friendly staffs and got us seated right away. The restaurant was clean and the décor has a hint of traditional Chinese flare mixed with modern feel.

After a quick glance on the menu, we ordered some meat entrees and two flavor soup , one pork and another their signature spicy soup with medium spiciness for the adult and pork soup for the kids. I think split pot options are wondering to have when you have kids.

After ordering, all of us headed to grab some free appetizers and sauce. The selection on the appetizers were impressive. I think there were at least 15 different types of appetizers offered. My only complaints was to wish for a larger plate! Kids of course went straight into the drink stations (non alcoholic) to grab what they desired.  Restaurant also provided their sauce combo recipe for the customers or you can do your own mixology to create that unique sauce for yourself! The salad bar and dessert bar was remarkable. We had to keep reminding the kids to hold their dessert desire till after dinner.

All the meat entrees came right away. I personally love the way beef. But make sure you don't leave in the soup for too long. As soon as the color turned, pick up the wagu and eat it! The skewer selection in the fridge was massive. I was not able tried them all! The large fridge with plates of ingredients was superb! I honestly never had so many fresh hot pot ingredients offered at a restaurant. They even offered abalone, which I love! The shrimp ball is another one of my favorite.

All 13 of us were stuffed with yummy food when we walked out. We are very satisfied with our dining experience. The ingredients were fresh and the service was great. I cannot wait to come back again!

My friend recommended this restaurant to me, since I enjoy hotpot, and yes I have been to this place for so many times.
I'm overjoyed that I no longer have to drive to Rowland Heights to eat skewers hot pot.
My first impression of this place was that the decorations were ancient with Chinese style but modern, and because it was new, everything seemed clean to me.
They have a large fridge with a variety of meats and vegetables to choose from, as well as a sauce bar with a variety of sauces. So far, the salad bar and dessert bar have been excellent.
I chose pork bone soup and mushroom soup, both of which were delicious, especially the pork bone soup. The meats and vegetables were both fresh.
So far, the service on the day I came was good, and they were very friendly. The price is reasonable, Im sure I will be back.
So far, the service has been excellent, and the staff has been extremely nice. The price is reasonable, and I am confident that I will come back many times.

name: BJ's Restaurant & Brewhouse
address: 13130 Jamboree Rd, Irvine, CA 92602, USA
reviews:
Sunday night dinner...
There was the expected wait for a dining room table, but we decided beforehand to eat at the bar. As usual, in almost all establishments, you can walk right in and sit down at the bar in spite of the wait.
It took a little while for Amber to acknowledge us, but found out that she was training a "new guy" and that always screws up the timing. Once greeted, she was pleasant, friendly, helpful, and efficient.
Ordered a couple of Blondes 🍺 for my sister and myself.
Also ordered Avocado 🥑 EggRolls and mac-n-cheese balls to start.
Good stuff!!!
I had the seared ahi salad and sis had the mini BJ pizza. Both tasty and large enough for both of us to take the remainder of each dish home with us.
We ultimately had a pleasant dining experience.
Pricing was reasonable.
Worth your time

I didn't even know this place was here, but I must have been the only one. It was very busy and I can see why. They had great lunch specials and the food came quickly. Also, kids eat free Monday through Thursday! The food was good for lunch and my son enjoyed the marshmallow graham cracker pizookie. Service was exceptional and it was nice and cool inside while it was super hot outside.

Came here eat in and take out many times. It is a good restaurant with standard American food. People are nice and helpful. I think the traditional American food like burger and fries are pretty good. I am sure there are many good dishes but the Cajun dish is kinda disappointing. We ordered this last time to try it out, it was way too salty and doesn't seems like or taste like Cajun food. You would know what I mean if you have tried the authentic Cajun food. But overall it is a good restaurant with nice environment.

One of the best breweries in this area., I like the atmosphere of this restaurant and food is average compared to near by restaurants. I like the beer varieties and it’s the best place for hangout with friends and family
Service is always amazing at this location. Lots of great food and beer options. Don’t skip on the pazookie. Everyone needs a pazookie in their life.

name: Fukada
address: 8683 Irvine Center Dr, Irvine, CA 92618, USA
reviews:
I was recommended my a friend and absolutely love it here! The prices are very reasonable and the food quality and portions are great.

The seafood salad is one of my favorites. Huuuge thick slices of tuna and salmon tataki's with a classic wafu dressing. Their unagi don is awesome too and is such a great combo with the seafood salad. The unagi is cooked to perfection and is very fresh and not super boney. Love the fact that you have the options to choose between white and brown rice!

The tatsuta age (fried chicken) was great as well. Nicely seasoned and juicy!

The udon they use is on the thinner side and I abosolutely loooove it. Super yummy. Also, this isn't pictured but I bought a salmon teriyaki plate to take home and I am obsessed. The salmon was sooo large and thick and the teriyaki sauce was perfect!

It's takeout/eat in service at the moment and I have no complaints! Order first and then grab a table. Quick and easy.

Definitely recommend!!

Counter service. Very good quick donburi, noodles and rolls with authentic Japanese flavors. Dashi/broth is very good. Sushi is not fancy, but is quality ingredients. Service is very thoughtful and they are very quick in preparation. Highly recommended.

$8 Udon in Irvine, heck yes!!!

My husband took me here cause he used to go frequently when he lived in the area.

It was delicious!!

There is plenty of parking, dine in can happen if you are ok with take out bowls and utensils (due to a shortage of employees, they cannot serve anyone like a restaurant), and there is water available.

I ordered the simple udon with tempura flakes that included spinach and it was amazing! The best part was how affordable it was!!

I tried my husband’s warm soba noodle soup and egg and chicken with rice. It was all so good!!

Would definitely come back here and recommend it to many!

It’s just a shame that so much dine in plastic containers are being used and wasted.

Suba was 5/10
Never had worst sushi/rolls so tasteless
Odun was great 8/10
Meckel fish was very dry 5/10

This is one of my longtime favorite restaurants in OC with some of the best Japanese food, but I absolutely cannot stand the current takeout container only service. Not only does it create so much plastic, it pales in comparison to the seated dining prior to the pandemic and dradically decreases the quality of experience here. It's been long enough, PLEASE bring the old dining experience back, what you have now just does not do your delicious food or loyal customers any justice.

name: Zov's Irvine
address: 3915 Portola Pkwy, Irvine, CA 92602, USA
reviews: Five star experience, five star price for good Mediterranean food. Best thing we ordered? The appetizer platter! It fed us till we were almost too full for our entrees! Very pretty place to dine in. Service was also quite excellent. Their great reputation in the OC is well deserved.
First time here and great place but food wasn’t to die for, I would give it a try again with other dishes.

My wife decided  that she would like to eat out late afternoon on Mother's Day. We had celebrated Mother's Day on Saturday instead to avoid the crowd. We were told by Zov's that they could seat my family at the bar at 5:30pm. We got there and to our surprise and delight, they seated my family at a table. (instead of the bar) A moment later, the manager came and explained that they had seated us at a table by mistake. We offered to move to the bar, but was told that because of my children, we could not be seated at the bar. He said they would figure it out and left us at the table. I could see that the restaurant was very crowded with other families celebrating Mother's Day and felt badly, but I appreciated the kind and calm response of the manager. The food was good and the service was great!

My husband, 10-year old son and I love coming to Zovs. It's a neighborhood gem with weekend live music. I love the Moroccan Salmon Salad, so delicious and a good size portion - the salmon sits on the salad with a nice tasty authentic mujadara next to it. Great protein dish. My husband loves the Kebob Two Way and my son orders off the kids menu. We tend to come back for our favorite dishes. The dishes are pricey but the food is delicious so we keep coming back. Sorry but I only have photos of the pretty dessert of the Ridiculous Sundae that Zovs gave me for my birthday. Not only does it look divine but it was yummy! How can it not be delicious, just look at it! I will post photos of our meal the next time. Parking is easy located in at the Orchard Hills Shopping Mall. Love the outdoor dining and live weekend music.

Another location with an incredible atmosphere; I loved the outdoor patio. Both the food and drinks were spot on and packed with flavor. The service was efficient and attentive. I'll definitely come back next time I'm in town!

name: Cha Cha's Latin Kitchen
address: 13126 Jamboree Rd, Irvine, CA 92602, USA
reviews: Honestly was blown away by tacos. They have a different flavor but a very good flavor out of all the tacos I highly recommended the mushroom taco amazing. Honestly hits different very delicious great flavor.

We went to Cha Cha's Latin Kitchen during the OC Restaurant Week. We really liked the green salsa with the chips. The Sopes were flavorful but a little messy and I wish they had a meat option. The Posole had a milder flavor than what i'm use to but was still tasty. We got the Crab and Shrimp Enchiladas and the Salmon. While they were both good, we probably wouldn't get them again. The Flan dessert was super sweet and extra creamy, which I enjoyed.

The atmosphere is lively and the outdoor seating was cozy since they have heaters.
And there's plenty of parking in the plaza.

My bf and I got the ceviche sampler ($16), queso fundido with chorizo ($14), and caldo ($25). Our friend got the salmon. The chips came out first with 3 different salsas. Nothing super unique about the chips. The ceviche was solid. It had a strong flavor. The queso fundido was ok (not as good as the one I had in Mexico obviously). It had too many potatoes, and I didn’t taste any chorizo. It comes with 5 tortillas, so it was surprisingly filling. The caldo had great flavor, and the seafood was tender. Ambiance was nice, and service was good
Great service and good food!  Highly recommended dishes: guacamole, short rib taco, and mushroom taco.

7/3/2024

Had a really good salad and the grilled chicken was delicious. The server was was very friendly and made good recommendations. Great vibe too and everything is clean. Very enjoyable second visit.

Original Post

All the food was really good and the staff was friendly and went above and beyond to make sure my friend in a cast was comfortable. Good food, good friends, good times.

name: NEP Cafe
address: 14346 Culver Dr, Irvine, CA 92604, USA
reviews:
Food portions are really tiny.

Situated in a large strip mall in Irvine, this is a good-sized restaurant.  Food choices are mainly Vietnamese-Chinese fusion.  I didn't particularly find the food really all that creative.    With just a slight variation from what I might find from a better quality local Pho type of restaurant.

I felt as if this restaurant was trying to make it more "upscale" by charging more and serving less.

As for overall atmosphere and cleanliness,  they are doing a good job.

It was worth a visit, but I probably wouldn't come back for lack of value.

The food truly is so delicious and unique enough to impressive my foodie family. However, it is insanely loud inside, makes you feel like you’re at a college dining hall. I would highly recommend booking a table outdoors - it is much quieter and you can actually hear each other speak.

As far as the food, I would highly recommend the beef belly and the beef tongue stew. Both are so unique and amazing.

My colleague and I decided to try a new spot for our weekly lunch and opted for this place, intrigued by its Vietnamese fusion cuisine. Located in Heritage Plaza, it offers ample parking space.

We visited on a Thursday afternoon, and the place was bustling. Despite a short wait, we were promptly seated. To avoid wait times, especially during peak hours or if you have a large party, it's advisable to make an online reservation. The wait staff and our server were friendly, and the vibrant ambiance along with ample seating made for a pleasant dining experience. The restaurant also features a round bar serving alcoholic beverages.

The menu was straightforward, and we ordered a wild berry matcha latte, chicken fried rice, banh mi chao - bo kho, beef tongue banh mi, and fish garlic noodles.

The wild berry matcha latte was good, though it had more ice than drink, making it somewhat pricey for the quantity. The chicken fried rice was excellent and met our expectations. The pork belly in the banh mi chao was good but lacked the depth of flavor found in the beef tongue banh mi, which was flavorful and satisfying. Unlike traditional banh mi, this place serves the bread on the side with the fillings on a pan.

The fish garlic noodles were tasty but arrived 20-25 minutes late, leaving us wondering if the chef forgot the recipe. 😂

Overall, the food was delicious and flavorful, but the portion sizes were small for the price. You might end up paying around $30 but still feel hungry due to their portion sizes. If you’re in the area and want to try Vietnamese fusion cuisine, this place is worth a visit. Just be prepared to spend a bit more if you're looking for a filling meal.

Nep Cafe, located in a bustling plaza in Irvine under the Kei Concept umbrella, offers a vibrant Vietnamese fusion dining experience. We ordered their dinner menu and were impressed by several dishes.
The Beef Carpaccio was exceptional, earning a perfect 5/5 for its deliciousness—we're still craving it!
The Garlic Noodle and Whole Branzino both scored well with ratings of 4/5, though diners should be cautious of small fish bones in the branzino.
The Seafood Ceviche received a 3/5, reflecting a middling experience.
Highly recommend trying their delightful Coconut Matcha—it's truly delicious.

Elevated Vietnamese cuisine

I walked in at 7pm on a Saturday with no reservation for a party of 7. We were told that the wait would be an hour.
We got lucky and we're seated much faster!

The cocktails were very good!
I personally like sweet and refreshing drinks, and I recommend the little saigon cocktail.
If you prefer a balanced drink, the Em Oi! Is very good. Have some who enjoys stonger flavors? The chapter ii is the choice for you.

All the plates have great portions. As a party of 5, we all were able to share bites of all appetizers. The shrimp salad was my favorite, it was very refreshing, and the dressing was flavorful.

All main dishes had generous portions. As a party of 5, we ordered 4 plates and were all very content and full!

The desserts were also quite rich!
My personal favorite of the three was the banana bread. The top of the banana had a torched turbinado topping which really elevated.

I really appreciated that the menu overall noted common allergies and intolerances. As someone that is lactose intolerant, it helps decide whether a creamy menu item is ok to eat 😊

name: Everyday Eatery
address: 6634 Irvine Center Dr, Irvine, CA 92618, USA
reviews:
Cozy Brunch Spot with Room for Improvement

Everyday Eatery in Sand Canyon Plaza offers a cozy cafe vibe and a healthy brunch menu that hits the spot.

🍽️ Delicious Brunch Fare: From avocado toast to hot cakes and waffles, the brunch options were delicious, fresh, and well-prepared. The variety of drinks, including iced matcha latte, americano, and Earl Grey tea, catered to different tastes.

🌿 Casual and Friendly Atmosphere: The cafe exudes a casual and friendly vibe, perfect for hanging out with friends. The patio seating adds to the relaxed ambiance, making it an enjoyable spot to spend time.

👎 Staff Service: However, I found the staff to be lacking in friendliness and could benefit from more training in customer service. Improving staff interactions would enhance the overall experience for guests.

🚽 Clean Facilities: On a positive note, the washroom was clean, reflecting the restaurant's attention to hygiene.

💰 Reasonable Prices: The prices were reasonable, offering value for money considering the quality of the food and atmosphere.

🔄 Plan to Return: Despite the minor issues with staff friendliness, I plan to return to Everyday Eatery to try more of their food. I'll update my review next time based on my experience.

Overall, Everyday Eatery is a charming brunch spot with delicious food and a welcoming atmosphere. With a little improvement in staff training, it has the potential to become a top choice for brunch enthusiasts in the area.

What a wonderful breakfast/brunch spot. I dropped my wife at an appointment and decided to stop and have breakfast. I found Everyday Eatery in close proximity and what a find. I ordered coffee, OJ, and the spinach and feta omelet. The food was so good and the restaurant was quite clean with a pleasant ambiance. Courtney assisted me with ordering and delivered my food to the table, and she was terrific as well.
I highly recommend this great breakfast spot.

This just became our favorite breakfast spot and we’re not even from here! We were so impressed with the quality of food and portions for the price, plus the coffee (latte’s) are delicious! We also highly recommend the breakfast burrito! It can get busy and it’s not very large inside, although on a nice day (like today for us) we were able to sit outside and it was beautiful. It’s a walk up and order and they bring your food to you. When we left, the line was out the door, but rightfully so! It’s well worth the wait!

We’ll be back for sure when we’re in the area again!

It was not a planned visit but the vibe/atmosphere were amazing. Foods were okay to me but better than plain breakfast meals. I wouldn't travel to this place but highly recommend if it's a quick option.

What horrible customer service! My wife, son and I went during the lunch rush for some breakfast, juice and coffee. The place is pleasant but there is very limited seating -- indoors and out was all full. We noticed a 4-top table with one person sprawled out with a laptop and folder taking up all the seats for over an hour. Turns out it was the manager Tatiana! We actually asked if she could swap for a single seat since there were 3 of us and she said no! Wow. Just Wow.

name: Krave Asian Fusion Restaurant
address: 2819 Main St, Irvine, CA 92614, USA
reviews:
One of the best Korean fried chicken wings I've ever had. They were MASSIVE! The garlic noodles were cooked to perfection, with the perfect texture without overbearing garlic flavor. Just the right amount. The gyoza dumplings were tender with the perfect crisp. With a sensational array of sauces. Very nice server. Great recommendations.

Will highly recommend to anyone who loves culinary arts.

Bobby provided excellent service, they have Sapporo on tap. I tried the mushroom burger and wings. I was really tempted to try the garlic noodles too, but I'll do that next time.

Restaurant was clean and had nice decor and some TV's.

The Chinese chili chicken strips and Bibimbap bowl were delicious! The flavor profile of both dishes was exactly what my taste buds crave. Sweet, spicy, and savory. I’ll definitely be dining here again to try more menu items.

We came here several times and liked most of the items which included the crispy chicken wings, and burger sliders. However, the place could use a thorough cleaning (I hope at least once in a while) this should include all the tables and chairs (felt sticky and unclean), the floors, and the doormat (probably need a new doormat). Most importantly, the cooks; uniforms needed to look crispy and clean. (We noticed a male staff walking in and toward the back kitchen ( his outfit appeared to be a bit filthy). We would love to come back but for these reasons, we will wait for a while before returning. This review stemmed from our sincere honesty and constructive feedback for improvement.

Chicken nice and crispy - I've eaten here a good number of times. Only gotten sick once but that don't stop me from coming back. I came closer to closing and they didn't kick me out so that's great customer service! Kudos for cooking me a fresh cup of hot water when they don't serve if. Ambiance is a bar style. Waiters and waitress chat to keep you company. Way to go!

name: SOL Mexican Cocina
address: 1910 Main St, Irvine, CA 92614, USA
reviews: Great food. Beautiful atmosphere and good service. The Roast beef was great. The grilled Corn was really yummy. Just a little complain I told them we are celebrating my birthday and they said they will do something and they never did :)

Went for a work lunch and ordered the Garlic-Mezcal Chicken with rice. The table chips and dip were a surprise as the chips are large. The dips are a great accompaniment to their chips. The place was clean with friendly staff. I enjoyed my sandwich and found the rice to be too salty for my taste.

I am not reducing their stars for the rice. As everybody else, five total, liked the rice, they still get five stars for food.  Their service is not quick. Which negatively affected how long we had to eat.

Jam packed restaurant.  Very loud with a party atmosphere. You have to love it. The drinks are awesome and food is very good. The spicy habanero sauce is unique to this place.
This is a chain restaurant and I would go to another location when I’m visiting.

Very good. Loved it first time, brought the whole family to enjoy. Food is great. Service amazing, drinks are very good and no skimming on the alcohol.  Facility has several seating options that are great for hosting few parties at the same time. There is full bar that has seating indoor and on patio. Overall very happy. Will be back

I went to Sol on my birthday, and we made a reservation. They completely ignored everything we asked for!
Luckily, the manager came and checked if we needed anything, and we told him he came back with what we asked for.
The waiter said we will make sure to do something for my birthday, we waited for 10 more minutes, and no one even bothered to ask! So we left.
I m very disappointed
This is my 5 visit and second visit in one month, and definitely, it was the worst.

name: The Cut Handcrafted Burgers
address: 3831 Alton Pkwy ste c, Irvine, CA 92606, USA
reviews: Was visiting from out of town and always on the prowl for great burgers during my travels. There are some truly great burger joints in So Cal and The Cut is right up there with the best of them. I always start with the basic burger, and this one did not disappoint. Cooked perfectly to medium rare and seasoned well with a burger to bun ratio that was spot on. The bun held up well and I devoured it immediately. The fries were fantastic as well with plenty of garlic and seasoning to satisfy my needs. The atmosphere is positive with plenty of seating and access to the outside world. Staff was a pleasure to chat with and seemed very proud of the business. Will definitely return when in the area.

I went there on a Sunday for father's day my kids took me because I love burgers and this place did not disappoint we started with the shishito peppers which were very good I got the cut burger expensive but very good my wife got the chilaquiles and my kids got the truffle burger and the sweet heat burger all were tasty. The tater tot were delicious crunchy on the outside and the sweet potato fries were on point. The service was good everyone there was friendly and the butter cake was delicious.

I'm a burger snob and I've never had a better burger.  I love the savory.  They recently removed some other fantastic burgers unfortunately .   Really wish the prices were a little less, but besides that, AMAZING food!  Please don't lessen your quality Cut!

I also have tried the biscuits and gravy..... Woah .. unique and delicious

And the coconut shrimp..... Yeah it's deep fried of course..... But wow.... They crush it on flavor!

Without a doubt the most exceptional service received at The Cut. We had arrived and were quoted a 20-minute wait and were offered a seat at the bar in the meantime. A table opened up and the staff were quick to let us know. The exceptional service did not stop there. We were greeted by our server, Lisa, who was truly a breath of fresh air when it comes to service, thoughtfulness, and respect. Being my first time there, my friend who recommended it was a regular, I ordered the classy burger with a fried egg, a salad and pancakes, I was hungry lol. Lisa was so kind to consider the cost and mentioned that with each burger there is a side, and asked if I wanted to have the Ceasar salad in a smaller portion as my side which suited me well. The food was great, and I would recommend anyone to enjoy their vast menu of very tasty meals. If you like Poutine, savory, sweet and much more this place checks all the boxes. You won't be sorry you visited!

I’ve been disappointed with so many burger spots in Orange County, so I was expecting the same with The Cut. Thankfully, I was very wrong. The sweet and spicy burger was one of the best i’ve ever had, the beer was fresh, and the service I got from the bartender was fantastic! I will definitely come back!

name: Islands Restaurant The Market Place, Irvine
address: 13762 Jamboree Rd, Irvine, CA 92602, USA
reviews: Visited this place twice in a week. There was no wait for weekday lunch. Pretty standard American food. Tried the kilauea burger for the first time and the chicken sandwich later. The size of the burger and the sandwich is big, you can be full easily with the fries. Service is various depending on where you sit. It is a nice place for a quick American meal.

What can one say about an Islands that has not already been said? The atmosphere of this restaurant chain is family-friendly, fun, and super clean. Even the restrooms are kept in impeccable order. The food is always delicious and the staff is very courteous. Plus, as a surfer and skiing advocate, i can't get enough of surf/ ski programming on the TVs. For this review, I would like to focus on the staff, as they are part of what makes every Islands visit exceptional.

I had placed my order on the app, only to have the app crash and lose my order. Now i had very detailed in placing the first order, so that when I had to do it again, I was a little frustrated, to say the least, and missed adding two items the second time around.

Upon arrival at the restaurant, I noticed that upon paying, the price was less than I expected, and this was when I noticed my mistake. The staff quickly took things in hand, modified my order, saying it was no problem, and even added a drink I had not considered until I saw what was provided in my "little's" order.

It did take a few minutes longer to prepare the additional items for our order, but the staff offered us complimentary drinks while we waited and were super friendly, to the point that three different staff members reviewed and check on everything while we waited.

This level of customer service is not really something I feel can be taught. It's something that comes from within a person who ensures they are doing their best job while ensuring the customer is satisfied with the service they are receiving. It's a level of professionalism that you don't find very often in large chain organizations, but this Islands has in spades.

I commend the staff at this location for their performance and skill at making patrons feel both welcome and the focus of attention for their dinning experience. Can't wait to go back!

I went there as Sunday with a friend, Dylan was our server wonderful person /server. He made us feel like family. Dylan made suggestions to make my meal more enjoyable.
Dylan was absolutely fabulous! I will definitely be revisiting this island's restaurant "and"
I will definitely be requesting Dylan as my waiter/ server. Server.
Great food, good drinks, and friendly service.

It was late, and they were closing soon, so I took a chance to get takeout.  The hostess was more than accommodating and very friendly.  She even offered me to sit and eat if I wanted to.  I ordered the China Coast chicken salad.  It was Deeelicious! 😋

name: Hangar 24 Orange County
address: 17877 Von Karman Ave Unit 110, Irvine, CA 92614, USA
reviews: This is a such a fun outdoor spot! I went for trivia on a Thursday night and had a blast. Seating can be kind of limited, so go early and be flexible. The food and drink was pretty good though. Nothing that was incredible, but nothing bad.
Hangar 24 is a good restaurant with a spacious and comfortable setting. Parking is ample and convenient. However, the wait times can be quite long, so plan accordingly.

The place is very nice, lots of table and chairs. The food is ok and the price is a bit high, Philly steak sandwich with fries costs $19.00.  Parking: need to go thru the gate and get the ticket, which you can validate at Hangar24 so you don’t need to pay.(it’s right next to cashiers and you do it yourself). It’s a bar where you order at the cashier, they give you a number, you choose where to seat N they will bring the food to you. It’s a great place to hang out with friends.

**Parking:**

- Tricky parking, see videos for guidance.

- Gets busy on weekends so parking is hard to find.

- Free parking if you bring your parking ticket and run it through the machine inside of the bar (no need to buy food or drinks).

**Food and Drinks:**

- I haven’t drunk or dined here, but others I talk to report satisfactory, albeit expensive food and drinks.

- Long lines on weekends.

**Atmosphere**

- Lots of people on weekends so finding a place to sit is hard

- A good place for singles

Great place to go with friends and coworkers. I've been here a few times and the atmosphere is always great. The food is good and the beer selection is too. There's usually a live band playing on weekends also. Parking is easy, with a large parking lot, and there validation inside, so you don't have to pay.

name: Bacchus Bar and Bistro
address: 6735 Quail Hill Pkwy, Irvine, CA 92603, USA
reviews:
I forget how much I enjoy a simple dish that gets elevated. This place is reminds me how a grilled cheese can feel so elegant with good ingredients and good presentation.

The steak could've been double checked that it was cooked to the requested temperature but it still has great pairings with it.

If you're looking for a great cocktail and it's mellow enough try to ask Van/Vanessa if she's able to concoct something special but everything on the menu is just as balanced and delicious.

Cozy Pine - it’s weird to have a campground/outdoor themed speakeasy in the middle of a reg restaurant. We walk in and nobody is there and then they lead us to a sliding door revealing a tiny box with about a dozen seats, lots of wood and candles, and picnic benches. It’s super tiny, like a grizzly bear will barely fit in there but it does have the intimate thing going and the drinks were decent.

I wasn’t too hot on the menu but the drinks were done well. There wasnt anything super creative but you’re going for the atmosphere and experience. Yes, prep your IG for the moment.

The ambience alone was definitely the highlight of our visit. The speak-easy, camp theme was well-executed, and I give full credit to the team for their efforts in creating such a unique atmosphere. Unfortunately, the food, while acceptable, was significantly overpriced. We anticipated high prices, so this wasn't a major issue.

What really let us down was the service. Despite the restaurant being nearly empty, everything took an unusually long time. The food, however, came out quickly, indicating that the cook was competent and perhaps the only one truly putting in effort.

Furthermore, If they want to stick with the camp theme, they should consider incorporating more camp-related flavors into their menu both drink and food. Additionally, hiring better staff is crucial. The place has great ideas behind it, but it's so poorly run that it seems destined to fail. It’s so close to being a nice place, which is probably what makes me so upset. I'm torn between wishing this place would fail and hoping they improve. I feel bad for the owner and wish them good luck in the future, but we won't be returning.

This place is delicious and has great drinks. Bartenders are all super nice and accommodating to your preferences. New York sour is a huge win here.

For those people commenting on wait times, context matters.   If the establishment is full, which it normally is on Friday nights, there will be a wait... especially for the speakeasy.   As long as you come in with that understanding you will have a great time.

Excellent place for dinner and date night. My husband and I had a really nice dinner of Chilean Sea Bass and Scallops and Risotto - customer service was amazing - Tony and Kim - thank you for the great service! We had a bottle of Taittinger  Champagne with dinner and we had Tuna Tartare and Beets and Burrata  for appetizers - the food was absolutely delicious! Ray ‘s has the perfect personality- he is amazing! Wow the new menu is amazing - the steak was done with perfection and as always Nicole and Ray - excellent service !!!!

name: The Garden Grille and Lounge
address: 2381 Morse Ave, Irvine, CA 92614, USA
reviews: I would say for a restaurant inside a Garden Inn this place is amazing, but its a great restaurant regardless of being inside a hotel. The service was perfect (Austin) was amazing and the food was incredible. Some of the best wings I've ever had! Go there even if you don't stay at the hotel.

I want to say thank you to Angela for all of her wonderful service. I frequently stay at this hotel and eat dinner often at the bar. Angela does a wonderful job as the bartender and consistently provides wonderful service. She remembers my name, engages in fun and humorous conversation (love her sense of humor). She simply knows what great customer service is and how to deliver it. She genuinely cares about her customers and wants them to have a wonderful experience. My two favorite drinks are a great "old fashion" or a classic chilled "martini". She makes both well. But even better than the really cold martini she makes, is her kindness and genuine respect for her customers. Thank you Angela for being a consistent reminder of what excellent service should look like.
Food was on point and tasty.. Service has been simply considerate, prompt, and appropriate. Enjoyable period.
Good food considering this is inside the hotel. Decent variety in food choices. Slightly on higher side for prices. But you would expect that at an in in-hotel restaurant.
Lovely hotel. Clean, modern, friendly staff. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

name: Panini Kabob Grill - Irvine Park Place
address: 3041 Michelson Dr, Irvine, CA 92612, USA
reviews:
My dad wanted to order in for Valentine's Day, so I suggested Mediterranean for a healthier meal. After searching high and low through Door Dash, we decided on Panini Kabob Grill.

We ordered the family meal for 4 and were concerned it may not be enough because we ordered a family meal from another Mediterranean restaurant before, and it was hardly enough for us. This time, I can honestly say we had more than enough of everything, so much so that we actually had a good amount of meat, salad, and rice leftover, as well as some pita and humus.

The only thing we did finish was the thin Steak Skewer because we only ordered one of those to try it. It was really juicy and tender. Definitely recommend trying it if you're curious like us.

Overall, we were really happy with our meal. The price came out to about $37 per person, but that's easily for two meals for each of us. We have plenty of leftovers, so tomorrow we will be having those, and I cannot wait! It was all SO good!
Mother in law took my husband and I for lunch. Never knew there was in Irvine. But it was so delicious! Definitely coming back again when we come back to visit. I had the salmon kabob plate.

Beautiful patio lunch with fresh food and outstanding service (thank you Francisco!). Bolognaise linguini had the perfect texture and the sauce held so much flavour. The chicken kabob with bulgar pilaf and romaine avocado salad was my favourite. Portions were large and great bang for buck.

Visited this location for the first time during lunch hour on a Friday. Place was busy. Outside seating was great with the heat lamps. We both ordered the chicken wrap that come with a side of hummus. I got chicken soup as a side and my friends got their Mediterranean salad. Soup arrived cold and the wrap didn’t really have a taste. I looked for salt but there was no salt shaker on the table. So I had to keep dunking the wrap in the hummus to get some taste on the otherwise bland wrap. I expected more given their falafel wraps are juicy and tasty but chicken wrap wasn’t. Disappointing.

Always great food and huge portions for the kabobs here. Come here for lunch and dinner. You won’t be disappointed.  Beef Koobideh Kabob, flat iron, chicken, salmon, and Lamb are all amazing.  Their espresso is great too.

Today I had their breakfast steak/eggs and it was just the right amount.

name: La Boheme
address: 8400 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: What a great restaurant,  the outside seating was lovely and not too busy during the week. The happy hour lasted all night, so we decided to stay for more drinks! The food was absolutely delicious, and the cocktails were vibrant and fresh. The Mac and Cheese croquet was absolutely amazing. The only downside was that I had to share this with my husband! The mussles were so tasty and not too spicy.  Along with wonderful attentive service, it really was a wonderful last experience in L.A. for us.

Lots of outdoor space and Happy Hour deals through the week that last until about 7 pm (including food and drink options). Not sure exactly when it starts though, but I know they have it on Saturdays as well. The Oysters are pretty good and very juicy. The Spaghetti was in a white sauce topped with large meatballs! Very creamy and pretty different from your normal spaghetti. Overall, service was fine for how busy it was. Cool vibe and very LA!

Tried multiple smaller dishes and everything was delicious. I usually never say that. They also make excellent cocktails, especially the espresso martini. Love the outdoor seating area and the unique decor. Our server Patrick was very attentive and on top of it. My only wish is that they didn’t put a huge obnoxious candle on my tiny dessert slice. A smaller simple birthday candle would have been more appropriate for the size of the dish. I’ll definitely come back to try all the other dishes on the menu.

One of the best dining experiences I had. Our server gave us life in the subtlest way. (I think their name was Kelsey or Kristin.) The drinks were amazing. The appetizers were appetizing. The entrees were divine. Just a fantastic time. The outside dining area was packed and decorated so nicely. As always, we love vegan options in every section of the menu. My only complaint is that I wish they had used Impossible meat instead of Beyond. However, the vegan cheese was delicious.

I’m low-key obsessed with this place and it was my first time. The inside was gorgeous and the stained glass window upstairs with the sun shining through was gorgeous. I wish the piano was being played. The food was amazing and I wanted more. The red sauce that came with the breakfast burrito was so yummy. Kelsey was also great at enhancing our dining experience. She was extremely friendly and made the best suggestions. She was so great at doing her job. Can’t wait to go back and definitely want to have a bday brunch here.

name: Norah
address: 8279 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90046, USA
reviews: wine was the best part of the meal. literally the worst clam spaghetti ever. no flavor and not fresh at all. had to ask for salt (which still wasn’t enough) v disappointed

Had the Wagyu steak with eggs, cornbread and a mezcal cocktail. The food here is flawless and deliciously so. The restaurant is pretty and so are the servers. There’s a nice patio. I really enjoyed the music. Even the bathrooms are remarkable. Meter parking.

Well hidden location with a quaint and symmetrical atmosphere. I arrived when they opened at 11AM for brunch. I was lucky enough to be one of the only people eating at the time. The steak and eggs. Both of which were absolutely perfect! The steak has the perfect combination of fat and steak for the morning. The sauce was delicious. I spread it across everything. The eggs were a great creamy flavor pair with the steak.  The biggest shock to me qere the potatoes. Usually just a part of the plate that never are considered a highlight. These potatoes were top tier and to me added hearty to the trio. They stole the show. They look like chicken wings. I totslly thought they were.

Been waiting for a while now to go to Norah, and  since the covid restrictions were lifted recently I jumped at the opportunity. We were a bit late to a 8pm reservation but it was okay. The staff were very friendly and asked us what we wanted to drink while we wait for our table: it was very busy for a Friday evening but that’s also probably because restrictions were just lifted.
The cocktails were delicious. I tried the passion fruit margarita and the kiwi sour. Both typical cocktails with a nice twist.
The food was also very good. You’re meant to share the plates. We got the cornbread which is a must! Make sure to put some of the butter on top. We also got the gnocchi and a pizza.
It’s also a really nice atmosphere outside at the back. Make sure to be seated there if you can.
Be prepared to pay around $80 per person.
Will definitely be adding this to my favorites in West Hollywood!

Management and staff is knowledgeable and goes out of their way to make sure you have a great dining experience. Enjoyed the unique wine selections and pairings. Great for happy hour or a sophisticated night! Loved the truffle cream pizza..yum!

name: GRANVILLE
address: 8701 Beverly Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90048, USA
reviews:
Service was ok nothing special but nothing bad as well.

The inside is just a typical restaurant, nothing special.

I had a burger which was very good.

However my husband had a pork steak with spinach on the side.
He got food poisoning and fell extremely unwell the moment I got back home. It must have been the spinach because I we shared everything else and I didn’t have any problems at all. Probably the spinach/ salad was not washed properly. Overall below average experience!
The waiters were polite and friendly though.

First of all, the best part about our experience today was our server, Lindsay, and that's saying a lot because our food was delicious, too!

Lindsay is a pro. I was a server for years so am naturally more sensitive to good and bad service. Lindsay is one of the best servers I've ever experienced. She's so welcoming and warm, she's knowledgeable about the menu and proactive about helping you choose the right dish, and she's attentive throughout the meal. She has a great attitude and best of all--she's clearly just being herself! What a gem.

I always love the Granville Salad. It's consistently well seasoned and perfectly dressed.

I also had vanilla ice cream and it was INCREDIBLE!

We'll be back soon and obviously requesting Lindsay.

Ideally, I'd give it a 3.5/5.

Granville in West Hollywood offers a beautiful dining experience. The indoor space is bright and airy, with skylights and plenty of plants creating a cheerful atmosphere. There's a central bar that adds a touch of energy, and the option for outdoor seating is a plus.

Unfortunately, the service wasn't quite up to par with the ambiance. Our server seemed a little frustrated and even rolled her eyes when we asked questions about the menu.  Having both breakfast and brunch menus to navigate was a bit overwhelming, so some clarification would have been helpful.

The good news is that the food arrived quickly. We tried the village scramble, skirt steak and eggs, french toast, chai latte, and berry lemonade. The lemonade was a miss - way too sour and unbalanced. The chai latte was just okay.

On a brighter note, both the village scramble and skirt steak came with delicious roasted potatoes (both sweet and regular), which were perfectly cooked. The sausage in the scramble had a nice kick, and the skirt steak was cooked to a perfect medium, though the portion size was a bit on the small side.

The french toast was decent, but nothing special. The butter that came with it was good.

Overall, Granville has a lovely atmosphere and some good food options. However, the service needs some improvement, and a couple of dishes fell short.

The food is so tasty. We will definitely be returning. The server and other staff were very friendly and helpful. Loved the vibe of the restaurant and the portion sizes of each dish was very good. We left satisfied and had a little left over. I would recommend to everyone to try this place at least once!

We decided to Eat before heading to the Hollywood Bowl concert( first time we usually take food) I used YELP to search for in b/t home & shuttle YELP hasn't failed me yet! Lol! What a Fantastic dining experience! First the Outsofe is Very Cute & Contemporary! The decor inside also has a Cool Vibe. There is seating outside & the inside is larger than I expected. The Hostess was great and we were seated quickly( had reservation since it was a TSunday around 5)
Our Server was Fantastic! She was attentive, Friendly , & Helpful with our choices. From the reviews we shared the Trio of tacos( Jackfruit, steak & shrimp) Perfect shareable appetizer! Delicious!
Hubby loves a good burger & this didn't disappoint! It was juicy& good Bun! The fries were jist crispy enough! My Porkchop ( one if my favorite meals to order at a new restaurant) was cooked to perfection! I was pleasantly full. With that said OFCOURSE THERE IS ALWAYS ROOM FOR DESSERT! So, brueleed banana brownie!! YUMM! OH..and the Drinks were Excellent! Very Good Dining Experiencel

name: Merois | West Hollywood
address: 8430 Sunset Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: Had a moment to stop by and have a nice lunch here. Service was nice and the staff was helpful and friendly. Food tasted good and was well prepared. The views from the restaurant are fantastic. Would recommend.

We couldn't decide so we ordered everything from the dessert menu.

FAV: Marjolaine Cake and Ube Basque
Cheesecake

Over all, I think each drink and dessert stands to meet very specific cravings and does it really well. It made for a wonderful distinct tasting experience.

Marjolaine Cake was a multi layered multi textured experience with beautiful plating. cutting through the top layer was a struggle and crushed the layers below at the slice but the taste was impeccable. It reminded us of our best tiramisu experiences.

Ube cheesecake was just good, beautiful deep flavors and colors. So if you want ube and cheesecake this is the perfect merge of flavors and experience without overpowering each other. We also enjoyed that it wasn't overly sweetened and complimented by a sorta sour cream spread.

The Spikey Lemon with crunchy meringue was also a contender. It was soft, light, melts in your mouth and bursting with lemony flavor with a satisfying meringue crunch. The shape was so quirky and fun. By the look of it, you know exactly what you're gonna get from the bite

The soufflé was well executed. It was a rich dark chocolate soufflé experience. It wasn't the most exciting on the list but if I was craving chocolate that would have been my pick.

The halo halo was interesting, it was an elevated and renewed experience of the original street filipino desert that my filipino fam is very familiar with. It was a fun twist. But it's quite unexpected and has mixed reviews for people who don't have any familiarity with the desert.

Service was wonderful, our server gave us wonderful drink recommendations. I liked the white pearl the most, it did have a lovely and noticeable ginger bite that helped me pace my sips.

Even as the kitchen and bar closed the staff left us undisturbed and allowed us to linger and finish at our leisure. The late night vibes at the roof top were just five stars! What a luxurious experience to taste the night away overlooking city lights. Inspiring!
The flavor of every dish was delicious! The food came out very quickly, the server was very knowledgeable, the presentation of the food was meticulous, the view was great . Such a good experience!
The views were stellar. The ambience and noise were perfect and the drinks were amazing. Watching the sunset while dining on the whole fish entree was everything.  I can't wait to go back!

This place is really cool! On a Tuesday night, the crowd was mostly subdued, and atmosphere was mellow. The decor and lighting allow for a relaxing and delicious night to begin. Which brings me to the food, which was quite wonderful!! Not one dish was below perfect, and the presentations were absolutely gorgeous. I’m talking Michelin-star presentations, and I wouldn’t be surprised if Merois earns a Michelin star. Coupled with a decent city skyline view…. I have to say I certainly recommend Merois! 5 stars!

name: Cecconi's West Hollywood
address: 8764 Melrose Ave, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: Went for a birthday celebration and we were not disappointed. 4 of us (and one dog) were welcomed to the expanded outside patio. Very well laid out and not at all crowded. The nosie level outside is also nice. We had a variety of dishes and all were wonderful, starting with the avocado and chickpea dip. It came in a huge silver champagne bucket full of a wide variety of vegetables. We also ordered the fennel pizza. Big pieces of well seasoned sausage on a wonderful and well baked dough. Very tasty sauce too. Four entrées were ordered  - butter lettuce salad, cavatelli lamb ragu, rigatoni bolognese and fusilli pesto. Of course we all had to taste and share each one. Subtle salad with light dressing, tasty lamb in a wonderful ragu, traditional bolognese with a lot of beef (although I do prefer a mixutre of beef and sausage) and a subtle pesto dish that was not overpowering. Of course a fine wine by the glass and bottle selection too. The drinks are great and well mixed, including the non alcoholic ones. Since it was a birthday, they presented us a profiterole with salted caramel gelato complete with a candle. They never rushed us and it was a wonderful relaxing time. Definitely worrh a return visit. Valet and metered street parking.

Loved this restaurant. The staff were amazing and every dish was great. It was very flavorful, warm, and just overall delicious. We were celebrating 2 birthdays and they brought out a salted caramel dessert on the house!

I regret not trying this place sooner because after dinner last night, I would say this is definitely in my top five favorite Italian restaurants in LA list. It’s in a really busy and fun part of town. This part of West Hollywood is not as busy as the North end so parking isn’t as bad but it’s still difficult at certain times. We were able to find a metered street spot right out front, but we were just lucky with the timing. Otherwise it will be $15 for valet. I especially love how the inside is designed. It has a classy 1920s feel to it and I especially love how dark it is inside, and how each table has its own lighting. It really adds to the mood. They also have a very large and busy bar that had every seat taken during our entire meal. Our server was very polite and all of our items came out quickly after placing the order.

They have a fairly large menu with a lot of great options on it. The hardest part for me was narrowing down which ones I wanted to order because there were so many that I wanted to get. I started off with the Whipped Ricotta and thought it was fantastic. It’s a really sweet and cheesy start to the meal. Next was the Fried Artichokes and honestly they were some of the best that I’ve ever had. First off, you can eat the entire thing and secondly, the flavors were just terrific. Next came the Steak Tartare and I thought it was wonderful. The black truffle really adds to the flavor and I especially loved the quail egg. For our entrées, we chose the Butternut Squash Tortellini and the Lamb Ragu Cavatelli. Both were good sized portions and were cooked perfectly. The flavors were just very rich and we enjoyed every bite. They did have some good dessert options but by this time of meal, we were just too full.

Overall one of my favorite Italian restaurants in all of Los Angeles. I definitely would recommend to anyone for any occasion, and I plan to be back in the future.

I loved the place, I didn’t have a reservation so I took a seat at the bar and ordered a drink of Hennessy on the rocks. The service is fantastic! They are all very attentive and warm. It is obvious that I will be back.

Fair review - one of the most delicious Italian restaurant in that area
Beef tartare was amazing
Grilled octopus - one love!
Cauliflower supposed to be grilled but it was more like boiled, but still good.
Artichokes unusual and also delicious.
Didn’t try any meet this time but I will come back here soon.

name: Eveleigh
address: 8752 Sunset Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: Absolutely amazing dope spot in West Hollywood. I have only been for Brunch and it is SO GOOD. Please start with the banana bread it is easily top 3 I have ever had if not number 1. Also had the Carlitos way cocktail which is so fire. It comes in a mason jar with no ice but they give you a side glass off ice to pour the drink into. The breakfast pizza was so good and a unique take on breakfast. I highly recommend this place everything is perfect. They do a great job.

I was looking for a cute, cosy classic LA date night restaurant when I found this place, and it was perfect. The outdoor seating area with the fairy lights and heaters was so cosy and attractive. The food was great- particularly the crab spaghetti which I just couldn't get enough of. Highly recommend for a date spot, I had a lovely evening.

This place is pretty dope for brunch. Love the location (on Sunset), I love the atmosphere, everyone was super friendly and attentive. The food was good, drinks were potent (♥️), and just a super chill place. Good, relaxing music played in the background. The price was too bad either. I went with a party of three. We all had 1-2 drinks a piece, ordered 1-2 food items and it came out to $133 (tip not included) and that’s pretty fair. No to mention, they don’t try to rush you out when you just want to chat a bit with your friends (which is really important to me. I don’t like feeling rushed especially if I’m enjoying myself). I guess I was really drawn my the color scheme. I love blues. It’s trendy. It’s casual. It can be a bit upscale but not intimidating. I’ll totally come back for dinner. I bet it’s gorgeous at night being on the back patio.
Place is great. Johnny the bartender is fantastic. See my pics. Atmosphere is fun
Small intimate indoor rustic vibe, large outdoor patio seating. Friendly service,  valet parking only.

name: Ysabel
address: 945 N Fairfax Ave, West Hollywood, CA 90046, USA
reviews:
What a lovely dining experience. Hunter was a great server and took care of us, recommending things and being generally ebullient. The food was delicious and I would absolutely recommend the miso salmon, cooked perfectly. The bite of the night, though, was the Brussel sprouts with kimchi paste and golden raisins. Next level!

Also, clean bathrooms with Aesop soap—LA baby!

I would say Atmosphere is the biggest reason why I love to come back here. Yes yes yes - food and service are great but atmosphere is 👌🏻👌🏻👌🏻

To me this place remind me about Europe and specifically Greece islands with olive trees decorated with lights and warm LA breeze. Lovely combination you cannot resist.

We loved our waitress Noemi 💕 she was very kind and attentive to all her tables.
Food is excellent!! Deff get the rigatoni! The steak was also very good, medium rare was better cooked than Craig’s for sure. I also recommend having the orange wine 😗👌Thanks for the lovely vibes and food x

A popular place for girls brunch.
I love there heaters! So warm that I would take my jackets off even on a rainy cold Sunday :)

Service is great and the ambiance is perfect.
I would with they have a new brunch menu tho:)

Recommended.

Everyone has their own biases. Mine is having a deep appreciation for restaurants whose full kitchen stays open later than most of their peers on any given night. It's with that in mind that Ysabel hold a special place in my heart.

Having grabbed a seat at the bar at 10:30pm on a Wednesday, you can imagine the sheer joy at being able to choose from the full menu. I went with the The shrimp and salmon and neither disappointed.

Did I mention that Ysabel is beautiful. With an array of indoor and outdoor dining experiences, Ysabel has the flexibility to be ideal for anything from social to professional.

name: WeHo Bistro
address: 1040 N La Cienega Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews:
Superb experience. I tried two Weho Bistro “best of” and… definitely superb.
Pair the food quality with the courtesy of all the service and you deserve 5 stars+.
Recommended. Greatly.

Been here a couple of times! Very accurate with reservations, accommodating our group of 7. Excellent service and food is a hit each time. I highly recommend the hummus trio app and the avocado burrata toast was amaaaazing! They also have great salads and sandwiches, and make a great Aperol spritz. As usual, I can’t wait to come back!
Lovely seating in the back patio, but a bit of a hike to the restroom.  Service was good  . The food didn't knock my socks off but it was good ( carbanara spaghetti) The specialty drink was tasty.

This is by far my favorite restaurant in LA. The quality of food is fresh and so delicious! I love the vibe, the staff are super friendly, and you just feel like you’re entering a magical place. It’s a special little corner of LA and I highly recommend it.

Their cream of mushroom soup is incredible, the sweet potatoes fries, the mágico mushroom pasta and honestly everything is just tasty!

Beautiful restaurant. The food is delicious and the service was impeccable. Blown away by the happy hour quiche bites (didn’t realize that is what quiche should taste like). Also tried the shrimp salad, the mac and cheese and the crepe suzette. All absolutely marvellous. AND I was with my friend from France who was very impressed. Highly recommend!

name: Gracias Madre
address: 8905 Melrose Ave, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: All vegan! All organic! Meatless Mexican cuisine that is so full of flavor it can please the pickiest of eaters. This restaurant is pretty much the epitome of what I think of for LA vegan food at its finest. What makes it even better is that they have Happy Hour too! Weekdays 3 to 6 pm that includes both food and drinks! The space is very chic and very LA. Service was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. Overall, give it a try if you want to get more vegan goodness in your life!

We enjoyed an incredible late lunch here.  We started with the nachos, they were devoured!!  Between the 6 of us we tried nearly every menu item!!  Nobody was disappointed!  We would never seek out a vegan restaurant, but the flavours and combinations were incredible.  The cocktails were good.

Amazing vegan place! All the items on the menu are absolutely gems. We love weekend brunch there. The patio is lovely and perfect for LA weather. Also don't underestimate and skip the vegan desserts. They are amazing.

Had a phenomenal time at the Drag Brunch this past Sunday! So awesome that Gracias Madre supports the community in this way.

Our server, Katia, was FANTASTIC.

The food is always a hit or miss for me. I didn't love the Cazuela Calabacitas (a frittata)--it lacked seasoning. And the black beans that came with it were pretty al dente. I prefer mine cooked thoroughly (I'll remember to ask for this next time if whatever dish I order comes with black beans).

I had a bite of the mushroom quesadilla and it was SO GOOD. Also loved the nachos. My friend loved her Crepas Mexicanas.

Katia also brought a comped dessert for our friend whose birthday we were celebrating. Love that touch.

Their patio is just lovely.

We'll be back, obviously!

The service was nice but way too fast We didn’t even have the time to finish our starters that they already filled the table with the main dishes. I wish the guacamole and ceviche were fresher. As soon as we finished our last bite, the check was brought. Well 45min and we were out

name: Bottega Louie WEHO
address: 8936 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: Let me start off by saying Jessica is the greatest waitress. Over the past few years I’ve come in regularly and I have nothing short of a perfect experience when she takes care of my table. The food is also amazing. Normally I like to stick to what I know, but lately I’ve been trying different dishes and nothing has disappointed. The photos I have from previous meals are mainly brunch, but they also have a delicious lasagna and the desserts are 1000/10.

Don't go for a meal. Disappointing. Overall it was an ok experience - because the atmosphere and pastries. But definitely not great. The food was not great. The service was friendly, but really lacking and got several things wrong!

My matcha was warm. Not hot. I had the eggs benedicts with hash browns instead of the English muffin. The hash browns were greasy, swimming in grease. I would not order them again. My friend ordered a side of eggs with her souffle pancake, but these were forgotten. The busser noted it on the ticket and said oh I see that you ordered eggs. How would you like them? So they arrived several minutes after the table was served. Another friend had toast, but didn't get jam, butter or anything at all to put on her toast. She had to flag someone down because the server did not check back after our food was delivered. The server never check on us. After we had completely finished our meal, and drinks, including water, the server did eventually come back and offer another round of drinks. But we were already finished eating. We all wanted to order another round of drinks but no one checked on us until we were completely done eating. He did bring us water while we waited for the check, which also took surprisingly long. If you're a thirsty girl you might wanna bring your own water bottle. My macaron was delicious. The restroom was very clean and well attended to. The pastry case is beautiful, vast, worth the visit, and should be explored.

We went to the Bottega Louie in West Hollywood for dessert after dinner. They have so many cakes and desserts. I have difficulty deciding because they all look delicious and I wanted them all! Lol

We decided to dine in and ordered a few items. The customer service is excellent. Our waitperson is very polite and attentive. The desserts are so good. I wish I could eat more!

Gorgeous space. Well designed, beautiful pastry displays. Aesthetics 10/10.

Service does not match the atmosphere. Our server was fine but quite indifferent, clearly there for a paycheque. Waters & empty cocktails were not paid any mind. After eating, we went to order a beignet from the counter and the server or manager there was very short with us and squished the beignet’s to fit in the box instead of choosing another packaging option.

The food was well made, very flavourful, definitely matches the vibe.

Very West Hollywood when it comes to a meal.

The lunch menu offers a variety of options, catering to different tastes. Chicken parmesan is a true standout. Tender chicken breast, breaded and fried to a golden crisp, is smothered in marinara sauce and melted mozzarella. The pizza is a slice of heaven. The thin crust is perfectly crispy, and the toppings are fresh and flavorful.

The pastries, especially the macarons did not disappoint. Vibrant colors, delicate shells, and a variety of flavors—each bite was a little piece of heaven. The chocolate éclair was another winner, filled with velvety custard and topped with glossy chocolate ganache. And don’t miss croissants 🥐

While the price is not the most budget-friendly option, the quality of food and service justifies the cost.

name: Amour Weho
address: 8715 Beverly Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90048, USA
reviews:
I recently dined at Amour Restaurant in West Hollywood, Los Angeles, and it was an unforgettable experience. The restaurant beautifully blends French cuisine with a Japanese touch, creating a unique and delightful menu. Each dish was a masterpiece, with flavors that were both sophisticated and innovative.

The ambiance is incredibly romantic, perfect for a special night out. The dim lighting, elegant decor, and soft music set the perfect mood for an intimate dining experience. Moreover, the staff were exceptionally friendly and attentive, making us feel welcome and well cared for throughout the evening.

Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or just looking for an extraordinary meal, Amour Restaurant is a must-visit. Highly recommended!

I came here with a group of friends a few weeks ago and WOW. I was so impressed.

First off, the atmosphere is BEAUTIFUL. Extremely well designed space, down to the cutlery and accents on the table.

Service was lovely! Very friendly and I loved their uniforms, just adds to the space in general.

And now… THE FOOD. Let me lead with the fact that I’m vegan. I’ll be honest, I was not expecting much because this is a French restaurant and historically, these are restaurants I typically get a salad with some olive oil and balsamic vinegar and side of bread. Well… the bread is delicious. BUT I was pleasantly surprised to find out that they can modify their vegetarian tasting menu to be FULLY VEGAN. And wow did they commit. Every single dish I had that evening was full of flavor, innovation, and creativity. I had a few favorites— the beet tartar & the kohlrabi steak with sun choke chips are still on my mind.

Overall this was a GREAT experience. If you’re vegan you will be taken care of. If you’ve got vegan friends, they will not feel left out of the experience.

This place is very cute & romantic. It was a very busy night and service was a little slow but tolerable. Unique dishes on the menu which was fun to see. The endive & fennel salad were our favorites. The lobster pasta was too salty and the very expensive sole lacked flavor. The chocolate mousse was lovely. They serve Soju & wine presently. Liquor license in the works. Only 2 bathrooms and really in the worse spot.. right in front of the kitchen. As people were waiting in line, the poor staff had to maneuver around them. There was a health fee on the bill but we asked for it to be removed and it was. Would like to come back for the summer.. their outdoor dining looks nice.

I recently dined at Amour, a charming French restaurant, and it was an absolute delight. From the moment I stepped in, the ambiance transported me to the streets of Paris. Quentin, our server, provided impeccable service with a genuine smile and excellent recommendations. The food was exquisite and beautifully presented. The attention to detail in both the cuisine and the service truly made our dining experience memorable. I highly recommend Amour to anyone seeking an enchanting taste of France.

Such an amazing experience from the service to the food to the beautifully decorated atmosphere! Feels like you were transported into france. This was hands down one of the best meals I have had in LA. Ordered the steak tartar, carpaccio, lobster tagliatelle, and cheesecake and everything was DELICIOUS. I even got to meet the chef behind these amazing dishes! 10/10 come here for a great dining experience!

name: Zinqué
address: 8684 Melrose Ave, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: Cute brunch spot near the Pacific Design Center. All their cocktails are wine-based. I got their Espresso Martini and enjoyed their variation on it. The Le Breakfast Bowl was good, but could have had a bit more quinoa to make it more filling. Very healthy and clean dish though. Overall, cute spot to check out in the area.
I really like the food and wine here. Such cool quaint, and frenchy vibes. I've been here many times for friday eve happy hour and it's always fun, yummy,  and wonderful service. 😋😍

Went for Sunday afternoon drinks and apps and had a great time! The service was a little slow but not terrible. We ordered the banana blueberry bread and it was increddddible! So yummy and moist- highly recommend. My friend got the curry soup which she loved and I got the fries which were good! Overall good experience and would definitely go back for a full meal.

Great experience, cute aesthetic and the server was helpful.
I had tuna and my friend had a smash burger. Both were great choices. Loved my dish. I wasn’t too crazy about the drinks. I was told that not all restaurants had liquor licenses so they had to make drinks with wine.
A cute place. The food is very delicious. I recommend you go by making a reservation.

name: Hugo's Restaurant
address: 8401 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews:
I love Hugos! I’ve come here with friends several times while in town and it is always good.
Staff are always lovely and helpful.
The food!! So many vegan/gluten free options are standard, you dont have to make many substitutions.
Drinks—I’ve had the turmeric ‘latte’ and a couple juices and they are always uplifting and tasty.

Im grateful for a spot that has such a considerate menu, great staff, and hosts gay events too 💚💚💚

I come here every time I’m in town...this is my favorite spot!! I really appreciate their carefulness and attentiveness to preparing food for those like myself with gluten allergies. Their menu has so many gluten free options!! The service is always great and the food is amazing!

We ordered CLUB SANDWICH (vegan) and Cinnamon swirl French toast. The sandwich was okay. I felt the flavors were less in the tofu. However, the French toast was yummy. I would go here again for the French toast.

Given the price, I didn't find the food taste worth it, however, the portion size is huge.

The service and the ambiance were good.

there is no gluten in this restaurant all the bread covered items on the menu are gluten free. you are going to pay for it but it's tasty, I took these photos offline because I forgot to take my own, but we (4 of us) shared nachos, chili fries, and fried chicken plate

Absolutely loved Hugo's! We went twice for breakfast and almost grabbed dinner too. Everything was incredible, especially for those with dietary restrictions. My wife has gluten intolerance, and they could make everything gluten-free! It wasn't just your basic eggs and bacon either - they had creative, chef-quality dishes. She loved the gluten-free cinnamon swirl French toast so much we asked if the bread was made in-house (it was!), and they even let us buy a loaf to take home!
Loved the classic architecture arches and stained glass also.

name: Le Petit Four
address: 8654 Sunset Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: I recently visited Le Petit Four and I must say, it's one of the best French restaurants I've experienced in Los Angeles. The owner was incredibly welcoming and friendly, adding a personal touch to our dining experience. We started with the snails, which were superb, followed by a Quiche Lorraine and Salade Niçoise for the entrées. Each dish was simply incredible, perfectly capturing the essence of French cuisine. The ambiance of the restaurant enhances the authentic French vibe, making it a must-visit for anyone in search of genuine French dining. I absolutely recommend Le Petit Four if you're looking for a top-notch French restaurant experience.

One of my favorite restaurants in LA. So French, and so Fun. You will feel like you are in France without having to shell out for the airfare.  Great people watching on the fabled Sunset Plaza. Parking is abundant in the huge lot just below Sunset Blvd. Incredible al fresco dining, minus the occasional noisemaker car (again, Why?) But the festive chatter of your dining neighbors is enough to make it a dreamy and romantic experience.

Alex and his incredibly hardworking and gracious staff make you feel so at home and well taken care of.  The menu is incredibly varied and always excellent. I've never been disappointed by a single dish and I try different meals when I am there.  Enough choices to satisfy everyone in your party.

This landmark is an LA Treasure! Get here while you can. The greatest places here can vanish.  Enjoy! Voila! Merci! XOXOX

The Calamari Steak is incredible. One of the best calamari dishes I've had in a long time. I ordered this dish as an appetizer and it was perfect to share with a few people.

The pizza wasn't bad, you're probably better off ordering a pizza from an Italian restaurant instead. Same goes with the pasta.

I was really upset with the Penne Le Petit Four. It was a bit too sweet, I was served this dish without parmesan cheese.

The environment is great, the parking is easy, and this is a great place to go for some french food.

This lunch was the highlight of our short time in LA. I still think about these crab cakes - they are a must. They were soft, fresh, and paired perfectly with both creamy dips. The service was lovely. We were given options about where to be seated: patio or indoors. For dessert, our server brought out a cake tray with the day’s freshly baked options. The napoleon was so satisfying. All in all happy with everything we ordered and would certainly be back again.

Great dinner while visiting WeHo! Hostest was great, also when I had questions about the desserts she brought the whole platter for me to see the assortment. Also, very much appreciated  was the fact they are all made fresh in house! Highly recommend!

name: Cavatina
address: 1200 Alta Loma Rd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews:
The best thing about this place is the atmosphere and the service. It’s beautiful and has a koi pond nearby and the service was excellent and the wait staff were extremely attentive.
Going to the food, the prime rib and chips were excellent !
However the cod and burrata were slightly below average, the cod was rubbery and the burrata was bland (despite the pesto pea spread).
The drink was slightly unbalanced for me , too much fennel / bitterness and lemon. But I understand that is subjective.
All in all, lovely experience especially if you’re staying at the sunset marquis.

Hidden gem here at Sunset Marquis!
We stayed 3 days here at the property the restaurant was a stones throw away from our villa and it did not disappoint!
The breakfast each morning was top notch, and the service as well.
They really know how to take care of their hotel guests. No matter what  request we threw at them. I cannot wait to return to the property, and this restaurant.
Very nice ambiance and setting, I ordered the salmon dish, it was delicious but the portions were very small overall.

I took my step kids here after my step daughter graduated from UCLA and they just loved it. Gorgeous atmosphere, great food, great drinks and excellent service. I had never had dinner, only lunch, before and I'd definitely do it again (when I'm finished paying off this meal 😋 😅).

High quality restaurant hidden in the heart of the Marquis Hotel with a rock star atmosphere where I personally had a great stake with a side of tomato and some macaroons dessert. Valet parking is also very friendly and it $10 with parking validation

name: Catch LA
address: 8715 Melrose Ave, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: Cool ambiance and space, but some of the food can be hit or miss. We went here for brunch and the Shakshuka and Poke Bowl were fine, but surprisingly the Burger was very underwhelming. We also got a side of Chicken Sausage that were pretty dry. Drinks are good up here and enjoyed the non-alcoholic Eye Opener shot which will perk you up! Their sorbet is pretty good and really enjoyed the Raspberry. Service was nice and friendly and no issues. Overall, love the space, but work can be made to their burgers!

Can’t say enough about Catch LA and how this was such a  delightful night. Wife and I were greeted from front door to the upper deck with the nicest staff ever. Hostess sat us within minutes of our  arrival. We got sat at a table that was a little cramped but turned out the seating was full with other amazing people like us.  Ended making friends with the surrounding tables. “Extra bonus that was”. Then  we were greeted with more friendly staff that gave us first timers run down on food specials and drinks.  Extremely knowledgeable and personable, staff that made you feel very comfortable  along with great recommendations.
