Timing of the food was spot on as we did the chefs choice which gave you a little bit of each one of there recommendations.  Followed up by an amazing visit from the manager as well, which really seals the deal as he was on top of everything  Thank you Loki and staff for the wonderful visit.  P.S.  before we left town the next day, we went back for brunch, and that was the same exact From beginning to end. Can’t wait to come back and visit soon. Thank you again for all your help and hospitality.

Catch LA is a delightful dining spot that offers a very pleasant and nice ambiance. The servers are highly proficient and attentive, providing excellent service throughout the meal. The food is great, with well-executed dishes that satisfy the palate.

The overall experience is highly enjoyable. The combination of the inviting atmosphere, skilled service, and delicious cuisine makes for a memorable dining experience. It's a great place to go with colleagues or friends, as the setting is conducive to both professional and social occasions.

If you're looking for a restaurant in LA that delivers on all fronts - ambiance, service, and food quality - Catch LA is a strong choice. It's a place where you can expect to have a great time while enjoying top-notch cuisine and hospitality. Both you and your dining companion are likely to come away impressed and satisfied with your experience at this excellent establishment.

This restaurant deserves to be one of the best. The first thing that delighted me was the interior. High level of professionalism of the staff, I would not have expected anything else. The food here is like art, it’s not just tasty, it’s beautiful. We ordered all the dishes on the menu for a group of eight people. Each dish left a pleasant aftertaste. And I got what I came here for - emotions.  Thanks.

First time at Catch. The staff were incredibly polite, which made all the difference. The food was delicious, and the drinks were excellent. Everything was perfect. I will definitely be back for another visit!

name: Madeo Restaurant
address: 8490 Sunset Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: Having explored every nook and cranny of Italy, I stumbled upon this hidden gem of a restaurant in Hollywood, CA  that exudes authenticity and purity. The pasta served here easily ranks among the top three I've ever tasted in my entire life. As for the Ossobuco, it surpasses any previous encounter I've had with this dish, leaving an indelible mark on my taste buds. Each plate presented an exquisite blend of textures and an unrivaled richness that truly elevated the dining experience to stellar heights. The desserts, oh, the desserts! They were a sinful indulgence, transporting me to a realm of pure bliss. The drinks, meticulously crafted, were nothing short of perfection. The service and hospitality bestowed upon us were unparalleled, with every detail attended to by the attentive and genuinely sincere staff. To my astonishment, the owners themselves graced our table, ensuring our utmost satisfaction. This remarkable establishment deserves not just five or even a hundred stars, but a staggering 10,000 stars.

The food and service at this restaurant are exceptional. I highly recommend this beautiful establishment. Their gnocchi is delectable, and their margherita pizza, though not on the menu (just ask for it), is simply divine. The cocktails are top-notch, and the napoleon cake is the best I've ever tasted.

The Best Italian restaurant in the City 👌🏼
Family owned and operated with a stacked menu that anyone with taste buds can appreciate. This treat does not come cheap… you’ll need to have deep pockets to enjoy this meal or save up because it’s worth it! But be ready for a hefty bill and make sure you save room for the most decadent mouthwatering desserts. Madeo’s is an authentic Italian top tier Restaurant, one of the cities leading and most renowned celebrity filled dining establishments. Highly recommended and loved by all who have had the pleasure to experience it  🥰 Thank you for treating all of us like your familia Madeo!🍝❤️

My favourite restaurant in LA - without a doubt! I almost don’t want to post about it as I don’t want more people to find out about it (it’s already hard enough to get a table there as is…) but it is one of the few in West LA that is worth the price you pay. Everything tastes exquisite. The service is exceptional. The ambience is impeccable. It somehow combines both the intimacy of a family-run place (which it is) with the elegance of this type of environment carries. The owner comes out to greet you every night. Birthdays, graduations, visitors in town… this is always where I take them. I highly recommend the penne Madeo, risotto and millefeuille.

The food was great but the constant looks and whispers in our direction from our waitress and other staff members  made the whole night very uncomfortable for myself and coworkers. We felt very judged and talked about. I would understand if someone was being loud or out of line but that was not the case. The staff should learn not to turn up their noses at people bc our money is just as green as theirs. They should remember they are an employee not a patron. We may have been scouting this location to bring clients to but that is out of the question now!

name: Boxwood Restaurant & Bar
address: 1020 N San Vicente Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: Stellar bottomless brunch on the weekends, it lasts till 5 pm Saturdays & Sundays! And it is bottomless in every way…food and drink. A luxury, since I hark from Boston where this is a rare sight :) Lovely presentation for each dish and the dining area is tucked away in the hotel, so it’s one of the most peaceful & quiet  brunching experiences I’ve had!

This is truly a hidden gem!!! I went for brunch and everything from food presentation to taste was amazing! The bottomless brunch was 100% worth it and great value for the price! The staff was so attentive and friendly especially Matthew. I will definitely come back when I visit LA again!

The Most beautiful Brunch rooftop. Came with my mom on mother's day and we enjoyed it so much. There were plenty of options to choose from. I'm vegan and they gave me a burger and a cauliflower steak. The staff is extremely nice and friendly. We will definitely be back. The rooftop views are beautiful and there are plenty of umbrellas☂️ Take an Uber you will drink a lot of mimosas/ Bellinis🤗

One of the best hidden restaurants in LA because it’s in the London hotel but it’s truly exceptional. Highly recommend going here even if you’re not staying at the hotel. I’ve prob ate here 50 times and have never had a bad meal.

Highly recommended! Took my son here for his birthday as he had been banging on about eating Gordan Ramsey’s food after watching too much Hells Kitchen. The dishes are pricey but that’s to be expected for a $$$ restaurant. The potion is good as you can see from the photos and you will be full. The menu does change but you won’t be disappointed.
The atmosphere was ambient and chill. Our server was French which added some authentication to it serving British/European dishes. The restaurant is inside of the hotel so be careful with your Uber if they don’t go into the hotel driveway. Best to stand on the main road to avoid your Uber trying to leave so quickly and charge you.

name: Tesse Restaurant
address: 8500 W Sunset Blvd Ste B, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews:
We recently went to Tesse and tried their DineLA menu which was $55 per person for dinner.

We ordered a couple of blue cheese  martini's which were quite small for $32 each and took forever to come out because they were short-staffed that evening.  I can't even imagine how small the martini on their specialty menu is which was described as "tiny" and even smaller than the ones we got.

For the 1st course we got the poblano beignets which came with 4 absolutely delicious pieces.  10/10.

For the 2nd course we got the beef tartare which was also amazing.  It was a small portion but still a satisfying amount.  It came covered in potato chips which we used to scoop it up. 10/10

The 3rd course was the bone marrow bucatini which would have been much tastier if it came out warm but it didn't. I can tell it would have been pretty tasty though but the coldness kind of killed it.   7/10.

The 4th course was black cod which was pretty bland and disappointing.  It was a bit soupy and came with summer squash and zucchini which was also boring, 2/10.  We got the duck fat fries as the side which were nothing special.  They would have been better if they were crispier, 7/10.

We love onion rings and though these were not part of the DineLA menu we decided to order them and they did not disappoint.   They were battered exactly how we like them. 9/10.

The desert was sticky toffee pudding which was, unfortunately, a let-down.  The cake portion tasted burnt.   The only thing that made it edible was the toffee syrup and scoop of ice cream but the scoop was too small. 5/10

Overall, I think this restaurant was overpriced for what we got.  Maybe doing the DineLA menu was a mistake.  The meal climaxed way too early.   I don't think we would go back.

Some of the food was delicious some was disgusting the pancakes burnt, the hash/rib/egg is a really bad combo uneatable Truffle fries and avocado toast are good! Our waitress Itzel was rude and highly unprofessional and they were understaffed or something. I had to ask twice for water when we were under 100+ degrees today Asked for bread came way too late and they had the nerve to charge me $10 for a piece of bread that arrived after we finished eating!! I didn’t even need it anymore Each time we needed something we had to wait for at least 15-25minutes!!! No paper towel in the bathrooms

Delicious food and cocktails. We were impressed by the marrow pasta and all the cocktails we got. The service was great, and it was lovely talking to the sommelier lady. The atmosphere was great with live music that was just the right volume to create a romantic setting without being disruptive. The friendly host knew we had a show to attend after our dinner and even checked-in on us at some point to see if we were doing good on time.

We had an absolutely incredible time during our first experience at Tesse! Wow! From the exceptional food to the epic service… we were totally blown away. It was one of the best meals we have ever had and will definitely be back. The all you can tesse experience was one for the books. Wow! Special shout out to Alicia, Blithe and Alexandra for amazing service. Highly recommend this incredible restaurant for any occasion.
Had a Father's Day Brunch! The Rib Hash was a real winner, along with the Benedict. The star of the show was the melt-in-your-mouth French Toast!

name: Olivetta
address: 9010 Melrose Ave, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: Had a lovely time at Olivetta. This was our second time at this restaurant and it was just as tasty as the first time. Definitely go here later in the day if you care about the vibes, the dim lighting is much more suited to this restaurant than the amount of light let in through the skylight during the day. The food is fantastic, I had the branzino and it was perfectly cooked and seasoned and my girlfriend got the bone marrow pasta and said that that dish is the reason why we will keep coming back. The non alcoholic cocktails were also delightful.

We booked Olivetta for an early Valentine’s Day dinner, based on its popularity and reputation. I would not classify it as fine dining, more so a really good Italian restaurant that specializes in drinks, and a more upscale and lively vibe versus a traditional fine dining restaurant like Madeo up on W Sunset. I would say it’s a great place to bring a date or dinner with friends or family, and not so much a work dinner location. The inside is beautifully done and has some great colors. There are tapestries all along the walls with lots of plants dividing the dining areas and a very muted red color that really adds to the ambience. They don’t have a dedicated parking lot, it will be valet or metered street parking. You have to check in with security street side first and then they let you walk up the ramp where you will next check in with the hostess. They have a large bar area as well as a lot of different seating options. Our table was extremely small, however, and the tables were very close together so this is not the sort of place that you’ll be able to have a private or sensitive conversation. Our server was very polite, although took quite some time to take our order initially but overall, I think he did a great job. The music is quite loud here so if someone has hearing issues they will really struggle to hear others at their table.

They have a fairly large menu with a lot of great options on it. We started off with a Squash Blossoms, which were absolutely fantastic. I have ordered these all over town and this is definitely one of the better versions. I was a bit disappointed that it only comes with three which is a hard number to share so I wish the portion size would’ve been a bit larger for this. Next we followed with the Caesar Salad and it was great. Again, not a very large sized portion, but still tasty flavorwise. For my entrée, I chose the Creste Di Gallo because having the bone marrow scooped in right before you eat is an unbeatable addition to me. It was a true treat. I love bone marrow anything so this was great pasta. The bone marrow itself added a great flavor and a crunch to the meal, which I truly loved. We also ordered the special for the day, which was the Dungeness Crab Tagliatelle. It was absolutely fantastic and had a ton of crab on it. The sauce was truly what made the dish and the pasta was cooked perfectly. For dessert we topped off the meal with the Brown Sugar Budino and I definitely would recommend it. It was sweet and salty and actually a great sized portion. it was a great end of the meal.

Overall, I would say Olivetta is a great date spot. It’s very lively and very noisy but in a fun way. They play the music quite loud so it has a very Friday night kind of feel to it. I would recommend and will try it again sometime in the near future.

Celebrated my anniversary here yesterday and hands down this can be my favorite go to. The ambiance so was romantic and European. We walked in and they gave us Champaign on the house because we were celebrating our anniversary which was nice. The waitress was beyond helpful. Whatever she recommended is what we got and wow 10/10. For cocktails i had the tequila + carrot which sounded weird but I gave it a shot and it was amazing! The crispy squash blossom was so delicious!!! My favorite thing on the menu. We also had the shaved fennel salad which was very good and refreshing. My husband had the Radiatore which is a lamb bolognese, we were skeptical about ordering that dish because it might be very over powering with lamb but the waitress told us its half lamb and half beef so we gave it a try and it was DELICIOUS!Must try! I definitely recommend this restaurant.

Californian upscale dining in WeHo. Made a reservation for 6:30pm online beforehand but we had to be seated a bit late since traffic is atrocious. Metered street parking and valet parking available. Indoor dining only. Credit cards accepted. We were a bit apprehensive about how the dining experience would be given the other negative reviews lambasting the service, but everyone was so pleasant. Our waiter checked in on us often and we always had a full glass of water.

We had the squash blossoms stuffed with ricotta (3) and baked prawns (4) to split as apps. I got the raviolo from their truffle menu; it was the first time I had such a giant stuffed pasta and this is also what made me realize ravioli is the plural form of the word. My sister got the bone marrow pasta which they cut and topped right before serving, and my dad got the lobster bucatini. The bucatini was fresh and cooked al dente. For dessert, we ended with the chocolate ball. I was unfortunate to have missed the melting of the ball since I was in the restroom but the dessert itself was tasty.
Enjoyed our night out at Olivetta, a sophisticated venue with interesting decor and artwork. Highlights included the branzino combined with the fennel salad. Great cocktails too.

name: Irv's Burgers
address: 7998 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90046, USA
reviews:
Love the burgers!! The customer service was top notch and the burgers were amazing. We tried the single and double burger with everything on it, both were great and had that smash burger quality (nice and crispy on the outside but juicy on the inside).

We practically inhaled those burgers and the fries were so good, we got both the chilli cheese fries and the regular fries. They tasted great, nothing revolutionary or unheard of, just delicious. And this was all to go, unfortunately parking was abysmal. Be prepared to look.

Irv's Original Roadside Double Burger / two patties,  American cheese, tomato, lettuce, onions, Irv's sauce, on a toasted bun - 5 🌟!
Crispy French fries - 5 🌟!

The burger landscape in Los Angeles is robust and bountiful. Irv's is often on the top or near the top of many burger lists. My biggest burger regret is that it took me a long time to actually go and try them out. They've been open and serving their amazing burgers for a long time.

The burger was fantastic. It was high quality beef, meaty with a lot of flavor and expertly cooked. The cheese was melty and balanced the beefy flavors. I always like getting a burger the way the restaurant recommends it, and their style is a classic combo.

I think the Irv's sauce is based on Thousand Island dressing. It was perfect.

They go with crispy, thin fries, and they serve a big basket. Of course I ate everything I ordered. How could I not when everything is this good!

I went on a Sunday and found street parking. This location may get tricky for parking other times of the day or week since it's in a busy spot for restaurants and bars.

The two star is for not accepting cash and the roadside being cheaper if you just build your burger the exact same way?

The “we don’t take cash” was the first time I walked all the way there to try it.

Second try was alright, but underwhelming

Third I was denied because “their system was down” and they could only take cash.

Pretty annoying

(I’ve since bumped it to a three star for better service) the food is good.

*This is like eating burgers at your favorite cousins house if you had to pay😂*

I’m always up to try a new burger spot & I’ve driven pass this spot a few times. I decide to find parking and give Irv’s a try.

The entire vibe feels like family! The guy on the register was super cool! It’s not like it was a huge moment but I took forever to decide and this guy was cool!

I’m not a food critic but this was a great burger! I wasn’t expecting this burger to be so full of flavor! I would’ve gotten two😂
I also had an hotdog unseen in the pics because you know hunger won!

They have a small inside eating area that is picnic style so you’re sitting next to strangers which is fun because I chatted with a guy that ended up being a Supreme reseller 🫶🏾 got myself some exclusive Supreme items for    Free!

Also they left a cute note on my bag like when you were in grade school!

Check this spot out & talk in the picnic area!🕺🏾

We came here because the branding looked curious and we like trying new burger spots 👀 Once we checked out the menu we learned that they also serve sandwiches, dogs, shakes and chili fries. I loved my BLT and my family loved the burgers. We all noticed that they had a lean feeling (for burgers of course) and the quality was better than many fast food places. I loved the rye bread on my BLT and the chili fries were bomb! “They make their chili in house” PS this spot has been around since 1949; they just moved location about 10 years ago! We’ll definitely be back for more 🫶🏻

name: Laurel Hardware
address: 7984 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90046, USA
reviews:
As a party of 9 celebrating post-graduation, we visited Laurel Hardware, and it certainly lived up to our expectations. Here’s what stood out:

1. Ambiance and Aesthetics: Laurel Hardware boasts a lively and well-designed ambiance. The crowd, food, and drinks create an amazing aesthetic that sets the tone for a memorable dining experience.

2. Cocktails: The drinks here are top-notch! Whether you're sipping on refreshing cocktails or memorable margaritas, it's a great way to kick off any celebration.

3. Food: While some dishes were merely okay, others were outstanding. We highly recommend trying the truffle fries, sticky pork ribs, and duck fried rice.

This place is AMAZING. Came with a group of four and ordered a bunch of things off the menu to share family style, and everything was excellent, including drinks. It's a little pricey, but that's expected for the area and ambiance. My only complaint is that apparently all of their fried foods share the same oil so my wife wasn't able to have any fried foods because she's allergic to shellfish and they fry everything, including shellfish, in the same oil. Seems a bit dangerous to me, but I'm happy we were asked about allergies, and this was disclosed to us by our server.
I'd definitely come again.

Tried out Laurel Hardware with a friend while we visited the area. Food overall was tasty and the atmosphere inside was interesting. Service was fine and the drinks were above average. Overall the vibes were a tad pretentious for what you get, but it's a good dinner option.

Came here for lunch for the first time and had a wonderful server named Allison. She was very attentive and gave great service. The shrimp tacos are a must. The food is perfect for sharing and everything tastes fresh and flavorful. Definitely one of my go to spots in LA.

Absolutely outstanding food, service and drinks!  Very accommodating as my son was so happy to be wearing his Mario hat from Universal and the staff made him smile with compliments.  The drinks are top notch and unlike many places where  only a certain dish is excellent this establishment has it all!  Everything we ordered was absolutely fantastic!  Unlocking DFW Communities will definitely feature it in a future video!

name: Saddle Ranch Chop House
address: 8371 Sunset Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews:
As you walk through the large velvet curtains, you enter into a barn-like wooden structure with all sorts of western memorabilia, signs, saddles, and the like. Saddle Ranch is a fun and boisteeous country-themed old west bar located in West Hollywood. Exemplary table service but sitting at the bar can be entertaining on its own. Take a spin on the mechanical bull ($5), which was on the low setting during our visit. 👍🏼

The many, many TV screens play a never-ending selection of great old 80s and 90s music videos, which were fun to watch.

Food was inexpensive and most dishes were very ample; lots of drink choices. Our neighboring table ordered the mountainous cotton candy martini, which was visually amazing. The large valet parking lot is $10.

This is a West Hollywood staple. You absolutely must come. Food is great. Vibe is even better. You can make reservations on OpenTable. I do recommend. It’s gets very busy after 8pm. Bar is open seating.

We ended up sitting at the bar, even though we had a reservation. We just loved the bartenders and were having too much fun to move to a table. It was a great decision.

Our service was quick and very accurate. Both bartenders were nothing other than professional. They were really on it with customers who came in over served. It was really cool to watch how the bartenders had full control of their bar and the experience the patrons were having. Absolutely outstanding.

We ordered the mound of nachos. So good. A ton of food. Could feed four. We got the mini burgers. Also great. We got tots instead of fries. Sooo good. We got the banana bread pudding for dessert. Perfect sweet treat to wrap up the meal with.

I can’t say enough great things about Saddle Ranch. I’ve been coming for over 15 years now. Thank You for always delivering!

I am definitely coming back here the next time I come to cali. The food was absolutely amazing and the service was amazing both the managers and the servers were very attentive. I was told to come here by heath and he did not disappoint! 10/10.

We went for dinner around midnight. It's great they serve food so late!

The staff was very polite and friendly and they kept checking if we needed something else.

We had the burger and the tacos and they were both decent.

Inside it was too loud for me, so we sat outside. It had heaters so the temperature was good.

Definetely recommend for a late night dinner.

Was starving before a comedy show and decided to hit this spot up. Glad I came here. Got the quesadilla. The food was delicious! And the service was great. Drinks were not watered down. And the decor is super cool.

name: Craig's
address: 8826 Melrose Ave, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews:
My husband got us a reservation since we were in town for vacation. The service and atmosphere were great. The food was just okay. I had the short ribs, they were very tender but bland. The calamari were fried to perfection. Chicken Parmigiana, Lobster Diavolo, and Salmon were just okay. The margarita I make at home tastes a lot better than the one I had at the restaurant. I only took a few sips and didn’t drink the rest.
I definitely expected better since it’s a popular restaurant. But it was all about the experience and we did see a few celebrities.

I’d heard a lot about this place so I knew I needed to check it out when I came to California. And man, the hype was real. Service was amazing from start to finish, staff were all super friendly and attentive and made great conversation with us! Food was incredible too, probably some of the best chicken parm I’ve ever tried. Yes it may be a little pricey, but it’s worth it to come here at least every once in a while. The ambience don’t miss either!

Great place. Staff is very attentive but gives you your space at the same time. I asked for suggestions, and all suggestions hit THE SPOT. I just wish the fishes came with some sort of sides. I got the bone in ribeye (medium rare, chard) it was PERFECT, but it needed a side of mash or veggies, and it didn't have that. But over all me and my fiance had a memorable time.

Ohh, Craig’s. My favorite restaurant and filet in all of Los Angeles. The perfect traditional steakhouse - great cuts of meat with outstanding flavor, a fantastic selection of tasty sides (creamed corn & brussel sprouts are my favorite), warm bread, delicious strong cocktails, mahogany bar & walls, and a perfect music playlist really allow for an enjoyable evening here every time. Always terrific service, friendly staff, and a really fun buzz inside. Never too loud, always just right. And you never know who could walk through that door. Craig’s, thank you for a delightful dining experience every time.
Lovely dining experience. Food and service were great. A good spot for locals or visitors!

name: Employees Only Restaurant and Bar
address: 7953 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90046, USA
reviews: I go to the NY bar all the time. It's one of my favorite bars in the world and for sure I'm going to compare the two. It's very chill here, it has a different bar in the back and a stage area. The interior is very ... Los Angeles. You get the impression that perhaps this place used to be a dinner.  The drinks are just as good and they have their own unique drinks and cocktails here.  Definitely try the Magic School Bus if it's still on the menu.  A must go for anyone who frequents the NY Bar.

The best and only place for delicious drinks and unique ambience. Their drink menu is out of this world. I come here often, so last time when I got bored with the menu, the bartender made his own creations by request based on my preference. Always a good crowd and a good conversation with the staff! 100% recommend it for a date night, casual night out with friends, really good food and the best drinks in this pet of town.

Drinks are solid here. I came here a few times and there was always a solid crowd.

Seats are not hard to find if you come late. It's a pretty pack around 11pm, but slows down a little after midnight.

There is a DJ on Fridays and some room for people to dance.

Vibe vibe vibe! Drinks were delish with a unique “Employees Only” logo engraved in the large ice. We enjoyed a great selection of whisky cocktails and to top it all off, chicken noodle soup for last call! Great experience and establishment!

I was a vendor at this venue, so I didn't drink or eat food. The guests seemed pleased with the dronks and were sharing positive feedback about them. Staff were helpful, pleasant,  and professional, creating a comfortable,  classy atmosphere.  The club was uniquely configured and seemed to have plenty of room for a party or club gathering. I was in the back bar area with a large bar, room for dancing, tables for eating, and enough room for an ice sculpting on the bartop.  There was a photo booth area and space left for me to serve my clients with a medium length table and 2 benches.
I took Lyft in, but there was valet parking.  Street parking was challenging and not  available. There was parking beside the building, but it looked like valet parking had control of that area.
The venue had a great sound system, and the DJ and a couple of Live performers were the front dance floor area. There was also a smaller bar in the front area. The music was TOO loud for my taste because customers could barely hear me. Thank goodness I had a portable amplifier. But it went out towards the end of the event, and I had to use a piece of  hard paper to create a makeshift megaphone 📣 .  Also, it was very dark in my corner of the back bar area but I always bring a small desk lamp 🔦 to all my events JUST IN CASE. The rest if the back bar and front dance floor were lit for a normal bar/ party experience.  I recommend you check out if you would like to party. I was at this location for a 300-year celebration of a libations company, and their staff was having a blast.

name: Electric Owl
address: 1451 N Gardner St, West Hollywood, CA 90046, USA
reviews:
Super cute spot and great vibes here! I last went a couple years ago for Happy Hour and I remember drinks were cheap and yummy plus they had a bunch of gluten free options.

I went back with high expectations and the food was yummy but there were limited options for gluten allergies. I got the L.A. Smash Burger and the House Salad. The dressing on the salad was unique and delicious and the burger was good, but since I needed it to be gluten free and bun-less, I’m not sure if it was worth $17!

I was very impressed as I walked in past the stylish bar and we were seated inside late in the evening. It was easy to hear each other (very important to me) and the almost perfect soft lighting and decor was ambient and pleasant.

As we started reviewing the menu I was impressed to see two small rechargeable lamps on the backs of our booth so moved them to the table where all 5 of us were switching our aggressive phone lights on to try to read the small texted menus.

I was flabbergasted when one of the staff removed the lights from our table pretty aggressively and told me the lights were only meant for decor. I explained we couldn't read the menus in the lighting and he simply reassured me I should use my phone and could leave if I wanted to. I requested to speak to the manager to which he explained he was the manager. I left the table to speak to him directly and respect my friends and his solution was to offer me the door again.

Not sure about my friends but I found the spaghetti Arrabiata to have well cooked spaghetti, great portion size (not too big) but it didn't have much flavor except salty and spicy.

Overall the prices seemed very reasonable, the wait staff attentive and I really enjoyed the experience, save the lighting saga.

I looked to speak to the manager as we left to see if he had anything more to say to me, alas he was nowhere to be seen.

I'd easily give this place a 4 or 5 star rating for all the other reasons but in my life I've never had an experience like this in the 30+ countries I've been to.

I highly recommend a customer service course for the manager.

Really fantastic environment. I wasn't sure what to think about when the menu looked so basic, but the food they made was all the pleasures of life with the right balance of flavors and exceptionally prepared. I also got a cocktail because they looked amazing in the pictures I saw online and they didn't disappoint. I got a tangy margarita. Their mains were a bit expensive so I didn't indulge in that, but pasta, pizza, and burgers were reasonably priced for a nice night out. 10/10 would come back again.

A cool place for cocktails and small bites. Was surprised by the quality of my burger especially since their afternoon menu is so small. We had tomatoes and burrata as well but the portion of burrata was quite small. The cocktail I had was pretty good as well. We had to place our orders at the bar which is fine but I do prefer actually being served at my table. The atmosphere is cool and they allow dogs on their back patio. Do recommend, I'm sure I'll return as it's in my neighborhood.

Really great spot for a nice and casual meal. Great drinks, I suggest the tequila tang. I've tried most of their menu at this point and while their menu does change from time to time, my current favorites are the butternut squash soup, the spicy vodka pasta, and the brussel sprouts. I've had mixed experiences with the pizza, on non-crowded nights it was great and on crowded nights we experienced slightly charred pizza and just barely cooked pizza (but we also showed up in the last 90 minutes of service and like I said, the place was packed). Smash burger is pretty solid as well. Definitely on the pricier side but very good. Staff has always been incredible. I haven't tried the wings yet so no comment there. Give it a go!

name: Saltie Girl
address: 8615 Sunset Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: We were a group of 4 girls and ordered the right amount of food! Hard to pick just one item but the highlight of the dinner was the burrata with caviar. Everything was excellent! Beautiful ambiance sitting outside.

Great addition to Sunset Plaza! Food was solid. The warm lobster roll was the winner of the night. Also loved the torched salmon belly, crispy branzino, crab toast and calamari. Drinks are delicious, loved the pear cocktail and the espresso martini is perfection. The ginger bundt cake was also stellar. We also ordered the dover sole and for $80, it was disappointing. The texture was very rubbery. Our server, Rosie, was fantastic - very attentive and professional. Knocked off a star because at the end of the night, the hostess told us to leave the table for the next reservation. I totally understand that, but there’s a nice, polite way to say it instead of demanding it. Definitely ended the night on a bit of a downer. I would come back, but maybe hang out at the bar with the yummy drinks and a lobster roll

One of the best seafood meals I’ve had and such a lovely experience! The clam chowder, scallop sashimi, mussels, the Lobster roll and amazing fish dishes were all prepared perfectly! Everything we had was delicious and the service was top notch. Great for a special dinner and I suggest the “Saltie” Martini, you won’t be disappointed!
Insider tip: There’s free parking in the back and Brunch on the weekends!

I was really excited to try this place but it was pretty over-hyped for the food quality and price (I had heard great things about the Boston location). Ordered the raw bar shrimp ($8 each and not properly cleaned), the salmon crudo, and a lobster roll which was fine. I liked the atmosphere and they had a bunch of nice non-alcoholic drinks on the menu.

Believe the hype about this Boston based restaurant which made its way to the west coast.  Made reservations on Resy and that was such a good decision.   This a great restaurant to enjoy your “see-food” diet.   I see the food and just want to eat it.   Even before I got there there were so many items on menu that I wanted to try.     We ordered several dishes to share: the crispy blue fin tuna roll, 1/2 dozen oysters, torched salmon belly, calamari and the lobster roll.

Let’s get right to the point- the lobster roll melts in your mouth, it’s phenomenal and after ordering just one to share this was the one regret as I wanted more and could have devoured it all by myself.  Its market price so ended up being $42.  Now it’s on the pricey side but definitely worth it and was more than satisfied.  Loved the service, vibe and especially the food.

Was already planning our next dinner while we were eating our dinner.  Parking was easy as they have a parking lot in the back.

name: SUR Restaurant and Lounge
address: 606-614 N Robertson Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: My sister and I had a brunch celebration after my graduate school graduation ceremony. It was a five-star experience from the minute we walked in the door. What a fabulous host and fabulous bar staff. We enjoyed our cocktails, croissant French toast, goat cheese balls and other delicious treats! The atmosphere was gorgeous and laid back at the same time. We are planning another trip from Texas and definitely another visit!

As a huge fan of Vanderpump rules, I had been eager to try this restaurant for years. It did not disappoint! What really impressed me was the interesting menu. I saw dishes I’ve never seen before in my life. The hibiscus smoked salmon was incredible, what a unique and fun combination of flavours. Thank you for the great time!

Had an awesome time at this place. A very nice meal, drinks and very attentive waiter who made sure everything was ok and dietary requirements were met without any worry. The place turns into a club disco with fab music and they had a beautiful singer there, although embarrassingly I didn't notice until she sat in front of me singing! I thought it was another great song! What a voice she had, wow! Lovely meal, lovely place, definitely recommended.

I came here for a surprise birthday party and it was incredible! The staff were friendly and attentive; our server was very knowledgeable and made wonderful suggestions! The scallops that were on special were wonderful. I loved everything we had! The entire place is gorgeous too, looking forward to experiencing this again soon. Highly recommend. Be sure to make reservations

Came here during happy hour -> dinner.

The staff was very accommodating when we came over without a reservation and with a fairly large party. They noticed that we just came fresh from a Graduation ceremony and promptly opened up a room for us, and allowed us to loiter in there eating small dishes until their dinner service was ready.

Starting off with the happy hour food.
1) Skip the Sliders, this was just OK, but not worth the price nor the food space
2) Fries, these fries were fried where it still had a crunch with a fluffy inside, even after cooling down. The fries themselves were already seasoned, there was no need for any ketchup
3) Chip and Cheese Dip, the cheese string pull was amazing and the dip itself was jam packed with flavor

Onwards to the dinner portion.
1) The Tuna Tartare was alright, wasn't particularly outstanding but overall was decent
2) The Fish Dish, it was slightly spicy, the kind where it's there and you feel it, but it also didnt linger too long, nor did it make you scurry for the water. The fish itself was also pretty tender, it had a delightful fish flavor and it tore away fairly easily.

name: Stella West Hollywood
address: 8899 Beverly Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90048, USA
reviews: Stella is quickly becoming one of my favorite places to dine in LA. Amazing food. Excellent service. If you're into crudo, order the table-side Hamachi. It's everything! There is also a very different vibe on the first floor. It's actually a floor down from the main floor. It has an open concept kitchen and a viewing window for the fresh pasta makers of the restaurant.

I had wonderful attentive service as a single diner. I sat at the bar near the kitchen as a walk in.  It was fun to watch everything. My only caveats is that since they are running open flame they blast the AC which I appreciated but I sometimes felt like I was sitting in a wind tunnel.  Not their fault, I could've chosen to sit elsewhere. My only note for seating to the restaurant is they need to add grips to the bottom of the chairs. If I turned a bit in my chair, the chair would slide. And the chair is not that comfortable. It felt low for a counter stool and the seat narrows so I was often shifting in my seat and then I would get further and further away from the table and had to awkwardly scoot up. And I think the people sitting a few seats down had the same issue.  They had to extend their legs awkwardly out to create tension for sitting.

The pasta is fantastic! I had the octopus pasta and it was cooked well and was delicious.  It's a little bit spicy and the pasta was a unique shape. I had the king fish crudo which was lovely, and a seasonal melon salad that had fresh melon and pickled melon which I found interesting but would probably never order again.  I liked the eggplant side but the pasta! I did really love the pasta.

The ambience and style is gorgeous.

One last thought - - better towels for the bathroom.

But would definitely come again.

There's valet but I found street parking on a side street and there's two hour metered parking on the same street.

Had an amazing dinner at Stella’s! Every dish from the appetizers to the desserts was perfection. The pasta tasted like it was made fresh in-house, and the flavors were just incredible. The staff made us feel so welcome, adding to the whole experience. It’s clear they put a lot of love into their food and service. Can’t wait to go back!

I had the pleasure of dining at Stella on their first night of service and I have to say I was blown away. The design by prominent restaurant designer Wendy Hayworth is stunning with attention to detail to inspire. You feel transported to another place and time with luxury and artistry at every turn from the lighting to the vintage glasses and elegant plateware. The music really made the vibe something special including some of my unexpected and favorite early 2000s r&b jams. The right music can take the vibe to a 10- and this was it for us!

Now on to the food and drinks, every dish impressed us with it's fresh high quality ingredients, beautiful and creative presentation and  plating , and delicious robust flavors. Chef Rob Gentile is indeed a star with incredible attention to detail in all of this dishes. My favorite in experiential presentation and taste was the tableside carved branzino carpaccio. The Salmon was a close second. As simple as it was the citrus salad was divine too! To top it off, as a very Italian restaurant you never know, but they happily accommodated my gluten free and dairy free dietary restrictions :) Their cocktails were beautiful and well balanced.

This would be a spectacular place for a private event or private dining from the patio to the two private dining rooms and giant bars and captivating spaces on two levels- I can't wait to bring back friends and clients and entertain here.

The service was exceptional. It was not pretentious, very warm welcoming and fun with the utmost VIP hospitality. Stella was exceptional and the experience was worth the price- you must celebrate here!!

Tired of the same scene-to-be-seen high end Italian place? Want to experience some of the best and truly delicious Italian food in Los Angeles? Try Stella. Gorgeous interiors, attentive without being intrusive service, and some standout food (and wide ranging menu) in a part of LA where you’d normally see women pick at their food. They’re eating here and smiling. Standout dishes: eggplant parmigiana side dish, mortadella & pistachio pizza, and any dessert. Well worth the price tag and a great date spot…or just a place to feel yourself and eat wonderful food.

name: Tail O' the Pup
address: 8512 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews:
Tail o' the Pup is a classic hot dog stand that has been around the Los Angeles scene since 1946. As well as with Pinks, it is one of the longest lived hot dog stands in this neck of the woods.
The original stand survives to this day and was in the Beverly center before moving it to WeHo on Santa Monica Blvd.
They offer a variety of food, which is normal fare for the Hot dig stand variety. Burgers, French fries, milkshakes, and the like.  Obviously, their specialty are the dogs in which the name of the establishment proudly has in its moniker.
The dogs have a nice snap to them, and are cooked well throughout. You have a variety of different versions available to you such as Chicago, chili, ballpark, dogs famous through their respective years.
The choices are endless.
It's historical. It's a nice nook to escape from the Los Angeles insanity. It's a time capsule of delicious proportions. Come on down and let the Dogs convince you on their own.

We’ve been wanting to go here ever since it re-opened and it didn't disappoint. We are not a huge fan of hot dogs in general, but if we were to go out for a dog, this place is near the top of the list. The dogs had a good snap to them and tasted delish. The chili was peppery with a slight kick; perfect for a topping on the dog or fries. Plenty of seating indoors or outside. They even have the coca-cola mix machines so you can create any flavor combo you like. Our only gripe was that it is fairly expensive for the portion size. I expected more fries and a larger dog for the prices they charge. Bathroom was clean. Depending on time of day, parking could be tough.

Such a great place with so much history!  Hands down the best hot dogs we have ever had!  Loved the adorable puppy hot dog trays.  Service was good.  Everyone was very nice.  A bit pricey for hot dogs and fries, but happy to pay it for a small, historic, business.

Horrible experience in restaurant. Food was gross, the corn dog looked like it was petrified from hell. The regular hotdogs were sloppily dressed and tasted staler than a 7-11 dog. It was comical to watch a bureaucratic process from line level to manager to figure out to change out a soap dispenser in the bathroom. I’m not going waste my waste my time detailing further but the soap dilemma seemed like something out of an SNL skit given the level of disfunction between the staff. Never will go again.
Food was really good. Vegan options. A lot of mentally ill unhoused people around who kept getting really close to me. So that made me feel unsafe.

name: Pura Vita
address: 8274 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90046, USA
reviews: The food here is decent, but pricey (though many restaurants in West Hollywood are expensive). I got a special panzanella salad starter that was good, though pretty small for $16. Lasagna was good, and I liked the house made cheese in it a lot, though I thought the tomato sauce tasted a bit sweet for my tastes. Pizza was a bit greasier than what I prefer for Neapolitan style. I really love and appreciate that there is such a special vegan Italian restaurant in LA, though I do wish the food was a bit less expensive. The staff was wonderful! Very friendly and attentive.

Wow! This place is awesome! They certainly captivated the tight spaced dining experience just like it is in italy, (not sure if that was on purpose or coincidence) but it was spot on! When we first walked in, we were hesitant because it just looked like a bar because the entrance was just the bar area, but when we went inside we were meeted with a kind waiter who lead us to the dining area and got us started. The food is spectacular, and you couldn’t even tell it is a vegan restaurant! We got the grilled citrus herb tofu and that was so delicious and the sauce was so light and creamy. Love the addition of pesto as well. We also got the Polpettine appetizer which are basically just vegan meatballs and my god they were so good. Then our mains came out and I got the seasonal pasta menu item which was a pea and lemon herb creamy sauce pasta which was so flavorful and light and just perfect for the spring time. My mother got the eggplant parmigiana and she told me it was indeed delicious. This was the best restaurant i’ve been to in the area so far! But the bill certainly did hurt the bank, but the company and food was worth it.

I love this place!!!!! One of my favorite vegan restaurants around and who does not love pizza and pasta!?!!  A true Italian gem and you don't even need to be vegan to enjoy this place. ANYTHING you order... Let me repeat.... ANYTHING you order will not disappoint. Baked ricotta, mozzarella sticks, pizza, Caesar salad, pasta... It is all excellent! The wine selection is incredible as well. I love the romantic atmosphere but would recommend playing Italian music to match the concept of the restaurant. It's usually rockabilly or blues/rock which is great for the pizzeria and I love that music, but I would rather hear Dean Martin or Sinatra. The servers are super friendly but at times, they zoom past your table and you have to flag them down. I look forward to dining here for brunch as it looks AMAZING! AND the cannoli's should be a permanent dessert on the menu. Expect to drop a pretty penny for the experience.

Literally the best vegan food in Los Angeles, Italian or otherwise. I was almost raised on authentic Italian cuisine, nearly every weekend in Little Italy in NYC and this also tops anything else I've had vegan or otherwise. We’ll be back so much it'll be ridiculous. Thank you to the impeccable staff, our sever was above and beyond —truly everyone and everything was.

Load up the carbs!!! This place is fabulous, honestly if you’re looking for vegan Italian this would be my choice 10/10. I haven’t had carbonara since becoming vegan and the vegan carbonara 🍝 is so good!!! Ask for the chili oil and flakes to give it a little spice

name: The Butcher, The Baker, The Cappuccino Maker
address: 8653 Sunset Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: If you're in LA and looking for the best breakfast you can imagine, head to The Butcher, The Baker, The Cappuccino Maker. I tried their Bananas Foster French Toast, and it was absolutely criminal how delicious it was! This isn't just French toast; it's the ultimate version, setting a new standard for breakfast indulgence. The toast was perfectly crispy on the outside, soft inside, with a rich, caramelized banana topping that made every bite heavenly. Honestly, it’s the best French toast I’ve ever had. The cozy ambiance and friendly staff just added to the fantastic experience. Don't miss out on this gem!

It’s definitely crowded, but the location and the ambience are still impeccable. We also didn’t wait too long, so that’s a big plus.

The service is very good, and our host was able to get us a table in a very short amount of time. He was also incredibly nice and went out of his way to make sure everything was perfect.

The food is unforgettable. We also got the color splash latte (I don’t recall if that’s the exact name), and it was beautifully made. The french toast and Eggs Benedict were also heavenly.

This is a cute brunch place. The service and atmosphere are amazing. We ordered homemade cornbread, the butcher Benedict, banana foster French toast and unsweetened matcha latte. The cornbread was amazing, it is a must try. The Benedict was missing some flavor. The potatoes came with the Benedict had too much dill on it. The French toast was okay. I like the unsweetened matcha. Overall, if you are around the area, you can try it.

First time coming. Thankful we had reservations for brunch. We got our table right away. Note- they won’t seat you until your full party arrives. 90 minute table limit.

The service was great all around. We felt so welcomed by the front of house staff that seated us. Once at our table our server was fantastic. Checked on us consistently and was overall quite pleasant.

The burger was great. The potato bites are insanely delicious. They don’t serve fries- but I wasn’t let down at all. The fried chicken wrap was also really good. Glad we got a few entrees to share.

I did the Bloody Mary. Loved it. We also did the mimosas flight. Super fun and good. We did order an extra bottle of the Prosecco to top us off. The latte was as cute as it was enjoyable.

Would absolutely recommend coming here. Such a delight of a spot. Food and service both really great. Location couldn’t be better. Thanks for such a great Easter Brunch!

I came for the painted latte which was really neat and delicious! I would recommend it for the fun of the experience. Food and atmosphere I would give 4 stars.  It is nice to sit outside, but it  is close to the road and other tables. I ordered eggs Benedict with breakfast potatoes. I would try something else next time as I did not care for the biscuits ( too dry) and my food was not very hot. Not a bad experience and would suggest giving them a go!

name: The Den on Sunset - West Hollywood Restaurant & Bar
address: 8226 Sunset Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90046, USA
reviews:
I like this place a lot.

I went on a Sunday in the early afternoon and it was a spacious restaurant and bar and wasn’t very packed.

The staff were great and bartenders were helpful. One of them helped me recreate a new drink to better align with the flavors I like.

The food was also yummy and come out quickly. I will absolutely come back here.

Truly a great experience! Everyone was so attentive and respectful. The music made me feel like I was in a safe space. It was my first time here, and most certainly won’t be my last!The drinks were delicious. I was able to get the Guava Island and had that all night. Truffle fries were a fancier version of animal style fries. DELICIOUS. #denonsunset #buzzybooth

brought out of town family here for brunch and it was delightful. on sundays they have bottomless mimosas as an option🥂chicken & waffles were both delicious and filling. would definitely try this spot again.

The way I used to love this place and its food, I’ve been coming here for the last year, but since February the quality has completely gone down.  We ordered 2 burgers to go and paid 60 dollars for it to completely destroy both of our stomachs. We had to cancel our plans because we were feeling sick. Seriously still upset and you should do better because customers who used to come in twice a week probably never going to come in again after this.
My Party and I had such a wonderful time at The Den on Sunset! Fun DJ playing Music! Great drinks! Good food! Excellent company! #denonsunset #buzzybooth

name: Connie and Ted's
address: 8171 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90046, USA
reviews:
This place was recommended by my brother in law. We went not knowing what to expect. I have only one word to say about this place- WOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Chef Sam was spectacular! Thank you to Chef Michael for making our visit truly special. Thank you to our server Romeo for taking extra care of us. Thank you to Mr Bill and his special Magma Hot Pepper that was on our table all the way from NJ!

The pictures cannot share the immense joy we had tasting each and every single dish we tried.

Connie and Ted’s is a true gem! If I could just live there and be fed everyday I totally would!

Fantastic place for seafood. I’d love to come back. We had the chowder sampler (the traditional one was best), oysters, lobster roll and the Sunday’s special fried chicken. I recommend the lobster roll (hot) and the oysters for sure. The chicken was somewhat subpar. It’s probably best to get seafood at a seafood restaurant, not chicken.

Went on the  weekend (Saturday) for lunch/ brunch. The chowder's were very satisfying as a starter. Crab cake, salad, and butternut squash were delicious. Our main entrees were Black Cod and Black Sea Bass, which were delicately prepared and melted in our mouths.

I loved my experience!!

I am a bonafide New Englander and when I heard that there was a seafood restaurant in West Hollywood owned by other new Englanders I knew I had to try it out!

Everything was delicious and our server was on point!

I’ve done lunch and dinner here several times, and my rating tends to vary between three and four stars from meal to meal, but mostly three stars.
The atmosphere is nice for a fish restaurant but nothing exceptional.
Grilled calamari is tasty, but small and seems to be breaded.
Fried calamari is good but not very meaty.
Crab cake is so buttery you don’t taste the crab.
Butternut squash side dish is very very sweet.
Ocean trout was over cooked but otherwise okay.
Friends I was with didn’t like the fried fish nor the fried calamari.

name: LAN NOODLE
address: 7100 Santa Monica Blvd SUITE 130, West Hollywood, CA 90046, USA
reviews:
One of the best and unique Chinese noodle restaurant in West Hollywood.
First time here and I tell you I am impressed and on awe!
Every dish that we ordered was unique in its own flavor, and freshness from the dumplings, mapo tofu, to the simplest smashed cucumber salad.
My favorite was five spice beef, and the pork dumplings.
All the noodles are made fresh by the special chef and they come in 8 different shape and are made to order.
I will definitely be back to try other dishes.

Amazing Chinese food with a unique flavor profile. I can honestly say I’ve never tasted anything like it. It is anything but run of the mill. I tried their chow mein and it was amazing. The Dan Dan noodles are great too but spicy. They have several different noodle shapes to choose from. One is triangular! Wow! They make the noodles in house and you can even watch them do this! Service is really great. They voided my Dan Dan dish because it was too hot for me and I didn’t even have to ask for that. The cashier suggested it. There’s parking in a structure beneath the mall this restaurant is located in.

Finally an authentic Lanzhou noodle around WeHo.
I had the Lan noodle, thick flat noodle soup topped with slices of beef.
I also had the cold chicken dish - scallion chicken.
Both dishes tasted authentic.

I was told the braised feed is the most popular item. I’ll try that next time!

The service was very quick. My noodles came out in just few minutes of wait.

There is also free parking for 1 hour at the basement.

Incredible food, fair prices, and great service. Some of most authentic and fresh Szechuan you’ll get in the US.

The food came out in almost 5 minutes and the waitress was very helpful throughout the meal. She even let us try a cup of a sour plum drink before we bought it just to make sure we’d like it.

You can’t go wrong here but I’d recommend the Dan Dan Noodle, Mapo tofu, chili oil splash noodle, cucumber, and pan fried chicken potstickers.

Good food. Had the veggie flat wide dry noodles with mango smoothie. So much flavor. Noodle made to order and cooked to perfection. Mago smoothie was  delicious  not too watery not too thick perfectly blended. Atmosphere was nice not too crowded, clean. Service was fast . All the workers were so nice and kind and definitely work as a team to take care of guests definitely will be back and can't wait.

name: E.P. & L.P.
address: 603 N La Cienega Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews:
The views are amazing!
The rooftop esthetic is beautiful!
Now, if the service and drinks matched the following, this place would be unstoppable! I would've tried the food if anyone would have offered to ask for my order. The menu did look appealing, though. Maybe I'll have a better experience next visit.

Great cocktails. They have mixology classes which I think could be very interesting.

The place gets busy around 6pm, right after happy hours end. Although a bartender may forget to charge HH rate, this happened to me.

Mid. The cocktails are aesthetic and tasty, if you can actually get someone to take an order and get them to you. All the waiters were congregated in the corner chatting with one another while drinks sat empty for 20+ minutes.

It’s a cool place to go, just lower your expectations and you’ll be fine

Visited this rooftop with standard LA decor and was pleasantly surprised by the friendly server who swiftly resolved a minor order mistake. Although the Saturday afternoon brunch menu was on the smaller side, everyone in our group thoroughly enjoyed their meals. We ordered the breakfast hash, burger and avocado toast - all good but nothing to rave about.

Nice rooftop bar with an awesome atmosphere. Music is great and the drinks (we got) were delicious! 2 bars upstairs so there’s no major wait.
Staff here super friendly and accommodating, security let us in but informed us next time dress code applies no shorts after 9pm.
As It Was, Mr Roboto, Blinding Lights were our favorite drinks of the night!

name: Dan Tana's
address: 9071 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: Overall we really enjoyed our dinner. I had the veal parmigiana which was good. The atmosphere was great and our server was great and such a character! He made our dinner fun.  It’s a spot worth exploring as it’s an iconic place.

The atmosphere here!!! The food was excellent! I had the scallops with linguine! Yum!! Everybody in the entire place sang Happy Birthday to two different people as the wait staff served them cake. I think it's some sort of tradition, because everybody in the whole place joined in! And somebody yelled a couple times , "Dan Tana's on a Sunday night!" You definitely got the feeling that there were actors, writers, and producers here that were just hanging out at "the corner bar"
. They have plaques on the wall from the city of Los Angeles celebrating their 50th anniversary from 10 years ago. So they have been there at that location for 60 years now! You could tell that most of the people knew each other and were regulars. It is steps away from the Beverly Hills sign. It is very small and intimate. It was solidly expensive! And it was worth every penny! The food was superb! And more than one person (discreetly) came by my table to make sure everything was up to par!
(I went to see singer-songwriter Gilbert O'Sullivan after dinner just a few steps away at that famous old club called the Troubadour.) Did I mention the atmosphere and crusty bread??!!🙃🙃🙃
Oh, and the waiter! He was so cool! He introduced me to a couple of other guys who were going to see the show next door at the Troubadour. I think one of them was Engelbert Humperdinck.(Wow!) It was very nice of the waiter to make the introduction. Did I mention that I had a wonderful time, and that the food was excellent!? Again, Wow!

This one is a bummer.  Sure, the place has an iconic LA history, but is it worth it?  For our party of 3, last Tuesday night, it sure wasn't.   We arrived at 7:25 for a 7:30 reservation.  Our entire party was there.  Checked in with the hostess... and waited..  and waited....and waited.  The hostess kept smiling and working the room.  Fifteen minutes go by, then 30... we check in about our table..."Almost!"  ..."soon!".....45 min...we then realize that anyone who they know is seated immediately....but newcomers get to wait.  What good is a reservation?  It ain't worth nothing here.  The hostess starts pouring on the compliments, "Oh, I love your shoes, oh here's some matches, oh!  You guys win the prize for waiting the longest for your table!"   I don't want that prize, I want a table and a nice dinner!   Then at about an hour and 10 minutes, only after staring the hostess down as she's about to seat another 3 top of "regulars" do we get our table, and then we get seated at a truly horrible table outside with zero ambiance.  The gregarious waiter greets us, and I ask if it's normal to wait an hour for a table?  And almost as if rehearsed, cuz we know he's heard this before, he almost yells, "YES!  IT IS!"  We were all pretty agitated and irritated at this point, so it affected the meal... which was lackluster at best.    Overcooked rubbery fried calamari, underseasoned caesar...I will say the chicken parm was good.  They did end up comping our drinks, but  the entire evening was off because of their poorly run system of seating people.  This was confirmed by the hostess when we encountered her again when we were leaving, she actually referred to it as a living museum, not sure if she meant the restaurant itself or the regulars, but thats what she said......Sorry guys, this is a Los Angeles love affair that I'm happy to break up with.

We tried this place after reading about it plus our enjoyment of Italian food and Old Hollywood. Everything was wonderful.

We did see James Woods dining as well, as this place is famous for being a spot for celebrities.

What a truly special place! To start, the service was amazing!!! Not only efficient teamwork but they all had a great sense of humor! We started with what the waiter claimed was the best Caesar salad in LA. He wasn’t lying. At the end of our entrees, there wasn’t a morsel of food on a single plate (party of 13). Not because the portions were small (they are huge), but because the food was so good. We tried a few different desserts and all were amazing! Thanks Dan Tana’s for a special night that exceeded our lofty expectations!

name: Madre
address: 801 N Fairfax Ave #101, Los Angeles, CA 90046, USA
reviews: This restaurant is incredible! The server Jose was incredibly attentive and friendly and gave us recommendations since it was our first time. Even my picky eater nephew ate all of his food. Jose also gave my mom a complementary sample serving of their cafe de olla and it was delicious! Next time we are in LA we are definitely coming back!

Spacious restaurant with eclectic, authentic menu of moles, tacos, etc., and an array of mezcals varying from the popular bottles to smaller, family owned distilleries. We tried the fried crickets and a manager brought out cheese as a pairing. So good!

We had a large party tonight for a celebration. Thankfully they brought out 3 servings of chips with guac/salsa because we waited at least 10 minutes before a waiter came to take drink orders. Had to flag someone down AGAIN to place food orders. Our two vegan/vegetarians received MEAT in their dishes and then waited at least 10 minutes to receive the correct dish. It wasn't that crowded but clearly they needed a server that can handle a large party. Food was just ok which was disappointing having spent time in Oaxaca. I'm only giving 3 stars for food because pricing was reasonable based on size of dishes. Wouldn't recommend, wouldn't come back. Skip it.

Superb food, if you come early you get great service, they’re a bit short handed so come early. The service was amazing, everyone is so nice. We enjoy the food so much. The food is oaxcan from the state of Oaxaca in Mexico so it’s very different, their Mole sauce is divine. The churro with Mole sauce was divine. Don’t leave without ordering Churros, it’s an experience. Highly recommend this place.

It’s a very good restaurant in this neighbourhood. They have many outdoor tables if you prefer outdoor seating. The service is awesome. Every single one takes care of you very nice and sincerely. The food was brilliant. Sooooo delicious! You wouldn’t stop eating! And the cocktails are wonderful too! FYI, don’t order extra tortillas, you may literally have some tortillas with every single dish. 😬😬😬

name: Riot House Restaurant + Bar
address: 8401 Sunset Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: Ate here because I stayed here but if I wasn't I don't think I'd go out of my way. The service was really nice. The guy was super friendly. It was pretty slow but it was also just him. The prices are higher but pretty comparable to other hotels. I got a vegetarian breakfast burrito and honestly it was a good burrito but I feel like $20 for just the burrito but no sides is a bit much for me. But that's just me. In reality it's a pretty average price. Anyways food was good, service was great, atmosphere is nice but overall nothing to write home about.

The food is appetizing and tasty though nothing about the offerings are particularly outstanding in terms of flavor and presentation compared to other offerings in area.

Convenient for a quick bite if you are staying at the Andaz though I would venture to other restaurants if you are just passing through or visiting the area.

Overall, I was whelmed with my experience here and would visit again only if I were, again, a guest at the Andaz to take advantage of room charging for points bonuses.

Edit: Breakfast is really tasty! Definitely enjoyed their breakfast offerings moreso than the lunch/dinner menu!

It’s my first full day in LA. I thought it was a lame move to eat at the hotel instead of going out but I took the lazy road!

Honestly, I had a great experience. Definitely stop in for coffee + breakfast if you are staying at the Andaz. We shared the corned beef benny and an almond croissant. Check the pics - it was the biggest croissant I’ve ever seen!!! 🥐🥐🥐

The service was a home run 🪐Andrew was our waiter and he was so friendly and attentive. Little things make a big difference for me… He split the benny into two dishes because we mentioned that we were sharing. He asked if I wanted ketchup or hot sauce (always a yes from me 🤌🏽🔥🥵) before the food came out. And he put in this care while the place was pretty full! I also saw the manager/host going around to tables and checking in with guests. Great staff all around.

In my view this is primarily a restaurant attached to the Andaz hotel.  Translation:  very expensive for casual dining.  That said, the breakfast was quite extensive with everything from fruit to meats and omelets to order.  It is a nice space and the coffee was decent.  Would I visit the space if I was not traveling - probably not.
The food and drinks are good here! The drinks taste so fresh, the bartenders are really skilled and the whole staff is great. I'd definitely go back to stay here

name: Casa Madera West Hollywood
address: 8440 Sunset Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: Honestly, one of the best experiences I’ve had in a restaurant. I made a reservation about a month or so in advance to celebrate my girlfriend’s birthday. She really enjoyed herself! The food was amazing, the staff was kind and helpful. I would really like to mention our server, Zarah who made the whole experience. She was willing to take photos of my girlfriend and me and also she recommended some amazing drinks. We are really excited to come back here. I appreciate everyone who helped give my girlfriend the best birthday experience .

Beautiful space and ambiance coupled with the most attentive service I’ve ever experienced at a restaurant. Our server Johnny was top notch—incredibly personable and paid so much attention to every little detail, even noticing when we had dropped a napkin and bringing newly folded ones over. Also loved that they offered vegan options for the burger (delicious!) and risotto (not the best I’ve ever had but still good). Their guacamole with plantain chips was so yummy. There was also an incredibly talented musician moving through the packed restaurant playing exotic string instruments along with the DJ—on a Monday night! Perfect night out in Hollywood

I am uploading pictures of the items that are worth buying. I do not understand why this place has only 3.9 stars. I believe this experience was 5 out of 5 stars. I have been in a lot of good restaurants in L.A. but this one by far surpassed my expectations due to the good vibes and the way the staff made me feel. Ally was the person who provided the service of hosting us and she was absolutely GREAT. I enjoyed having a GENUINE (not fake) professional who can make me feel welcome and happy. I was celebrating a special occasion and she made sure to be funny but at the same time not pushy and polite. The staff at front, I do not have her name but she was amazing and complimented my whole outfit. I ONLY take the time to give REAL reviews about people that make me feel good. There was a woman playing live violin and I think it added to the whole vibe. I recommend this place because of MY experience. I am glad I did not let myself be influenced by negative comments because I would have skip a night to remember. I WILL BE BACK! You have to know that parking is an issue but if you do Valet Parking, they are super nice and accept card and it is 25. You still need a stamp from the front desk. YOU ARE WELCOME ;)

Such a cute restaurant. Food was amazing and our server John was great! He gave us the best advice on what to order and everything was delish. My husband is lactose intolerant so he was able to point him to dishes that could accommodate that.

One of my favorite restaurants in Los Angeles! The service is always outstanding, and the food is delicious. The lounge music with live DJ sets creates a perfect atmosphere, in harmony with the interior design of the place. Additionally, the view of the city from above is truly spectacular recommend to anyone looking to enjoy a special evening!"

name: Irie Restaurant & Lounge
address: 7715 Santa Monica Blvd Second Floor, West Hollywood, CA 90046, USA
reviews: Came around mid-February. Our experience was great, the service was good, it was a busy Saturday night. The pizzas were okay, the pork belly and mushroom cakes were delicious, and so was the steak even tho we got the wrong one. The gelato is good and the tiramisu was so bomb. The vibe is just so chill and fun, and the drinks were pretty good too. I highly recommend and will definitely be back.

I’ve been to Irie a few times, and I always bring someone new to experience it. The food is good all around. My favorites are probably the lamb rigatoni and the roasted chicken. Service is always wonderful. The staff is friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable. The atmosphere is relaxed, with a great ambience. Would 100% recommend

Truly a faultless experience! The atmosphere is very upscale, yet comfortable. The food was exceptional. Every dish we ordered felt elevated and was delicious - shout out to the Lions Mane cakes, fries, ravioli and brownie.

And to top it all off, you can smoke weed right at the table! We had so much fun and I can’t wait to go back!

Amazing new place with that allows you to smoke at the table. They start you off with a smoke menu and you can rent a bong for $25, you close out and pay for any of that before you order food. You can't order alchohol at the table they have a seperate bar for that, but all the food is sharable portions and you can just keep getting 1 or 2 at a time. Food was great and we didnt feel rushed or anything, super comfortable and unique.

You must experience, if you are a gardener and a foodie! The vibe, service and portions were great. When ordering, we put everything in at once and I would recommend sending 1-2 things in at a time. The food did arrive luke warm and quickly turned cold due to how cold they have to keep the restaurant. You don’t need cash for the gardening part, they take card but charge $3. I’d recommend bringing a jacket as the restaurant is pretty cold due.

name: Tu Madre- West Hollywood
address: 1111 Hayworth Ave, West Hollywood, CA 90046, USA
reviews:
Yo mama don't cook like this.

Tu Madre is a cute little taqueria just off of Santa Monica, with absolutely amazing food. We ordered an array of tacos, all of which impressed:

Fried Chicken: 9/10
Sweet N Sour Chicken: 8/10
Crispy potato: 10/10
Crispy fish: 9/10
KBBQ street taco: 10/10
Carne Asada: 8/10
Brisket: 8/10

I've previously ordered food from Tu Madre via a delivery app and the food is equally as good. The one warning I'll give for the tacos is that they aren't the biggest portions, and they're served on individual plates. If you have a small table, you may run out of space if you order enough tacos to be satisfied.

In addition to the large selection of tacos, they have an equally diverse drink menu. They offer margaritas by the pitcher, flight, and glass. If you order the flights, they come with a sparkler (as I said, the place is cute) for your social media memories. If you're not in a margarita mood, they also offer other cocktails and a sad selection of beer. I got a Madre Passion, which was spectacular, and my partner ordered a Deeply Rooted Issues, which was very citrusy.

Tu Madre would be well on its way to five stars if it weren't for one thing. Service can be slow, which is the reason for dropping a star on the overall rating. I noticed the speed of service depended on where you sat. Unfortunately for us, we weren't at an advantageous table. I think we talked to our real server once. He didn't take our order, bring the food, or help us with the check. He checked in once or twice, but that was it. Thankfully, we were heading someplace else after dinner and didn't want a second drink. Otherwise, we might still be sitting there.

Overall, go to Tu Madre for the food. Or, if you live close enough, order via a delivery app and enjoy the food without the annoyance of being ignored.

Food was pretty tasty. The drinks on point and the vibe was pretty chill. Good indoor and outdoor seating and decor. That said…wasn’t particularly taken by the service. Food is brought out in batches and on the same plate regardless of who on your table placed the order.
Party of 4 : We all placed our order at the same time (2-3 tacos each) - I got my 1st taco out, but had to wait while the rest of my table got their order. Meanwhile one of my friends only got his 1st taco around the time the rest of us were on our 3rd order which was kinda awkward….Idk…the service style seems to make it more complicated than what it has to be.

I was a bit disappointed. I ordered 2 tacos KBBQ and the Fried Fish. Received what I thought was street tacos, but no their regular tacos are street sized. The KBBQ was marinated for something like 24 hours, I found it a bit chewy, not tender. The fried fish taco wasn't crispy but soggy. Our waiter was non-existent after serving. Our table of 5 quickly emptied our single water pitcher. I don't like leaving this type of review but management needs to know. Hope your experience is better than mine.
Loved the fried avocado vegan bowl. Everything in was very tasty. I usually don't like rice but even the rice is flavourful. Loved it.

Y’all! I love this place and have frequented several times but this past Monday was my favorite. Mariah (sorry if it’s spelled incorrectly) was the sweetest while taking our order and serving us. Not sure if she was on her lunch or left for the day but we didn’t get to say bye.

Food and drinks are sooooo delicious. Please go for the happy hour. Everything is always so colorful and vibrant. The decor makes you feel as if you’re visiting another city. Service was amazing. All our food arrived fairly promptly and it never felt like we were left alone by staff for too long. Had some food leftover and yummm, it was delish!!!

name: Jones
address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90046, USA
reviews: The two us were having an amazing dinner. We ordered drinks, appetizers, a pasta and main dish and dessert. The service was well attentive.
