But after we had finished dessert the hostess came up and asked us to leave because she had another reservation coming. We had been there for 1.5 hours. We were on time to our reservation. We felt it to be very rude as we were enjoying our date, the food and service. At no point was there mention of some kind of time limit. Definitely killed the vibe.

Visiting from San Francisco, I could not have found a more vibey spot to enjoy a delicious dinner and vibrant social scene after our music festival.  They served us some of the best spaghetti and meatballs I’ve ever had. I am trying to figure out their secret.

Awesome food beautiful people and a nice host! Almost perfect the only crazy thing was the long time on the waiting list to get a table but it was rush hour so I partially understand that! I will dine in again for sure

Things we loved-- great vibe. 1970s swanky. Excellent service. Good cocktails. The ravioli was our favorite dish.

Not as successful -- spaghetti and meatballs, pizza, cezar salad. These were ok, but could be improved.

Visited for my first time on a double date. Great dark cool atmosphere with old Hollywood vibes and a bar in the middle. I would just say get ready to be nice and cozy as the booths for 4 are very tight. This is not the place for you if you don’t like a louder quite dark environment with only one little light above us illuminating our table. The food and drinks are reasonably priced. We got two pasta dishes which were both delicious. I would recommend a visit to the restroom too where you’ll see thousands of photos stuck on the walls. In terms of parking, it can be quite difficult getting street parking but there is the target parking lot across the road where you’ll only spend a couple of dollars for 2 hours so definitely worth it. If you’re still feeling like a drink afterwards I’d recommend hoping over the street to the Formosa Cafe for a night cap!

name: Delilah Los Angeles
address: 7969 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90046, USA
reviews: Obsessed with the Mac & cheese, ribs, & shrimp cocktail!! Ambiance is the best in the city & the music makes everything even better.

I recently visited Delilah and was incredibly disappointed with the experience. We had to wait over 30 minutes past our reservation time without any communication or updates. It felt like our time was being wasted, and the staff couldn’t be upfront about the delay.

Additionally, the doorman was completely disrespectful, adding to an already frustrating situation. This experience was far below the standard I expected and has left a sour taste regarding this establishment.

Amazing experience at Delilah, everything was fantastic from the service to the food! The atmosphere of the restaurant is a perfect dinner vibe, amazing music dim lighting. Staff is very helpful with menu descriptions and selections.

Gorgeous, sexy and very hush-hush retro atmosphere. It's a total vibe! The service is top notch. 👏🏾 I dined the Saturday evening pre-Oscars.  Must tries...the Ribs and chicken tenders.  Strict "No Photos" policy.  Enjoy your experience. 😎

Unfortunately, very unfortunately, I was given a plate of mashed potatoes and lobster with PAPER :)

I made reservations, 3 days in advanced for a Birthday/Father's Day Dinner were the special dish of the celebration was a whopping $140.... At a place / high end restaurant such as Delilah I believe and stand on the service, kitchen abilities, and reputation of an establishment.

However, again very unfortunately I took one bite into my dinner meal ($40) and chewed on paper until I finally spit it out and saw what it was!!! It turned me off from the entire meal.

I DID NOT ORDER ANYTHING ELSE FOR THE REST OF THE NIGHT, watched as my guests and company ate their dinner. Sipped my Champagne Papi, and sadly didn’t get to enjoy dinner here.

Wouldn’t come back due to the way the GM (general manager) Michelle treated the situation.

name: Toca Madera West Hollywood
address: 8450 W 3rd St, Los Angeles, CA 90048, USA
reviews: Had a lovely time at brunch. The food was delicious and the ambiance was mystical. Come here on the right day with the right crowd when the vibe is good and you won’t even feel like you’re in LA. You’ll feel like you’re on an island with some very pretty people, eating a satisfying meal soaking up the good energy. I only came here for brunch … can’t comment on the rest of the menu .

Last night was my birthday and i made a reservation to the Toca madera
Let’s start with that i specifically asked to have a table next to the bar and they completely ignored that.
After that one of the servers brought us some shut that have fire in them and he drop them on me !!!he ruined my expensive dress that i bought especially for my birthday, he left a stain on my Chanel bag and the worst part he burn my hair 😢
I completely understand that this is human mistake but I expected at least that one of the managers to come to me and apologize and offer some compensation . But no one is was care that my birthday completely destroyed because of that.
I really don’t recommend about this restaurant

Absolutely loved this place. Food was great, service was amazing.
Had so much fun celebrating birthday at the small area behind the dj booth. Not loud, warm.
Short fire show approximately every hour.

My sister and I had a great experience! Service and food were fantastic and very cool West Hollywood vibes with moody lighting and sultry design.
The food is fantastic, the street corn and ceviche blanco were so good as was the salsa and tacos. Every dish was sensational. The cocktails were delish, strong with great flavours. Friendly staff, attentive and great with recommendations. Follow up by management to check in on dining experience is a nice touch. Great night out 🍸

I came here with a friend on a Friday night and we weren’t expecting much to be honest. We’d been joking about how it was probably going to be a let down because we had no trouble booking a table the night before and assumed that it would be average because of that - thankfully we were wrong about that!

From the service to the atmosphere to the food to the drinks, everything was perfection. I had the hamachi which was incredible and so full of flavor, as well as the crispy calamari which was delicious and not too deep fried like some tend to be. For my main I had the salmon which was beautiful. It feels like there’s so much thought put into the flavor combinations. We shared the mousse for dessert which was amazing and not too sweet, it was just right. The waitress (I think her name was Madeline/Madison or something?) was so lovely and had great recommendations, she really knew the menu.

It was a Friday night so it was buzzing and very loud, so be prepared for that. There was a fire dancer that came out and danced on the bar which was really cool. Honestly everything was amazing. My friend kindly paid so I’m not sure how much we spent but I assume it was a lot, but this was a case of you get what you pay for. It was the perfect middle ground between high end fine dancing and a fun L.A. party vibe. Would absolutely come back and have already recommended it to friends and family.

name: Zarape Cocina & Cantina
address: 8351 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: Great little place I stumbled on in my travels. Best tacos I’ve ever had. Quality of meat was top shelf. Fantastic Margarita and the vibe was very cool. Staff was Friendly and the service fantastic. Best Mexican I’ve had so far.

Lovely Mexican in West Hollywood. Really nice ambience/vibe. Bit more upmarket than some other Mexicans we visited in the area. We had burritos - beef birria and carnitas. Very delicious but could’ve done with some guacamole inside or a dip of sour cream would’ve been a nice touch! But was probably the only normal size portion we had whilst visiting america (from UK) so at least we felt alright after the meal and not stuffed! The churros were delicious too (a dipping chocolate sauce would’ve been good tho!). Lovely service our waiter described all the different burrito fillings for us 🫶🏼 happy hour ended at 6:30pm which was sad as it used to be 7pm
Zarape' was so delightful! I love the ambiance and the happy hour food was very yummy. I especially liked their carnitas taco. Can't wait to come back and try a margarita!
Stopped but after the drag show at hamburger Mary’s. Service was attentive. The guac was really yummy. Ordered a Paloma but it was subpar.
Loved the guac and cheese dip the fajitas were delicious.  Service great and drinks stiff. Great experience reconnecting with friends from 30 years ago!

name: Tocaya Modern Mexican
address: 8720 Sunset Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: New discovery!! Tasty tacos!! Mouth watering good! Hibiscus Ginger Tea! Guacamole topped with Pomegranate and Pepitas and accompanied by Fresh Chips.

This place offers huge value for the price and quality of food it has. It is not a fancy mexican restaurant by far, but it has pretty good mexican food. The bowls are also a pretty decent size for a portion and they tasted really good! Highly recommend for a quick and relatively cheap dinner (compared to other mexican places).

Good Mexican restaurant - I really liked the way to build your burrito, as it had multiple base options and all extras that you can add to it. Banana chips were also great, especially with guacamole. The sauce added to burrito was also good, you could feel that it’s fresh. I didn’t really like loud music outside, especially that it was loudly from the street and also from the speakers. Overall that’s great restaurant to eat something fresh.

Best place on the strip, saw some fancy places while walking on sunset bvld and this is not as fancy but simplistic, amazing food n margaritas. Perfect for what we were looking for - good food, drinks and simple place. Price is the best I've seen around this area. Friendly ppl work at this place. Do try it out if you're in the area
Very nice place. I like the beef and chicken tacos. Cocktails were also very good!

name: Petrossian Restaurant & Boutique
address: 321 N Robertson Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90048, USA
reviews:
One of the best breakfasts that we have had in Los Angeles this year. They specialize in dishes with caviar and although expensive it is definitely the sort of place that is worth the visit. Service was polite and prompt, and parking was extremely easy. They don’t have a parking lot however, we are able to find metered street parking directly across the street. We had reservations at 11 when it opened and spent pretty much our entire meal alone in the dining area which was great. They have a lot of great options on the menu, so it was hard to choose what to order because there were so many that we wanted to get. It’s really bright and open on the inside. The tables are not too close together, they have fresh flowers all around the dining area and overall it looks very elegant. They also have a large area where you can buy different jams, caviar, smoked salmon, other things.

We started off with a couple of lattes and some orange juice, which was a great and sweet start to the meal. For our dishes, we chose the Eggs Benedict and the Caviar Frites. Both had a lot of caviar on them and had delicious flavors. The eggs on the Benedict were cooked perfectly and the sauce was really well-made. The fries were good alone themselves but with the crème fraîche and trout roe it really made them special.

Overall a delicious brunch option in West Hollywood. I would definitely recommend to anyone and look forward to coming back in the near future.

Exceptional experience at Petrossian Caviar! Chris provided an incredibly attentive caviar tasting, offering personalized recommendations and pairing suggestions with champagne that will elevate our New Year's celebration. His expertise and care made the experience unforgettable. Moreover, the meticulous packing of the caviar in ice ensured its freshness, arriving perfectly for our celebration. Thank you, Petrossian, for the exquisite service and quality products - highly recommended for anyone seeking a top-tier caviar experience!

I ordered the smoked salmon flatbread and bibb salad and wish I had more room in my belly for more!

The smoked salmon flatbread was too perfect. From the perfectly baked flatbread to the sprinkles of red onion and Capers on top. I really couldn't fault it at all.

The salad was also such a great balance between the creaminess of the burrata, the crunch of the beans and radishes and the right amount of dressing. It's too bad I couldn't finish it because I was too full from taking on the flatbread solo!

Overall I had a really delicious brunch, served by really friendly staff and it made for a memorable first meal in LA.

It's quite pricey but honestly worth ever penny!

Best place for caviar, or a romantic French dinner date, old Hollywood style place, small but very comfortable, beautiful flower center piece in the middle of the restaurant, makes this place very elegant and romantic.
Service was perfect. Parking on the street is easy to find. Went on a Wednesday evening, and the place was maybe 2/3 full. So you could probably walk-in on a weekday, if you liked. Noise level was perfect. Bring a date here!

I don't give out 5 stars very easily but this place deserves it! Service was extraordinary and the food experience was one we will not forget.  Our server was very well educated and did an amazing job helping us with the selections.  Food was divine! Highly recommend you add this to your LA itinerary!

name: Mamie Italian Kitchen
address: 7900 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90046, USA
reviews:
This new trend of Toscan sandwiches has hit LA big time. I’ve tried most of the other spots already and this one was my favorite by far. Fresh ingredients, great taste!
They’re organized making the wait very reasonable.
My dad had the Verano which was packed with delicious ingredients and I made my own panini. We shared a piece of one of the “pizza” of the day: guanciale. Crispy and yummy!
The bread was fresh, crispy on the outside but airy on the inside.
I’ll definitely go back! Can’t wait to see what my husband thinks!!

I was born and raised in Italy so I know how real Italian food tastes like…this place did not disappoint! The burrata is delicious and so is the prosciutto. Was so happy to taste some real mortadella which is difficult to find. I also had some pastries and they were good. Even the vibe is Italian - maybe that’s why service is slow 😄You’re gonna have to wait at least 20 miles for your focaccia- we were fine with that as it was Sunday. 😋😋😋

I was looking to get a dairy-free sandwich while waiting for my tires to get replaced down the street and decided to try out this restaurant.  Luckily, they had a vegan option called the Fiorella which was made of roasted veggies, arugula and pistachios.  I'm not sure I ever need to eat a sandwich with meat in it after this.  It was delicious!  The bread was perfectly crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside and the sandwich was flavorful overall.

This is now probably my favorite sandwich in LA.

I stopped by for a slice of pizza which is actually a great slice of focaccia with topping. Flavorful in a simple way with fresh ingredients, the way Italian food is served in Italy. I will be back to try their salads & sandwiches. So many good options for lunch!

This place is a taste of Italy. Think of entering a sandwich shop in  Florence, Rome and or Milan.

The service is impeccable.
And any of their sandwiches are high quality. Seriously you just cannot go wrong.

name: Norma
address: 631 N La Cienega Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: NORMA is a culinary gem that deserves all the praise it receives. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted by a warm and inviting atmosphere, and the attentive staff made me feel right at home, ensuring that every detail of my dining experience was taken care of. The menu at NORMA is a masterpiece, curated by Executive Chef Jason Fullilove, with standout dishes like the sourdough flatbread topped with whipped ricotta and caramelized honey, the hot fried 1/2 chicken with a ginger spice blend, and the dry-aged sea bass paired with forbidden black rice and pickled market veggies. The desserts were a sweet symphony of flavors, including the vegan stone fruit clafoutis and the cast iron cookie. NORMA's commitment to accommodating dietary restrictions and allergies was impressive, and the 18% gratuity added to the bill was a fair acknowledgment of the outstanding service received. If you're looking for a dining experience that combines exceptional food, impeccable service, and a welcoming ambiance, NORMA is the place to go. Treat yourself to a culinary adventure at NORMA, and prepare to be amazed.

Cute and “vibey” restaurant in Weho with good shareable plates. I really liked the roasted potatoes and the lamb meatballs!! Husband really liked the Wagyu strip loin but know there’s not a lot of bells and whistles on that dish- just straightforward meat lol. Service was great as well.

I had a really amazing time at Norma! I went with two other friends and we shared the steak frites, amazing curried cauliflower agnolotti, the carrot and broccoli appetizers, the salmon entree, and biscuits. Very fresh food and generous portions - the steak and agnolotti definitely stood out as the best. They had cute cocktails and mocktails and really nice bartenders and servers. The atmosphere and decor were great - we had no trouble hearing each other but it was lively and fun and seems like it becomes more of a lounge later at night. Awesome neighborhood spot and I can’t wait to go back!

Norma is such a cute spot with really nice decor and amazing food. We were a group of friends who went there for dinner and shared plates and everything we had was so tasty, including the cocktails. I especially liked the octopus, probably some of the best I’ve had. This place could be the perfect date spot but it also looked like they have a private area you can reserve for an event too. Will definitely be coming back!
We had a great time at Norma, the food was delicious and very good value for the price. Our server, Ryan, was incredibly attentive and helpful! We definitely recommend Norma!

name: Traktir Restaurant
address: 8151 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90046, USA
reviews: So delicious! The borscht, potato dumplings, and stroganoff were so delicious. The vodka flight is a must. Huge portions on the food and drinks.
Wonderful first time experience.  The seating is great, as it's half open air.  The home made infused vodka is so smooth.  The borscht and golubtsy are fantastic.  I can't wait to come back.

I wasn't sure what to expect when we decided to dine here. What a wonderful experience. Our service was so kind explaining the food and vodka. The Sturgeon was very tasty. Cooked medium as it can get tough, ours was juicy & flakey. The dumplings were a fun tastey treat. Now the salad was a taste bud explosion! Full of fresh herbs & the garlic dressing was delicious. The vodka tasting was fun. This is a must visit place! BTW there is a nice little market next door where you can pick up some Ukrainian/Russian treats. Parking was easy with a lot attached with plenty of spots.

I have been to Traktir a few times now and have never been disappointed. They infused their own vodka in-house and it was amazing. The service is great friendly and attentive but not overbearing. The food is phenomenal. I would highly recommend trying Traktir out if you have never been there and want a new experience.

My wife and I were ignored tonight.  Having lived here our entire lives we thought this restaurant would be nice to try.  Charming inside and we had selected many expensive items off the menu.  We were not even given water and no one even looked in our direction so we could order.  Having lived here for over 50 years this was a big disappointment.

name: A.O.C.
address: 8700 W 3rd St, Los Angeles, CA 90048, USA
reviews: Lovely ambiance in the courtyard! Tapas style French food that has a comfy yet elevated touch. The fingerling potatoes are a delicious cheesy mess that was creamy yet light. Highlight of the night! Really enjoyed the salads and Spanish Fried Chicken too. Service was on top of things and very attentive. Very California vibes and feel. Good space for a smaller group or a date night too.

Came here with two friends for Dine LA! First time being here. It was great. The food is so tasty, the chicken was juicy even though it was breaded. The portions are large, even though they may appear small. The wait staff are very attentive. Overall, it was a seamless experience with great food, ambient lighting and a cute outdoor porch area. Great date night place as well. I don’t drink alcohol however they do have an array of cocktails and a very extensive wine list.

We enjoyed a nice dinner during our visit to LA. The focaccia was delicious and had a perfect crust. I ordered the fried chicken and it was so tender and juicy. The portion sizes are smaller and meant for sharing. We ended up being quite full after our meal. The food was very good, but didn’t blow us away. All very simple and fresh, so can’t complain! The restaurant itself is very nice and great for a nice dinner.

The patio is lovely. Our waiter was attentive and helpful. The cocktails were inventive, the favorite was the Basil Smash.
The food: The Farmer’s Plate - will come back for this, so good. Could be a meal.
Cherry Salad was not plated to share, awkward to eat, do not recommend
Roasted Chicken is a large portion, but again the pieces were big and hard to share - very tasty though
Sugar snap peas, english peas, pea tendrils - Very few peas, mostly tendrils and these were  tough and chewy. Don't order
I have stopped in to this branch on a few occasions. All were great. I like being seated on the covered patio the most and the Spanish fried chicken is delicious.

name: Ardor
address: 9040 Sunset Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: We came here this year again for celebrate birthday. Beautiful interior and exterior decoration with plants. Great place with tasty foods. The lamb chops is so delicious ever!! Yellowtail tuna tartare would be better with something crunchy with lettuce. The foods are so exceptional. The service is also good. The vibe is cozy and pleasant. We loved everything that we ordered. Definitely we will come back again!

Such a beautiful place, loved their ambiance. We went there last Friday for small plates and drinks. Their risotto and hazelnut bar were soo good. Drinks were also amazing. Server took more than 15 minutes to take our order initially but once they came, service was really good.

The overall ambience of Ardor was exceptional. Food wise, the steak and eggs really stood out to me. The yellowtail tar tar would be better with plantain chips or something crunchy rather than lettuce. The oysters and the onion rings were delightful. The pasta on the brunch menu was okay, as well as the eggs benedict. Our dessert which was the cheesecake and churro waffle were amazing. Our server was super attentive and made sure every need was met.

I’ve had the good fortune to visit Ardor twice this year. Most recently for an elegant Christmas dinner with good friends. It was a limited menu ( not the full dinner menu) and still delightful!

Drink: Chili - their version of an old fashion. Delightful and ever so slightly sweet.

Food:
Milk Buns - perfectly light and rich
King Crab tagliatelle- never disappoints and a favorite every time!
Wagyu beef with various salts - every bite was delicious!!
Crispy Brussel side - refreshing with the savory dishes
Braised short ribs - very good but was hoping for more complex flavor
Chestnut ravioli with truffle - it was OK. Would not order again.

On previous occasion other standout dishes were:
Charred Oyster Mushrooms - delish!
Cauliflower Cacio e Pepe - delish!

Earthy atmosphere,  surrounded by greenery.  There is indoor & patio seating.  All the food was delicious, fresh.  I had the sweet potato curry, tasted the salmon, and branzino...The milk bread is Soo delicious, too.   Also enjoyed the key lime pie !!!

name: Katana LA
address: 8439 Sunset Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: Always amazing! I love coming here while visiting LA. I feel like the food is always the same which is huge. The only thing with the service this time was it was too many times asking us if things were okay. I almost couldn’t enjoy conversation with my friend because of it. Otherwise I highly recommend for the great food and loved sitting outside.

Great sushi and cocktails! There were six of us so we chose the Izakaya feast - curated sushi from all three in-house kitchens and they included the respective chefs' choices. Everything was delicious!
The only drawback was the wait time before we got a table. We did have a reservation but had to wait an hour before being seated.
The food is really good, I really like the sushi , the service is not bad , but the most important here is the view to LA, I really like the vibes

I went here with my girlfriend on Valentine’s Day and we both loved it. The nice dark atmosphere the restaurant has gives a really good dinner vibe. We started off with 2 cocktails and loved them. We got the fresh oysters and miso soup as an appetizer. We really loved both of them. The miso soup was so tasty. For our main dish we both got the surf and turf and loved it. This place is definitely a must try.

Beautiful building/interior.
Heat lamps by the tables outside. Good sushi, tasted fresh. Loved the eggplant app.
Good service.

Lots of steps to get up to the restaurant, I don't know if they have an elevator available. We ate dinner outside and it was a vibe, and nice to enjoy the LA scenery.

name: Night + Market Weho
address: 9043 Sunset Blvd West, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: Honestly one of the few spots we must visit whenever we’re in town for work. It never fails. Happy hour is a great deal. Servers are knowledgeable. Claire slayed the game when we visited this last time. The right amount of spice. Flavors are amazing. Everyone go here.

Absolutely delicious. Everything tasted fresh and appropriately spicy when ordered Thai spicy. We had the crispy rice salad with sour pork and it was crunchy, flavorful and sour. The sai ua was full of herbs and grilled perfectly, served with a fire nam prik. We also shared the pastrami pad kee mao and it was great. The pastrami works well with the noodles and basil and I always love a green peppercorn! Will have to be back.

Side note - cute interior!

One of the best Thai food places I’ve ever been to. The noodles with pastrami were amazing but pretty spicy. Service and vibes were great as well! Everything here is fresh and delicious! I wish I lived closer so I could visit more often!

Went here for my birthday dinner with friends and it was a good experience overall. I had fun. Parking can be tough - street parking. The food was okay. It was definitely flavorful, it didn’t taste bad and the service was great, the employees were welcoming and patient and the food came out fast. I loved the location of the restaurant, towards the end of sunset strip before it goes into the Beverly Hills area. It’s a trendy and colorful place and has a casual feel to it. I’ve had better pad Thai - this pad Thai tastes pretty average. Which isn’t bad! It definitely tastes right and the chicken on both the pad see ew and pad Thai were great. The sweet potato curry didn’t taste like sweet potato and more like regular potatoes but paired well with rice. The crab wontons were the best - they were super delectable and I liked that it sat on a bed of vegetables. Flavor is heavy in general as is with all Thai food, lots of sauce and heavy seasoning but I guess that’s what makes it good. Wouldn’t go for Thai if you’re health conscious but once a week dining out can be okay. The sweets were sweet and satisfied my sweet tooth and the mangoes were incredibly fresh and sweet. It was good experience overall though! I rated it three stars because I think the food was pretty average and didn’t blow my mind and the price is regular pricing you see at a typical restaurant in LA.

This place is great….  just not the same when they aren’t offering the hidden treasures :( so if you’re thinking about getting it tonight they don’t have it. Also the blonde waitress did not give out welcoming vibes. She was very cold and never smiled . Never asked  came back to check on us. It’s really sad because I love this place but not sure I would come back because of the service by her.

name: Soho House West Hollywood
address: 9200 Sunset Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: Absolutely loved my visit to Soho House in West Hollywood! The atmosphere is exclusive and vibrant, perfect for networking or relaxing with friends. The decor is stylish, and the views of LA are unbeatable. Excellent service and a great selection of food and drinks. Highly recommend for a classy and enjoyable experience!

Totally my vibe: you need a membership to get in, but the atmosphere is unbeatable. The cocktails were amazing (I had two or three back to back). The staff was okay—either super busy or just didn’t care—they barely checked on us.

We were waiting for a table outside/terrace, but since it’s first come, first serve, we didn’t get one, lol.

They say you can’t take pictures because of Soho House's privacy rules, but after we left, I checked Instagram and saw tons of people posting pics from inside.

Simple and chic with just enough vibe. Prefer weekdays but that my personality type. 🫠
Anywhere with sourdough toast gets 5 stars from me so there is also that to consider.
🌴🥓🍳🍞☕️🤸🏾‍♀️

Went for a dinner with friends. Absolutely loved the ambience and the views. We had poke bowl, meatballs, guacamole and chips, chicken parm and it was absolutely delicious. The only thing this place missed was the choice of Bourbon drinks.

Very nice staff and views.
The menu has a good number of options with variety in each dish.
Thanks for the hospitality.

name: Barney's Beanery
address: 8447 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews:
Barney’s Beanery in Santa Monica is an absolute gem! From the moment we walked in, we were enveloped in a nostalgic atmosphere that exuded charm and character. The eclectic decor added to the vibrant ambiance, making every moment feel like a journey through time.

But it wasn't just the ambiance that impressed us; the service was exceptional. Both our server and the server in training were incredibly attentive and sweet, ensuring that our dining experience was nothing short of wonderful. They were knowledgeable about the menu and provided excellent recommendations, enhancing our meal even further.

And let's talk about the food – it was simply delicious! The tuna melt was perfectly grilled with a generous amount of flavorful tuna and melted cheese. The Caesar salad was fresh and crisp, and the breakfast burrito was a hearty and satisfying choice.

Overall, Barney’s Beanery offers not only fantastic food but also a delightful atmosphere and outstanding service. It's a place where you can enjoy a meal with friends or family while basking in the nostalgia of yesteryears. Five stars without a doubt!

The most American place I’ve ever been (in a good way!) such a cool bar, chilled on a Saturday night with a huge variety of people. Seemed a late 20’s hangout. Huge food menu, loads of craft beers,arcade games & pool

Old time bar where Jim Morrison apparently came in for the odd drink and Janis Joplin had her last meal. In a really cool spot in Hollywood with equally cool people. Staff were decent but do have the Hollywood '..tude' which ain't for everyone. Tried a local actors beer. Damn fine. Simple old-school bar. Loved it.
Game 7 of Lord Stanley's Cup Finals and the place is full of my fellow Hockey fans. Great service and my Southern Fried chicken salad was worth the order.

Love this place. it has it all when your looking for swanky dive bar with pool tables and decent seating. The food is whatever but decent enough, most people come for the drinks and the vibes. The pricing for drinks are very good. There is a karaoke night on Wednesday which is interesting. Def a overall good hang out with friends or even a date. The location is ideal as it’s in a prime Weho location. It’s a locals spot so def pop in when you get a chance. It’s casual so don’t overthink it. have fun

name: Amarone kitchen and bar
address: 7149 Beverly Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90036, USA
reviews:
Perfect for date night!
The food was amazing, drinks were good and dessert was out of the world
Surprisingly they don't have any chicken option so that was a bummer but nonetheless they have enough option to still enjoy
Their tiramisu is best I have had so far,definitely worth trying
Had a wonderful dinner here with my husband. All the good food, drinks, and wonderful service.
My husband and I came from out of town and we enjoyed this restaurant. Sandro was very sweet, explained us the menu. Definitely coming back. Thank you for the GREAT service! I really recommend!

Enjoyed a wonderful dining experience with my brother and niece. It was our first visit to Amarone and we were so pleasantly surprised by the professional and friendly service we received from our waitress Mia and also the management who stopped by to check in with us during our meal. The food was delicious and the experience even better 😊 🍕 🇮🇹 ❤️

If you are anywhere in Los Angeles or on a vacation this is a must stop and a hidden gem in West Hollywood. You will have the best Italian food in all of Hollywood and maybe the City. There is not one thing wrong with this place. It is perfect. You will be in heaven. You will be calm and relaxed while served by the best staff and the owner is cute as a button, and Italian.

It was concert night for Buddy, my grandson, and I and we were in search of a new fine dining restaurant. We were driving down Sunset Boulevard in West Hollywood and Buddy sees this little tiny Brown building and says let's look. He sure knows how to pick them. Turns out to be an Italian restaurant with everything made from scratch, no preservatives, no sugar, just amazing food. They even make their own bread.

We walked in, parking is on the street and they might have valet at night, I don't know. We were the first ones there. They were not even open yet, but we did not know and we walked in. The sweetest, most adorable young man asked us where we would like to sit. The place is so pretty, but small. We told him to put us where ever he wanted. We were starting to realize the place was just about to open. The waiter took us upstairs to the most wonderful table near a window. He asked what we might want to drink and gave us menus. Their menu is not huge. Again, they make everything from scratch.

We were brought warm Italian bread and it was so great. I asked about it and they make it right there as they do everything. It was amazing.

For entrees we had ravioli and a wonderful pasta filled with shrimp, clams and mussels in a red sauce. It was so great, my grandson was "sharing" my food. Again, all made there, to order, by scratch.

For dessert we had the best Tiramisu I have ever had in my life.

As the place began to fill I could see wonderful dishes going by. The waiter was kind to my grandson and gave us all the time we wanted. It was just a wow experience and I have been to most of the Italian places in Hollywood. I can't wait to bring my husband. He is going to love it.

On the way down the stairs an adorable man took my check and card. It turned out he is the owner. He is Italian and all of these receipts are his. I think he might have "borrowed" a little from his grandmother and mother and added some of his own. I could tell he loved his little fine dinning place. He was so sweet--photo attached.

You must go there. You just must.

name: Rosaline
address: 8479 Melrose Ave, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: The main course, prawns and scallops did not disappoint. Everything was loaded with flavors we were looking for. The appetizers were almost as good. The drinks were delightful! Our server was knowledge, pleasant and very helpful. We look forward to returning to try more dishes. The donut dessert is worth the wait,!!

I have been to this place before and I don’t understand why they had to change or modify their menu. Ceviche was flavorless, the onions were bitter and the leche de tigre was not made properly. The saltado wasn’t saltado. No char on any of the ingredients, filet was overcooked and barely any onions and instead of fries, they had boiled purple potatoes? Had to send it back. Then we ordered the short rib, and it was not soft as it should be. It was more like BBQ ribs and not braised…The beet salad was amazing and the beef heart (anticucho) was pretty good, but I paid over $300 for a disappointing experience. Don’t mess with the classics. Especially when Peruvian cuisine is in the spotlight.

As a Peruvian I gotta say… Approved!
The dishes aren’t your typical Peruvian dishes. They are gourmet. Prices are a little high but the quality of the food justifies the price. I will go back!

Wow. This place is incredible. We had the octopus, branzino and for a starter the cod/potato starter. Everything hit the spot. Do eat all of the sauces that come with each dish. I was floored by the wasabi/mustard sauce on the side of the appetizer. And there’s a special tomato/olive confit on the potatoes of the octopus that is spicy and just, so so good. The drinks were amazing too - everything is so smooth. Highly recommend chicha gin fiz. This place is also beautiful and amazing that I’m actually writing the review in the restaurant, which is a first. Thanks for a great meal, chefs at Rosaline!

Tomahawk steak. Enough said. I also had their paella , and it was incredibly stellar. The shrimp, the sauce, crispy burned edges, this place didn't disappoint. The service was incredible, the second you walk in. The inside is dimly lit with just enough light to set a romantic atmosphere and a vibe that makes you want to stay longer than you anticipated.

name: Pizzana
address: 460 N Robertson Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90048, USA
reviews: Best pizza in town for sure. Pizza is a sensitive issue because it is very difficult to find an authentic pizza with ingredients that are fresh. Ingredients used in this unique pizza are from Italy. I love the design of the place. The colors used and the whole vibe is just perfect. I will come back.
Food was great. Modern twists on classic flavors. Service is great too. They take reservations which is nice.

Tried Pizzana for the first time in Hollywood as we were visiting from OC for the day.  we saw the place in istagram which claimed to have the best Pizza in LA and decided to give it a try.  I was only me and my wifey for this dinner, and we stopped by their location around 5:30 to see if it is busy and whether we needed a reservation.  They told us to better reserve a spot just in case.  When we showed up an hour later, we were the only patrons, but by 8PM there were a couple of other parties that came in.  The location is very small.  You can see their kitchen from the street.  The have about 3-4 tables inside right where the kitchen is visible and where all the take out hussle happens and about 10 tables of 2 outside in an alley that has been converted to an indoor seating area, which is super dark and I guess romantic?  They have seat lamps and the roof is covered but not with a real roof but you are semi warm and if it is rainy there is no danger of getting wet.  Their menu is fairly simple, and it is on a paper place mat.  They have a few options for starters, 4 salad options, and about a dozen pizza options.  We decided to try their brussel sprouts salad (18), Chopped salad (20) and their Neo Margherita Pizza (24).  Salads came out fairly quickly.  I was kinda disappointed by the size given the price, but they were both tasty.  The Chopped salad is light and doesnt have too much salami or cheese which is the way I like.  The brussel sprout salad is mostly lettuce with grated brussel sprouts on top but has yummy pistacchios and it was a big hit with my wife.
The star of the show was the Neo Margherita pizza that came out of the oven with just the right amount of chard on the crust.  It is traditional nepotetan thin pizza which is really delicious.  You can definitely taste the san manzano tomatoes and the fresh cheese (which they say it is imported from Italy - fior di latte)....really nice.  It is a 12 inch pizza that come in 6 slices.  Of course I had 4 slices and wifey had 2 LOL.  If I had to pick on anything is that the crust may need a tad bit more salt and oil, as I really enjoy the crust especially the slightly chard ones, but this one was a bit too dry for me, so I have to transfer some of the sauce from the main slice on it to make it edible.
Overall great food, seems like most of their business is take out and delivery...

Came here for a late dinner and made a reservation for the three of us at 9pm. Metered street parking available. Credit cards accepted. Outdoor seating in an alley with heating as well as indoor seating available. There’s a single occupant restroom in the back (note that you must push pretty firmly to open the door). We ordered the chop salad, carnivoro pizza, Bianca pizza, and vodka pasta. Everything was tasty and I particularly enjoyed the texture of the pasta. The chop salad was hearty and a good starter if you’re hungry. I preferred the carnivoro over the Bianca but enjoyed both. We had a few slices leftover that kept well for the following day.

We had the broccolini and fried cauliflower for appetizers, and three different pizzas. The appetizers tasted good. The pizzas are all pretty personal size - sliced into six, good for sharing as well. The pizzas were delectable and full of original flavor, it was warm and fresh. The wait for the pizzas was a bit long, but we had the appetizers beforehand. The pizzas are decent but the crusts were fairly burnt — hence the three stars, but if you don’t mind burnt pizza crust then it shouldn’t be a big problem! The burnt crust  could also be because the oven was burnt before hand and not scraped before. The restaurant has a pleasing architecture to it and is very trendy. Good place to come for lunch and dinner!

name: Tar & Roses
address: 602 Santa Monica Blvd, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews:
One of the best meals we’ve ever had! Highly recommend! Everything we had was delicious!

Oxtail dumplings
Balsamic glazed ribs
Singaporean chili crab cake
Fried cauliflower
Maitake mushrooms
Lamb shank
Hanger steak

Our server Brad was very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. We were sad we were too full to get dessert.

We had a phenomenal experience here. Service and food were spectacular and I cannot wait to return!

Crudo, peach & buratta salad, roasted half chicken, mushrooms, gnocchi, and the strawberry ricotta dessert--holy mother of god every single dish was consistently good.

Our server and everyone who touched the table were lovely. They really set themselves apart with both special food and special service.

Really looking forward to returning.

If I could have had more off the menu I would have done, but I don't think my waistline would have been best pleased. Really great variety of dishes to cater for a myriad of different tastes. Mostly small plates to share on the table (which I love as you get to try a bit of everything) wonderful industrial feel to the place as well. Staff were helpful and gave us good advice for selections off the menu. We'll just have to visit again sometime to try the other dishes.

Really enjoyed our meal here. The English peas served edamame style was our favorite app. We also enjoyed the hangar steak and the shellfish pot. Our waitress was super friendly and helpful. The dishes are meant to be shared so go with folks who like to eat. All in all a fun date night out.

Went on a date to celebrate getting a new job. We had the oxtail dumplings, ricotta gnocchi, eggplant, fried cauliflower, the venison loin, and the toffee pudding. The experience as a whole was fantastic. It truly felt like an artistic experience as much as a culinary one. The food was delicious and the menu is so carefully crafted for fall. The staff is top tier and are professionals without question. Definitely a life-enhancing experience and I will be back!

name: Water Grill
address: 1401 Ocean Ave, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews: Food and atmosphere were both exceptional. Brenda was our server and she was very attentive and professional. Would recommend to anyone looking for good quality seafood! Chilean Sea Bass and the Scallops were seared and cooked perfectly.

My wife and I were staying in a hotel in Santa Monica on July 4th, 2024 and we were looking for a good seafood restaurant. I found this place on Google and saw it had over 2000 really good reviews and the concierge at our hotel also recommended it, so I made a reservation and we tried it.  When we arrived, the place was packed and there was a line of people waiting to be seated. We were seated within 5 minutes after letting them know we had a reservation.  Andre was our server and the guy was excellent. We asked about some of the items on the menu and he answered all our questions.  We started out with the Spanish Octopus and a few Margarita’s.  The Octopus was fantastic, but be aware, you are only going to get one arm of the octopus which is common in every restaurant.  After I took one bite, I wished there were 8 arms on that plate!  The Chilean sea bass was hands down the best we have ever had and the portion size was great.

This place is on the higher end and the bill reflects that, but we didn’t have a single complaint about this restaurant, the food or the staff.  The bill was $194 before tip for two of us.  We would definitely dine here again if in the area.  I highly recommend this place if you’re looking for good seafood.

All the staff we interacted with were friendly and seemed very happy to be working there.

Absolutely amazing place; not only were the staff super friendly, knowledgeable and punctual, the food and drinks were top notch. I personally enjoyed the platter and my wife had the king Salmon. Would definitely recommend to others and would love to visit again

We had an exceptional dining experience at this restaurant! The food was simply outstanding, with every dish bursting with rich and delicious flavors. The environment was equally impressive, offering a warm and inviting ambiance that made our meal even more enjoyable. Highly recommend for anyone looking for great food in a lovely setting!

Stopped by to treat my newlywed wife for her birthday during our honeymoon. While we couldn't get a table they offered us high top seating at the bar which was fine for us. We ordered the oyster sampler and the lump crab cake; both of which were amazingly fresh quality. I ended up getting the lobster roll entree and my wife got the fresh grilled fish (I forget what type). The quality of each dish was hands down one of the best I've had. I went with the butter version but in hindsight I would have preferred the mayo version. While the lobster was tender, it could have used something in addition to the bread for it to not be so dry. The fish was tender and flaky. My wife can be picky about fish but she really enjoyed it. They were also nice enough to check with the kitchen about my wife's lactose intolerance, and gave her a non dairy sorbet dessert. Overall I definitely recommend this place for anyone who wants a great meal in a lively atmosphere with great service.

name: The Albright
address: 258 Santa Monica Pier, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews: Super casual restaurant directly on Santa Monica Pier. Order and pick up at the window. Indoor and outdoor seating. Quite possibly the best clam chowder and bread bowl I’ve ever had. The lobster roll was also excellent. Very highly recommended.

Delicious and fresh.

The service was friendly, however it did take a bit to get our grilled oysters to us but it did not disappoint and we enjoyed them down on the beach.

Also get the strawberry lemonade, it tastes like fresh strawberries and it wasn’t super sugary.

Grabbed brunch here on a Sunday Morning.

Cute and open air building with plenty of seating inside and out.

Service was sufficient. Not to particularly engaging or opinionated regarding the offerings.

We had picky young adults with us so a seafood place can stress them out.

Burger- was very enjoyable
Fish and Chips 5/5
Fish tacos overall good, could use more sauce.
CT lobster Roll- hubs really liked it.
Calamari- could be better, kinda chewy
Oysters on the half shell- Black Magic oysters were so sweet and yummy! However they were still connect to the shell and that’s not typical.
Chocolate chip cookie- just ok

The team there seems tired. They took orders and provided food, but not one person smiled back when I interacted with them. It was a sunny day and was so happy to be outside and being there dampened my mood. That sad vibe translated to the food.

Lobster roll:  one word - dry. The bread was so dry I almost choked. I got the New England style and they didn't put a lot of meat in the roll, so 35% was just stale, dry, bread. Also, the fries were cold and tasted like they'd been sitting out for a while

Ahi poke: underwhelming with very little flavor and bland, mushy rice

Grilled salmon: best dish we tried and had some flavor. Small portion of fish, overcooked veggies, bland, mushy rice

We spent $72 on these three items. We won't be in any hurry to return.

i think it was a scam. they charged 16$ for an appetizer size poke. all my friends food portion were really small and not the worth the price. i think everything on the menu are overpriced. with those price you can get a proper lunch or dinner at a restaurant outside the pier. If you’re looking a place to eat dinner, i would recommend to not eat here. but if you are okay with the price, you can try

name: THE Curious PALATE
address: 395 Santa Monica Pl, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews:
Story time! My friend was craving a cheese burger and I didn’t know where to find one. A nice security guard let me in on the best burger he’s ever had in his life, and walked me over to The Curious Palate.
I didn’t know it at the time but the owner was there and working the counter behind the bar. He greeted me and my toddler with warmth and welcomed me in to view the menu before offering suggestions. I placed the order and went chase after my kid on the escalators. My friend came by and went into the restaurant to pick up the burger and ended up staying to enjoy the meal. I came back to find her and her daughter settled at a table sharing fries with house made ketchup.
The owner came by to see how we were doing and we found out that all the veggies are sourced from the farmers market and they make their bread in house along with their burger patties. The burger was top notch and we agreed with the security guard about how it may be the best damn burger in town.
The restaurant is bright with plenty of space for large families. The bar stools are comfy and invite the urge to sit a while and enjoy the lovely Santa Monica air.
Will definitely be coming back 😊

Everything is homemade. The menu offers a delightful variety of dishes, all crafted with fresh, high-quality ingredients. The service was impeccable, with the owner and staff going above and beyond to ensure we had a fantastic dining experience.

It’s my first time here and I’m glad I found it! Their Spicy Thai Satay sandwich tasted amazing. Their homemade ketchup also hits different. We also loved their Swordfish sandwich.
They were a little understaffed, but they were friendly and the service was quick.

Curious Place has left the best impression!! Great hosts, delicious dishes, beautiful presentations, and lots of wine selection!! I recommend it to everyone for a great brunch on the weekend!!
I will definitely go back.

My second visit was as great as the first time!
We even had a small chat with the nice owner and he told us where he gets his fresh produce and is willing to share his recipes

Amazing little place inside the shopping mall! Food is outstanding and service is great. Loved their selection of local draft beer. Great coffee porter. Pea pesto pasta was delicious, light and fresh, with lots of pesto, peas and sun dried tomatoes. Way better than most Italian places. Burger was tasty too, cooked medium and served with well seasoned fries. Definitely recommend!!! 😋 😋 😋

name: 1212 Santa Monica
address: 1212 3rd Street Promenade, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews: It was a packed night which is a good sign but could also be very interesting with service. We had reservations but there was a little wait which wasn’t that bad. A drink at the bar helps. Once seated, an outside table, our server Anna was amazing. Very attentive to everything and so appreciative as well. Trying to take care of the other tables as well as us. She was a busy bee but got everything done. She and the other guys was able to get us another headlamp as the one that was utilized next to us ended up being turned down when another party requested it not an acknowledging us one bit. And then the nerve to put a jacket on afterwards because it was too cold. But instead of fussing over it, she and one of the other guy moved an unused heater to accommodate our table. Great service. Starters were amazing, fries are always good. Our entree was good as well but more keen on the starters. Great and fast service, Anna was amazing.

The restaurant is really amazing, decor is pretty, not too loud, nice music, and our server Donald was really sweet. Nice service, really paid attention to what we needed and recommended the best for our group. Really appreciate it and will come back when visiting the area.
Anna was great! She was very attentive and friendly! The dine LA course was delicious! Generous portions and very tasty! All-day happy hour is a plus, quality drinks! Highly recommend!

Perfect for a late snack.  Remus was the friendliest and most helpful host we’ve had in ages, and our food (crostini, squash blossom, tagliatelle) hit the bar for excellence.  The mocktail version of the Gooseberry also made my night!

Spent a few days in Santa Monica with a friend and our teenage sons. Wanted to treat them to a nice dinner and 1212 did not disappoint! Food, staff, ambiance, everything was excellent! I had the mushroom risotto, it was the best one I’ve had outside Italy. Lasagna and ravioli were excellent, great wine list too.

name: The Penthouse
address: 1111 2nd St, Santa Monica, CA 90403, USA
reviews: We had amazing dinner, with beautiful views of the city, the ocean and the sunset:)) Service was superb, starting from the host and finishing with all the servers, bussers, valet! The noise level was very high though-we were screaming when we’re talking-so if you are planning a quiet evening atmosphere, that’s not it)) Very lively and loud here. Food and dessert were fantastic! I didn’t like the Freshlove drink, but the second one that Server recommended, smth with Apple, was very yummy!! Def recommend!

I recently had the pleasure of dining at The Penthouse Santa Monica, and it was truly a culinary experience to remember. Perched high above Santa Monica, the restaurant offers breathtaking views of the sunset and the sparkling city below, creating the perfect backdrop for a memorable evening.

To start off the meal, I ordered the Crispy Rice with a choice of Hawaiian Tuna, Spicy King Salmon, or Truffle Wagyu Steak Tartare, and it was a delightful explosion of flavors and textures. The crispy rice provided the perfect crunch to complement the fresh, tender tuna, and the truffle created a harmonious dish that set the stage for the rest of the meal.

Next, I tried the Greek Style Octopus, and it was nothing short of exceptional. The octopus was cooked to perfection, tender with a slight char, and the flavors of the Mediterranean herbs and spices shone through beautifully. It was delicious and flavorful, leaving me wanting more.

For the main course, I indulged in the Umami Steak, featuring USDA Prime Flat Iron, Truffle Potato Cloud, Portobello Mushroom, and Umami Sauce. The steak was cooked to a perfect medium rare, incredibly tender, and bursting with savory umami flavors. The accompaniments elevated the dish to another level, and each bite was a symphony of deliciousness.

To round off the evening on a sweet note, I savored the Profiteroles with Vanilla Bean Ice Cream and Chocolate Ganache. The profiteroles were light and airy, filled with luscious vanilla bean ice cream and drizzled with decadent chocolate ganache. It was the perfect ending to a perfect meal.

Overall, my dining experience at The Penthouse Santa Monica was nothing short of amazing. The food was exquisite, the service was impeccable, and the views were breathtaking. I can't wait to return to this gem of a restaurant and indulge in their culinary delights once again. If you're looking for a dining experience with a view to match, The Penthouse Santa Monica is the place to be.

I had the pleasure of dining at The Penthouse Restaurant for breakfast, and it was an unforgettable experience. The service was amazing, with attentive and friendly staff ensuring everything was perfect. The view from the sky is simply breathtaking, offering a stunning backdrop to a delightful meal.

The breakfast was delicious, with every dish expertly prepared and bursting with flavor. Even though I only had breakfast here, it was enough to leave a lasting impression. I can't wait to return and try more from their menu.

Highly recommended for anyone looking for an exceptional dining experience in Santa Monica!

We came on a Saturday evening without reservation, and were able to get a table quickly. The sunset view can only be seen on one corner. The food was good, but not over the top. We ordered brussel sprouts for appetizer and it was over-cooked too-roasted. The price tags were high and the entree portion size was small. You can get parking validation.

Amazing experience for my sisters birthday. The location is stunning, the service is amazing and food was generous and delicious. The prices are actually reasonable for what you’re getting. Our server Cristina was so sweet and attentive and the rest of the wait staff works so hard to ensure all customers are taken care of. We will definitely be returning.

name: North Italia
address: 1442 2nd St, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews:
This place is a definite go-to for pizza and pasta lovers. The Margherita pizza and chicken pesto pasta we tried were both exceptional. The flavors were spot on, and the portions were satisfying.

Service was impressively quick and friendly. The restaurant itself has a nice, open atmosphere, but it can get quite crowded and noisy.

However, this might be part of its lively charm.
Overall, we had a great experience and would recommend this spot to anyone looking for delicious Italian food.
The best pesto pasta ever!! I tried this pasta in Miami 2 years ago and here I am now I ate it again in Santa Monica with the same yummy taste. Great margarita pizza. The service is wonderful too.

Excellent dining at an affordable price. Beautiful restaurant in a great location in Santa Monica. Food quality is excellent but I wish they had more choices and less grease on the pizza.  Best short ribs, I strongly recommend!!

One word... AMAZING..... This was a fantastic and delicious restaurant.   The service was amazing,  the food was spectacular and environment excellent.   The server answered every question we had and was extremely courteous and patient with all our questions.   The food was amazing and I loved the fact that everything was made from scratch in-house.  Come check this place out it is scrumptious.

Great  food, service atmosphere.
Spicy rigatoni vodka has a great sauce and sausage they use for it was great enough.
Bolognese has strong meat flavor, which I love it and all the pasta were perfectly cooked as al dente.
Their meatball was so great the sauce, and creamy polenta was a shock for me, I've never seen but it goes really well.
All the servers and host greeted me nicely and it seems the servers are professionals and explained the menu really well.
Definitely recommend this place!.

name: The Misfit Bar & Restaurant
address: 225 Santa Monica Blvd, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews: The atmosphere of this place is awesome. The decor is pretty cool. However, my waiter had the personality of a fence post like she was totally miserable then she was replaced by another waiter midway through my dinner. I thought that was kind of weird. The new waiter was very nice and polite. The food was mediocre at best. Nothing crazy but nothing to complain about. Very expensive they charge five dollars for a soda and no free refills.

Amazing 1924 building with fabulous food, ambiance and drinks. My mom is a vegan and they had plenty of vegan options that she liked I had the sea bass it was absolutely amazing and my brother had the crispy chicken sandwich that was very good I got to taste a bite of it.

Amazing! For drinks, the Mrs. ordered a Japanese Dream. (1st time) It was INCREDIBLE. Highly recommend! The Smash Burger, and Gilberto’s Guac are GREAT as well. The atmosphere, and the staff are top notch. Favorite food of our trip!
Amazing craft cocktail half price for Happy Hour. Vibrant location....food is wonderful. I recommend the Ceviche and bacon wrapped dates.
We found the ambiance of this establishment to be pleasing, complemented by exceptional service. The menu options were delightful, particularly the octupus, burrata, and the fresh oysters.

name: Rustic Canyon
address: 1119 Wilshire Blvd, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews:
Ok, the bread 🍞 here is stupid good. We dined at 530p and they only had 3 left. So, trust when I say if you wanna be in gluten heaven, go early. Service was excellent. Food was too. Everyone there cares about what they're doing and it shows.  Solid operation, everyone!  🎉

Pork Chops? Good Lord.

Down to the most basic desserts... A cantaloupe sorbet was very memorable.

Excellent dinner! The salads are delicious, lots of stuff, mix of texture and healthy nutrients for the most active lifestyle. As a vegan, the options are slim. The asparagus was tender and juicy. The Spring Salad was crunchy and refreshing. People loved the trout, the polenta was loose and devoured. I had the strawberry sherbet for dessert, sweet and full!

This restaurant is a real gem, constantly refreshing their menu to offer new culinary delights. The food is exceptional, clearly showcasing their passion and dedication to quality. It's the little things, like the double shucked peas, that really highlight their commitment to perfection. The Mt. Lassen trout was a standout for me—simply unforgettable. I was so impressed by their cuisine that I couldn't resist buying their cookbook.
The food here was well worth a stop. Everything was so good, the service and servers were great. Everything is in season. I would highly recommend it.

We loved every single dish we ordered; the house-made bread and butter, addictive marinated olives, heavenly dumplings, refreshing and complex tomato variety salad, inventive and well-balanced cocktails, chocolate halva, and the freshest, most divine fruit plate we’ve ever tried.
The service was knowledgeable and friendly, and we had the best, most comfy seats in house.
Will definitely be back when in town, and make sure to try out multiple sister restaurants.

name: Ivy at the Shore
address: 1535 Ocean Ave, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews:
During an early morning stroll along the Santa Monica promenade, we started to feel peckish. So, we decided to stop in at the very unique and quaint Ivy at the Shore restaurant. It was a beautiful and comfortable place to sit and eat breakfast while enjoying a view of the ocean shore.
The staff who were very attentive greeted us warmly and Carlos helped us with suggestions on what to order.
I had the scrumptious breakfast pizza topped with a poached egg and washed down with incredibly fresh squeezed orange juice; my wife had the French toast, and my daughter had the crab benedict.
Then when it came to dessert time, I ordered the blackberry apple crumble, my wife ordered the heavenly key lime pie, and my daughter ordered the cup of berries.
I had a great conversation with the staff about the history of the restaurant, as well as its beautiful and comfortable atmosphere.
This place is definitely worth visiting when you're in the area.

Place was very crowded around the time I came.. Had a reservation but got seated 10-15 minutes later. The presentation of food was great but the taste… Everything I had including the salad was bland. This was very disappointing because you would think if the food was expensive, it would at least be good. The only thing I would recommend is the fried calamari, fresh pineapple juice, and passion fruit tangerine sorbet. I would not go back, but it is a cute restaurant just for the aesthetic.

Amazing find. We were heading to the Santa Monica pier and our Lyft driver stopped right in front of this spot. We looked inside and could not resist having lunch there. It is an amazing place, a feel like a kick from the 1960s Cuba, rustic elegance with superb service. Definitely a relic from a different time that rises above all of the kitsch of Santa Monica pier. Don’t eat on the pier, spend the bucks and eat here.

The food is unexpectedly simple and elegant. Not food you will find in other places. And the staff is gracious, patient, accommodating, and grateful. They have been trained extraordinarily well, and everyone knows their job and does it without prompting.

The decor is fascinating, vibrant, engaging, entertaining. Fresh roses at every table. A place one could sit and appreciate for hours. Never been to a place like this. Music was a bit odd - recording of female vocalist doing anything from Billy Joel to Carole King to Deep Purple. That’s the only thing that didn’t quite fit. On the other hand, maybe it’s just the quirk this fabulous spot needs.

This is a place you DO NOT want to pass up. Worth every penny and the time spent.

Passed by this restaurant and decided to have dinner here. The staff was very nice and fast. Food was good, we had fried calamari and drinks (espresso martini and margarita), but nothing exceptional. The restaurant is in a great location, placed right on the other side of the road from the Santa Monica pier. I would recommend it as it was a nice place to eat, but be prepared to pay a bit more (2 portions and 3 drinks ca 160$)

Another amazing dining experience at Ivy at the Shore. The seafood platter was a sumptuous appetizer, and the sea bass, grilled salmon, and lobster ravioli were savory and satisfying. And, of course, the staff, as always, was gracious, attentive, and accommodating!

name: Élephante
address: 1332 2nd St Rooftop, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews: Really good food. Reservation highly suggested. Went for breakfast and the whole menu was open for ordering. Ending up getting the breakfast sandwich which was good but really just a nicer version of an ordinary breakfast sandwich. Had a taste of the polenta and that was nice too — different. I can’t forget the whipped eggplant — delicious! And with the bread is so good! Coffee tasted well. Lastly, our server Tony was very attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable. We appreciated his service. This place is one part hype and another part really good at what it does.

Delicious food and drinks in a beautiful spot with great views. Loved the gem lettuce salad, the whipped eggplant, the vocdka sauce pasta and the truffle pasta. The tequila/mezcal cocktails are delicious! Service was decent, considering how packed it was for a mid afternoon on a Wednesday! Will definitely be back.

Beautiful views and exceptional views! The entrance to this amazing restaurant does not give any clue as to the amazing view once you arrive to the seating area! Watching the sunset as you dine, I could stay here for hours just enjoying the vibe and the food! My daughter recommended this restaurant and it did not disappoint! Can't wait til I'm back in LA again to try another awesome dish!

This was a disappointing first and last experience. We made reservations for the “sunset room,” but were seated in a corner by the kitchen doors and cappuccino maker. I asked if we could be seated in the main area and was told there were no seats for a party of 2. We watched as half a dozen parties of 2 were seated within the main area (including at tables for 4 and a party that had no reservation). It set such a negative tone for the dining experience.

Instead of enjoying the lovely views and open air, we had every dirty plate pass by us, listened to the constant stacking of plates, and had the kitchen doors swinging open behind us. We ate our food as quickly as possible and left. I cannot imagine seating someone in this seat unless as a last resort. As a first time patron, I would never go back after this—despite finding the food good.

If you’re intent on going, I’d recommend the cactus room or a larger party to avoid the same experience. Apparently even when 80% of the dining room is open, they’ll still shove you in a corner.

Great ambience and people watching, especially when the weather is nice.

Delicious Mediterranean food - specifically the sopresata pizza, the whipped eggplant, and the meatballs. Also, perfect for sharing with others in your party.

Highly recommend if you’re looking to bring guests/out-of-towners to Santa Monica.

name: FIG RESTAURANT
address: 101 Wilshire Blvd, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews: I have been to here for brunch twice and really enjoyed it both times. Service and ambiance were great too. We had the pancakes, cinnamon roll, burrito and the acai bowl. All were very good. I highly recommend if you want to go for a nice brunch with family. The eggs Benedict was amazing too.

I had very high expectations when I finally decided to go here for brunch. From the pictures the food looked phenomenal, unfortunately both dishes I ordered were underwhelming. I might have to go back and try some other items or possibly the dinner menu. But as of now they left me unimpressed. The atmosphere was phenomenal and the service was fantastic. the venue is at the Fairmont so it’s quite a pleasurable experience being surrounded by the aesthetics. I ordered the salmon eggs Benedict, and the lemon ricotta pancakes. Neither of them matched up to the price tag, and felt like they were missing that “something special.” Spent upwards of $100 total for these two dishes. Hopefully the next visit impresses.

This is the 2nd time I have been here. Dinner was great!  It was a slow Saturday night. One of the specials was Shishito peppers. Normally not spicy but man did we get all the hot peppers. Oysters were very small but very good. Cucumber mint mocktail was lovely. The filet was cooked perfectly. The butternut squash pasta was divine. Wedge salad was unique. The sorbet was disappointing.

Our server and the staff were very attentive and kind.

Beautiful place. Delicious food. Amazing service from ABRAHAM. I decided to order eggs Benedict with side of potatoes.most delicious meal I’ve head. I will be returning. Expensive meal you eat once in a while.

A California Style Mediterranean Restaurant, the menu ingredients fuse Mediterranean Cuisine with Asian Cuisine. Happy Hour is the best time to go 50% off. My favorite dishes are the Southeast Asian inspired Beef Tartar with Tapioca Waffer, similar texture as a Chinese Shrimp Chip. The Branzino is the best entrée, Roasted crispy skin. Every few minutes you'll see Flaming Saganaki Served at a neighboring tables.

name: Meat On Ocean
address: 1501 Ocean Ave, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews: I visit Santa Monica dozens of times a year and have been noticing this restaurant for a while. Today, I took some time to try it out, and the aged steak was excellent. The restaurant has a classic decor style, with brown as the main color, which I quite like. The street-facing tables are open-air, offering a pleasant view of the beach and a refreshing sea breeze. The steak quality is outstanding, highly recommended!

Food, AMAZING! Service, AMAZING! Kelli… EXTRA AMAZING!!!

My husband and I celebrated our four year anniversary here and in all the time we’ve been together, we have not had food as outstanding as this! If you haven’t been, GO! And as for Kelli. She is an absolute delight!!

Made reservations here so unsure if you can just walk in, but if you can, I would recommend still making a reservation as this place is near the beach, and it can get really cold at night.

The server we received gave superb service, from knowing how to recommend dishes, giving a pretty accurate description of portion sizes and what to expect as well as not trying to upsell any dishes.

When asked about the specials and what was on hand for their dry aged, she was really knowledgeable about the menu itself, it really showed great professional expertise. On top, she did not give off the vibe of a overly fancy server, but rather one where you can casually talk to, which in turn provided a pleasant experience.

Every dish that was ordered was either good or surprisingly good. Some of the items, such as the make it yourself charcuterie board, we had no idea what to actually select. Our server helped walk through each option as well as provided her own input on what she likes the best (hint it's not always the expensive options).

I would say, this place is a great place for special occasions or sometimes a place where you just want to treat yourself a little more.
Best restaurant ever!!!! I been coming here for years now and the food is outstanding… I never had one single thing wrong. Staff is so nice and friendly too. I wish this place is closer to me.

This restaurant was excellent! The atmosphere, establishment, staff and hospitality was excellent! You must try their aged steaks. Seasoned to perfection. Hands down to our waiter! He added perfection to my birthday! Thank you guys!

name: Blue Daisy
address: 609 Broadway, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews: Amazing food. Different menu choices from your normal breakfast spot. Healthy food options, as well as some of the traditional breakfast items. No kids menu, but they do have half portion options. The food quality was amazing. Super fresh. The portion sizes were decent, BUT they were very hearty and I ended up full. Atmosphere was ok, just like any other cafe. They have espresso coffees as well. I got a latte and it was amazing. So rich and smooth. Service was super fast and food came out looking like an upscale restaurant. I will definitely be coming back.
This place is so cute. The atmosphere was great. The food was delish. I had the bacon crepe - highly recommend. The zucchini hash was different but we still liked it.

Nice food, nice atmosphere. Breakfast at Tiffany’s kind of vibe with the blue everything, including the interior design and background music.

We arrived around 12 PM and didn’t have to wait. We were seated inside.

We decided to try Blue Daisy after walking several blocks in search of a traditional breakfast spot. Historically, whenever we've driven by Blue Daisy, it's been packed. However, since it was a mid-morning on a weekday, there was nearly no wait. We were promptly seated and chose to sit inside as the sun was directly shining on the outdoor seating area, making it less comfortable than usual. To our surprise, the interior was larger than we had anticipated. There was a beautifully decorated room in the back hosting a larger party, which had an ethereal quality.

Inside the main dining area where we were seated, there were various seating options, including a bar. The restaurant offers a range of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages, juices, and handcrafted caffeinated drinks.

The menu at Blue Daisy is not your typical breakfast menu. The options appeared to be freshly sourced and uniquely-prepared. My guest and I opted for safer choices: a Nutella, strawberry, and banana crêpe, and a short stack of chocolate chip pancakes. Both dishes were delightful. We also ordered a side of sausage and bacon. The bacon was perfectly crispy without being greasy and the sausage patty had a slight kick to it, making it equally tasty.

My guest ordered a drink called the Sunrise (I think), a combination of several juices with a touch of mint, which was refreshing and delicious once she added some raw sugar to it. I chose a mocha, which was only served hot and arrived in a cute little cup with a beautiful design on top. While it was more coffee than mocha and not to my liking, it was beautifully presented. I ultimately opted for a different type of drink that also had fresh mint in it, that was much better and definitely refreshing.

The service was good and it appeared as though people go regularly, there was a sense of community, connection and camaraderie amongst those that work there & their guests. Personally, that's always refreshing to see.

Overall, our experience was good and we can't wait to go back.
This place is a must-must-must-try! Every time I'm in the area, I’ll stop by for brunch, and it never disappoints. No matter what you order, you have to try the zucchini hash. It's amazing!

name: Back on the Beach Cafe
address: 445 CA-1, Santa Monica, CA 90402, USA
reviews: Four years ago, we were traveling for a conference, and this place made an impact on me in the middle of the pandemic. Despite the craziness and ridiculous California rules all around the beach. Such as not being able to use a PUBLIC restroom! My sister and I, along with my toddler, drove around what seemed like an eternity looking for a restroom that wasn't closed or that didn't require a reservation from a restaurant. We took so long to find one that we got hungry. We stopped here to try our luck with the bathrooms, and luckily, the restaurant was open and had outdoor seating available. We were overjoyed to find this awesome spot! After relieving ourselves, we excitedly ordered the salmon and burger. They were the best meal we've had in years in the area. We made a vow to come back, and we've been back regularly when in the area ever since. I can't believe I didn't write this review sooner! Thank you to your friendly staff and awesome cooks. Can't wait to be back again.

Great atmosphere. Fairly solid food quality. A bit pricey but it's on the beach.

Used to come here with Ken D and get the Fred's Salad. After his passing, now come here with my own family. Love to continue his tradition.

It wasnt my first time but usually didnt feel like sharing experience as it seems like everyone is happy enough . but today it was different, Young Hostess was polite and sweet , gave 30 mins walk-in wait on Saturday and they sat me on time , greeted by lovely Rona ( if i spelled it right ) , i ordered immediately ( Mushroom burger + Beer ) and received it in less than 15 minutes . Staff is friendly.. over all peaceful, lovely experience..

Loved this place and will definitely be back. They said the wait was going to be 20 minutes but they got us in after about less than 5 minutes lol
