Food, drinks and atmosphere was amazing. Great views and loved the little playground next door for my toddler to burn off some energy. Such good vibes!

If it weren't for the fact that this place is right on the beach I don't know if it would be as popular. The service is incredibly slow (though the servers are friendly and nice) and they get super overwhelmed easily. Food is decent. Best thing is really that it's right next to Annenberg community center and of course right on the beach.

name: UOVO | Santa Monica
address: 1320 2nd St Ste A, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews:
This was truly one the very best Italian restaurants that I’ve eaten in. We were seated by the bar and it was a great view to watch the chefs at work.

We tried the tasting menu for 2 and each dish was just remarkable. We were served with 3 different kinds of pasta that were cooked for 2 and split into 2 plates for us. With that we got one appetizer and a desert to share as well.

My favorite was the tagliatelle cooked in white truffle butter, but honestly it’s hard to pick a favorite cause everything just exceeded our expectations by a mile.

Would definitely recommend this place to try out authentic Italian pasta.

To say this place has ruin any other pasta place we had in the past is an understatement.

I want to start off by listing a few things I appreciate about the establishment.

1. First come, first serve. No reservations. Allows the customers to possibly dine in sooner rather than waitlisted due to prior booked reservations.

2. Location is small but it’s quaint and gives a more personal vibe with the bar seating and open kitchen concept. I enjoyed seeing how the dishes were made.

3. The staff from the host to the servers to the chefs are amazing. They were all friendly and work diligently. The flow of the front staff to the kitchen never skipped a beat.

Let’s talk about food! Uovo offers a simple menu so if you want a lot of fancy things like other places, this place might throw you off as they keep it very straightforward and simple.

Their pasta is fresh and flown in overnight from Italy. Every plate we had was perfection. Perfectly cooked al dente pasta where the chew leaves you lingering for the next one. The plates are shareable for 2 people; covers a good 2-3 bites.

What we had…

1. Truffle tagliatelle (special of the night) : the truffle was not overpowering, every strand of pasta was blended with the cheese and truffle. Ever wish you can be a judge on those cooking shows and enjoy those amazing dishes? Well, this dish made me felt like I was a judge the whole time and I was raving how freaking delicious it is.

2. Ragú:  tagliatelle pasta with the best bolognese we had in a very long time. The bolognese tasted as if it’s been simmering for days on end, maybe it has because one bite in and I didn’t want to share it with my boyfriend. It’s a mix of beef and pork with so many familiar aromatics. Warning, this bolognese sticks to the classic; no cheese, no cream. The only way to eat bolognese in my opinion.

3. Caico e Pepe:  I lean towards the red sauce pastas but holy cow this dish is something you want to slap someone for. The chef swirls the pasta around on a pecorino cheese wheel (I really appreciate not burning any alcohol with the cheese) and top it off with more pecorino and black pepper. We were in awe and speechless.

4. Insalata Arugula & Mizuna: tossed and dressed perfectly. Fully enjoyed the hearts of palm and almonds with this salad. A lot of textures and flavors.

5. Tiramisu al cucchiaio:  we love tiramisu but to find a good one is harder than you think. Uovo serves up one in a glass but it’s good! The mascarpone, the espresso and everything in between. And it has hazelnut so enough said.

Absolutely loved the food and experience at Uovo! We went with the classic set and we savored every single bite. The pasta was fresh, flavorful, and delicious. We will definitely be coming back to try the other sets! :)

Really really good pasta.  They're schtick is that they fly the pasta in fresh everyday from Italy.  They claim to be the only place that does that.

Caciao de pepe was delish. Ragu was delish. Clam (vingolese) was pretty good. Can't remember the name of the fourth one we had; think it was a pomodoro (?) and it was super delish.

Small space, so I can see it getting crowded or a lineup during busy times.  We went for a weekday lunch and there was lots of room.

Would highly recommend if in the area.

Let me start by saying that Uovo is worth the wait! We showed up without a reservation for our party of three and had to put our name down. The wait was around 30 minutes, but it gave us time to chat and get excited for the deliciousness to come.

The atmosphere is undeniably intimate. The dim lighting and the candles at each table set a romantic scene. It felt energetic and lively, perfect for a date night, but it was also a bit crowded and felt a bit cramped.

The menu offers two options: a tasting menu for sharing and an a la carte menu. Here's the kicker – the tasting menus serves two people each, so if you're dining solo, you'd pay double the listed price. We opted for the a la carte menu because we wanted to try specific dishes.

One thing that truly sets Uovo apart is their pasta. They don't extrude it in-house; it's shipped overnight, ensuring peak freshness. We tried two pasta dishes, and let me tell you, they were phenomenal!

The first pasta we tried was Cacio e Pepe. The handmade tonnarelli (a thicker, more substantial cousin of spaghetti) had a satisfying bite that cradled the sauce beautifully. The Pecorino Romano DOP ensured a rich, salty depth that perfectly complemented the peppery kick. Imagine creamy, nutty cheese clinging to the pasta, punctuated by bursts of black pepper flavor.

The second pasta we tried was Ragu. It stayed true to its Bolognese roots by featuring a rich blend of beef and pork without any cheese, milk, or cream.

Both the pastas were delicious, but the portion was smaller, which had us craving for more.

We also indulged in the Yellowtail Crudo appetizer. The fish was incredibly fresh, and the combination of chili pepper, micro-arugula, and citrusy dressing created a delightful burst of flavor.

But save room for dessert! The Tiramisu was, hands down, one of the best I've ever had in the States. It struck the perfect balance of richness, creaminess, and coffee flavor.

Overall, Uovo is a fantastic dining experience. While the wait and slightly cramped space might be a consideration, the incredible pasta, fresh ingredients, and delightful desserts make it absolutely worth it.

name: BOA Steakhouse
address: 101 Santa Monica Blvd, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews:
Recommended by my daughter. She’s right, food was absolutely delicious!  Walk-ins welcome.
They had seating available indoor and outdoor. We chose outdoors to take in the sun & beach vibes. Service was slow at 6pm on Sunday.
Our server Joe was professional and to the point. He resembled actor Liam Neeson a bit :|)

The dining experience was wonderful. All of the staff went out of their way to make us feel special. We don’t  order a lot and don’t drink which leads some places to treat us a bit poorly. Not here. We were treated like  we ordered the most expensive champagne and steak dinner. We came in late and really enjoyed our light but very filling meal.  I had the famous table side Cesear and crab cake.  My husband had the waguy meatball and the wedge salad. He loved them both. I loved the salad. It was very good. The crab cake had just enough breading and the crab was very fresh. .

I visited this restaurant on a Monday evening during their ONE-hour Happy Hour. Upon arrival, I was initially asked if I was there to pick up a delivery order, possibly due to my casual dress. After clarifying, I chose to sit at the bar. The bartender, a man named Ryan (if I recall correctly), was friendly and professional. He didn't make any assumptions and engaged me in a brief conversation before taking my drink order.

For starters, I chose the boneless sweet chili pepper wings from the limited Happy Hour menu. They were absolutely delicious—perfectly fried, tender, and well-seasoned. Next, I ordered the shrimp scampi, which was not part of the Happy Hour menu but was worth every penny. The dish featured three jumbo shrimp in a delightful lemony sauce with capers and onions, accompanied by a small piece of bread. It was heavenly to say the least!

For my entrée, I decided on the steak frites with fries. Given that this is a steakhouse, I had high expectations. Unfortunately, I was disappointed when my steak arrived. It wasn't the teriyaki-like sauce that made it appear dark—it was the fact that the steak was burnt, despite my request for a medium-well piece. When Ryan checked in on me, I expressed my dissatisfaction but declined a replacement steak as I needed to return to my room promptly.

I ate what I could, had a few more drinks, and requested the check. To my surprise, the total was just over $150, with the burnt steak still included in the bill. While I didn't expect a complete comp, a gesture acknowledging the charred steak would have been appreciated. Despite this, I will return for the restaurant's chill but elegant ambiance, the excellent bartender, and those delicious boneless wings. However, I think I'll stick to having steak elsewhere.

Probably one of the best burgers ( bar menu ) I’ve ever had. The lychee margarita was delectable! Service was attentive and personable but not overbearing ( which we appreciate). Will 100% be back to dine again.

Appetizers and sides were good (minus the brussels sprouts) but we were very disappointed in the main dishes. My partner had the lamb chops and I had the roasted chicken. The lamb chops were a bit chewy and lacked flavor without the sauce. The chicken was completely flavorless. Even the asparagus and potatoes lacked flavor.

We chose this restaurant because we were celebrating my partner’s bday. There were quite a few parties that were celebrating a special occasion around us. I noticed that each party received cake and ice cream so I requested it as well. I put in the request with our first waitress which was communicated to the waiter that took her spot but for some reason he brought out two cookies and a small scoop of ice cream which had hair in it. It’s safe to say we probably won’t go back.

name: Chez Jay
address: 1657 Ocean Ave, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews:
People claim this is a dive bar, but it has only mid to top tier booze options. So while the interior shoes signs of the times (it's historic), this still is a relatively higher end place. I do love the history. The fish in the wall apparently was caught by General Patton off Catalina Island prior to World War 2. I really enjoyed my time here. Bartender was attentive and poured a generous mixed drink.

They do offer steak, but this is definitely more of a bar vibe than a restaurant.

Came to Chez Jay with my family to go to dinner with some clients. The staff were great at hosting the young children who had a blast and we all enjoyed the food and the classic atmosphere. Everyone left full and happy. Easy free parking next to the building.

Delicious food! Such an awesome vibe & dive bar but with the best food! An absolute must if you're in the area.

We had filet & salmon ... both were perfect

I love it here. The food and vibes are always great. I did have a reservation at 7 and was not seated till a little after 730 due to overbooking and how crowded it was. Had a few martinis while waiting so I was pretty drunk for dinner which made the food taste even better. I love their scampi and potatoes. Love it

Very great seafood. The sand dab was wonderful. The free bread was served warm and smothered in garlic flavored butter. The potato side was wonderful. Great service. Only complaint was that my table was in the middle and bar guests kept talking or moving over me or running into my chair. Also,  it was a bit too dark inside.

name: Fritto Misto
address: 620 Santa Monica Blvd #A, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews: Went there with my best friend for her birthday 🎂 It was amazing! The waiter Matthew was very knowledgeable in cocktails and super welcoming. We ordered the combo platter and chicken pasta- such a big portion! The combo platter had many different kinds of veggies and seafood. The chicken pasta was creamy and juicy. Chocolate flourless cake was our dessert - super rich! Drinks were affordable and nice. The bread was the only thing that I wouldn’t recommend… a bit dry … Would definitely come back again.🤩

Well.... It could've been better. Food was okay. They brought us cold bread and cold butter 🤢, they forgot my appetizer and didn't even apologize for it not coming. They interrupted our way by asking us to move for a party of twenty and promised a dessert 🎂, which is exactly what they gave a party of 3, ONE, dessert. Creme Brulee was ice cold 🥶. Never expected that. Unfortunately, I Probably will not return.

Good food. Borderline of wow quality. But the dish my SO got wasn't impressive. We both did build your own pasta, but we'll try ones from the menu next time.
Adequate service.

I'd definitely back when I'm around, but I cannot travel more than 20 minutes for this restaurant,

I visited this beautiful restaurant yesterday with friends after the Getty Center trip.

I ordered lobster and shrimp ravioli and jumble ravioli, black and white spaghetti, and Misto salad. The salad is fresh and healthy, with fresh veggies on walnuts and pine nuts. The black-and-white spaghetti tastes out of the world! The Ravioli are good too.

The Challenging part is parking. It's really hard to park on the street. I tried for a while then went to the restaurant to ask their employee, one gentleman told me to go across the street and park at the Santa Monica Public Library, you can pay 3 dollars to park there.

I'm going to take my family next week to the Getty center and then visit this place again. I

Great experience & food! Upon walking in, we were greeted immediately by 2 busy waiters. Staff was incredibly friendly & helpful.
Gluten goat cheese pasta was fabulous and super tasty, added chicken.
Also had chicken alfredo & ricotta pillows as an appetizer. We were given a gluten-free chocolate cake that was delish! We'll be returning.

name: Massilia
address: 1445 4th St, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews:
Love to come here for their pasta and pizza but the couscous was always calling my name. I come from Brussels and I was afraid to be disappointed. But that’s no way to live a life, so I went this time and tried it !

It is delicious, will probably come back every time I crave a couscous!
It’s probably my new favorite spot in town!

Plus, a word for the amazing staff that made the birthday all the party girl’s wishes come true! Great team!

Massilia is a nice restaurant in downtown Santa Monica. We came for a weekend brunch but it wasn’t too busy and we got a nice spot outside, but far from the street so it was calm. We ate from the Dine LA lunch menu and were very impressed. Cafe drinks and appetizers were standard and had no issues. The bouillabaisse was very uniquely flavored and memorable, and the mushroom pizza was enormous and satisfying. For dessert we had tarte tatin, which was sizable and tasty. I think the food could be more refined, but given the low price we paid for the tasting menu, it certainly met my expectations and I left full, with a few leftover slices of pizza for dinner!

Everyone needs to go try their 8-hour lamb shank, I’m still thinking about it from last night. We did the Dine LA menu and the portions were so big! The staff was more than friendly and we had a great time. We enjoyed everything and will be coming back

This review is for the Happy Hour! Tapas, small shared bites for food under $10. There is a set cocktail menu for Happy Hour. Prices are 50% off, however if you ask to switch it up, like change a Gin to Vodka, then the price goes back to regular price.

Mindy, our bartender was fabulous and informative!

I will definitely return again! Nice ambience!

Came here with my girlfriend for lunch. The setting and ambience is a vibe. Great date spot. They have couches for seating and they are incredibly comfortable. The food was 3.9 stars, but the space is 5 stars. We got the Pasta Bolognese and Spicy Chicken Wings. I was happy enough with both dishes and the price was fair for the quality. Both left something to be desired in terms of flavor, texture, and presentation. I would gladly come back here but wouldn’t get the same meals. It’s worth a visit if you want a beautiful and cozy space to enjoy a meal in.

P.S. The otherwise beautiful chandelier needs some TLC. There is so much dust on it that it looks fluffy.

name: Jonah's Kitchen + Bar Santa Monica CA
address: 2518 Wilshire Blvd, Santa Monica, CA 90403, USA
reviews: I have nothing to complain about in this restaurant. I have never encountered such an atmosphere before. I’ll keep the words of delight to myself, just watch the video... Delicious and light food. I will definitely visit this place again.

We went to Jonah’s Kitchen for our anniversary with a large group. The back patio is so charming and relaxing. The food is superb. As others have mentioned the brisket is fantastic and the peach cobbler lives up to the hype. Would definitely go back.

Food was RIDICULOUSLY GOOD. So flavorful and rich and comfy. Really hype energy and the staff seemed to have a great vibe with each other. Kelsey helped us out and was SO sincerely kind and accommodating. Go here! (I would all the time if I lived here)

Most definetly an amazing experience. We were told its typically a self serve at counter and pay but since we were a party of 5 she hooked us up with an incredible service. Theyre in process or transitioning to servers. Food was on point, drinks were delish i had mezcal paloma i felt adventurous and shoulda had a normal because it does not mix i shoulda known better but still good same with old fashioned little too sweet for me so maybe next time none for me. The meats were on point perfectly pink and cooked throughout the ribs as well. All of us shared it all. Started with guac and chips, mushroom caps that were to die for omfg, and the meat board i forgot the name but well worth it all of us full with leftover box even. Eventful dinner for my cousins bday celebration with friends!!

Brisket melted in your mouth, and the lamb chops were the best we’ve ever had. We would definitely recommend these!! Price point was great for the quality of the meat. They don’t come with sides, but we split the two meals and with dessert we were full. Order the peach cobbler!! So good!

Lost a star because we were ignored for almost 15 mins before a server even came to give us water. Then, when we were ready to leave and asked for the check, another 10 mins until I just went up to the counter and asked to pay. I worked in a restaurant before, I get it. We didn’t order drinks, so that is why we were the least important table in the server’s eye.

name: True Food Kitchen
address: 395 Santa Monica Pl Suite 172, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews:
Health oriented restaurant near Santa Monica pier. The dishes taste great, and it shows that they have put lots of thought and effort to creat healthy and sustainable food that tastes good.
The place is super spacious and the staffs are nice.
It is kid friendly place. They have kids menu as well.

Outstanding place all around! My wife and I Ubered there - they had all gluten free options for her which she thoroughly enjoyed. I ordered the OG drink - very nice. And the bison sausage pizza = really good especially with the salsa! To cap it off, we ordered the all gluten and dairy free dessert = chocolate chip cookie, coconut ice cream, whipped cream - and the waiter threw it in for free! Thanks bro! Definitely would visit and eat there again!

I will forever dream of the tuna lettuce wraps. they were so good and flavorful with the perfect amount of spice! my steak was pretty much unseasoned so I asked for salt. the vegetables were good along with the vinaigrette. my mom's burrito bowl was delicious! We got dessert but I didn't really care for the blueberry crumble. My drink was the pomegranate seltzer! It wasn't very sweet but was good nonetheless.
Was tasty, if you are European you can feel there safe with food ;) I mean you'll like the dishes. They're nicely presented and healthy! without a ton of fat.

This has to be the best eatery, definitely the best food I had on 4 continents. Fabulous!! When we come back to LA I’ll make sure I’ll visit again.

Definitely worth checking if you want a proper coffee by non-US standards - this is the place. Superb cold brewed coffee. ☕️

name: The Lobster
address: 1602 Ocean Ave, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews:
Such a fancy restaurant near Santa Monica pier! There are a large scale of windows so the view is pretty amazing. No harsh wind inside. I feel so warm and good service from Andrew. Risotto and dessert is so delicious. I will bring my family over here.

But you have to pay for the parking

It is a phenomenal experience with a wonderful waitress, Ms. CJ. The atmosphere was tranquil, and the cuisines were top notch. I appreciate the prompt services, and it was too difficult to leave such a beautiful restaurant. Hope you enjoy as much as my family did!

I highly recommend the Lobster Mac and Cheese dish! They put plenty of lobster in this dish, and it was delicious! Service was amazing as well.

It was our first time at this restaurant, and the server was very patience with us (explained what dishes were the most popular). We ordered some lobster as well, and it was also delicious (sweet and fresh).

Not to mention, the view from this restaurant is also breath-taking! Unfortunately, I do not have a photo of the view, but you should see it for yourself!

What an amazing first meal in Santa Monica! Service was fast and efficient. The black linguine is every seafood enthusiasts dream. The crab cakes are delicious and the grits are divine. What an amazing view too, cannot wait to go back.

Delicious seafood with a beautiful view of the Santa Monica Pier. Loved the staff and the atmosphere. The food was very delicious. I would recommend the grilled lobster. It's great for a fancy night out on the town. We had a wonderful evening.

name: Heavy Handed
address: 2912 Main St, Santa Monica, CA 90405, USA
reviews:
If you're looking for a burger fix you need to check out Heavy Handed.

The menu has a bunch of great options, but would recommend the double combo. The double burger is packed with juicy, flavorful patties that hit the spot every time. The single is good, but the double is the perfect balance of meat, cheese, and all the fixings.

The vibe here is super chill, too. Whether you're grabbing a quick bite or hanging out with friends, the casual atmosphere makes it a great spot to relax and enjoy some killer food. The staff is always friendly and quick to help out.

So, next time you're in the mood for a burger in Santa Monica, would recommend Heavy Handed and go for the double.

If you like smash burgers this is the place for you. Long lines, lack of parking and sitting can be a distraction. BUT you can order from their website and simply pick up at the window in less than 5 min....completely bypassing the line!!! We parked, ordered, walked over and found a place to sit and order was ready. My husband loved it. I thought it was adequate but not worth the bother. Cool place to try out if you are in the area.

Cool spot on Main St. First bite of the burger was amazing, but thereafter, you really start to feel the grease sit heavy on your stomach and the taste/flavor is very one note. Love burgers, but hit a wall on this one and couldn't finish it. I get it; it's called Heavy Handed for a reason, so maybe this is not the right place for me. I prefer a few other burger places in SM over this, but it's worth a try and the vibe was definitely lively (for better or worse) on the Friday evening we went.

Went here over the weekend as I was looking for a great burger and Heavy Handed did not disappoint. Best smash burger I’ve had to date.

Cool little spot. Had a line up which took 10-15 minutes, but was worth the wait.

Finally crossed this place off of my list of places to try. Verdict? It's good, tasty... but a bit overpriced for what you get.

It's a smash burger. I got a double for $11 which is pretty steep IMO compared to other places to get a casual burger in LA (In-N-Out, The Win~Dow). The bun was nice and soft. The meat was good quality, had a nice taste, tender, and was smothered with gooey melted American cheese. The heavy sauce in the burger is almost like cane sauce or animal sauce. It's tasty and blends well with the cheese and makes for a rich burger. The onions and especially pickles help cut through the grease and rich/creaminess. The burger size was a bit small for a double patty and after finishing it I was still hungry. I am a pretty big eater though.

The basket of fries were good and you get a lot with a basket order.

Service is basically you order at a window, sit down outside, and try to find a table. It's a vibe outside and it does get busy. They'll buzz your pager when it's ready. Outdoor ketchup dispenser and soda fountain. This food will make you thirsty for sure.

Would I go back? Maybe... but it's not a must. I would try their soft dipped cone and some beers they have next. The food is good, but expensive and I still was hungry afterwards. In all, it's good but I would probably go somewhere else for a burger!

name: Blue Plate Oysterette
address: 1355 Ocean Ave, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews:
Had a delicious meal with friends here. The host was very kind and worked in our party of 5 on a short notice during a busy weekend night. We shared a lot of dishes, each as wonderful as the next. Chef’s Choice raw oysters were super fresh and juicy, the grilled oysters were fantastic - though I do wish they served crackers or bread with both. (I’m from the Gulf Coast and we love our oysters with a little crispy cracker or saltine - though I realize this is a preference.) The raw scallops with uni were extremely tasty, as well as the shrimp cocktail. Fish and chips were fresh and crispy with just the right amount and texture of breading that didn’t fall off. The side of Mac and cheese was creamy and wonderful, but did need some seasoning.

All in all, a wonderful meal shared among friends in a quaint outdoor atmosphere. Would absolutely recommend to anyone and will visit again when in the area!

All the seafood is super fresh and delicious.
The mussels are by far the best mussels that I have ever had because they are cooked perfectly and the broth isn’t just a regular buttery garlic sauce. It’s super flavorful. The rest of the food is just outstanding.
They gave me a key lime pie for my “early” birthday. My mom is leaving the USA after visiting me here. It’s probably the first time in 25 years that I could celebrate my birthday with her even though it’s an early birthday. I really appreciate the dessert. Thank you so much!!!!

Tried the dine LA menu, and loved it! Service was super fast and all the food tasted great. The first course was clam chowder which was light but packed with flavor and really celebrated the flavor of clams. The lobster roll is enormous and comes with a heap of fries. I had the hand roll combo which is great for anyone looking for a flavorful meal without huge portions. Overall I was very impressed and would like to return and try the regular menu.
Terrible service. Uni hand roll had cold rice and tiny. Fish and chips were flavorless. Food did not come out at the same time. Oysters were redeemable, but definitely not worth the price.

This joint is in a great location, can't imagine what they must pay for rent.  That would at least explain the need to charge $18 for the grilled artichoke- which, don't get me wrong, it's excellent.  The cocktail shrimp and oysters are also delicious.  Order any of the chilled seafood dishes and you won't regret it.

name: Michael's
address: 1147 3rd St, Santa Monica, CA 90403, USA
reviews:
Good food, not excellent, way over priced. When you spend $125 an adult and leave hungry there is a problem. Couldn't even take photos.
The food was good but not the level I'd expect for the prices. For example for $45-50 a main course it either better be excellent OR a robust dish that will fill you up. This was neither.
I respect it's an institution and has a nice layout and ambiance, with good staff, but fundamentally you are a place that serves food and it needs to be better or more reasonably priced.
Amazing! Awesome menu, great staff. Felt welcome from the moment I walked in the door. Sat in an incredible Garden. Could have been in the south of France for all I knew. What a wonderful experience.

At Michael’s, an enchanting space,
Tiffany, our guide, brought such grace.
The atmosphere, a charming trace,
Where every detail finds its place.

Freshness blooms in every dish,
A seasonal menu, a delectable wish.
The duck, a savory, succulent bliss,
A culinary dance, nothing to miss!

Love the place with a nice terrace !
The grilled octopus was amazing ! We also had a pizza delicious !

Michael's just celebrated its 45th Anniversary,  and I have dined here for 41 of those years. It may no longer be the "it" place  but dining in the back garden remains a wonderful experience, as it was for our anniversary dinner. Great dishes and service. Outstanding wines. Near perfection.

name: Sol Agave - santa monica
address: 1733 Ocean Ave, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews:
We were looking for a good Mexican restaurant and found Sol-Agave online with good reviews, so we decided to try it out. We were seated promptly and requested patio seating (great little view).

We ordered fajitas, a few kids meals, shrimp meal, and guacamole appetizer per our waiters suggestion (Edgar). He was very informative and provided answers to all our menu questions.

We were happy with the food and service. The chips were brought out warm (which we love), salsa, and beans. Highly recommend!

Nice Mexican restaurant, with extremely flavorful food, with nice presentation. Seating was quick and we got by the glass patio.
It has indoor and outdoor seating.

They have nice collection of margaritas, beer and wines.

Few dessert options and meal is complete.

We have been out to eat for all our meals the past 4 days. This is hands down the best meal we've had. Fish ceviche flavors are delicious and a little spicy (perfect amount.)The happy hour tacos were phenomenal 😋. The margarita was pretty meh but I don't even care because the food is amazing.

Ordered the jalapeño creamy soup & it was delicious!  If you don’t like cilantro, like my hubby, don’t order it!  I loved it!  Their mahi mahi tacos on corn tortilla were so yummy too!!  We finished the meal sharing the BEST butter cake I’ve ever put in my mouth!  If we lived here, I’d go to Sol Agave weekly!!  Highly recommend!
Absolutely delicious! The appetizer of chips and dipping sauces were heavenly. We ordered this sea bass dish and chile verde dish, both amazing. Great service, I'd definitely come back again!

name: Fia Restaurant
address: 2454 Wilshire Blvd, Santa Monica, CA 90403, USA
reviews: A girlfriend of mine and I tried this place for the 1st time. Such a great choice! We were so happy how everything turned out. Food & drinks were great & tasty. Atmosphere was super nice. Nice spot for a date night. Definitely will come back & I highly recommend.

Absolutely amazing service and amazing food! Our cocktails were made perfectly, and they definitely had a nice kick. Nothing makes me more upset than when they charge you a ton of money and measure out your booze, this is not that place! The restaurant has cool vibes and a unique modern / classic decor. If you're looking for a smaller non-chain steakhouse that does things right this is the place for you!

Special shout out to Patrick the sommelier! Talk about a guy that's good at his job, knows the wines, and doesn't miss a beat... this is the guy. To top that off he has a great personality and made our evening all that much more special! Thank you Patrick and team Fia, you guys are doing a great job. Keep up the good work!!!

We went Saturday morning and it was really quiet. The mimosas kept coming and they refill it once they see it gets low. The service was really friendly.
We didn’t really touch the pastry basket but the coffee cake was good. We ordered the shrimp and grits and the eggs benedict. Both were really good but the benedicts are better than the shrimp and grits. It was a wonderful experience.

The perfect place for a weekend girls brunch!!!
Unlimited memos a plus a professional full bar with amazing liquor options.

The food is PHENOMENAL! My favorite are the shrimp and grits and the omelette.

Make sure to make a reservation!

Street Parking shouldn’t be that hard.

I would definitely come back and this is highly recommended!

I went to this restaurant to eat on my birthday. The restaurant has a special order which is the Beef Wellington. I was enjoying the dish and very impressed with it. The beef was very tender and the dough on the outside was very crispy. Besides of the foods, the ambience was very chill and nice when my table was seated on the patio under the pine trees and lights up around.

name: Lunetta All Day
address: 2420 Pico Blvd, Santa Monica, CA 90405, USA
reviews:
I really enjoyed the vibes of this place, very cute patio outdoor areas, plenty of parking around and lovely food. Decaf and milk alternative options are also available here.
We only had some challenges at the end as they seemed not to be able to collect more than one payment, when we split the bill. Just a glitch, did not change the good experience we had.

Easily one of the best breakfasts that I have had in Santa Monica. I have pretty much been everywhere so that’s really saying something. There’s a lot about this place that I really like. First the food quality is great. Our server was extremely polite and very attentive. They have a free giant parking lot in the back, and plenty of seating inside. We sat at the bar because all the dining tables were taken, but it was still a really nice experience. They don’t have a very large menu, but they do have a lot of great choices on it. Lunetta At Night shares the same roof, but is next-door. I plan to be back in the near future to try it because their breakfast was that good.

I started off with a Cappuccino, and it was terrific. Strong and flavorful just like I like it. I chose the Eggs Benedict for my entrée and honestly really loved it. I got a side of the chipotle aïoli, and it was a great combination with the mini potatoes. I especially liked how the ham is shaved instead of a thicker Virginia type ham. I thought it was great and I would order it again.

Overall a great breakfast option in Santa Monica with extremely easy parking. I would recommend to anyone and I plan to be back in the near future.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at this charming restaurant with a large group for my baby shower with friends and I must say, it was an overall wonderful experience. From the moment we walked in, the ambiance and decor created a warm and inviting atmosphere.

The service was prompt and friendly, and our server was knowledgeable about the menu, guiding us through the various options. As a large group, it can sometimes be challenging to accommodate everyone's dietary preferences and restrictions, but this restaurant offered a wide array of dishes that catered to all tastes. The menu featured a delightful blend of traditional and innovative cuisine, showcasing the chef's creativity and expertise.

Now, let's talk about the food; it was absolutely outstanding! Each dish we ordered was beautifully presented, and the flavors were simply exquisite. The attention to detail in each plate was evident, and it was evident that the chef had put a lot of thought and care into every ingredient and combination. From the perfectly seared scallops to the succulent braised short ribs, every bite was a burst of flavor.

The portion sizes were generous, ensuring that everyone left satisfied. Additionally, the restaurant was accommodating when it came to special requests and substitutions, making the dining experience tailored to our preferences.

What truly stood out during our meal was the way the restaurant staff handled our large group. Despite the hustle and bustle, they managed to remain attentive, ensuring that we had everything we needed and that our glasses were never empty. They were patient with our questions and requests, making us feel valued and appreciated as guests.

Overall, I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a fantastic dining experience. The food is top-notch, the ambiance is inviting, and the service is exceptional. Whether you're dining with a large group or on a fun brunch date, this restaurant is sure to impress.

Went for brunch. Nice atmosphere - light and bright. Tried lemon ricotta pancakes which were fine but nothing to write home About.
They were sticky in your mouth and not enough syrup was given on the plate and the butter is melted butter. The fried chicken was dry - that was disappointing.
The mimosas for the table came pre-mixed in a carafe and didn’t taste like there was much champagne in it. Too much OJ. I would ask for it separately and make your own. The mushroom/ cheese omelette was good The waitress/server was excellent.
The booth we were given is for tall people and we had to sit on the edge of it most of the time as sitting against the back was awkward. Pillows for the back would have helped. Nice place but likely won’t go back.

Perfect food, we loved everything, Crisp Chicken & Pancake, Avocado Toast, fresh orange and lemon juice, fresh brewed coffee and Cappuccino. The service was great and everyone is smiling, the place is beautiful and perfect for breakfast, bathroom is ok, and enjoyed our meal. Kids and adults loved it ❤️

name: Forma Restaurant & Cheese Bar Santa Monica
address: 1610 Montana Ave, Santa Monica, CA 90403, USA
reviews:
The truffle tortellini is excellent - tons of flavorful cheese and truffle flavor.
The branzino was excellent - crispy and well-seasoned. I didn't like the vegetables on it, though, and the green sauce it comes with doesn't really go well with it, but it had all the lemon juice in the green sauce.
The wild boar pappardelle was delicious. The boar had a gamey taste with a texture similar to beef. The sauce and pasta was perfect.

Waitress was very friendly and helpful with suggestions.
The interior is very nice and elegant -- a perfect date spot.
The price for portions are also very reasonable.

Finding parking can be kind of annoying.

We came here because our son loves Italian cheeses. We started with three types of cheese as appetizers. The restaurant serves the cheeses with orange marmalade m, crackers and nuts. The cheeses were excellent and each small serving costs $6-7. Then we tried the wild boar pasta and truffle risotto. Both were good, but not great. The desert of semifreddo, which was a serving of half frozen gelato and other treats it was delicious and highly recommended. There are some street parkings available, but we were there quite early at 5 pm.

Nice restaurant that’s easily accessible with good ambiance. I ordered the charcuterie board,  bruschetta, and opted to  add two different cheeses options; a semi-hard cheese and a hard cheese. For the two cheese additions, it was an additional $15.  The cheese was high quality but the portion was a bit too small, even for a charcuterie board. The bruschetta was served in a bowl with bread crumbs which was very unique and tasty.
My husband ordered the chicken and mushrooms which was cooked in a white wine reduction sauce which he said was very good. He also ordered the grilled Spanish octopus which he said was seasoned well but the octopus was slightly overcooked.
My son ordered the lasagna which was cooked to perfection and seasoned perfectly. For desert we ordered a scoop of chocolate gelato and Nutella bread pudding. The gelato was standard but good. The bread pudding was still a little too wet in my opinion and needed a couple more minutes in the oven but that may just be a personal preference as I’m not one to eat bread pudding frequently. Also I don’t think it was made with Nutella in the mix, just drizzled on top after it came out of the oven.
I’d may go back again if given the opportunity but there was honestly nothing there that left me craving more.

Excellent cheese selection. And I really mean it!!! If you're looking for a glass of wine and a cheese platter, this is the place.
Pasta is okay. Nothing near to al dente. Risotto reminds me of rice porridge. Service wants to be enhanced too.

Thought the food was pretty good. Service was a little confused and it took like an hour for each course, which is not bad, just unexpected. Liked my lasagna and chopped salad. The tiramisu was awesome. Nice little spot on Montana.

name: Art's Table
address: 1002 Montana Ave, Santa Monica, CA 90403, USA
reviews: All time favorite when in Santa Monica.  Service is outstanding. Ivy was friendly and efficient.  Food is always exceptional. Love the beet salad, chopped salad, curry chicken and calamari for lunch.  Outside seating is comfy and quiet

Always consistent and a lovely spot to sit outside on a nice Sunday morning for breakfast.   The johnny cakes are wonderful as are the coffees and egg dishes.   The kids menu is great and the service terrific!

We came here for dinner. Most of the seating is outside, but we sat inside, which was perfect for us. I ordered the Steak Salad ( $22) which came beautifully presented, but the dressing drenched the salad. The steak was perfectly cooked. I ate all the steak! Next time, I will ask for the dressing on the side. My friend ordered the Turkey Burger ( $20) which was tasty, sloppy and a bit on the smoky flavor. She said she would not order it again. The curly fries were very tasty!

We finished with a Lava Cake, beautifully presented, but it was the smallest scoop of ice cream on this planet! Very rich in flavor. Will I order it again, probably not.

I will try Art's Table again perhaps for breakfast or lunch, but not for dinner.

The food was nice. One dish was Grandma's hash. It was a little bit over spicy. It came with a scrambled egg on top. I feel the dish would of been better with an over easy egg. To break an egg yolk into that hash would of been special! The second dish was a wonderful Turkey burger. The restaurant has a nice neighborhood feel to it. The Staff.... well the staff are not professional. When you pay top dollar you expect Pro Waiters. Don't get me wrong the staff is nice but nice is nice. And nice, does not make the food taste better.
Charming outdoors dining scene.  Very mediocre food—wouldn’t recommend anything we had.  Salads would probably be safest.

name: The Surfing Fox
address: 120 Colorado Ave, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews: This place was great! Went on a Tuesday and the server could not have been nicer to us. Food and drinks were all on point and I really liked the decor of the place too. The Fecacia bread was AMAZING! Even with it being close to the pier, this place seems like a hidden gem, well worth it! The only "negative" would be that it seemed like 1 server was on duty and he was SUPER BUSY the entire time.

Nestled right by Santa Monica Pier, this is a decent restaurant I found while looking for a place with an outdoor seating. Not many items on the menu, and the burger was okay. I loved their fries though. Staff were super  friendly and extremely attentive, while the ambiance was terrific. They have a pretty sweet outdoor patio, and the inside gives you that fun, beach vibe suited for Santa Monica. Ideal for a casual Friday date!

We had an incredible experience at this restaurant. Sitting outside on the comfy couch with tables was a delight, especially with the cozy throw pillows and blankets that kept us warm against the ocean breeze. The ambiance and decor were outstanding, creating a perfect vibe. From our seats, we enjoyed a view of the pier entrance and some excellent people-watching.

The food was spectacular. We ordered the mahi-mahi fish tacos and the fried chicken sandwich, both of which were absolutely delicious. The tacos featured fresh, homemade tortillas and a perfectly balanced mix of ingredients, complemented by a lime half dipped in Tajin for an extra kick. The fried chicken sandwich was packed with flavor, with epic toppings and a buttery bun that didn’t get soggy. This place truly knows how to cook!

For drinks, he enjoyed a refreshing IPA while I sipped on unsweetened iced tea with lemon. Both beverages were perfect for a beach day and paired wonderfully with our meals.

I highly recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for an upscale venue in a touristy area. The prices were average for LA but well worth the money. After our delicious lunch, we walked right over to the beach and pier. There are plenty of paid parking options within a block. We chose the multi-story parking structure nearby, paying about $8 for 5 hours, which covered our lunch and beach time.

You won’t be disappointed here!

Great food - last phenomenal restaurant before you get to Santa Monica Pier - located within the Pierside Hotel. - the surfing Fox offers a wonderfully unique and delicious menu - I ate here a half dozen times during my recent stay - and my favorite was salmon eggs Benny, I also loved the breakfast sandwich and the breakfast burrito- the coffee is La Columbe and is truly delicious- I recommend this place - but the brunch is divine!!!
Amazing beach vibe local grub spot served up with a snarky attitude. Gotta love it. Surf stand Food beach vibe just off Santa Monica Harbor. Highly recommend.

name: Seaside on the Pier
address: 250 Santa Monica Pier, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews: The lunch meal we ordered was above average; I enjoyed the fish and chips and the tartar sauce was excellent, as was our server Gabriel. Touristy and pricey, but consider the location. Overall, good eats.

My friend and I checked out the Santa Monica Pier one Saturday and decided to try this place (since we saw the mediocre reviews for Bubba Gump…). We were very happy with our decision.

We arrived around 11:30 and were able to pick where we sat. We sat outside on the upper floor balcony with stunning views of the pier and beach below. Our server was quick and attentive, but not too attentive. We never had our waters refilled. I was surprised the prices weren’t astronomical, as we were right on the pier, but I feel like in this day and age, you get what you pay for.

I ordered the fish and chips and my friend got the impossible vegan burger. Our food came out rather quickly and the fries were excellent - seasoned nicely and tasted fresh. My friend enjoyed her burger and I really liked my cod “nuggets.” The only downside was that I wish there was one more fish piece; they were delicious after all. I also liked the coleslaw, just wish there was a little more of it.

We decided to dine here because of its location on the pier, offering indoor seating, outdoor patio seating, and rooftop seating. The restaurant is situated right in front of the ocean, although the view is only accessible from the outdoor areas.

Upon arrival, a host welcomed us at the door, but after that, service was a bit haphazard. They had a wide selection of alcoholic drinks and were able to make a mocktail margarita for a child, which was much appreciated by both of us. It was exceptionally tasty.

We started with a shrimp cocktail served in a traditional glass. However, it was more watery and sugary than expected, tasting more like ketchup than the usual ingredients. We sent the untouched shrimp cocktail back and moved on to our main courses.

For our entrées, I had a ribeye served with what seemed to be canned or frozen thin green beans and fries, while the child had a cheeseburger and fries. I have to give credit where it's due: the ribeye was perfectly cooked to medium-well. Despite the typical fattiness of a ribeye, the fatty parts were well-grilled and, with a bit of added salt, quite delicious. The meal was very affordable.

I requested that the shrimp cocktail be removed from the bill since we had sent it back almost immediately. The staff graciously complied without any fuss. The restaurant is kid-friendly with a casual dress code and multiple seating options. When we walked by on the weekend, there seemed to be live music or perhaps music from a nearby restaurant, but either way, it looked like a good time.

We had a wonderful service. The food was amazing. The southwest burger was very filling and the meat was cooked just right. The shrimp sandwhich was delicious. Reasonable portions. Views are phenomenal

The service was great! Our waitress was very polite and welcoming! The food was also great. I got a big bacon burger, and it was delicious besides falling apart a little bit. The bathrooms, however, were a little gross, and the way around was a little confusing. Other than that, we got the second floor with an amazing view and had a great time!

name: Tartine
address: 1925 Arizona Ave, Santa Monica, CA 90404, USA
reviews: Cute place. We ordered smoke salmon tartine which was so good. The crunchy bread was perfect with the salmon. We also got the savory scone, sweet danish Togo. However we ate the sweet danish before we left the restaurant. It can’t go wrong with the bakery here.

Tartine quickly become my preferred morning spot. I always love the idea of placing my order at the counter and selecting my own seating. Here it is.  And got even more. Outstanding food, excellent service. And the scenery are captivating. Returning over and over again🤍

I honestly don’t understand the 1 star reviews here. This place is awesome - great bread, great pastries and sandwiches, great drinks, lovely outdoor patio - a baby and pet friendly place. Yea, staff can be tired and not feeling like smiling when they see you - so what? just don’t live a tip if that bothers you 🤷🏻‍♀️
I always enjoy stopping here for brunch. The food is delicious with a great vibe.  The Morning Bun is one of my favorites but you can't go wrong with any item on the menu.
Amazing coffee and bakery .parking is straight math and science . My burger was soggy like a omelette . Maybe better to do buns on the side. It came with chips and I ate it like nachos .

name: R+D Kitchen
address: 1323 Montana Ave, Santa Monica, CA 90403, USA
reviews: R+D is one of my favorite restaurants, it hits every time. You can’t really go wrong with anything, but obviously Dings crispy chicken sandwich is the best, highly recommend getting it lettuce wrapped for a healthier option!!

R+D is consistently good. They have it down to a science. Some quirks that enable them to be so consistent are limited ability for substitutions and that their takeout menu is limited to certain items to preserve quality (eg items that don’t hold up well when consumed 20+ minutes later in a takeout container aren’t available). There is also often a wait but that’s a virtue of its popularity. None of that is a complaint just helping set expectations for people. Other than that food is always fantastic, service also great and wine/beer/cocktails stellar as well.

This place runs a tight ship. If you make a reservation, make sure you have your whole party there at the time of the reso. They have great food and service, and to have that you need a tight ship so kudos to the team there. Open kitchen concept is very nice with some friendly chefs. The little bird (and creamy polenta😮‍💨) were amazing and the banana cream pie was quite literally the icing on top. The Pupp approves.

Everything was top tier from the food, to service, presentation, and cleanliness. However the bathroom situation there is a little less than ideal and awkward. The stalls are single room closed door but the sinks are outside the bathroom in the same small area you're waiting to use the restroom.. during a busy time there would be a major traffic jam and messy with water dripping on the floor making the restaurant itself liable. It would also be nice if they had a patio but they are able to keep the door open so if you're close to the front you get a nice semi outdoor experience. The tables on the sidewalk IMO does not count for a patio and didn't seem comfortable. Being in southern California near the beach I expected a full maintained patio option. Otherwise it's a great place if you have a small group or dining solo. Wouldn't recommend for family or large groups.

Loved the vibe. Excellent cocktails. Super friendly waiter. It is strange to find a spot in LA these days that excels on all fronts. As other reviewers have pointed out, the chicken sandwich and tuna burgers are must trys. The jackrabbit and negroni were both excellent, and the carrot cake was a 10/10. Am pleasantly surprised and genuinely happy I stumbled across R+D

name: La Vecchia Cucina
address: 2654 Main St, Santa Monica, CA 90405, USA
reviews: Thank you Google maps for recommending this place when I searched for pizza! The food was amazing (carbonara sauce was impeccable & the pizza too)! What made the night even better was how friendly our server, Mike, was. If I could have Mike as my server at every restaurant, I’d eat out every night! 🤣 highly suggest coming to eat here. You won’t be disappointed!

Been visiting the Holly place for years, last decade, pretty much whenever I visit the area. Not to be missed, as it's the closest you gonna get to Italian home cooked meals, outside of Italy. The main 'problem' you might face is which meal to pick that particular evening, as all are absolutely delicious, or perhaps you feel just somewhat cowardly and going to stick to the proven, over the years, favorites... that's a great dilemma to have and I warmly recommend putting oneself in that position, if not already done so...
buon appetito!

Magnificent!!!

My daughter and I were visiting the area and previewed the menu- we didn’t have high expectations because so many restaurants boast “authentic Italian cuisine.”

The food we consumed reminded me of Italy!

Folks- you will not be sorry.

The portions are handsome. The food is piping hot where need be. The pasta is perfectly prepared.

The freshness, flavor and quality is all there.

The bread is fresh, light——divine.

The service was outstanding- super kind staff.

This is one of the few restaurants I would drive the hour to frequent.

I would recommend reservations as they do get quite busy but I would not discourage you from trying to walk in to get a table- they will try to accommodate.

We enjoyed the outdoor seating. While there are space heaters- it gets chilly because you’re by the sea, so I do recommend something warm for the latter part of the day/evening.

Buon appetito!

Great experience, the service was great, the food was great, it was so clean also.
I took a margherita with an Ice tea.

The staff was So Nice with us especially Roberto who took some times with us at the end.
I recommended this place during the week by the way.
Low-key neighborhood spot in Ocean Park with a beautiful outdoor setup. If you’re looking for authentic and delicious Italian food, then La Vecchia is your spot…even the bread and oil are amazing!

name: The Whaler Santa Monica
address: 101 Broadway, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews: Great spot to watch sports.  Plenty of screens. Surprisingly great food.  Garlic wings hit the spot.  Loved the falafel and avocado salad.  Cold draft beers ideal for watching game. Crowd was cheering and into the action.

Stopped for brunch on a Sunday. We had hoped to eat next door but it was too busy and we were on a time crunch. Oddly, The Whaler was almost dead - which gave us pause as to why - but we tried it anyway.

Service was quick and the food was unexpectedly great. Our party of 5 each loved our meals! The chicken and waffles was on-point. I loved that the sweetness was baked into the waffle and didn’t require syrup, instead using a creamy hollandaise as the sauce.  The Nutella French toast was universally loved, and the sweet cream served separately in a bowl to dip instead of just melting into milk on top was thoughtful. The ceviche was delicious and fresh and not too spicy. The Captains Breakfast was plentiful and well-prepared and the one that ordered it said it might have been the best waffle he’s ever eaten. He loved that it was crispy on the outside and soft inside. All in an all, we were VERY pleasantly surprised by the food.

The downside was the cleanliness of the restrooms. Seeing the dingy white doors and hallway leading from the dining room to the restroom was VERY off-putting, and made us concerned about what the kitchen might look like. This is an easy fix that could be cleaned in less than an hour but hasn’t been touched in months, if not years.  The men’s restroom was horrible. Like, truckstop worthy. Super gross. Please, please fix this.  The food and service were great but had I gone to the restroom before ordering, I’d have honestly just walked out and never returned.  If the public-facing side of a restaurant looks like that (especially one in such a prominent tourist spot), it’s not hard to imagine the back of house looks worse.  That’s worrisome.  And an easy fix someone simply refuses to do.  Wiping down the bathroom doors halfway areas should be ongoing side work for a server each night.

Went here and got two mango carts for 26$ with tax and 20% tip it was 34$. Now that I look on my transactions on my bank app I see our server who goes by “Ghost B”  charged me an even 50$ flat for two beers. I kept the receipt that says 28.66 and funny enough the receipt does not show the 20% tip so that tells me she manipulated the POS system to tip herself more after I left. We have seen these schemes in TikTok where they tip themselves however much they want. and I did not think she would that to me. It looks like she had a few drinks so maybe she thought she was invincible. I made a claim to my bank and hopefully people stay away or simply pay cash to avoid these unauthorized transactions.

Descent first time experience, service was slightly slow might be short handed i understand, great happy hour Tacos didn’t come with salsa clam chowder was luke warm quesadilla was good, will give them another shot next time we are in the area.
Only went for drinks. Perfect location near the beach. Bartender/ service was great. Drinks were good too. Atmosphere is cool, and clean. Would love to come again and try the food.

name: Local Kitchen & Wine Bar
address: 1736 Ocean Park Blvd, Santa Monica, CA 90405, USA
reviews: We stopped in without reservations and were lucky to grab the last two seats at the bar. Food was excellent - great variety of mains, pastas, apps, and pizzas. Don’t skip on the pizza it’s some of the best crust we’ve had in LA. Hanger steak was second best perfectly cooked with a great crust. We got the special pasta (lobster) and noodles were fresh.

One of my favorites new restaurants on Ocean Park, only a few blocks away from my house. It's great to have such a nice restaurant within walking distance.  Not only convenient but excellent food, cocktails and wines.

One of my favorites is the mussels with sourdough bread. Great for sharing, but you must pay extra for the toasted sourdough bread which you must have to dip into the wonderful seafood broth (perfectly spiced and seasoned.)

The second is the mushroom truffle pizza. Ghisallo, known for their pizza, is a block or 2 away, but i think Local's pizza is better. Better cheeses, less oily, crispier, thinner crust. The best IMO.

Lastly, the 24 oz bone-in aged ribeye. This is a great dish to share. I love the chef's version of this classic dish. Again, other places can serve bone-in ribeye steak, but the smoky, grilled flavor is amazing.  The only negative is that sometimes the ribeye may have a lot of fat. Sometimes, I'm cutting away 20% of the steak. I'll have to search back and find a picture of their ribeye and post it.

Overall, as a local, I enjoy eating here and trying their different dishes. They're all pretty good. Coming out of the pandemic, they had the best outdoor patio seating arrangement: cozy, front patio and a large parking lot patio, all with ample patio heaters. I prefer the indoor seating but it can get really loud when busy.  I also gave only 4-stars for service, because sometimes, they seem understaffed. The service staff are good and friendly, but can be overwhelmed during peak hours. Thus we eat early and leave early, often taking our leftovers and walking back home. It's great to take a nice walk after dinner.

Where do I begin?  Everything was phenomenal.

The vibe is laid back, but sharp.  Wanna dress up for a date?  Do it.  Wanna wear jeans and a t-shirt to hang out with a friend?  Do it.

The welcome was genuine and friendly and the menu… we wanted to order all of it!

Since we aren’t gluttons, we settled on the mushroom toast, fried artichoke hearts and an arugula salad with a truffle mushroom white pizza.

In a word: delish!

All of it was expertly prepared and I was darned close to licking the plates.  Now that I think of it, that’s the one thing I regret not doing.

Also, well over half their wines are available by the glass.  It’s a great selection from California, France, Italy and Spain (and maybe some other places in Europe)

Lastly, the olive oil cake was probably the best I’ve ever had.  It wasn’t too sweet and the blueberry compote was a perfect addition.

We will definitely go back.

I had a 3 hour dinner here with a group of 5. The service, food, and atmosphere were all great. The staff was so friendly and the roof was retractable, giving us direct sunlight and a lot of fresh air. I had the chicken under brick dish which was pretty good.
We also shared a cheese board and olive oil cake, both of which were amazing.

Local Kitchen and Wine Bar is under new management and has a new chef. I am happy to report they have really upped their game. The service was great and the food was delicious. We had the mussels, the burrata and the cobbler. We will be back!

name: LA Puglia
address: 1621 Wilshire Blvd, Santa Monica, CA 90403, USA
reviews: This place is out of this world! The food is simple amazing and the owner Valentina is the greatest host we ever met! I went here with my friend from Rome and they were impressed how the food taste like in Italy! Well Done La Puglia! Keep on delighting your guests we will be back!

Amazing food and service! Thank you to the servers and owner for taking us and seating us 10 minutes before closing. We got late from LAX traffic and were all starving!! We got eggplant parm, pugila pizza, molfetta pizza and Rosa pasta. Everything was delicious. Tons of vegetarian options. Highly recommend this place!!

I am an Italian expat, I’ve been in the U.S. for 6 years now. I never had a better experience at an Italian restaurant than the one I had at LA Puglia tonight. The food is amazing and authentic. Seafood is fresh, flavorful, perfectly prepared, and at a competitive price for LA. Pizza and pasta are great and taste like the ones back home. On top of that, the whole staff is so attentive, without ever feeling too intrusive, and some of the nicest people we’ve met. I am happy to have found a slice of home in my home away from home.

When I first got here I was already impressed by the slick design of the entire space and the bright warm lighting.
Then the fact that this is a hub for a creative gathering here every Tuesday 10am-12:00 and I got invited to this beautiful place by other music professionals was a heartwarming quality signature which got me curious and enchanted when I got here.
But it didn’t stop there. I found out about the huge back space where they host amazing high standard live concerts every Tuesday night and we instantly signed up for it. The enjoyed an absolutely delicious dinner in a charming cordial atmosphere and to top it off I got an sms the next day by the wonderful owner of the space, Valentina, who served us in person that night.
It’s my new favorite Italian in town for daytime & night time! 👏👏👏
Much love to the entire lovely team,
Carmen Corinna aka. AM!NA Jaguar

Dinner at La Puglia. I was very excited to try as we truly miss the fare from this amazing Italian destination. Unfortunately we were rather disappointed.
We started with their steamed Mussels with Cherry Tomatoes. This was very good and the Casereccio bread was also very good.
The Ragu and Lasagna both lacked flavor. The Orecchiette with Mussels was very good, although all of the food it would appear that the chef did not use any salt or pepper in the cooking. Pizza was OK (Margherita Style).
Once the food arrived no Parmeseano Reggiano was offered, this is Italian?
Service was lacking all night. Staff was not very attentive, we had pile ups of plates and drink glasses.
Overall we were disappointed. The food in my opinion did not taste like anything we had ever eaten in Puglia which is one of the best foods in Italy.  Having to add salt, Pepper, having no Parmeseano Reggiano and lack of service all lead to our overall dissatisfaction of La Puglia.

name: Capo
address: 1810 Ocean Ave, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews: This place has been around for a LONG time and it is totally understandable. It is truly delicious and charming. It’s got some old world vibes and a real cozy atmosphere. We sat at the bar (which I highly recommend) and the bar tender/server was awesome. She gave us great recommendations, was super friendly, and even suggested things we didn’t know we could do (like 1/2 portions of two pastas and split everything). In the age of ‘fine dining’ meaning a tasting menu…go here for culinary delights you get to choose for yourself. Also…no time limits! We were there for 3 hours and it flew by but we never felt rushed.

I would say it’s one of the best Italian restaurants in Santa Monica, but it does have some issues. It’s really small and intimate on the inside, you feel like you are eating in someone’s house. It reminds me of a few restaurants that I ate in when I was in Italy last so it had a very authentic feel to me. I am also half Italian so I feel I know good and bad Italian food. The issue we had is that a lot of the items are overpriced. For example steak tartare is $48 and a simple grilled Branzino is $85. For these prices we all felt the food wasn’t special enough to justify the prices. They don’t have a parking lot but metered street parking is easy to find or your other best option would be their valet for $15. Our server was very polite and all of our items came out very quickly. They were a bit slow on the drink refills, but aside from that everything else was very fast.

I started off with the Filet Mignon Tartare and it was very good, although it didn’t have any spice to it so wish it had some mustard or horseradish to it because it felt a little dry to me. Also expensive for $48 which I don’t understand, but I did enjoy it. For my entree I chose the Bucatini with Lamb Ragu and it was fantastic. The portion was a bit small but it had really great and deep flavors. After I finished with the Chocolate Soufflé and it was A+. I truly loved it and would highly recommend ordering it.

Overall a nice dinner in a beautiful location although it is overpriced. I would recommend but the price points are really strange.

The dining experience was exceptional in every aspect. From impeccable service to delectable food in a charming, intimate ambiance, it surpassed expectations. Mirco, our server, was outstanding. It's reassuring to find establishments of this caliber still thriving. I highly recommend it and will certainly return.

My husband and I wandered in off the street, jet lagged and very hungry, after the kitchen had closed. Nether the less, we were seated and served a three course meal that was delicious and we had a special bottle of wine. The staff could not have been more accommodating and gracious especially as we kept them long after other patrons had departed. Capo turned an evening that had started out poorly into a very pleasant and memorable surprise.  Thank you muchly.

This is a tough critique to write because the management staff were very courteous, and worked me in to an otherwise busy Wednesday night. Still, wait for service was long and I was extremely disappointed with the pasta, which was average at best, but came highly recommended. Not only was it, “just OK”, but it came with an undisclosed price tag of approximately $250. I had read the reviews and was prepared to pay $150 pp. Here’s the thing: they told us their portions were very large [not true] so we decided to split that pasta. For 1 truffle pasta, 2 glasses of wine, and 1 dessert, including tax and tip, our total was $450!

You can get bigger servings, with more truffle, for half the cost, and still enjoy a legit Italian restaurant experience, at Locanda Positano.

Chocolate lava cake, cream & ice cream, was very good. Wine was as well. Good thing or I would have rated two stars.

name: Colapasta Restaurant
address: 1241 5th St, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews:
It was more casual than I thought, but overall it's a very good pasta restaurant. You can taste the freshness by their own creation. The lasagna was the highlight. I'd give it a 8 out of 10. It was super thin, which was impressive.

The Bolognese was good, but not as dynamic as I had hoped. Unfortunately, the focaccia missed the mark altogether. It was completely bread-like and missed the rise, air bubble pockets, and outer crunch, while living in a proper drench of olive oil. So it goes.

Delicious and fresh pasta. The wait could be longer than expected - there should be a better way to reach out to the hostess, which was lacking.

We tried 3 different pasta and the best one was the lasagna.

Will definitely come back if craving italian food

This place is a must visit if you love pasta. They make all of their pasta by hand and the ingredients are all organic and you can really taste the difference in the food. We arrived for dinner and was quickly seated. The restaurant has a very homey feel with its decor and very inviting ambiance. The staff were all super friendly and helpful. We ordered the Moringa Agnolotti,, Calamarata al Pomodoro,, Focaccia Bread, and a bottle of Valpolicella Ripasso. The pastas were perfectly cooked and bursted with flavor. The bread was fluffy in the middle and crispy on the outside and did a great job of soaking leftover sauce from the pasta. The wine was bold and rich with hints of cherry and nuttiness. We ended with a tiramisu for our dessert which was light and fluffy. Would highly recommend this place

This is hands down the best pasta we have had in Los Angeles. Having traveled Italy extensively and several times, we’ve always craved pasta dishes akin to the quality and distinct flavors you’d find in each town. Colapasta absolutely nails it with a tight menu of dishes that are each a win. The atmosphere is relaxed. The chef is right beside you making fresh pasta. The staff are friendly with great menu recommendations. The prices are affordable. This restaurant is a true gem for anyone craving a great meal. The Casunziei is a must try if you’re a first timer.

What a pleasant place to have lunch. The seating area was relaxing and comfortable. Of course, we came here for its pastas and weren’t disappointed. The serving size was smaller, so we ordered 4 different pastas. The lasagna was as advertised, it was excellent. All other three pastas were very good especially the agnolotti. We’ve never had it before and it was a very pleasant surprise. Highly recommended.  The only downside of our lunch was that it had sold out its bread. Other than that, we enjoyed our experience here very much. And the service was excellent as well.

name: Ye Olde King's Head
address: 116 Santa Monica Blvd, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews: Very British. I introduced my future daughter in law to shepherds pie. She and I both agree the gravy was amazing. She noted the potatoes were delicious and the meat was very rich. I had bangers and mash. The only difference to actual British food is the toughness of the sausage casing. Otherwise yummy and with the drive

Just had the best afternoon tea at the Kings Head!!
Great food and proper good clotted cream for the excellent scones. Very reasonable price, ambiance wonderful, and the service was perfect.

The Kings head is a great English pub and I’ve had many a great breakfast and dinner. This was the best. My wife and adult kids all agreed; this is a must visit!

Thanks Christine for a great experience and we will definitely be back.

Came here for the 1st time w/9 fam members. It's a fave of my Aunt & Uncle's. The food, finger sandwiches & pastries were very, very good & tasty. My brother & I had the Vanilla Tea. So, sooo good. The other teas our grp had were the Earl Grey & Asom.

Love this spot. Great breakfast if you order the right thing. The English omelette is my favorite, with English Muffins.

Raoul and the staff are lovely.

Top top place if you are a Chelsea fan!

We love this place! Whenever we need our London fix we come here and eat the same food we would eat in a pub in London. It’s classic pub food, nothing spectacular nothing disappointing. Service staff are very friendly with good banter, atmosphere is very nice. It’s one of the places you can order a pint of Guinness with black currant and they’ll bring it to you without a “ha?”.  Their King size Fish N’ Chips and Poached cod is particularly good. We haven’t tried their Sunday roast or curries, I’ll report back when we do. If you are in Santa Monica and need to get your London fix, give it a good go.

Update on 8/27

We went there for their Sunday roast. They have lamb, beef and veggie patty.   Our friends said the lamb was a little over cooked but the Yorkshire pudding was really nice. Lastly we had their apple pie and it was very good.

name: Wally's Santa Monica
address: 214 Wilshire Blvd, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews:
Celebrated a loved one's birthday here with friends!

The food is on the pricey side - but the 5-star experience makes it justified. Food, ambiance, and service were top notch.

The restaurant is unique and flooded with wine bottles all over the walls. What a fantastic collection.

Highly recommend the spicy salami pizza and the truffle brie! I would love to come back and experience the rest of the menu
Excellent charcuterie and cocktails menu. Great spot for happy hour and their burger is excellent as well. Prices are a bit high but still great on occasion.

This was a delightful family experience where we just forgot about issues, laughed, and enjoyed life. Food was so good we threw some elbows, and the wine selection... just look at the picture. All the walls look like this.
Very accommodating staff, our experience was fantastic. Parked in the public parking garage and walked a few hundred feet. Atmosphere, quality of service has us wanting to go back and relive the evening.

Nice restaurant close to Santa Monica pier.

Beautiful interior. Wide selection of wines and champagne. It’s like sitting in a wine cellar. Great atmosphere. Perfect for occasions and celebrations. There’s live performances on Monday night.

Food is decent. Truffle Baked Brie is my favorite. Entrees are mid. You may skip the surf and turf, not the best I’ve had.

I liked this place until yesterday. Sure, dramatically overpriced (I.e their Iberian ham marked up 3-5x from any Spanish specialty market I’ve been to in the states, house cheddar is like 50 bucks for 8oz, etc.), but overall the restaurant has been good and I have enjoyed the product curation. Yesterday I bought some specialty items for a charcuterie board and bought this fancy churned butter for 30+ dollars. I drove home with all of it and was excited to try the butter so I opened it. The sight and smell of it was absolutely horrifying. How could such a nice place let butter of all things sit so long that it rots into a rainbow of putrid mold. I don’t understand it. It would be one thing if this was a grocery store or a small hole in the wall specialty store, but this is Wally’s on Wilshire in the Heart of Santa Monica. With those prices. I brought this monstrosity back into the shop and they barely seemed to react, a muted apology. Then the proceeded to take 15 minutes of my time figuring out how to refund me the item. I’ve spent lots of money there dining and they don’t know who I know - it’s LA after all - and they’re not offering me a store credit, a complimentary product, or so much as a genuine apology for selling me a literal mold culture. Will not be shopping there anytime soon. Extremely disappointed.

name: Lobster & Beer Santa Monica
address: 530 Wilshire Blvd, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews: Highly recommend the clam chowder. Went with family, it’s a small dive bar atmosphere with both outdoor and indoor seating.  Given the heat and the breeze by the beach, outdoor was a lot more cool. Service was… okay. Food was good for the most part, similar to another post, the lobster was more on the edges of the quesadilla than inside of it. However it was happy hour prices, so maybe that was is it. There was less then 3 other people at the location when we were there.

Fast and friendly service!

Sat outside on a beautiful Saturday morning!

Our server suggested the Connecticut roll and it was bomb! 10/10 flavorful, soft buttery bread, good lobster for the value! Highly recommend!

Calamari Fries and cocktail sauce!! Omg! So yummy-meaty and tender and served steaming hot and fresh!

All right here goes. I don't normally hand out 5 stars, but this place is phenomenal. The gentleman behind the counter recommended the Connecticut role as opposed to the Maine role. The Connecticut role is warmer and buttery, whereas the Maine role is cold with an aioli sauce. It was a toss-up because they both sounded blissful. That first bite of The warm, buttery melt-in-your-mouth bun sent me straight to the Pearly Gates.  Unfortunately, there was no one next to me to slap so I slapped myself it was that good. The fries were excellent, too.

This place was an awesome visit for my first time on the West Coast. That California Orange wheat beer was out of this world. Being from DC, we don't get amazing stuff like that, unless ones preference is IPAs. Got the lobster rolls and lobster grilled cheese. This place is a must and when I come back to the west coast again, I am definitely stopping by for a couple hours.

Loved it, food is so good and service is A1. All food is so delicious and fresh. Lobster 🦞 tail is too nice for 15 dollar. Lobster tacos and clam chowder soup was awesome. Ambiance is small but cozy and beautiful. Will love to come back here again

name: Hillstone
address: 202 Wilshire Blvd, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews:
Have been coming here for years. Hands down the best veggie burger. Even my meat eating son approves. Recommended dishes vegetarian: spinach artichoke, grilled artichoke, kale cashew salad, French fries, veggie roll macadamia.
Great service. My son loves their ribs.
Super tasty dishes, chill atmosphere, attentive staff, and less expensive than some other nearby eats.  Definitely going to visit again!
