The steak and salad were both incredibly delicious, exceeding our expectations. The service was also very comfortable and accommodating.

Although the wait time was a bit long, it was totally worth it. This is one of the best restaurants we've been to during our trip in California.

Hillstones Santa Monica is a must-visit restaurant for anyone craving delicious Hawaiian steak. The ambiance at Hillstones is upscale yet inviting, with a modern and sleek design that creates a sophisticated dining experience. The staff is professional and attentive, ensuring that every aspect of your meal is perfect.

Now, let's talk about the star of show - the Hawaiian steak. It is simply mouthwatering! The steak is cooked to perfection, with a juicy and tender texture that melts in your mouth. The Hawaiian flavors are infused into the steak, giving it a unique and delightful taste that will leave you craving more.

Overall, Hillstones Santa Monica and their Hawaiian steak are a winning combination. Whether you're looking for a special night out or just craving some amazing food, Hillstones is the place to be. Don't miss out on the opportunity to indulge in this culinary delight - it's an experience you won't soon forget.

Only bad thing is they no longer have the salmon appetizer
We went here for a quick early dinner after an appointment in Santa Monica. And although not super posh, it was really excellent ~ great room, amazing food and spectacular service!!

name: LouLou Santa Monica
address: 395 Santa Monica Pl #300, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews: Fun and upbeat establishment for French cuisine with a twist. Lively patrons, DJ who also sang a few songs. Service was professional and quick. Food was delicious. Escargot was excellent and served with walnuts - something new. Salmon was perfectly prepared as was the bed of asparagus below the fish. The bacon-wrapped scallops were cooked to perfection and sat atop a puree of parsnips with crisped basil and micro greens folded in. All of it delicious.

Aesthetic and service (had Nick as our server) was AMAZING, but food was very mediocre.

Grilled Octopus (with Romesco Sauce, Avocado) -
Really like the octopus here. It was perfectly cooked and not rubbery or anything like that. That Romesco Sauce on the side paired perfectly with the octopus. Totally recommend this dish!

Mediterranean Hummus (with Crudite) -
Hummus was absolutely delicious! Smooth and creamy and actually went really well with so many other items we ordered. It was a good volume of the hummus so there was plenty left over even after the veggies were eaten.

Grilled Asparagus Side -
They accidentally brought someone else's order to our table here, but this asp was Lovely! I don't usually like asparagus, but this was an exception. Great with that hummus!

Cauliflower Steak - the cauliflower was still hard on the inside and not like a steak; More like a head of roasted cauliflower.
Ended up eating just a quarter and taking the rest home to cook it more.
This was the disappointment I would say.

Poulet Aux Morilles - Chicken entree
Not a bad dish but nothing fancy about this one. Husband had ordered this and if I'm not mistaken it was a little salty? Or a little dry? I'm not sure which but there was some issue here which made the dish a little lacking in something special.

Lamb Chops -
Friend ordered this and he seemed to really like it. I didn't try but the presentation was beautiful and he finished the entire plate so I take it as a good sign.

Endive Salad -
Another one ordered by our friend. Love the amount of vegetables in here but not a fan of how oily it was. I didn't want to try too much of it just because of the oil in there.

We noticed they had a chocolate fountain while we were leaving and the server. Nick was generous enough to give us some fruit and a bunch of that chocolate on a plate. Really rich chocolate and a good end to the meal.

Shout out to the server again for just giving us a fun time with conversation and laughter.

Highly recommend this rooftop restaurant bar in Santa Monica.

The food is delicious.  My kids and I had the brunch special.  The union soop was really good.  The Cesar salad was also good. Highly recommend to get the calamari. These calamari are above and beyond any calamari you have tasted, my kids approve.  My son also loves the Kobe beef, and I loved the chicken sandwich.

Service was okay. The waitress was lacking attention to the table.

The restaurant has laughing sofas, bamboo and rope decorated  areas and a great covered patio that lets the sun shine in.  It brings a bright and relaxing environment where you can enjoy the food with your friends.

Arrived when they opened for lunch so we could have a quick bite while waiting for our hotel checkin. The pizza rivaled those we had in Italy, the drinks were superb, and the ceviche was also flavorful. Great service and adorable location. Quiet for a weekday lunch which we appreciated.

I thought the food, service, and atmosphere at LouLou’s was very nice.
Poached salmon with asparagus was delicious.
Tuna tartare on chips was yummy.
Sweet shrimp on a stick was overly sweet for my taste, but still very good and very popular.
The restaurant is on the top (3rd) floor of the mall. It can also be a little cold when the weather is cold because of its open walls.

name: Sogno Toscano Cafe´& Wine Bar
address: 1512 Montana Ave, Santa Monica, CA 90403, USA
reviews: Sogno Toscano is a new Italian favorite of mine! Growing up with homemade Italian food, I was always so particular about the Italian restaurants I would go out to. This one tasted so comforting and authentic. I can’t recommend it enough if you are looking for flavors that are true to Italy. It felt like home in a way, and the vibe was so warm and welcoming! I can’t wait to take my husband here because he is obsessed with Italian food! I highly recommend ordering the Vegetarian Lasagna! And for dessert, the Tiramisu!

After visiting Sogno Toscano in New York, I had such a positive experience that I made sure to make a reservation at their LA location. Although I have yet to visit Tuscany myself, they brought the fully immersive Italian dining experience to Santa Monica Beach. We were warmly welcomed and instantly seated in our area of preference and felt so well taken care of the entire night. It's the perfect spot for a morning cappuccino, afternoon spritz, or evening dinner!

Amazing schiacciate and fabulous atmosphere.

This place came highly recommended for their authentic Tuscan style food, particularly the schiacciate. I am happy to report that it lived up to the expectations.

Went here on a Saturday for lunch. We were seated right away in their beautiful outdoor area. We got 2 different sandwiches and they both were great. The ingredients were fresh, albeit slightly sparse for my taste, and the bread was the star of the show, as expected.
It may seem a bit pricey, at about $26 for a single sandwich, but when you factor in the ambiance and the overall level of quality it’s somewhat justified.

The level of quality is evident in everything. From the food, to the service, to even the customized plates (check the bottom of the plates, lol).

I would recommend this place for special occasions.

A great little hole in the wall wine and food market. The gnocchi was 10/10 as was the Mediterranean salad.

Our server was well informed and cordial. I felt like he knew the menu well and was proud of the restaurant.

The outdoor patio is a hidden gem
This place is fabulous. Fresh and delicious. Might be the best sandwich I've ever had. Also a great wine list. The fresh pesto pasta was also phenomenal

name: RED O CANTINA
address: 1541 Ocean Ave #120, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews: This was an interesting place to visit right by the corner and near the pier. The atmosphere was great and the dining area was beautiful as well as outside dining. The menu selection was good and the waitress was friendly as the staff. Pricing is what to be expected $$/$, and the food was very good although I noticed the rice portion to be small than the bean portion. Rice was a bit bland but everything else was very good, taco, nachos, quesadillas and the sweet plantains. I noticed that a gentleman had a burrito not sure which one but it was huge and if I ever go back I definitely will choose that humongous burrito. Would recommend. Kids menu as well.

Being from PHX, I have a high standard of what Mexican food should look and taste like. This place being near the pier I expected “tourist” food.

Dead wrong- this place is authentic. Best margarita I’ve had this year.

The food is delicious, and the price is comparable to the area.

Definitely come here for good food, good atmosphere, and the best margarita in California.

This is my second time at Red O Cantina, and the food did not disappoint. Sadly, the cocktails are a bit lacking hence they are weak, and costly for what you get. Both times I have been here with another couple and they too had the same experience. The atmosphere is great, staff is super friendly and service was wonderful. I would recommend dining here if you are looking for a casual restaurant, a taste of Mexico cuisine, convenient to the pier and plenty of parking.

I have my own rating system.
6 stars: Presidential Service
5 stars: Top Notch Service
4 stars: It was straight
3 stars: Ok
2 stars: 😶
1 stars: I need to bypass the manager and speak to the owner.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
Customer Service Attendant: Jesus H
Detailed orientated, Friendly. Recommend great choices.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
Happy Hour Food
We had a variety of items off the menu. Very delicious and filling.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
Location is right across from the pier/beach/street performers.

I'll give the food 5 stars but will say the chips were stale. Julie, our waitress was friendly and provided great service, we ordered jalapeno margaritas with Mezcal amazing, chips (stale) with guacamole and salsa (pace with some spiciness).  My wife and I shared the fajitas, chicken, steak, and shrimp. It was amazing the steak was tender and had good flavor.  We originally came for the butter cake and drinks, butter cake was good.  I recommend this place if you want some good drinks and food. Only took a picture of the butter cake.

name: Milo & Olive
address: 2723 Wilshire Blvd, Santa Monica, CA 90403, USA
reviews: Been coming here for a few years now, and as a LA / Santa Monica native. It’s one of the best places for brunch and dinner. The food is always consistent, clean, and fresh. What I mean by clean is that it leaves you not feeling all tired and bogged down. Russell, Omar, Chris W. , and Sara has always provided tentative service. The restaurant is very well balanced, the feel, the vibe, the decor. It’s perfect for date night or a casual brunch /dinner. Not to mention their pizzas are top 10 in LA voted by many high level critics. Stop by for pastries and coffee or a full meal.

Excellent food w great service!  We came he for dinner and the manager greeted us w a big smile and a firm handshake since my buddies are regular here.  Order an arugula salad which was light and tasty.  The pizza was a surprise too with an egg in the middle!  Compliments to the chef for an amazingly crisp and light crust.

And is that was not enough; the Manager sent us hike with a huge bag of baked goods!! Plan to come back next time I am in LA.

Was so very happy with the food at Milo & Olive! Pastries were fresh, delicious, bursting with flavor. Got the savory farmers makert veggie croissant and sweet cream brioche. The pepperoni & mushroom pizza was good. Liked the crust, but the pizza options are pretty basic and uninspiring.
The real star was the Milo Spicy Italian sandwich! Great combo of quality meats and pickled veggies, very balanced flavor, probably the best sandwich I've had in Santa Monica!

Excited to go back and try more of their food! They have generous hours. Opens at 7am for pastries, coffee, bread. Breakfast dishes 8-11am. Lunch and dinner is the same menu 11am-close.

I don’t even know how this place had such great reviews. I had very high hopes for this place, this location was more than an hour away but the food looked, and sounded, great. Which is not the truth. We ordered a couple of dishes. Pizzas, appetizers and sandwiches. So, it’s not as if it was just the one type of food they were lacking in. It all looks better than it tastes.

The pizzas were soggy and quite rubbery, which is usually not what I’m looking for when I order pizza. Not only that but it was definitely lacking in flavor, as each dish was. If you aren’t going to season your food, at least put salt and pepper on the table.

We came here impromptu with our two year old and it exceeded our expectations. We walked in at 5 and they were able to accommodate us as long as we were done by 7. They had high chair and crayons. Food came out so fast. Loved the mushroom pizza and my daughter loved the kids pizza  - the crust was firm on bottom and very flavorful. The prosciutto app was fresh and worth it. We also had a seasonal peach burrata. All of it was so good we finished with the tiramisu which was very large.

name: Orto Santa Monica
address: 502 Santa Monica Blvd, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews: Absolutley Hands down the BEST Italian food, straight from italy. We we greeted by the owner, who waited on us and guided us through the menue. Outstanding!!!!! Run not walk to this little Vegetable Garden of heaven, thank you.

We went to this place for a team dinner & it did not disappoint. Food tasted great and was presented well. Service was great, with ambient music. Desserts were good too. Only negative was that they didn’t have non alcoholic drinks on the menu.

Great service and decent food, was dissapointed with 18% surcharge its like paying tip of 40%. Will not dine or recommend anyone to eat here. Also did not say cheese pasta special would be $68. Dissappointed at prices and surcharge that they have here now definitely would not recommend.

We loved Orto so much we visited twice on a 3 night trip to LA!
The pasta was absolutely stunning, I had the cheese ravioli and mushroom sauce, it was light but rich and tasty. Up there as the best pasta I have had at an Italian restaurant.
The waiting staff are fantastic, chatty, knowledgeable and really helpful, we needed tips for bars and they didn't hesitate to help.
Highly recommend.

One of the reasons why I don’t like LA…we attempted to walk into two places that were 90% empty, the first one didn’t wanna take us, the second one gave us a table straight in the sun with zero shade, and when we requested one of the other 30 tables that were available, they said they were reserved until we left. Ended up finding this place available on OpenTable and we are so happy that we did. The food is delicious and the service is even better. Highly recommend this restaurant!! The pasta with truffle was delicious, as was the pink sauce. Everything we ordered was very good and the staff and owner are super friendly.

name: Sugar Palm Santa Monica
address: 1819 Ocean Ave, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews:
This restaurant allows you to enjoy very unique and universal food at the same time. I highly recommend Shishito Pepper and Agedaishi Tofu!

It has really good vibe and spacious and neat space.
I love here and visit 2 times formy 5 nights stay.

Loved being outside at the sugar palm! We sat at the bar and had a happy hour treat. Great cocktails + bites. We were even able to get poolside glasses and take them over to the pool. Loved the blood orange margo and the Moscow mule. Very fresh, and a wonderful staff!

We had the Happy Hour Lamb Leg Berra Tacos, Steamed Mussels and Grilled Asparagus. The Tacos were so good we had to get a second order 😋🌮
Such a pretty restaurant located inside the Viceory Hotel. Lots of indoor and outdoor seating. Outdoor area have a fireplace. Happy Hour Daily 3pm-6pm

Was in the LA area for business and decided to go to Santa Monica for a morning walk and breakfast.  Sugar Palm did not disappoint. It is inside a hotel right across from the beach- near the pier.  Service was excellent- very attentive staff and you cannot go wrong with a “Dutch Baby” I was pleasantly surprised to see this gem on the menu and it’s a five star for sure.  The outside patio looks very inviting, it was a cool over-cast morning, so we dined inside. Parking on premises is available or grab a spot on the street behind the hotel, if the beach spots are taken.
It seems Sugar Palm has had a recent chef change; food is excellent. Cocktails are also tasty and attractively arranged. Outdoor patio, top! Don't miss this hidden gem.

name: SOCALO
address: 1920 Santa Monica Blvd, Santa Monica, CA 90404, USA
reviews:
1st Visit:
Dinner here last on the patio was just lovely in every way.

First, the service was impeccable. Our server was patient, friendly, knowledgeable, and good humored. Every employee who touched our table was professional and kind. And something I haven't experienced in a long time happened--the manager checked in with us at the end of our meal.

The chips are thick and warm. Three very different salsas for whatever your palate prefers. Watch out for the super spicy one!

The ceviche was delicious! Texturally on point and the right amount of citrus. Normally I don't like shrimp in my fish ceviche but the shrimp pieces were cut small and I actually enjoyed their addition.

The corn dish was also superb.

The drinks are good but I recommend starting during happy hour so they're not so expensive.

Can't wait to go back and try the tacos.

Subsequent visit:
Socalo continues to delight me. The chips and salsa are mouth watering good. Great drinks. I always enjoy the ceviche. The carne asada tacos are good, though I did think the tortilla was chewy in a weird way--hard to bite off.

The service was just wonderful as usual.

I visited Socalo two days in a row. I was pleasantly surprised at how delicious the food was and the service was five star. Thank you so much to Renata and Donald for making this a wonderful experience. They made good suggestions, they made any kind of accommodations happen.  The second day I visited with my cousin who had to bring his little dog because he had been attacked by coyotes a few days earlier and needed constant attention and they have us a really nice heated outside seat on the patio.  After the meal, Donald surprised us with a little dessert compliments of the house. Thank you again and I highly recommend this place. Didn't forget to take a picture with the flower wall as that was also suggested to us.

UPDATE! June 2024

Counter Service Only. You order, pay and then the staff will lead you to your table.

I recommend reading the menu ahead of time, since there are a lot of good options, and there is only one line.

Weekday Lunch specials are a good deal for $9.95 and  add $2 for a soda or ice tea. However,I ordered the Socalo Burrito/ chicken which comes with a beautiful salad, approximately $14. My friend ordered the shishito peppers and a bowl of tortilla soup. She enjoyed the shishito peppers, but the soup was a bit salty. I didn't taste it.

The food presentation is beautiful. The service, not so much. The soup and shishito peppers came out within minutes! My burrito took another 15 minutes. I found 2 chicken bones in the first 2 bites. I told my friend to eat and not wait for me, thank goodness.

We both only had ice water, and I asked for refills twice before getting my glass refilled. Granted it was lunch time, even when  the server acknowledged that I wanted water twice!

We both wanted to order the trio of sorbets but when we looked at the line to ORDER.... we decided to leave. Shame. I guess I could of ordered the sorbets when we placed our lunch order, but .....

I am giving 4 stars total because the service and that this is no longer a Full Service restaurant.  I almost want to give them 3.5 stars, but ....
--------------------------------

This review is for their Happy Hour! ( Wednesday - Saturday) They have Happy Hour Monday-Saturday.  The hours differ on Saturday ( 3-5pm). Parking is validated  for 90 minutes. Enter  the subterranean garage just south of Santa Monica Blvd.

We both loved the El Picante margarita for the hot spice kick! I also ordered the Chinola margarita which has passionfruit, mint and lime. The Chinola is smooth and sweet.

I chose the Poblano Quesadilla and added chicken for $4 more.II forgot to take a photo, sorry.  It was perfect for my meal. I really liked all the flavors.
My friend ordered the Nopal Tostada, beautifully presented and tasty. She also ordered a Birria (lamb), and she enjoyed it.

We shared the Baked Nachos!!!  This was really a wonderful  textured tasty dish! Because  it was baked, the tortillas were crispy! I loved it!

I recommend their Happy Hour Menu for food and drink!

I returned to check out their all day and night Taco Tuesday!  The Taco Tuesday menu is fantastic! There are seafood, beef, pork, chicken and veggies options! The Taco Tuesday menu has more options than the Happy Hour menu ( Wednesday- Saturday) , and it 's all day and night ( during restaurant hours) so I would choose coming here for Taco Tuesday!

A great experience and great food. We ordered the Queso spinach dip with chips. The chips are endless and we were only served in small portions so they were hot at all times!
We also ordered two tacos each, the Cana asada and the al pastor tacos. The meat was not chewy! It was a bit dry at time (Al pastor) and the ingredients did not really come together that well, but still great.
Everyone was very friendly but we did have to ask for a refill on chips and water often. I would definitely recommend getting the chips with some sort of dip!

Our dining experience was awesome. We attended The Other Art Show at Barkers Hanger in Santa Monica. After the show we were hungry. So we started looking for a place near by to grab a bite. We called a could of places and being a Friday night. We were failing. Then we called Socalo. The young lady was very nice and said if we were flexible. She has a table for us. We said yes. And off to Socalo we went. Pretty much from arrival to departure. We had wonderful customer service experience and delicious food. The tortillas and sauces are house made.
The staff was nice and attentive.

We can't wait to return...

name: Osteria del Fornaio
address: 401 Wilshire Blvd Suite 140, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews:
During a family vacation, we stumbled upon this gem one Friday night on the Santa Monica promenade. Surprisingly, the area was pretty quiet around 8 pm, and we were famished for a decent meal. After wandering for a bit, we finally stumbled upon a restaurant nestled on the corner, and to our delight, it was OPEN!

We were quickly seated, as the restaurant had only a few patrons. It offered a variety of seating options, including tables indoors and outdoors, as well as bar seating. Their menu featured what seemed to be authentic Italian cuisine, along with a separate menu of specials. Additionally, they boasted a full bar.

I opted for a dish from the specials menu: Australian barramundi fish marinated in a creamy lemon and caper sauce, served on a bed of thick asparagus, spinach, and mashed potatoes—absolutely delicious! My husband ordered a perfectly seasoned and sized steak, accompanied by equally hefty portions of asparagus and mashed potatoes. Meanwhile, our kiddo devoured a Margherita pizza, which was just the right size for us to sneak a bite or two.

The fish special exceeded all expectations. Despite my initial nerves about trying something new, it was expertly grilled and marinated, complemented by the lightly creamy caper sauce. The sauce perfectly coated the fish, which rested atop the bed of perfectly prepared asparagus and mashed potatoes. It was simply divine and tasted nothing like your typical fish dish.

My husband thoroughly enjoyed his steak, praising its seasoning and size. Paired with the asparagus and mashed potatoes, it was a satisfying and impeccably cooked meal.

As for the pizza, it was the only dish our kiddo finished during the trip—clearly a testament to its quality.

We're already eagerly anticipating our next dinner at this wonderful restaurant!

Walking distance. Affordable for a family of 3 with drinks.

This local restaurant is perfect for a Happy Hour 😊 $13 delicious things crust pizza and great cocktails/beers, plus they have non-alcoholic cocktails!
Their calamari is really tender and properly cooked!
Spacious upbeat Italian restaurant serving good California style pizza and other dishes. Salads are fresh and creative. Service was friendly and competent.

Fabulous restaurant in a great location. If you're looking for a place where locals go that's off the beaten tourist track, Osteria is for you!  In addition to really great food, including a robust daily happy hour menu, seating choices include a semi-open indoor area, as well as both shaded and open patio spaces. As long time Santa Monica residents, we go here often to enjoy a quiet and lovely experience that reminds us why we live here.

We have been to Osteria at least 6 times and for some reason I always forget to review this gem. I take my photos and there they sit. Maybe it is because I have so many that I put it off. I have not even attached half of them. We just love this place and will never stop coming back.

Osteria is a fine dinning Italian eatery with a casual twist. You can go dressed  however you want and the place is full of natural light and ever so comfortable. It is super pretty inside and out. It is really just the perfect place to go for great food.

The service is just the best. Each time we have been there we are warmly greeted and the servers, we have had a few now, are amazing. They are all so kind and friendly. My grandson has a speech issue and the servers have always figured this out pretty fast. They are so patient because he really wants to tell you what he wants and not always have someone else talk for him. They  listen and understand, because they are listening, and will make whatever changes he may want, although he usually just loves the menu.

Everyone that works there is super nice. They will ask you if you need anything, even is they are not your server. The bartenders have a smile you can see from your seat. They must just hire kind people.

The food is ever so great. Most of the pastas, maybe all, are made right there and they are perfect. They don't have a huge menu but everything they have is great. I think we have been through the entire menu at this point.

All of the pasta dishes are great and their fish is amazing. Everything is so fresh and perfectly cooked.

They also have the best bread. Now it is for a fee, but it is worth it. The last time we were there they did not have as many bread choices as they used to and I want them back. They make this bread with cheese that is so great, but alas, it was not to be when we were there last week. So, bring it back!

They also have super tasty desserts. All of them are great and we have shared them all. Again, the menu is not huge, just perfect.

It is not usually crowded because it is a large space. I would make reservations, but you don't need to. They have a great bar area with a TV and every drink you could imagine.

The place is always spotless. Parking is not the most fun, but you will find a space or just part in the public lot and walk about one quarter of a block.

The prices are high, but not insane. It is all worth it. Go there.

name: Big Dean's Ocean Front Cafe
address: 1615 Ocean Front Walk, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews: Just get the special. The staff was delightful and happy to serve. The views around the patio are spectacular and perfect for people watching. The food was also tasty, and you wont regret getting the special; especially if it is the fish sandwich with spicy special sauce. If you are visiting the pier I advise dropping by here for some food.

Great local hangout with good food and drinks at a reasonable price. You get more for your dollar if you eat here then at the peer. Service was not the greatest. I had to wait a while before my order was placed. Lots of space in the back patio. The place is bigger than it looks.

The service makes up for any other deficiencies.  Amidst flowing beer and a générally festive atmosphere, my wife and I asked for coffee and hot tea.  The wooden box showcasing the selection of teas was obviously being perused by another customer.   I got "black tea".  I'm sure my server got an award for emptying the ten-year old dusty box on the top shelf in the back of the pantry.

The fish-n-chips was decent.

One of the best deals and best bar food restaurants near the Santa Monica Peir area. I got a cajan chicken sandwich with avocado based on bartender recommendations, and it was outstanding. Beer is reasonably priced. Open air restaurant with TVs. See the pictures!
I had fish and chips, the fish was delicious crunchy outside and the meat inside all white, the fries where fresh and seasoned well.. the restroom clean and spacious.

name: Society Kitchen
address: 2901 Ocean Park Blvd #123, Santa Monica, CA 90405, USA
reviews: Wanted to like this place, but everything was under seasoned and cooked weird. The eggs on the Benedict were VERY over cooked, this was basically a hard boiled egg. Very little hollandaise, and the English muffins were sooo thin. Needed to wipe the plate edges from extra sauce from I guess the pan where the potatoes were cooked?, which would've improved presentation for sure - and the hostess said they weren't overly busy so this shouldn't have been an issue in my book. Again, not a big deal, but noticeable in addition to everything else. The potato hash begged for any amount of salt and frankly any seasoning at all. Service was fine, drinks were good, sitting outside was nice. If the food was better, I would go back - but sadly I don't plan to. I hope they read this and find ways to improve!
Super cute brunch place with indoor and outdoor seating. Came for brunch and got the farmers breakfast and a caramel latte. Both were excellent. Highly recommend this place. Clean airy vibe.

Went there for brunch. There were a good amount of people sitting and eating already when we arrived there. Ordered and paid at the cashier beforehand. They brought my coffee, drinks, and cheese cake first. They all good, tasty and yummy. But we waited main for 40mins, you may need to wait patiently. Breakfast burrito and farmers breakfast were good. Just potato was overly salted. I’ll come back if service time was little faster. My advice is that please let your customer know if the food is coming late :)

Yummy. Creme brulee late was a little sweet but still a good pick me up!
Outdoor seating has good vibes.

We went there on Sunday at around 10am and got a table inside without wait, but it got crowded short after. The food tasted great and the atmosphere was great too, but our orders were forgotten for half an hour, and they didn’t notice it until we reminded them. Otherwise it was perfect.

name: Piccolo Santa Monica
address: 2127 Lincoln Blvd, Santa Monica, CA 90405, USA
reviews: Piccolo is one of the best restaurants on Lincoln for its delicious food, exquisite wines, and above-and-beyond friendly staff. The grilled octopus, grilled calamari, and linguini mare with the black in linguine are must-order dishes, and you really can’t go wrong with any of the wines. Kelsey is the best manager and always makes sure things go smoothly. The bartender is also brilliant and all of his cocktails are amazing. They have both romantic indoor and outdoor seating, and I always leave with a smile on my face.

This place is fantastic! What a little gem on Lincoln. The service is great with friendly service. The Pasta is homemade and AMAZING! High end meals at reasonable prices and great cocktails. Highly recommend this wonderful restaurant.

Extremely friendly service here, and delicious food. It is a bit above my price range generaly, so I go there for a treat, and they have been unfailingly friendly.  The burrata and poached pair is cravable.  The pasta dishes are always delightful.  The salads are savory and refreshing.  They are happy to recommend wines to suit your tastes.  I enjoy both the outdoor and the indoor seating, and had a nice time at the bar once, where the bartender introduced me to a regular there.  This could be a nice place to just hang out if you lived in the area.  Can you believe this: once the host even offered to walk me to my home, a couple of blocks away, since it was late at night.  Hearwarmingly kind.

The backyard is dimly lit and there are candles on the table, creating a memorable atmosphere. Heat lamps were more than adequate. Not loud, and not packed cheek to jowl, so it's easy to have conversations here. Very few kids here. The food was great quality, well prepared, good portion sizes, served warm. The fare is upper tier, traditional Italian, with little to no innovation. There are a few vegetarian choices but that's not a strength here. For dessert we tried tiramisu, which was mostly cream and lacked flavor. We didn't see our server all that much and had to ask another for a refill of water. The location is right on busy Lincoln, which unfortunately does not have much for public transit. Great place for a romantic dinner or other special occasion. I would probably come back.

Everything on their menu is excellent. You're paying for quality of food and service. The staff is very friendly, professional, and attentive; they always make sure my glass of wine is never empty. Furthermore, the atmosphere is quiet and mellow; perfect, if you don't like to shout at everyone you talk to.

name: pasjoli
address: 2732 Main St, Santa Monica, CA 90405, USA
reviews: A sleek French spot! I came with a girlfriend and we split a bottle of wine and a few dishes. The food was super rich but flavorful. I enjoyed the pastries stuffed with cheese and the sea bass. Both were cooked excellent and I would order again. The waitress was super sweet and knowledgeable. Overall we had a great experience!

The interior of this place is quite attractive and it's got a very good menu if you're into very classic French food, and aren't afraid of everything being very rich and buttery.
I found the appetisers and hors d'oeuvres better than the mains, which were pretty heavy. The tartare, dauphinois and chicken liver was exceptional.
A nice meal marred slightly by the service which was a but uncomfortable. The relentless upsell was a bit much.

My wife and I have frequented Pasjoli numerous times, and with each visit, our appreciation for this gem in Santa Monica only grows stronger. From the moment you step inside, you're enveloped in a stunning ambiance that perfectly blends elegance with warmth.

The hospitality at Pasjoli is truly exceptional; every detail is thoughtfully attended to, from discreetly refilling our wine glasses to seamlessly clearing our table between courses. It's evident that the staff takes immense pride in providing a memorable dining experience.

Speaking of unforgettable experiences, the Tuna and Tomato dish at Pasjoli is nothing short of heavenly. The flavors and textures are perfectly balanced, leaving us dreaming about it long after we leave. If you have the chance, do not miss the Loup de Mer if it graces the menu. The lobster velouté accompanying it is remarkably silky and bursting with flavor.

And let's talk about desserts—the chocolate soufflé at Pasjoli is a masterpiece. Paired with cocoa nib ice cream that complements it flawlessly, it's the ideal conclusion to an exquisite meal.

In summary, Pasjoli is more than just a restaurant; it's an experience that keeps us eagerly looking forward to our next visit. Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or simply craving exceptional cuisine, Pasjoli consistently delivers excellence that is hard to match. Highly recommended!

Really love this restaurant. One of the best food crews on the West Coast, from a level of attention to detail on food and service. I think it was smart for them to loosen up a bit with a la carte service instead of traditional pre fixe for this tier of restaurants.

Love the recent collaborations. Here are some shots of their recent event with Yangban.

I was a returning customer and I had a terrible birthday dinner tonite. Me and my friend drove from OC on Tuesday night under heavy rain, when we got there it was not too crowded and it had few big tables available. Maybe waitress thought we wouldn’t order too many so we got a tiny little place. Meanwhile there were another 2 groups with 2 parties came in same time, they got big tables, interesting. After we finished order, it’s definitely too many for a tiny table but waitress even not asking if we need a bigger place. Unbelievable! And she checked several times for other tables but just 2 times for mine, I had to ask her for more water… back to food, I don’t know what happened but every single course was way tooooo salty we barely to finish even half of the plates. And other tables had a quite long introduction about the main course ( the signature duck) but we only had 1 min briefing. The manager checked back to us and gifting us a free cheese cake which was sweet, thank you. But honestly it’s just too late. I was too disappointed and rush to leave because I need get some other options before all restaurants closed. Total was $458 or $485( my friend paid the bill I couldn’t remember clearly) for 2 ppl with cold service and awful food, I don’t think you want same experience as mine. Btw we are Asians.

Updates:
Ann, thank you for your sweet explanation with everything, first of all please be aware of, as customer service, I think your employee should have their judgements to check if customer needs a bigger table or could just kindly offer “ hey I think you might need a bigger place let me know if there’s anything I could do for you” I think this is more decent way as customer service especially as a M1 star restaurant. And as I mentioned during that time there’s more than 1 bigger table available, there’s nothing wrong if you guys can’t offer a bigger table at that moment, but as better customer service I think you should and you could even just ask. I work as luxury retail I know what customer service is. About Waiter/ waitress checking, I strong recommended you check back with your camera see if I was telling a truth or I am creating drama. And way back to the food, I understand for some time somehow, it might happened the food was overcooked or over seasoning. But if the entire courses came with same issues, I think you should improve your quantity controlling instead of pointed that I was wrong or I declined your options. Because it’s unacceptable if a M1 star restaurant had such issues. And forgive me I had no time to wait you guys re-cook everything. Because I don’t need pay my time for your mistakes. Overall, thank you for your cheese cake again but good luck for your future business.
Have a great night!

name: Isla
address: 2424 Main St, Santa Monica, CA 90405, USA
reviews: Elegant, sophisticated, and yet casual and unpretentious! And I have not tried them yet outside of happy hour, but they’re happy hour prices are fantastic! See my video clips and photos that I’ve attached for my full thoughts on this restaurant.

Food was very good but the service was a disappointment. A pet peeve of mine is an improperly timed meal. All of our dishes were brought out nearly at once and at one point we had 4 of our 6 dishes delivered before we even finished our salad. The dining experience felt rushed, which is frustrating because the food was good.

They also have a 3% extra charge for using a credit card that they automatically add.

One of the best restaurants I’ve been to in Santa Monica! The cocktails were delicious, the service was great, and the food was incredible. Highly recommend the chef’s choice. The food was super fresh and the atmosphere was very warm and inviting. One of our new LA favorites!

Have only been here to drink, though I've heard the food is really good too. What I can say for certain is that bar manager Kent is amazing, and his drinks don't disappoint! It's tough to find really creative and well executed cocktails on the Westside, but the bar at Isla is one of those places where you'll always discover that elusive amazing sip.

Also, they have Isla Noches on Fridays through the summer where they do a late night drinks and dance party from 10pm to late with drink specials, a dj, and dancing! (And if you're lucky maybe some flaming Dr. Pepper shots)

The staff was so kind to squeeze us in on a busy weekend night. The atmosphere at Isla was very lively. I expect on a quieter evening, it would be a lovely place for a romantic dinner. Excellent beverage menu. Food is New American style with some unique flares. Make sure to check out their sister restaurant Crudo e Nudo!

name: Ugo Trattoria
address: 1237 3rd Street Promenade, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
reviews: We randomly found this gem while walking in Santa Monica. The figo pizza was amazing with fresh mozzarella. My parents LOVED the bolognese sauce. It was so incredible they mentioned it was the best they had in years. The service was quick. Our waiter was polite and very kind. We will come back whenever we come back to Cali.

The food was very solid and good value for money.

We ordered a pizza and penne arrabiata. The arrabiata was suitably spicy, although it could have been a bit spicier for me.

The service was friendly.

The food arrived relatively quickly after we ordered. Our waiting time was about 10-15 minutes.
I love Ugo. My go to meal is the Penne and Caesar Salad. The promenade (Santa Monica) is a pleasant place to dine up where this restaurant is. Not a ton of noise.

Room for Improvement at this  Street Restaurant Trattoria - I recently dined at a street restaurant in Santa Monica, and while the ambiance was lively, the pasta dish I ordered was unfortunately overcooked and overpriced compared to other options in the area. With a few adjustments to their cooking methods and pricing, I believe this restaurant could provide a much better experience for patrons.

Aside from their excellent tasting food, the server was incredibly nice and helpful. She went out of her way to make sure we had what we needed.
The bread dip with olive oil, parmesan cheese,  cracked pepper and balsamic vinaigrette was amazing. We will definitely be back. Thank you 🙏🏽

name: Birdie G's
address: 2421 Michigan Ave, Santa Monica, CA 90404, USA
reviews:
Wow - what a great spot. The food is outstanding.  Tried several dishes and most of them were A+++.

The MT. LASSEN TROUT GRAVLAX  - out of this world.

RICE FLOUR-BATTERED MUSHROOMS - incredible. Like… maybe best mushrooms ever?

PICKLE CHICKEN - 100% get this, because this is a home run.

The lamb and new york strip… meh. Quite good overall, but there are better things on the menu and I wouldn’t recommend them.

The cocktails and service excellent too. Enjoy!

I enjoyed almost everything I ate and drank. We had the cornbread, relish platter, rockfish, fried mushrooms, peas, rose pie, chocolate cake slice and a few drinks (5 total between the three of us).

Cornbread is delicious.
I really like that they put the green chili in the butter. It shines more that way without overpowering the cornbread.

Loved the platter. Didn't even know we could eat ice plant (?). It was such a nice texture. Everything was so good generally.

The fish was so well cooked. Just right and not too fishy (I think the ginger helped).

The peas were so fresh and yummy. I don't think it even needs cheese. I could eat it on its own.

Drinks are solid and strong. Service from the maitre d to the server to the mixologist to the busboy was all consistently exceptional. The ambience is fantastic. I like that they don't try to squeeze in a million chairs. I think the overall design of the space also just feels airy.

Food was average, we did enjoy the creativity and flavors of the relish plate and mussels. Matzo ball soup was flavorful but not mind blowing. Steak & fries seriously underwhelmed us, portion size was tiny. Our cocktails, however, were delicious and spirit-forward just like we were hoping for.

Service, however, was a MAJOR disappointment. We came for our 7pm reservation and saw the server only when he took our order and to deliver some of the dishes. It took 2 hours before our main course was delivered to us. Each time the server delivered our dish he apologized profusely for how long it was taking and stated he was embarrassed at the pace our dishes were coming out. The meal started off strong with our cocktails and two starters, but by the end, we were so disappointed by the service we decided to skip dessert and just go home.

Bummed because we really wanted to come back to try the pickle chick and other dishes/cocktails, but hard to justify coming back.

The Matso ball soup is worth the trip 🔥 The Caesar Fries were fried perfectly but a tad salty. The Empress Bundt cake was baked beautifully. The fresh whipped cream is perfect with the cake. I like the caramel but I found it overpoweringly sweet. More of a balance would have been nice. The restaurant decor is interior designer worthy and the location in Santa Monica is hard to beat!

This place has an amazing vibe, food and service. The restaurant is Family style so food is meant to be shared with the table.

The half chicken is juicy, flavorful and well presented, same for the New York steak and the Cesar salad. Maybe the salad had too much dressing but that is just my preference. Also because of the concept of sharing the food, the price is very fair.

name: Avra Beverly Hills
address: 233 N Beverly Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: Nick was exceptional helping us as we celebrated two birthdays. The restaurant is beautiful and patio great. Very LA and chic. Excellent menu, loved the oysters and halibut. Everyone loved their fish as well. It’s pricey but if you have a special occasion or want a nice experience in the heart of Beverly Hills, Avra is great. Thanks, Nick!

Visiting from Qatar 🇶🇦
The food was really good , fresh and to our preference.
Our helper (Nick) was  SO welcoming and informative and very friendly, which made the experience amazing.
Definitely recommending the restaurant to friends back home whenever visiting Los angles

Our first time and definitely not the last time at this delightful restaurant. Impeccable service, amazing waitress (Olga) who was watching her tables so closely, making sure during the entire time to accommodate her guests. Pleasant, professional, great personality and a perfect match for such restaurant. The food was absolutely delicious. The atmosphere was so comfortable, perfect lighting and seating area. The manager (Leslie) stop by our table because we wanted him to know how much we appreciated Olga’s great work and how much we enjoyed everything. No matter where go are in LA, you must visit this wonderful restaurant. Kudos to the chef, staff and the management.

This is a must visit if you are a foodie!!  Or if you just appreciate great food, great service and a relaxing, atmosphere.

While this may seem expensive, the experience is more than worth it.  You absolutely get what you pay for and much more.

First time but definitely not a last time. All things just beyond expectations from the appetizer to the main course. We ordered chilian seabass and was awesome. Steak also was great and tasty. Highly recommended this chic restaurant in the heart of Beverly Hills.

name: Il Pastaio
address: 400 N Canon Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews:
Il Pastaio in LA is straight-up amazing! 🍝🌟 The vibe is cozy, perfect for dates or hanging with friends.

Justin's pasta dish is next level—so much flavor! 🤤 Service is top-notch, and the vibe is chill. Definitely worth the hype, 5/5 would recommend for a pasta paradise!

Came here on a Tuesday night and having to wait for 15 mins for a table tell you how popular this place can be! It is a high end Italian restaurant right in the middle of Beverly Hills. Our friend is a regular here so he took care of the ordering. We ordered seafood tomato based soup, lobster linguine, T-bone and Filet mignon, lentils and shrimp salad, and many more. Everything is so delicious and with the right portion so you don’t feel stuffed after trying different dishes. The desserts are a must too!

Definitely you'll experience the real authentic italian food at this restaurant.

We had:
Calamari Fritti
Caprese Salad
Ravioli di Ricotta e Spinach
Spaghetti Al Pomodoro e Basilico

All dishes tasted excellent.
The service was excellent.
We had a great time there. The service was great and friendly and the food was authentic. One of us accidentally made a mess on the table and they were pretty understanding. Thank you!
Delicious food. As I was effectively seated on the sidewalk, the ambiance left a bit to be desired, but I very much enjoyed my caesar and arrabbiata. The arancini and apple tart tatin were just okay.

name: The Rooftop Beverly Hills
address: 9850 Wilshire Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: Delicious dinner and amazing views. This rooftop restaurant has some of the best views of Los Angeles, and the food did not disappoint. The service was great, and the DJ made the atmosphere so enjoyable with fun music to listen to as you look at the skyline. We ordered the Guacamole, Shrimp Lettuce Wraps, and Tuna Tartare as appetizers and they were all delicious. Possibly the best tuna I've had. For dinner we got the Salmon and the Lobster Burger and they were both phenomenal. The Brookie for dessert topped with vanilla mochi ended off the meal perfectly. Great night.

Atop the beautiful Waldorf Astoria hotel with panoramic views of Beverly Hills and Hollywood from 12 stories high. An impeccably garden walkway to the restaurant starts the vibe.
The Rooftop by JG is one of the largest of its kind in Beverly Hills.

Starting off with Forbes five star hostess Hannah who moved our party to a better table without asking.
The tequila mockingbird cocktail was probably the best drink I've ever had.... Pricey, but worth it!
Our gregarious and attentive server Harmony recommended the Sashimi with spicy white Ponzu appetizer and it was a home run!

Everyone from the bartenders to the wait staff were spot on, highly recommended! We'll be back

I was a regular at JG in Shanghai on the bund and wanted to see how this JG compared — it did not disappoint.

Views are great here almost 365 of the city. I prefer it over SoHo House as it’s more open air yet feels more private.

Food was really good as expected. Service was great, everything was served fast and the staff was extremely attentive

I get the feeling of GRANDEUR when I come here. The Ultimate dining experience with a breath taking view of Beverly Hills.  Great drinks,food,service. A little more expensive but no place like this in Beverly Hills compares.

Went here on Fathers' day 2024. The view was spectacular & the hostess had a nice disposition. She also had to bus our table prior to seating us. We got the lobster burger & Spicy Thai burger. The food & drinks were delicious & strong. I'd give them a 10/10. However, our server Jade was a 0/10. She took 10 min to come & acknowledge us. Meanwhile the party we checked in with had already ordered drinks with their server. We had to ask a bus person for water since Jade was MIA. She didn't even check on us once! We had to ask another bus person for a salt shaker & someone else re-filled our water glasses. JADE did absolutely NOTHING!  At these prices, service should be top notch! My friends who frequent this restaurant rave about the service so unfortunately, we must have gotten the one bad server they have. I'm usually a generous tipper but tipping Jade 10% was for the hostess & bus people who actually worked. I'd definitely come back for the view & food/drinks but never again subject myself to the poor service Jade exhibits! The poor service from Jade makes this restaurant less desirable when compared to similar establishments. There are too many other nice restaurants in LA that offer outstanding service, great food/drinks & beautiful aesthetics.

name: The Hideaway
address: 421 N Rodeo Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: 10/10 highly recommend. Bean dip was fire. Wagyu appetizers were great. Super chill vibe on Rodeo Drive. The staff were pleasant. We sat where the sun was beaming in and the hostess was able to have someone pull our shade to cover us, so generous and kind.

This place was absolutely amazing!! The bartender put love into every drink that was served. The food was so delicious I had the uno dos tres menu with the Tuna tartar, a Salmon Caesar salad, and for dessert the flan. Everything prepared to perfection! They even had bean dip that was vegan which was perfect for me. I definitely recommend making your reservation you won't regret it!

Absolutely delicious food, magical vibes, and excellent service all tucked into a beautiful hidden space right on Rodeo. If you haven't been you are missing out! Great place for large parties, intimate dates, hanging with friends, or a dinner business meeting. My favorite dish is the Duck Carnitas with a side of esquites and truffle fries.

10/10 highly recommend. Mitchell was the absolute best. He was very knowledgeable about the menu given some allergies in our party. The food was delicious and so were the drinks. Three in our party got the pre fixe menu. Then my friend and I shared the Australian ribeye, shrimp ceviche, and esquites. (Ate all the food before we could snap pics.)Will be back the next time I’m in LA.

Tucked away below the main road you feel like you're in a secret hidden spot. Enter immediately going down some stairs taking you just a little further below street level where you enter a big window ceiling so during the day is nice and bright. Making any sense? You'll just have to see it for yourself.  Outside patio furniture for table tops and decor to match a feeling you are in Mexico enjoying a nice outdoors dining. Waiters greet you with complimentary in-house made chips and roasted tomatoe salsa with a small board of lemon, lime & salt. We also received a complimentary vegan black bean dip, which was delicious! Food is quality, flavorful, and portioned perfectly. Lattes are smooth and delicious even without offering any flavors. If you are one for flavored lattes, maybe try the café de Olla with cream. It has a hint of spices like cinnamon in it and may be a great substitute for your flavored lattes. I like to visit places a few times before doing reviews to see the consistency of its work, so from this you can tell I have not been disappointed. It's highly recommended that you make reservations. Enjoy!

name: Prospect Gourmand
address: 105 N Robertson Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90211, USA
reviews: This beautiful little place is right off of Wilshire Boulevard. Atmosphere and service absolutely fantastic. I ordered the fish tacos, which took a little while and were a little on a spicy side but overall, I will recommend this place. The menu selections were fast and appealing!

I think I just had the best Burger ever. The meat was so good and juicy.
I thought it couldn’t get any better, I tried their dessert. I had the Peach Pudding and it blew my mind.
Great place. Went for Happy Hour. Got the same delicious sauce on my chicken that they use with the short ribs dinner. Creative yummy food.

This place is a GEM! Beautifully prepared, fresh, and creative flavors inside a beautiful atmosphere. I could not believe the variety of flavors in every dish that we tried! We got three happy hour specials (before 6pm) - the salmon collar, Brussels sprouts, and guacamole were all perfectly balanced in flavors and textures. At our table, we all agreed that the gazpacho was the best any of us had ever tasted. For entrees, we shared the duck breast and short ribs….although it took a half hour wait to come out, these dishes did not disappoint! The duck breast was especially special with a fantastic fruity sauce with Sichuan pepper flavors - a combination I didn’t think would work well together but actually was an explosion of flavors. The duck breast was perfectly cooked rare. The short ribs had the juiciest meat and fell right off the bone, and came with the most delicious mashed potatoes. The only thing I would critique is that the short ribs were a bit salty (it seemed like it would go really well with a starch or maybe more plain steamed veggies) but honestly everything was beyond delicious and we will definitely be back again!

We just got back from a fantastic dinner here. We arrived early so that we were able to order a lot items from their happy hour menu (way too many items since the portions were large), but as a result we got to taste six different appetizers/entrees before we had our main courses. Everything was delicious especially the Brussels sprouts. Additionally the duck and the steak were amazing. The prices were quite reasonable in light of the quality of the preparation and presentation. This is a must do experience.

name: Il Cielo
address: 9018 Burton Way, Beverly Hills, CA 90211, USA
reviews: We loved the lamb chops and seafood pasta. Didn’t like the risotto with lobster. Loved that they had mocktails…i got the pomogracoloada which was yummy. We also ordered sangria and a spicy margarita. Calamari was okay. Service was good. However, we felt that the owner was racist which was a shame because we spent our money here. As someone who just recently travel from Italy, i wouldn’t say this is that comparable. It’s just okay.

This place has been on my list, and finally, I experienced it last night for a late bday celebration.

It's a gem.

Valet parking was $15
We sat in the corner right pocket right next to the entrance. I never got up to explore the other areas, so I'll just have to come back.

The service was truly great! From the gentleman who poured our water, to the waiter, to the gentlemans that cleared our plate.

Each individual was given bread after placing our orders. It was delicious and we asked for more. We ordered the following.

Il Cesare
Il Polipo
Funghi Porcini
Pappardelle Al Cinghiale
Salmone
Pollo Arrosto

Birthday Dessert (most popular)
Cuore Di Cioccolata

My favs were the polipo and Porcini! I was pleasantly surprised at how good the salad was. Even more so with the polipo. The octopus was so tender and very well seasoned. I couldn't get enough of the potatoes as well.

I ate most of the Porcini and was full off that before realizing that my friend ordered 3 other main dishes. I'm biased as I love mushrooms. The porcini had so much flavor and is honestly one of the best I've tried. I loved that there were a lot of mushrooms with every bite. I'd come back for this because it hit the spot for me.

Everything was delicious on its own. My next fav was the Pappardelle! The boar was again very well seasoned and flavorful. Noodles were flat and thin, perfectly cooked with the right amt of firmness for each bite.

Lastly, the dessert was a super cute aesthetic with a perfectly written happy birthday. It was thick and sweet. Heavy for a meal with what we ordered. It was a delight to try, but I would try another dessert next time.

Wonderful place. I love outdoor dining so this place definitely made the cut. Food was great and the service was awesome. The ambiance:  serene and quite relaxing.
We are going back to dine again soon!

Had our first dinner as a wedded couple here and everything was amazing. Staff made us feel extremely special. The food was sublime (pre-fixe), especially the Homemade Pappardelle with Maine Lobster and White Truffle Sauce.

I've been there as just a guest for the New Year celebration of 2024, I was so amazed by the kitchen and service that I decided to celebrate my wedding at this place also.

They rent nice private rooms for any amount of people 20+++ and offer everything you need for a special occasion.
In my case, it was a nice pre-fixed menu, which is AMAZING!!! the best appetizers in my life, lobster truffle pasta, lamb and more!!

il Cielo decorated the place for me with flowers,
Decorated a wedding case
Both of the decorations were unbelievable!

Pasquale personally was guiding me through from process from the beginning to the end.

I'm infinitely happy I decided to do that, from the 1st day working with Pasquale I forgot about multiple tasks that need to organize your wedding (chef, plate\glass rent, florist, etc). We decided everything within 1 day and I was set up. Amazing!

Now I feel like I am connected to this place, we will come back for ever anniversary celebration!

name: Porta Via Beverly Hills
address: 424 N Canon Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews:
Breakfast solid 2.9 / 5.0 - Just meh food with attentive but sloppy service.
For breakfast food like this I can just go to a diner. It's quite un-special and lacks flavor. Bacon is basically deep fried to a crisp, eggs & pancakes were basic but fine, everything else was fine. Coffee tastes good but was just seemed like the waiter didn't care, was very rushed (even though they weren't busy) and twice over poured coffee and didn't return to clean it up.
Didn't care for the style of the waiter (rushed and disinterested, seemed like he doesn't enjoy job) but the helpers were great. Nice white table clothes and nice setting.

The ambiance was superb, and the beef patty in the hamburger was juicy and delicious – I loved it! Several of my Chinese friends who were with me are fluent in Spanish, so they directly communicated with the Latin American server in Spanish. The server was very friendly and even provided complimentary bread before the meal.

We had a great time at this bistro, because of their delicious desserts. The service was friendly, and our order came quickly. The Black Out Dark Chocolate Cake was absolutely delightful and my favorite among the desserts we tried.
Excellent food and very nice service. Good price performance ratio.

I’m visiting the area and saw the menu here and had to try. This place was absolutely spectacular. Everyone was so kind and attentive, and the food was to die for! 100% recommend to try out. The outside dining area was so comfortable and it is in a beautiful spot in the Beverly Hills area. Absolutely have to go again!

name: Wally's Beverly Hills
address: 447 N Canon Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: This is a wine lovers heaven. The largest wine selection I’ve ever seen in a restaurant. The menu is perfectly designed to be complimented with your favorite wine. They also have a very large bar area, which include a vast selection of other great alcoholic beverages. This restaurant offers a cheese section, uniquely selected for purchase along with other products. The food is so tasteful and has beautiful presentation. My only complaint is the stools not being comfortable. This casual ambiance is a perfect place for lunch or dinner. You definitely must put Wally’s on your list next time you visit Beverly Hills.

This restaurant did not disappoint. The food was absolutely delicious. I loved every bit of it!

The restaurant itself has a great ambiance and is filled to the brim with wines, literally lining every single wall up to the ceiling. If you sit in the back like we did, you get a view into the open kitchen and watch the magic happen.

The standouts for me were the truffle fries and the lobster pasta which was heavy for sure, but very very good. It was a squid ink pasta in a delicious lobster sauce with quite a bit of seafood. The truffle fries were perfectly cooked and reminded me of belgian fries almost.

This is a must try! Will be back here for dinner for sure when I'm in LA.

We recently attended a party at Wally's Beverly Hills, and it was an exceptional experience. Located near Rodeo Drive, Wally's offers an upscale yet inviting atmosphere perfect for any gathering.

We sampled nearly everything on the menu, and each dish was a culinary delight. The charcuterie and cheese boards were a highlight, featuring an impressive selection of high-quality, artisanal products. The seafood dishes, particularly the oysters and lobster, were fresh and perfectly prepared.

For mains, the truffle pasta stood out with its rich, earthy flavors, and the steaks were cooked to perfection, tender and flavorful. The diverse wine list, expertly curated, complemented our meal wonderfully, adding to the overall indulgence.

Service was attentive and knowledgeable, ensuring our needs were met promptly and with a smile. Wally's is a gem in Beverly Hills, offering a memorable dining experience that combines elegance with outstanding food and drink.

First time at Wally's last night and had the best time. Bartenders were so friendly and helpful with ordering from menu. I got the avocado salad that was seriously one of the best salads I've ever had. So colorful and fresh. We then shared the spicy pepperoni pizza that was also fresh and had the perfect kick to it. This is definitely my favorite restaurant right now. Can't wait to go back and try other items on the menu. This restaurant deserves ten stars!

Wally's is a Beverly Hills Must! (January 2024)

We recently were shopping in Beverly Hills and the associate at the boutique we were at recommended Wally's for an afternoon drink + snack.

When we arrived, we were already in-love with the atmosphere - wine bottles up and down the walls and you get to eat/enjoy in the middle of it all.

A few cocktails later, charcuterie board and the must-have black truffle baked brie bread... we were very satisfied with the visit/recommendation! The staff were also very nice and made great recommendations on food + drink.

name: The Ivy
address: 113 N Robertson Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90048, USA
reviews: Amazing dining experience at The Ivy! The seafood Italian cuisine was superb. We ordered the salad with half lobster and the seafood pasta. The lobster was fresh and delicious, and the pasta was light and tasty. Service was incredibly fast and efficient. We had a reservation and were a bit late, but we didn't have to wait as they had a table ready for us.

I wanted to visit here again as it's so different to the Ivy in London. I love the Spanish decor and all the flowers. Try to get a seat outside if you can.
For a fancier restaurant, this place still amamges to have a bit if charm and character and it's beautiful to sit in. The menu is so extensive its almost overwhelming, but everything we got was good. I had a lovely lunch here.

BEVERLY HILLS STAPLE- one of our favorite spots for a special night out. This restaurant is beautiful and the staff cares about every detail. Our dinner was delicious. We ordered margaritas, the squash blossom, the scallops, the crab claws, the mussels, mashed potatoes, and grilled veggies. Probably could have ordered the half size of the mussels. Antonio was our waiter- he was fantastic. Can’t go wrong here

Step into the enchanting world of The Ivy, a culinary haven nestled in the heart of Los Angeles. From the moment you set foot on its grounds, you’re enveloped in an atmosphere of sophistication and charm, setting the stage for a dining experience unlike any other.

Renowned for its upscale ambiance and exquisite cuisine, The Ivy elevates dining to an art form. With a commitment to using the freshest, locally-sourced ingredients, including those from the owner’s estate, every dish is a masterpiece of flavor and finesse.

During my recent visit, I was treated to a culinary journey that delighted the senses at every turn. From the crisp freshness of the salads to the rich complexity of the entrees, each bite was a revelation of taste and texture. The attention to detail extended to the garnishes, with handpicked flowers adding a touch of elegance to both drinks and dishes.

Despite my short stay in Los Angeles, I made it a point to visit The Ivy multiple times, drawn back by the irresistible allure of its cuisine. Even amidst a busy sightseeing schedule, the thought of indulging in The Ivy’s culinary delights was impossible to resist.

In conclusion, The Ivy stands as a shining beacon of culinary excellence in Los Angeles. Its upscale ambiance, coupled with the unparalleled quality of its cuisine, makes it a destination worthy of repeat visits. Whether you’re a local resident or a visitor to the area, a dining experience at The Ivy promises to be nothing short of extraordinary, leaving you with memories to savor long after the meal has ended.

Outstanding place. Beautiful! Cozy. Amazing food and drinks and the SERVICE!! The waiters are so professional. Best service I have had in years. They are friendly, attentive, and they move so fast through (at least today) a super crowded restaurant. You should absolutely go!

name: The Penthouse at Mastro's
address: 246 N Canon Dr Floor 3, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: Drinks and split butter cake at the bar with a good friend. Perfection! She and I couldn’t even finish the cake because the portion was so big but we wanted to because it was so delicious. Great live music that night in the bar too and excellent service from the bartender. Can’t wait return for more.

This was an absolutely  amazing dining experience! Service was unmatched, Very helpful and meet all of my table needs. The food was absolutely delicious!  The manager even called my daughter to ask how the experience was! Who does that these days? Fine dining was my experience! Guess what the menu had my name on it WOW!

We were served by Steve who has worked there for more than a decade or two. Recommendations were good, steak was seasoned with a good amount of salt and doneness was on point. The quality of beef was 👍🏻 ! Breads are fresh bakes, texture is soft and fluffy. We booked this place on a last minute’s decision and was able to get a good seat. We also placed a special request for celebration and they have kindly acceded to our expectations with a nicely decorated yummilicious cheesecake as dessert. This is an overall a better steak restaurant in terms of their service and foods as compared to Capital Grille which we used to patronise frequently.

Step into the epitome of luxury dining at Mastro’s Steakhouse, nestled in the heart of Beverly Hills. From the moment you enter, you’re enveloped in an atmosphere of sophistication and refinement. The strict dress code sets the tone, urging guests to dress their best for this elevated dining experience.

Prepare to be transported to a realm of culinary excellence as you sample each meticulously crafted dish. From the indulgent caviar to the perfectly cooked steaks, every bite is a symphony of flavors that leaves you craving more. And let me tell you, the bone marrow served alongside the caviar and steaks adds an extra layer of richness and indulgence to the meal. It’s a culinary adventure that you won’t soon forget. This is the only place I did not take much pictures as I chose to be fully immersed into the experience Mastro’s had to offer.

Beyond the exceptional cuisine, Mastro’s Steakhouse offers an inviting atmosphere and impeccable service that elevate the dining experience to new heights. Whether you’re celebrating a special occasion or simply indulging in a night of luxury, Mastro’s Steakhouse promises an unforgettable experience that embodies the essence of Beverly Hills sophistication. Don’t miss the opportunity to dine at this culinary gem—you won’t be disappointed.

We came here for our birthdays. Calling ahead of time, they prepared special menus with our names on it and a cheesecake with whipped cream made in house. We ordered the Prime Rib, Brocolini, French Onion Soup. I’d give the steak 8.5/10 for the price. The service and atmosphere were great.  Highly recommended for dates, family dinners, or corporate/client meetings.

name: Spago
address: 176 N Canon Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews:
My husband took me to Spago as a surprise to celebrate my birthday. What a treat!

The service was impeccable. It is clear from the moment you park the car in front of Spago that every single staff member strives for excellence.

We were seated in a comfortable booth inside and enjoyed seeing the lighting changing as the sun set happened late. The ambiance is sophisticated, yet comfortable.

We felt very lucky to have an extremely kind and sweet server named Rita. Her assistants (who brought in the food, the drinks, removed empty dishes, lit up my birthday candle) were also kind and professional. They all brought a feel of being happy to be there in that given moment.

As for dinner, I'll name my favorite dishes:
* the tuna cones
* the branzino (I think the best I ever had)
* the peach strudel (inspired) dessert

I appreciated the personalized touch of having my name written following the "happy birthday" wish with our dessert.

Mr. Wolfgang Puck came to greet us at our table at the start of the evening, which was quite sweet.

As we were walking to leave the restaurant, many of the staff members thanked us and wished us a good rest of the evening.

Impeccable, from beginning to end, with the addition of a follow up email on the following day.

The experience was remarkable. Reservations are strongly advised as the establishment appears to anticipate your arrival with additional amenities. The dishes were flawlessly prepared, and the flavors were exceptional. I highly recommend Spago.

What a great and iconic restaurant to visit while in LA.   Staff is all super friendly and welcoming and our server Josh was fantastic.  His recommendations were on point based on the types of foods my wife and I prefer.  So glad we made this stop a priority while visiting Southern California.  Amazing and worth every penny.

To celebrate Mother's Day, we chose Spago in Beverly Hills, a decision that proved to be exceptional in many ways. The ambience was refined and inviting, perfect for a special occasion.

The service at Spago is unparalleled – attentive, knowledgeable, and always with a smile. The wine list is extensive and carefully curated, with our server making excellent recommendations. We paired our meal with the Donnachadh Rosé of Syrah 2023, which was light, and refreshing, and complemented our dishes perfectly.

Our meal began with their famous bread and salsas, setting a high bar right from the start. We also enjoyed the Spicy Big Eye Tuna Cones, featuring sesame, ginger, wasabi, chilli aioli, and daikon sprouts. These were as delicious as I remembered from my previous visit – a perfect balance of spice and freshness.

For our main courses, we indulged in the Liberty Farm's Duck Breast, which was beautifully cooked and paired with caramelized endive, kumquat marmalade, candied walnuts, and a spiced duck jus. The flavours were exquisite, each component enhancing the duck without overpowering it. We also tried the chicken and the Chilean sea bass, both of which were prepared to perfection, showcasing the quality of the ingredients and the chef's skill.

Desserts at Spago are nothing short of spectacular. Being a special occasion we let ourselves be recommended for Mother's Day but we will return to try everything we can.

Spago remains a top choice for fine dining in Beverly Hills. From the exceptional service and wine list to the delightful starters and exquisite entrees, and the unforgettable desserts, every aspect of our Mother's Day celebration was perfect. Highly recommended for any special occasion.

Spago remains a top choice for fine dining in Beverly Hills. Highly recommended for any special occasion. However, I have to say, this visit was Allegro Ma Non Troppo. We've enjoyed the concept of Spago's kitchen on many previous occasions, having dined there numerous times before. Unfortunately, this time wasn’t the best experience.

We flew in from Australia. Attentive staff, waitress and maitre'd. Extensive wine menu to cater all palates. The food was absolutely delectable. The signature dishes were the highlights including spicy big tuna cones and salmon pizza with the ever crisp dough. A must try is the Singapore style black pepper  Branzino.Will definitely come again.

name: Il Fornaio Beverly Hills
address: 301 N Beverly Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: First time visiting. Public parking was $5 after 6pm. Easy to make reservations on google maps. Staff was friendly. I didn’t love the seating area were they put us. Not much of an ambiance. Pricing was reasonable. Food and drinks were tasty but nothing spectacular. Great location to walk around and explore after dining.

The service was efficient and friendly. Our food came pretty quickly, and it was some of the most delicious pasta and pizza we have tried! Definitely recommend it for a nice, relaxed lunch in an authentic atmosphere.

I walked in to this place since the review looks high in google and the price is decent considering the area. However, the waiter who served us is very rude and racist. He offered us to order bread and when I asked what kind of bread, his reply was “Of course Italian bread, no Asian bread here. Ciabatta”, with a smiley face and giddy tone. When I said I’m okay he also replied “Of course you are ok, I’m not a doctor”. I found that these comments are unnecessary and unprofessional. He quickly gathered the menu when I’ve just ordered one item, although we were planning to order more. I guess they were very busy, albeit some empty seats observed. I asked him for more water since they didn’t offer any, and he jokingly replied that it will take an hour. Upon seeing my frown, he said ok and quickly refilled the water. When I mentioned that an hour passed by quickly. He said “Of course that is how we do things here”. Boy am I glad that I didn’t live here then. I was dissatisfied with the service so we left less than 18% tips. The bill came out to be $95 and we gave them $100 bill. He was asking for 15% more. I thought tip was more of a courtesy and not an obligation? We added an extra $10 bill as per his request. The food was ok, but I guess the terrible service is the price we must pay for having an affordable Italian food amidst Rodeo Drive.

Came here for the second time to dine, really love the ambiance. The service staff is very polite, the coffee is fantastic, and the freshly baked pizza is excellent. I particularly enjoy the olive oil with Italian balsamic vinegar for the bread before the meal.

About 4-5 years since I was here.  The vibe completely off.  Food good but service and overall ambience lost or cold. Had to ask for water - not even offered it & bread used to be complimentary / when I queried it the reply was “oh that was pre-pandemic”.  That is just sad.   Read the play people -  the salmon portion for the extra $16 was insulting.   Arriverderci Il Fornaio.

name: Crustacean Restaurant Beverly Hills, CA - Brunch, Lunch & Fine Dining
address: 468 N Bedford Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews:
Crustacean Beverly Hills is a dining experience that never disappoints! From the moment you step in, you’re greeted by an elegant and inviting atmosphere that sets the tone for a fantastic meal.

The menu offers a stellar selection of dishes, and the An’s Famous Garlic Noodles are an absolute must-try. Every dish is prepared with care and precision, delivering fresh, vibrant flavors that keep you coming back for more. The seafood is always top-notch, and the warm, inviting service makes the meal even more enjoyable.
