The attention to detail from both the kitchen and the staff is evident, making each visit a memorable one. Whether you’re celebrating a special occasion or just indulging in a great meal, Crustacean continues to exceed expectations. I can’t recommend it enough!

We did the Dine LA. Great way to try this restaurant.  The courses were all good. Slow paced which I liked. Service was good throughout. I hear it looked nicer before the remodel. It was simply designed I thought.

We came for a birthday celebration. I hadn't been to this restaurant in years but the service was still impeccable and the food delicious.  It's a typical Beverly Hills restaurant so don't expect a lot of food for your dollars.  We were all still hungry after the 6 of us spent almost $900!! (Yes. $900!). But again, everything was great.  Drinks are tasty and unique but not very strong.  Vegan garlic noodles were delicious with the heart of palm crab cake and the beef.  Don't know if I'll be going back any time soon unless someone is treating me though.  The atmosphere is lovely especially with the open patio area.

Outrageously priced for terrible food, sorry to say. This beautiful restaurant that has been in business for over two decades and has good reviews by some, it was a failure in my opinion.
Loved the atmosphere (floor designed aquarium, beautiful color theme…). Tastefully designed setting, with great service. However that where the positive features end. The waiter was explaining various options on the menu, and one of them that caught our attention was, “multi generation secret recipe” part. Naturally, we decided to try this secret. The fried rice was bland devoid of any Asian spices, the noodles were lacking the flavor one would expect of any Asian dish. The fried eggplants were okay. The crab was definitely overrated. No soups on the menu (soup options are always good idea, especially when the weather is still cold). The vanilla ice cream was melting upon arrival and the coconut flavor was left out of the coconut ice cream. Not worth $750 for party of four.

My family, visiting Beverly Hills for the first time, sought an upscale and memorable brunch experience during a weekday. Making a reservation at this restaurant was a breeze, even during the busy lunch rush hour. The detail-oriented and brilliant five-star wait staff ensured our service was prompt, which we appreciated given the tight schedules of relatives working nearby. Several of us opted for the brunch specials, while I followed the host’s recommendation. The food was beautifully plated and met very high culinary standards, and I particularly enjoyed their coffee, a welcome treat before my 6-hour drive to the Bay Area. However, the brunch offerings didn't quite meet my expectations and seemed to pale in comparison to what I suspected might be available for lunch or dinner. Despite this, the beautiful atmosphere, friendly staff, and seamless service nearly made for a complete five-star experience. I’m quite sure I’d return to try their dinner menu—if I can manage to get a reservation!

name: Steak 48
address: 9680 Wilshire Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90212, USA
reviews: Love love love this place. I wanted to try one of everything and was so grateful to even have what I had. As we were ordering tempted, and you know, I was eating oysters, steak, appetizers, and popcorn ice cream don't let the price points scare you off because this place is worth every time you spend. All the food that I have posted was for only two of us and we ate every ounce of it.

As a local who works in the neighborhood, I love coming here for dinner with friends! It’s definitely our “Go-To” spot where everyone is happy with the food, the drinks & the service. Last night we were fortunate enough to have MICHELLE as our server. She truly IS A GEM!!!! I would probably be very sad if Michelle ever left because the pride she takes in providing excellent service is second to none. If you’re fortunate enough to get her, she will guide you through the menu to help you make the best decisions! Everyone else is good too, she just goes above & beyond!

It’s against my religion to NOT order:
-The Ribeye (ask them to slice it if you’re sharing with others). We usually opt for the heated plates as well. Can’t go ring with rare to medium rare. The dry aged is good too, same with the cap!
-The Corn Brûlée is crack in the best way (maybe not the best if you’re trying to avoid sugar & butter, but all things in moderation)! I don’t event want to try to make it at home. It’s torched to perfection.

Other staples that I really enjoy:
-Escargot
-Deviled Eggs
-Fried Lobster
-Seafood Tower (Lobster, Alaskan Crab Legs, Oysters, Stone Crab and the Shrimp Cocktail) all amazing!
-Beet Salad
-Shrimp Popcorn
-Brussels Sprouts with Bacon
-Sautéed Mushrooms

My absolute drink of choice is their dirty martini with 3 blue cheese stuffed olives!

Steak 48 in Beverly Hills, you've stolen my heart! From the moment I made the reservation, I knew we were in for a treat. The confirmation call was like a warm hug, setting the tone for an exceptional dining experience. And then, the pièce de résistance - the bread! Heavenly doesn't even begin to describe it. Our party of steak lovers was in awe, with each cut cooked to perfection. The sides? Generous enough to feed a small army (we shared, of course!). But what truly set Steak 48 apart was the service. Our server (sorry, name escapes me, but you know who you are!) was a rockstar! And the cherry on top? A post-dinner thank-you call! Talk about delightfully old-school charm. 10/10, would steak again (and again, and again...). Can't wait to try your other locations!

Michelle was excellent & thorough. She asked if it was our first visit to Steak 48. She provided an overview of the menu & shared with us her personal favorites.  The service here was off the chart. Will, the manager, came by our table to confirm if everything was okay. We were a party of 4, 3 of us ordered different steaks. All were cooked to order & tasted great.  For a starter, I recommend the wagyu beef tartare. It was exceptional.

Decided to try out this new steak house for my birthday! I’ve done Mastros I’ve done Ruth Cris, all of the ones in the area but this was a different amazing experience overall! From when I checked the hostess’s gave me a warm welcome. The ambient was very old money New York. I love that the bathrooms are single so you can take as many pictures as you want. From the complementary bread to the cocktails to the steak, everything was made to perfection. I forgot my servers name but he’s was amazing as well gave me a run down on the menu and guest favorites. Everyone was very sweet, that’s a big thing for me and everyone was so nice made my experience so much sweeter. For 1 person I paid 190. Mind you it is family style so the portions were on the the bigger side. The shrimp must try! The bone in is the way to go. I had the pomegranate martini and it had me feeling right! Amazing restaurant with great service and even better food. Thank you will definitely be back very soon (:

name: The Grill on the Alley
address: 9560 Dayton Way, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: I recently dined at this restaurant with my son. He ordered the 12-ounce New York steak, requesting it to be cooked medium. Unfortunately, it arrived rare and undercooked, with visible blood. The steak's taste was subpar, and the string fries were burnt and inedible. Although the ambience was beautiful and the service excellent, the food was a major letdown. This experience merits a 1 out of 10. The meal was extremely overpriced, and we will not be returning. If you want to enjoy your food, steer clear of this place.

Affluent type restaurant in downtown Beverly Hills. The food is a little pricey, though it is delicious 😋. The lambchops are phenomenal. There is valet parking, curbside parking (if you can find it), and a parking garage just past Rodeo Drive.

Best place to spend your night.
Top qualities food with best in class service ….
One of the best place on Beverly Hills …..
Seriously recommend to take your friends and family members to hangout ….

Even employees who works there are highly trained and professional . I will really appreciate their service and professionalism…

We stopped by here just on a whim and I’m so glad I did! Dan was absolutely fantastic and really made the whole experience. The food was amazing and they were able to cook the burger to my requirement! A*

Came here to celebrate our anniversary, ended dinner on a elated note. Everyone was super friendly here, even the other neighboring parties surrounding our table. We even witnessed a proposal. 🥳

The staff here is stellar. Super courteous, extremely helpful explaining, a different level of service.

The vibe is classy old school and the environment is warm. The price meets the quality standard without compromise.

The food and drinks are exactly how we expected. The coffee gelato dessert was extremely delicious.

You can park anywhere in the public structures around Rodeo Drive.

name: Ocean Prime
address: 9595 Wilshire Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90212, USA
reviews: First time in Beverly Hills, and this restaurant was the best! I love their staff. They were really courteous, professional and gave us the best service. I love the food! Specially the blackened salmon salad. My husband enjoy his Blackened Snapper that he said be was speechless. We really had a great time here.

This is my favorite place to come celebrate my birthday. The staff is wonderful the food is consistently delicious and the desserts are yum.
Will continue to come back here because they never disappoint.

Love this place! The place is a vibe and the staff is attentive and nice.
Got there pretty early. We didn't have a reservation so we sat the lounge area. It's was still Happy hour. There was a $10 drink menu do I had the Black Orchid. It was delicious!!
I got the ahi tuna and it was prepared perfectly. The creamed spinach was good also. I highly recommend.

My friends both got the steak and it was definitely to their liking. Their sides were the twice baked potato and jalapeno a
Potatoes. Seasoned nicely.
My Daughter took me to Ocean Prime for Brunch on father’s Day!  Food was Amazing! Atmosphere amazing and ambiance amazing!  10 out of 10. 5 Stars

I have been to other Ocean Prime locations and had a great meal during each of those visits, but I would say this Beverly Hills location is probably my favorite overall. The flavors were as great as I remembered and I just loved how upscale and well done the specific location is. Erik, our server, was absolutely fantastic and really made the meal a better one. Inside is especially large, open, and kept dark which is really nice because it felt like your conversation was more private. They really space out the tables so it didn’t feel like everyone was overlapping each other in terms of conversations. They don’t have a parking lot and street parking is quite hard to find in this part of town so your best option will be their valet for $15 or a nearby parking garage for $10.

One of my favorite things about Ocean Prime is their large and diverse menu. There is something for everyone here. I started off with the Lobster Bisque because it’s one of my favorite bisques that I have had at any restaurant. This one was as good as all the others. Next I followed up with the Steak Tartare, and it was fantastic. The soft crostini was a great vehicle for the tartare. For my entrée, I chose the Chilean Seabass and although I wish that portion of fish was a bit larger, it still was delicious. I especially liked the truffle vinaigrette on top. I was going to do the Warm Butter Cake that I’ve had in the past, but at this point in the meal I was just too full.

Overall a fantastic seafood and contemporary American restaurant in a beautiful part of town. It is a bit expensive, but it’s certainly worth it. I would recommend to anyone for any occasion.

name: 208 Rodeo
address: 208 N Rodeo Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: Fantastic good and service! Lots of options and types of food. Amazing way to present the Desserts Menu where the full plate with actual options was presented to select from…. Was difficult to say no to that! Highly recommended and we will definitely go back when on Rodeo Drive!

What a superb restaurant - if you are in or near Rodeo Dr., you must visit this place. Excellent in everything; location service and atmosphere.  Cannot say much about the food - we ordered calamari and shrimp, lobster spaghetti, and 208 burgers; all taste sooo delicious. I would say that the lobster 🦞 and spaghetti is my super favorite dish.

I will definitely come back again - I highly recommend.

We found this restaurant 209 Rodeo Restaurant during our shopping walk along Rodeo Drive. Despite the fact that we did not have a reservation, they found a free table for us. We sat outside on the terrace. We chose salmon with salad, hamburger and pasta from the menu. The service was helpful-a little forgetful, but we didn't wait long for the food. The food was delicious and the atmosphere pleasant. The surroundings of the restaurant were also very nice. More on Instagram @larmarluxury.

Parking: There is a parking garage on Rodeo and Dayton that provides quick access to the restaurant. After 6pm, you can park for a $10 fee. The walk from the garage to the restaurant is pleasant. Although it’s a short distance, you’ll walk by a number of the finest luxury designer boutiques.

Reservations: Reservations were not only easy to book, but available at short notice. There is no fee for lateness or cancellation. Upon arrival, I stated that I had a reservation, but I think I would’ve been seated just as quickly had I not.

Service: There was a waiter nearby at all times to assist us with our needs whether It be placing an order, refilling water, asking for the bill or directions to the bathroom. I think this also has to do with our seating, We sat directly outside the restaurant, therefore all waiters/waitresses , busboys and host needed to walk past us often. The outdoor fridge containing desserts and sparkling water was directly across from our table, making service quick.

Food: In this day and age, many restaurants are charging for bread and some are not even offering It at all. 208 Rodeo hasn’t abandoned the bread option, but does charge an extra $12 for truffle butter.

We ordered the 208 Burger. This includes a Wagyu blend, caramelized onion, sharp cheddar, truffle aioli, brioche bun, garlic fries. This fries were thinly sliced. The burger is filling and is enough to satisfy you if eating It alone.

I ordered a side of Truffle Mac and Cheese. The portion size was small and It lacked salt. Both the salt and Mac and Cheese were finished the next day as leftovers. Once adding a bit more salt to the Mac and Cheese, the taste improved dramatically.

My guest ordered the Lobster Mac and Cheese. This was toothsome, but why pay $36 for an appetizer lobster Mac and cheese, if you can have a half Maine lobster tail for six dollars less or a lobster spaghetti for $12 more.

Comfort: This restaurant offers indoor and outdoor seating. The outdoor seating allows you to enjoy dinner while watching the sunset. There are outdoor heaters provided that will absolutely keep you warm.

Overall, this is a beautiful restaurant. You have the option to eat indoor or outside. It’s pretty easy to snag a reservation here and the ease of parking makes It a much more accommodating experience. I would definitely recommend this place for a date night.

Excellent restaurant in the ♥️ of the Rodeo Drive, just next to the photo-spot No.1; which is very entertaining to watch 😎. The service is absolutely to and the food fantastic. We did have lobster 🦞 & Caesar’s Salat. We will be back for sure 🫶🏼😋; it’s on the rather costly side 💸 but definitely worth it!

name: The Terrace
address: 225 N Canon Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: Was not expecting this to deliver the way it did. Stunning space (we sat indoors for lunch). Our server was so lovely and kind. The food was great. Highly recommend the cannellini bean soup and the smoked trout salad. I also had the gnocchi and it was delicious but rich. However the portion was perfect for lunch. Fries (they ask if you want slim cut or thick!!) were perfect. Also, on the table they leave whole lemons and a knife so you can add citrus to your water! So LA! We were hotel guests but I would recommend for anyone. A stylish venue but not stuffy; very welcoming. They actual terrace is perfect for a warm day.
Our service was amazing; the food was delicious and beautifully presented. The drinks were fun and very good. We got there right in time to catch the live entertainment right on the patio.

We had a reservation and they honored it quickly. Location has a great view of a plaza and is green and lively and full of amazing flower and plant smells. Food is also good but nothing to rave about. Service is great. I had the burger with fries. Fries were really thin and small for my taste

They made a mistake and overcharged us by 54$. We paid and we left, then in 1 minute I realized that it is a lot and we went back. We were still in the lobby, near the entrance of the restaurant. When I asked May I get our receipt, they said , ohhh we know that we made a mistake and we overcharged you.
Excuse me, you knew about this mistake and you did not chase us to give us money back??? You knew it from the beginning. It is called stealing money. How could it be at such place?
Picture is as a proof that I visited you.

Went for brunch. The food was very plane but very overpriced. The service was absolutely awful, waited 15 min before someone came and gave us water and had to ask 5 times. And of course the included 20% tip automatically! Overall I will not be back!

name: Nua
address: 403 N Crescent Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: What a hidden gem!! Went there with my husband to celebrate our anniversary and had no expectations, and the experience was so great. The service was personal and attentive, delicious Mediterranean food with new twist and such a fun atmosphere. And even kosher meat/fish/poultry. Amazing patio and indoor spaces inside the Crescent hotel. Can’t wait to try their breakfast, brunch and lunch menus. Highly recommend to anyone who wants the triple set: service, food and atmosphere🙏🏼

Best mediterranean breakfast!! A must if you are in the area. A friend recommended me to check this place out on our trip. It did not disappoint. The food is so fresh and tasty. Wish I could come back one day.

We went there on our bikes and they don’t have a spot where you can park the bikes but the hotel next door did have a pole where we left our bikes while eating. It is Beverly Hills priced but we had a great time!

We ate hamburgers, the patties were very dry, it didn't appeal to me because I like them juicy and soft. The salad and fries were nice, the atmosphere was very nice, there were European influences. The service was fast and nice

I like this place because the outside patio has a lot of plants. I like the veggie options and overall it’s a good place for lunch. It’s walking distance from places. I went there three times. Service varied each time so I can’t give 5 stars.

Hands down our favorite Mediterranean spot! All our dishes were beyond delicious. We didn’t have a reservation on a Friday night but were able to find a cozy spot at the bar. Bartender Josh is the bomb! You have to order the hummus and chicken kabob.

name: Dante Beverly Hills
address: 225 N Canon Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews:
Our dining experience on 7/29 was mixed. The restaurant ambiance is wonderful. We had two servers due to some schedule transition. Our first one was great; our second one was pretty hands off. She also didn’t seem to know what was going on, asking us if we wanted to order dessert while we were waiting for our entrees to arrive.

Mare Misto: 5/5
Very crispy calamari and rock shrimp

Cannellini bean salad: 4/5
Pretty good but underseasoned

Pappardelle Al Ragu: 5/5
Delicious

Steak frites: 2/5
Overcooked; skimpy on the chimichurri, fries were crispy but not seasoned at all
For $78, we would expect the chef to be able to cook it to the correct temperature so this was a major disappointment. Since it took so long, we just ate it since we didn’t have time to have them remake it.

Non-alcoholic cosmojito: 2/5
This was mostly ice and not a good value for $15. It was maybe a couple ounces of cranberry juice and Perrier decorated with ice and mint leaves and citrus slices.

I had been to two locations in NYC before but was pleasantly surprised by this location in Beverly hills. We just walked in and were able to get a table on a Thursday. Very high class and amazing drinks as always. We love the Negroni. The calamari was okay. Overall my experience here is that it’s better for drinks. I have not tried many items though so I plan to do that next time I go. You will get an amazing view of the city too.

EDIT: MAY 2024 Dante invited me back to make this right, I appreciate that effort from their crew and it’s clear they took my feedback on board (see my new cauliflower pic) thank you Dante for being so responsive.

I’ve been to Dante a few times now, both in New York and Beverly Hills. For the BH location, I was last here Nov of 2023 for context and now Feb 2024 which is when this review was written.

First off, the cocktails are always delicious. The service team does an amazing job at making sure your drink experience is top notch, no matter what you order. And the ambiance is always pretty too, no matter the time of day you visit - with comfy booths/chairs and a wonderful view.

Now onto the food, which is the main reason for this review today. I am glad to see Dante offer so many vegan options (yay and thank you!) When I come, I normally order the cauliflower as my entree, which in the past has been delicious, filling and very flavorful. Tonight when I ordered this dish, it was a very different story. The portion was not only what felt like 1/3 of the size but also cold in the middle. (I am Including photos for reference of this difference in size). Yet, the price of this dish has not changed. I am just really taken aback at the vast difference in experience regarding this entree in the times I have ordered it.

For Dante’s level of service, prices and experience, I hope they can correct this for future guests who may want to order the cauliflower.

Did not disappoint. We came during lunch which is a different vibe entirely than evening service & drinks, but I was pleasantly surprised with the ambience, food, and service. It is on the 9th floor and across from the Maybourne Pool with a light food menu. Views over BH are great and I love the patio seating.

Our server Gabriel was lovely, polite, and attentive. I was celebrating my niece’s graduation and birthday, and he brought out adorable non-alcoholic minis which I genuinely appreciated. We got the Diavolo pizza and burrata as a little snack and it was good.

Lovely place, a little difficult to locate because it's located on the 9tb floor. Only street parking if you get lucky. The service was great, however I asked 3 people for a straw and they seem to forgot everytime I came to the table. Luckily a waiter filling my water made my straw wish come true finally! On the flip side they made my birthday very special and the place definitely has great welcoming vibes. I would definitely return again and recommend 👌🏾.

name: Via Alloro
address: 301 N Canon Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews:
Been coming here for years & it’s one of our families favorites 💚
Great drinks & perfect thin pizza!!!

BUT the salad we had last time left us VERY Unimpressed-
“SALUMIERE 21.50
CHOPPED ICEBERG LETTUCE, TOMATO, SHARP PROVOLONE CHEESE, GARBANZO BEANS, SALAMI, FRESH MOZZARELLA, BLACK OLIVES & VINEGAR SICILIAN OREGANO DRESSING”
We had to play seek & find to have any bites with Salami, they had about 5-8 tiny strips in the whole salad (see pictures)… how sad 😞
- I know what we won’t order there from now on.

Restaurant has ZERO regard for the importance of caution around allergies. Myself and another guest at my table, both specifically asked for “NO salami” and stated allergies. Yet both of our salads had salami. General manager, Armando, stated, “it’s only a couple pieces. We’re very busy. Are you a mother? Enjoy your Mother’s Day.” When I stated this is a health concern, he replied callously, “if anything happens to you let us now.” Our waiter, Guissepi, then stated “it’s ok.” To which I again reiterated “it’s not ok.” Suffice it to say, I did not eat anything after the salad was sent back as I can’t trust an establishment that has no regard for allergies.
Food was good, atmosphere was excellent, service was amazing, I tried fried calamari, squid ink risotto and margarita pizza.

I had a wonderful experience here both times I’ve been! The staff is always so nice and make you feel like you’re one of a kind. HIGHLY recommend the calamari appetizer. Will definitely be back and bring friends!
A very pleasant restaurant with excellent cuisine, a wide range of cocktails and friendly staff. For every recommendation.

name: THE Blvd Restaurant and Lounge
address: 9500 Wilshire Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90212, USA
reviews:
Amazing little spot
Our server David was such a gem- so so kind and nice!

Menu is wonderfully crafted and food was amazing

Iced latte was delicious!!

If you want to sit outside there is a minimum 50$ spend per person which is okay, as that is the general meal cost

Very Authentic Valentine's Time Meal Sets!  Everything is perfect to me.  I requested no salt and sauce on the side.  The server is so professional, he took good care of us.  When the sauce has no salt, he asked the chef place the sauce with the foods, if there is salt in sauce, then sauce on the side.  Even the sauce has no salt, it is still so delicious.  It is so amazing!  We will definitely come back in the future.

JAZZ IS NOT DEAD

Came here for my birthday last Sunday for brunch. From start to finish — the experience is elegant. Jeff was our waiter and said “fifth is the new 18.”

The photos explain the experience. Live jazz music, now wait, parking across the street is 2 hours free, I paid $5.

Food is excellent,  especially the burger with the marrow infused. The barbecue sauce was delicious and not really “ketchup like in consistency.” The dessert is amazing — whip cream is fresh (no fridge taste like another high end hotel I had been to in May on the east coast). I love the detail of the thinly rolled white chocolate dyed with raspberry juice shaped like a candle… cannot figure how the patisserie chef created that. Dessert reminds me of Patti Jinich’s James Beard Award Mexican recipe, except I never tasted hers. This was healthier abd beautiful. In one of the patisserie, there is some ice cream surrounded by fresh whipped cream.

Crouton on the Caesar salad was shredded to not overpower the pepitas. Dijon has turmeric, no white wine, therefore softer. Mayonnaise uses safflower oil and real eggs (I.e. soybean oil typically has a flavor).

Hot water served in a German (probably Boden) double-wall glass.

The take home coffee used a paper lid. I tested the cup two more consecutive days and it is sustainable, not coated with chemicals. All paper packaging that doesn’t soak through because of its texture.

On the way in or out, check out the stunning chandelier and bouquet of flowers. This is the hotel where “Pretty Woman” was filmed and I believe that the human-operated elevator still works.

They have the best desserts, lots of effort for minimal price… I’ll try to find the Mother’s Day dessert. Mikimoto next door — gorgeous store.

We had brunch here after our magical birthday dinner at cut lounge the night before. I had the salmon Benedict and my darling husband had the huevos rancheros burrito. Of course the mimosas and bloody Mary’s were flowing lol and our waiter at the bar was Pepe who had been there 36 years and was the most attentive and best bartender ever. Needless to say ~ best service ever ~ best room ~ and best brunch ever 💃🏿🎉💗😍

‏Excellent service, and I enjoyed my time there. The cappuccino was great, and the sweet were even better, with wonderfully blended flavors. The total was around $30.
( The name of the sweet is sunflower )

name: BOA Steakhouse
address: 9200 Sunset Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
reviews: Going to Boa was an amazing experience. We had the most lovely waiter, Shaw. The caesar salad was made in front of us and was delicious. The steak flight was three different 2 oz pieces of Japanese A5 wagyu. Each were delicious and overall the best steak I ever had. One of the steaks were only made 1 cow at a time and the restaurant needed a special certificate to carry it. The mac and cheese was also amazing and cheesy and buttery. Overall it was an amazing and delicious meal.

Andre, Trinity, Du’a and Jonathan who made and shared the history on how Ceasar’s salads came to be set the bar for restaurants in LA. Amazing, amazing, amazing. Great energy great vibration a wonderful place to celebrate an anniversary or birthday or just to come be made us feel like we bought the place out. WE were served by kind people and that matters when you go out. The staff cares and you feel it at least we did. Thank you to the entire staff for making our anniversary an extra special celebration. If you’re ever in Hollywood go to BOA Steakhouse and tell them The Garrett’s sent you. Ask for Andre and enjoy the rest of your life.
Love,
The Garrett’s

Exquisite! Great food, excellent service, and immaculate optics! From arrival to the venue to departure, the collective hosting, service and management team were a class act! Highly commended for ambience, quality of food, service and experience. James was a delight and was knowledgable on menu offerings, neighborhood experiences and intriguing to learn from! Robert and Joel, in management displayed excellent consumer touch points, and I highly commend BOA!

Highly recommend !  Had my bday celebration and the experience was immaculate. From the manager greeting then checking in multiple times, to the incredible dishes.  Seafood was super fresh.  Perfect place to celebrate a birthday. Thank you for having us !

Ribeye steak, Chef's cone(caviar), Goat cheese
All were incredibly good. I highly recommend Black truffles cauliflower gnocchi for the side.

name: Honor Bar
address: 122 S Beverly Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90212, USA
reviews:
Very nice place in Beverly Hills. My girlfriend brought me here to try their signature chicken sandwich that was very good but even if it’s signature I would melt the cheese..no way that you put cold cheese in a sandwich. Fries were very good and the margaritas were amazing!
If you are not a big eater share the sandwich because it’s huge!
Considering the location they should take care the ventilation system because it’s not nice going out smelling by food so much.
Overall great typical place that I recommend to everyone in the area

The Honor Bar is very famous around Los Angeles, especially on social media. It’s in a beautiful part of town, Beverly Hills, and it’s designed really well on the inside. It’s dark, but lit enough so you can read the menu but not see every single detail around you. I’m a huge fan of mood lighting, so was a big fan immediately when I walked in. Similar to a darker East Coast steakhouse. Directly next-door to South Beverly Grill, they both share a parking lot and offer valet for $20, but we were able to find street parking a block away, even though it was metered. As the name implies it is a bar, however, they also have table seating, and not only do they have great drinks, but they are known for their great food, especially their crispy chicken sandwich. We made last-minute reservations the morning of the day we wanted to stop in and we were able to be seated right when we arrived for a 7 PM Wednesday night dinner. The hostess was very polite and we were seated at one of the high top tables immediately after entering. It was pretty crowded on the inside, but not too loud. They also have another location in Montecito, which I plan to try next time I am up there.

Honor bar is especially known for their Dings Crispy Chicken Sandwich so we had to order one. It’s a very large portion, so would be easy for two people to split it. I thought it was truly fantastic and worth its reputation. I think it would be even better if there was an avocado smash included but still I enjoyed it very much. They’re also well known for their burger which I plan to try next time. We ordered the Kale Salad to start and it was good although nothing out of the ordinary so I would recommend skipping that. They also have a very large sushi menu, which is a great option. We split the Rainbow Roll and it was great. The seafood was very fresh and everything was prepared perfectly.

Overall pricing is pretty fair, especially given where it’s located. The food and drink quality is great and the service is super fast. I can definitely see why it has the reputation it does and I plan to be back in the future.

Tried their burgers and crispy
The burger was flavored with Barbecue spices the thing that we didn’t like
As to the crispy chicken it was good
Service was good

Great vibe. Delicious burgers (honor, chicken > carnitas). High quality fresh baked bun. Good portion size. Tabbouleh salad is 👌🏻

Update: I’ve been coming here for over 5 years and the quality is still the same. The best burger in town, easily. Perfect intimate date spot too. The fries are a must, we usually order 2.

The Thai Crunch Roll is a heavenly combination that I’ve never experienced before. Recommend highly

Great place.  Went because of the reviews of the chicken sando and burger……so I got one of each.  They were both delicious, but the winner is………the crispy chicken sandwich.   It was really good and not over hyped.  Also had a Negroni that delicious.  The bartender/waiter was awesome.  Cool place.

name: GRANVILLE
address: 8701 Beverly Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90048, USA
reviews:
Service was ok nothing special but nothing bad as well.

The inside is just a typical restaurant, nothing special.

I had a burger which was very good.

However my husband had a pork steak with spinach on the side.
He got food poisoning and fell extremely unwell the moment I got back home. It must have been the spinach because I we shared everything else and I didn’t have any problems at all. Probably the spinach/ salad was not washed properly. Overall below average experience!
The waiters were polite and friendly though.

First of all, the best part about our experience today was our server, Lindsay, and that's saying a lot because our food was delicious, too!

Lindsay is a pro. I was a server for years so am naturally more sensitive to good and bad service. Lindsay is one of the best servers I've ever experienced. She's so welcoming and warm, she's knowledgeable about the menu and proactive about helping you choose the right dish, and she's attentive throughout the meal. She has a great attitude and best of all--she's clearly just being herself! What a gem.

I always love the Granville Salad. It's consistently well seasoned and perfectly dressed.

I also had vanilla ice cream and it was INCREDIBLE!

We'll be back soon and obviously requesting Lindsay.

Ideally, I'd give it a 3.5/5.

Granville in West Hollywood offers a beautiful dining experience. The indoor space is bright and airy, with skylights and plenty of plants creating a cheerful atmosphere. There's a central bar that adds a touch of energy, and the option for outdoor seating is a plus.

Unfortunately, the service wasn't quite up to par with the ambiance. Our server seemed a little frustrated and even rolled her eyes when we asked questions about the menu.  Having both breakfast and brunch menus to navigate was a bit overwhelming, so some clarification would have been helpful.

The good news is that the food arrived quickly. We tried the village scramble, skirt steak and eggs, french toast, chai latte, and berry lemonade. The lemonade was a miss - way too sour and unbalanced. The chai latte was just okay.

On a brighter note, both the village scramble and skirt steak came with delicious roasted potatoes (both sweet and regular), which were perfectly cooked. The sausage in the scramble had a nice kick, and the skirt steak was cooked to a perfect medium, though the portion size was a bit on the small side.

The french toast was decent, but nothing special. The butter that came with it was good.

Overall, Granville has a lovely atmosphere and some good food options. However, the service needs some improvement, and a couple of dishes fell short.

The food is so tasty. We will definitely be returning. The server and other staff were very friendly and helpful. Loved the vibe of the restaurant and the portion sizes of each dish was very good. We left satisfied and had a little left over. I would recommend to everyone to try this place at least once!

We decided to Eat before heading to the Hollywood Bowl concert( first time we usually take food) I used YELP to search for in b/t home & shuttle YELP hasn't failed me yet! Lol! What a Fantastic dining experience! First the Outsofe is Very Cute & Contemporary! The decor inside also has a Cool Vibe. There is seating outside & the inside is larger than I expected. The Hostess was great and we were seated quickly( had reservation since it was a TSunday around 5)
Our Server was Fantastic! She was attentive, Friendly , & Helpful with our choices. From the reviews we shared the Trio of tacos( Jackfruit, steak & shrimp) Perfect shareable appetizer! Delicious!
Hubby loves a good burger & this didn't disappoint! It was juicy& good Bun! The fries were jist crispy enough! My Porkchop ( one if my favorite meals to order at a new restaurant) was cooked to perfection! I was pleasantly full. With that said OFCOURSE THERE IS ALWAYS ROOM FOR DESSERT! So, brueleed banana brownie!! YUMM! OH..and the Drinks were Excellent! Very Good Dining Experiencel

name: Cantina Frida
address: 252 N Beverly Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: Extremely flavorful tacos! Super fresh and delicious every time. 3-5 of these bad boys will have you thinking about Cantina Frida for the rest of the afternoon. Excellent guacamole too, some of the best we’ve had. Always fast & friendly service and a great atmosphere inside too. Fairly priced for the area. Give Cantina Frida a try!

We were visiting Beverly Hills and went to Rodeo Dr. I wanted soup & we found this restaurant with chicken and rice soup. My wife had chicken taco and Berry margarita. We sat on inside by the outside open window area. The soup was a really big bowl, shredded chicken, flavorful and hearty! The chicken taco was bigger than expected and she enjoyed it!! The Berry margarita fruit wasn’t sweet and was okay, not great. Our table did not have place seatings & after food delivered my wife went to another table to get napkins. The server was friendly. The kitchen was on the side of dining room behind glass panels we thought was interesting. The restrooms were upstairs and not ADA friendly that we saw other alternatives.

Chic Beverly Hills vibes? Check!

Upscale and well decorated restaurant in heart of the action. One of the few Mexican spots

Tacos were good but they’re not your classic ‘LA tacos’. But the fish taco held its own

The sopa de tortilla was surprisingly decadent. Huge bowl of crispy tortilla crisps, avocado and firm cheese.. server pours piping hot sopa right on at the table. Delicious!

Service was outstanding

Beautiful place with seating inside and outside, a big bar and attentive waiters.
We only ordered quick appetizers and even that was so delicious and fresh. The drinks were strong and tasty. I definitely will be back for a full meal!

The vibes & staff of Cantina Frida are great. Fast and friendly service, solid location in Beverly Hills & can be good for celebrations or date nights.

Food is basic for Mexican/Tex Mex - we ordered quite a few dishes and all were average. Food is above average priced and drink prices are standard for LA ($15-20 per drink). Drinks are strong so that’s a plus. Restaurant can get very loud/hard to hear the people at your own table.

Would give a 4 on the vibes, decor, service, and drinks. Food is a 2-3.

name: Gucci Osteria da Massimo Bottura
address: 347 N Rodeo Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: Nothing bad to say about this experience everything was delicious and well balanced. Everything was prepared so stunningly and with such elegance. It is expensive but well worth it. Drinks were so good and inventive. We ended up getting two desserts as well. Great experience and the restaurant itself is stunning. Our waiter was attentive and took great care to explain everything well. The tortellini was stand out!

Absolutely fabulous!! My sister and I were visiting LA and we pretty much booked lunch at Gucci when we booked our plane tickets! That was how excited we were to go. And wow, wow, wow, what an experience.
The service is impeccable - friendly, professional and so knowledgeable about each dish and the ingredients.
The food is stunning - looks gorgeous and is really good. The plates are meant to be shared which is great as we sampled a variety of dishes. The risotto was sublime, rich flavours and based on the tastes of a traditional pizza Neapolitan. The tomato tartine looked like artwork and tasted just as good. The fish was also a start. Every dish was meticulously presented and explained by the servers.
The setting is very ‘Gucci Garden’ with rich florals and prints - stunning.
This is a restaurant to be enjoyed for special occasions for sure and it’s worth it.

Gucci Osteria in Beverly Hills offers a brunch experience that is nothing short of extraordinary. Helmed by renowned Michelin-starred chef Massimo Bottura, this restaurant seamlessly combines the world of high fashion with culinary excellence, making it a must-visit destination for food lovers and style enthusiasts alike.

From the moment you step into Gucci Osteria, you’re enveloped in an atmosphere of elegance and sophistication. The restaurant’s chic decor, featuring Gucci’s signature touches, creates a luxurious ambiance that perfectly complements the exquisite cuisine. The friendly and attentive staff add to the welcoming vibe, our server Matthew, made us feel right at home.

The brunch course at Gucci Osteria is a masterful blend of traditional Italian flavors and modern culinary innovation, each dish meticulously crafted to deliver both visual appeal and exquisite taste.

Selection of Freshly Baked Bread and Pastries
The meal begins with a delightful assortment of freshly baked bread and pastries, accompanied by an array of sweet and savory spreads. The quality of the bread and the creativity of the spreads set the tone for the rest of the meal.

Cured Fish and Meat
Following the bread and pastries, the selection of cured fish and meat showcases the finest ingredients, prepared with precision. Each bite offers a burst of flavor, perfectly paired with the accompanying Domaine Terrebrune 2021 Bandol and Cantina Privata - Domaine Ott ‘Etoile’ 2021 wines.

Eggs and Eggs
This innovative dish features eggs prepared in multiple ways, enhanced by a bacon crunch and potato foam. The addition of Imperial caviar elevates the dish, providing a luxurious touch that pairs beautifully with the Ca’ del Bosco, Franciacorta, and Cantina Privata - Krug Grand Cuvee MV, Champagne.

Aromatica
A refreshing interlude, the Aromatica salad features organic greens from the farmer’s market, balsamico, and flax seeds. This light and flavorful dish is a testament to the restaurant’s commitment to fresh, locally sourced ingredients.

Le Crespelle di Mamma Dani
The spinach-filled crepe, bechamel, crispy pancetta, and sage combine to create a rich and satisfying dish that highlights traditional Italian flavors with a modern twist.

Holy Crab!
A standout dish, the Holy Crab! features russet potato cartouche, spider crab, and smoked trout roe. The flavors are perfectly balanced, offering a unique and indulgent taste experience.

Crispy Enoki Mushroom
Served with seaweed aioli and bubu arare, the Crispy Enoki Mushroom dish is a delightful fusion of textures and flavors, providing a crispy, umami-rich bite.

Mini Me & French Fries
This dish combines cotechino, ribeye, salsa verde, and balsamic mayo, served with crispy French fries.

Monte Bianco Pavlova
For dessert, the Monte Bianco Pavlova features merengue, chestnut, rum, and chocolate, offering a light yet indulgent finish to the meal.

Gucci Cornetto
The Gucci Cornetto, with gelato alla crema and K&K raisins, is a sweet and creamy delight that perfectly captures the essence of Italian pastries.

Honey Yogurt
The Honey Yogurt with cardamom granola and fresh berries is a refreshing and healthy option that adds a nice balance to the dessert selection.

Modena Cheese Tart
The Modena Cheese Tart, made with Parmigiano Reggiano curd, is a savory treat that rounds out the meal beautifully.

The restaurant is conveniently located within the Gucci store, allowing you to blend a luxurious shopping experience with your culinary adventure.

Gucci Osteria is more than just a restaurant; it’s a celebration of art, fashion, and gastronomy. Whether you’re a food enthusiast, a fashion lover, or simply looking for a luxurious brunch experience, Gucci Osteria offers an unparalleled journey into the world of haute cuisine. Highly recommended for anyone seeking to indulge in a brunch that’s both exquisite and unforgettable.

Beautiful spot!

I love restaurants that not only have tasty food but also feature beautiful decor + plating. I also appreciate it when chefs & servers go through the details of the dishes you order. Makes you understand + enjoy the food even more. Great spot if you're looking for pretty views & good food.

The people on here complaining and giving one star, don’t exist. There is no way that if you appreciate great food and service that you would be dissatisfied. The place is really pricey as a Michelin restaurant would be in the arguably the most expensive street in the world, with a luxurious brand and tier to the chef of the number one restaurant in the world. Speaking of which, I had the tortellini and the Emilia Burger as they are the two Massimo classics in the menu.. bread basket and dessert were amazing as was the service. The burger was delicious and the tortellini was elegant and had a big flavour. I don’t think I would have to go back again but I certainly enjoyed my visit.

name: The Belvedere
address: 9882 S Santa Monica Blvd Ground Floor, Beverly Hills, CA 90212, USA
reviews:
We had brunch. The waiter brought 2different types of Champagnes and I chose the sweet one. He only explained about $60 free flow so I assumed it was $18 for a glass because Champagne on the menu was $18.

However they charged $40 for a glass of Champagne. I asked the waiter why it was $40 not $18. He just answered it was $40 without no further explanation.

As a tourist, I definitely feel like got ripped off. They would better train their waiters in better way as professional.

A lovely evening of fine, fresh, dining on fascinating recipes by an obviously caring chef.  Service is not to be mistaken as poor but what a traditional dining experience should be: un-rushed, uninterrupted evenings with friends infused by light, occasional inquiries as well as presentation of each dish.  The setting is tasteful, a small mix of art and interior design with most comfortable and intimate seating which does not scream out “dress code please” but is most certainly enhanced by harkening your dress code back to a time when meals out were occasions to dress and “show” up.  Do not be intimidated by a French menu or the seemingly inaccessible.   The wait staff and even the chef himself are likely to make you feel sincerely appreciated and help you find menu items which will allow you to taste something so great and so unexpected that no worry should keep you away.  Make this your special occasion and you can certain it will be unforgettable.
We had brunch at this place for my sister’s birthday. The food was ok but ridiculously over priced!!

What a pretentious condescending
Manager. They tell me they run out one of the stars of the meal. The corn bread. So they bring me dinner rolls. What is a thanksgiving dinner without cornbread. What’s worse is everyone received theirs but me. It was 7pm. Middle of dinner service. And they run out?? Makes no sense then the manager says I’ll give you 20% off your meal. As if I needed the discount. I want there to pay 250+ for dinner per person and you think I worried about a discount. What a joke. What’s worse the. Rolls they brought me weren’t even really good outstanding. I left the restaurant. Don’t need a condescending restaurant manager who can’t control his kitchen. How can I trust the food when they can’t even do the basics.  175.00 for thanksgiving dinner plus drinks. Wine and tip. Your way over 250.00. What a major disappointment will never go back to restaurant or hotel ever again.

We were greeted promptly, the manager was excellent.  I am giving this restaurant 4-star instead of 5 because we had a waiter with an attitude.  It took him a while to serve us, additionally, we were relocated to a different table.  I was surprised to see that he wanted to serve me coffee that had been on my previous table for over 10 minutes.  When I asked him to bring a fresh cup of coffee, he wasn't happy about it.

Nevertheless, he was replaced with a waitress called Ruby.  She was excellent, very friendly, approachable, and great customer service.  Food and ambiance are far below average for a hotel of this caliber. With a few improvements to the menu, food quality, and environment, this could be a great spot!

name: Spice Affair
address: 50 N La Cienega Blvd #120, Beverly Hills, CA 90211, USA
reviews:
We dined at Spice Affair in Los Angeles with a party of four, hoping for an exceptional Indian cuisine experience. Unfortunately, the visit was a mixed bag.
We started with the Dahi Kabab, which was underwhelming and lacked the expected flavor and creaminess. For the main course, we had Dal Makhani and Karahi Paneer. The Dal Makhani was just average, neither disappointing nor impressive. The Karahi Paneer fared better, offering balanced flavors and well-cooked paneer, making it a decent choice.
The meal's highlight was the Gulab Jamun, which was deliciously sweet and spongy, providing a satisfying end to our dinner. However, the overall food quality did not justify the high prices. The restaurant is a bit overpriced for what it offers, especially considering the average quality of most dishes.
The ambience at Spice Affair is good, with a touch of elegance that makes for a pleasant dining environment. However, it falls short of being truly up-market. Despite the mediocre food, the staff were excellent—prompt, polite, and attentive, enhancing our dining experience.
In summary, the place offers a pleasant atmosphere and great service, but the food quality and high prices are disappointing. If you do visit, the Gulab Jamun is worth trying, but overall, the experience may not meet the expectations set by the pricing.

Spice Affair has set a new standard for Indian food in LA. I tried several dishes and they were all exceptional and delicious (my favorite was the butter chicken and lamb). The atmosphere is beautiful and comfortable, with attentive, knowledgeable and gracious service. I look forward to returning again soon!

Butter chicken IS TO DIE FOR, I haven’t had any better. We also got the saag paneer, two appetizers, garlic naan, and lamb vindaloo. The service was amazing!! They make sure you love your food and give awesome recommendations. This is my favorite Indian place so far!! We will definitely be coming back!
I have to give this restaurant 5 stars. It is a beautiful decorated with wonderful food and impeccable service......If you want the perfect spot for date night....this is the place.
Great Indian food. We have been there a few times and each time has the same great taste.

name: Culina Ristorante and Caffè
address: 300 S Doheny Dr, Los Angeles, CA 90048, USA
reviews:
This was such a fantastic meal and service! First of all, hats off to our waitress Sonya and beverage/wine manager Alfredo for their exemplary in-depth and friendly service, knowledge, and passion for their food and wine!

As for the food, this was quite a Italian culinary adventure. The food at Culina was some of the tastiest and unique Italian cuisine I've had in Los Angeles.

For appetizer we had the Focaccia Al Rosmarino, Carciofi Fritti (Fried Artichoke), and Polpette Al Sugo (Wagyu meatballs).

The Focaccia was a delicious way to start with its Tris di Salse ('nduja Calabrese, tomato-basil chutney, and sundried tomato tapenade). There's a lot going on here with each "salsa" that gives variety in a delicious way.

The Polpette Al Sugo (Wagyu meatballs) is very savory can easily be a centerpiece of a delicious pasta by itself.

Unfortunately I had the Carciofi Fritti as my last appetizer and of the three it was the most ordinary. It's not that bad, it's just not as remarkable after having the other two delicious appetizers.

As for the main course, I've had the pasta Crested di Gallo e Salsiccia, and it was one of the best pastas I've had. A lot of flavor that are distinct and works very well together. The sauce is white wine that is light. Each ingredient (fennel sausage, broccolini, mollica di pane, Calabrian chili, and parmesan) works like individual instruments in a symphony. The fennel sausage is the meaty base of the flavor, the  broccolini adds the herbal flavor, the mollica di pane or bread crumbs adds crunchy texture, the calabrian chili adds a hint of spiciness and excitement, and the parmesan tops it off with its cheesy salty goodness.

The wine paired was Lato Sud, a red wine with an unforgettable delicious taste that starts a little bit smoky and spicy and ends in a slightly sweet and mellow after taste. Each sip is a delightful surprise.

Finally for dessert, we had Tiramisu and Cannolo al Tavolo (fried cannoli). The Tiramisu had the most consistent texture and consistency I've had with Tiramisu with its thick but light mascarpone mousse that makes you want to close your eyes and savor each bite, while the cannoli was a tasty crunchy dessert that is both playful and a real delight to eat.

Long story short, everything except the fried artichoke was delicious and highly recommended. Compliments to the chefs and the staff, this was a five-star dinner!
Flavorful rendition of coastal Italian with extremely friendly and attentive staff at dinner and nice arbor seating.  Seasonal menu but the staples are done very well

Stayed at the Four Seasons and tried their restaurant, Culina, out. Top notch service that you'd expect at the Four Seasons, with extensive wine knowledge by our dinner servers, Joe and Kristoff, and the dedicated support staff. The menu offerings and recommendations were delicious for both breakfast and dinner.

The decor is top notch, and the space offerings your choice of ambience are tastefully defined. Indoor dining room was bold and spacious. The al fresco options elevate the experience. Lush, tranquil, and inviting.

Isadore Sharp would be proud of this establishment. Totally recommend!

I went for a work dinner. Excellent service. Fabulous food. I want to give a shout out to our lead server, Sonya. She really took care of our table. When I asked about amaro, she was able to provide an explanation of the flavor profiles and then provided me a tasting flight of 3 amari so I could appreciate the differences.

I had a great dinner here and thought it was amazing. The ambiance is very beautiful and service is excellent. The menu also has some items that can be made vegan, I tried the tomato soup from the in-room dining menu. Menu, I tried the focaccia, and they made me a pasta. That was excellent. The sun's there by the glass is to die for.

name: Gourmando
address: 107 S Robertson Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90211, USA
reviews:
Beautiful Location and very delicious food but it just took too long to get it served at our table. They apologized mentioning that our order was at the end of the list but we noticed that other people that arrived after us were being served before us.

Not sure what happened but I must admit that my burger was very delicious.

Savory & Succulent!
This farm fresh cuisine is as mouth watering as it is delectible.
My visit was on a weekday afternoon(not their busiest) late lunch hours. The specials lent themselves to my appetite and were exquisitely great recommendations from the staff. I highly recommend this place for their quality of food, but they also have a great selection of drinks & wine, as well as catering service. Cheers!

Our Favorite Restaurant! Love Chef Isaac & His Wife Manager Chancey!
The rest of the staff are equally Friendly & Helpful! We & everyone are always treated like Family!
Very Nice contemporary Decor! We enjoy the creative Menu!
The Ceviche, Grilled Pork chops, burgers, steak, & Truffle fries are my faves! Go!

Went here for Dine LA last night and was excited because it was my first Dine LA experience. My gf said last time she was here the food was great and it was worth coming back to for Dine LA. We had reservations and we were seated upon arrival. Everything was great so far, our waiter was very nice. Found it odd they were out of the duck confit, in the first hour of dinner service.
Drinks:

Chef special cocktail (bourbon and absinthe mix) it was ok
Banshee Pinot Noir (a bit fruity, slightly dry, and smooth)

For appetizers we ordered:
Grilled Spanish Octopus (pretty tasty would recommend)
Chile con Queso Truffle Mac (also another tasty option, truffle oil was very light)
Roasted Butternut Squash Soup (great soup, loved how the pepper and spices cut the natural sweetness of the butternut squash a bit)

Entree:
Wild Pacific Shrimp ala Plancha (tasted good but was Abit salty)
14oz Angus Ribeye Steak Frites (steak was tasty and fries were nice and crispy. I've had better steaks but this wasn't bad)

Dessert:
Chocolate Ganache Tart (yummy)

Reason for 2 stars:

Appetizers  took quite a while to come out, 35-40mins. Entrees took about an hour to come out. Our ribeye was sent to a different table and had to cook another one. The shrimp came out but was missing a portion of the entree (crispy paella rice which imo was integral for giving contrast in texture) we had to ask our waiter why it was missing a part of the entree. Food overall was good, but waiting for about 40mins minutes for appetizers and a little over an hour for our entrees sucked to the point I wasn't even hungry or had the appetite to even eat half my entree. Our waiter comped our drinks which was a nice gesture, but most likely will not return.

Note: no picture of rib eye steak frites because I was IDGAF at that point to almost not care anymore.

I genuinely loved this cute spot 💞 found it at random and I got their lunch special ! 1. Soup of the day 2. Salad 3. Pick your entree and 4. Drink  for $25. Our server Chanci (I don't know how to spell her name) was so funny and attentive! I will definitely come back for Happy hour !

name: Viviane Restaurant
address: 9400 W Olympic Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90212, USA
reviews: We had the chips and guacamole, French toast and breakfast burrito. It was good. We sat by the pool. Nice and cozy setting.

Enjoyed the atmosphere a lot was sat outside around a pool. Do that were a bunch of little kids inside the pool playing it was nice to be outside. Only problem or issue I would say was the extremely over price drinks. They were using relatively cheap liquor but charging exorbitant prices. Food was good

Tucked in the Avalone hotel in a quiet residential neighborhood. The waiter elevated the experience by 100%. He was full of joy and super attentive. Dining options inside or outside around the pool…well edited menu, finished with the warm cookies- dessert was the best.

The ambiance is nice, not too loud and not too crowded. Food is decent, but i was expecting more for a place like this. Cocktails weren't really up to par with the environment as well. If you're not looking for fancy fancy but just a nice place to have a bite, that might check the boxes.

Dined here while staying at the Avalon Beverly Hills - arrived late and did not want to go looking around for dinner. Service was good, ate outdoor next to the pool and heater was on. Had the clams linguine which was fine but portion was small and it was pricey. Very nice ambiance.

name: Blasteran
address: 272 S La Cienega Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90211, USA
reviews: From the moment we walked in the service was a notch above the rest. They were brightening my day, one joke at a time. I ordered the Blasteran Burger and was slightly disappointed. It was $27 and about a 6/10. The fries on the other hand were something to write home about! The garlic parmesan fries were likely the best fries I've ever tasted. My mother ordered the fish plate and said it was "tasty". We ordered the French Toast for dessert it was very soft and very good. I would definitely recommend it!

The food was fantastic!  The Blasteran Burger with Truffle Fries:  both were cooked perfectly and full of flavor.  The Garlic Noodles with added shrimp were super good.  The shrimp were butterflied and grilled perfectly.  So much flavor.  To top it all off, the staff was super friendly and attentive.

This was my second visit.  The first time around I had the Pork Belly Bao which were amazing!

Deliciously prepared plant-based burger, likely one of the best I’ve enjoyed in LA. The bun to burger ratio was on point. The herbivore was filled with avocado, red onions, lettuce, tomato , vegan cheese, arugula, and cashew remoulade. Mouth-watering goodness. The mixed green salad had crispy lettuce, cherry tomatoes, finely shredded carrots, and a bright refreshing dressing. The only reason I didn’t give this five stars is due to the price of the burger ($28 for the burger only). Adding the mixed green salad was an additional $5. Had I chosen fries it would have been an additional $7+. Food was delicious no doubt, but pricey for a burger. Nice atmosphere and friendly servers. Metered parking available, no valet.

I personally feel like the best wagyu burgers in town are here at Blasteran. Been coming here for years to get my burger fix and their wagyu burgers always live up to my cravings. The truffle mac and cheese is also delicious but on the heavier side. These are pricier so I like to come here for special occasions. Street parking in a popular area. Garlic parm fries are also a delicious side but I like the burgers best.

Wow! I can't even begin to describe how amazing that meal was! It was absolutely incredible! The flavors were out of this world! The tomato soup and steak sandwich together created a burst of flavors that I will never forget. Honestly, it was one of the best meals I've ever had in my life!

name: Piccolo Paradiso
address: 150 S Beverly Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90212, USA
reviews:
The atmosphere was great! The food was bland and came out semi warm. The server was nice and very informative. The drinks were strong and good. I had the mussels which was an appetizer. We asked for extra spicy and the broth was good.
The lobster pasta wasn't that great. It was bland and was definitely missing something.
If you looking for a place with a nice vibe this is it but the food isn't that great.

I walked by this restaurant so many times but I never had any food here before. It seemed like one of those neighborhood’s favorite place and I’m so glad I tried it. More than anything, SPAGHETTI NATALE was amazing. It was so simple but packed with flavors and spaghetti was cooked perfectly. It was on the expensive side since the fish was $58, but pasta prices are not like that and I think I will go back a lot more for that pasta alone. It is definitely a classic old school italian place with great service.

We we're trying to get on a diferent restaurant and ended up at Piccolo Paradiso. Best choice on all. Food, service and ambiance. Francesco - our server - was remarkable. Definitely a comeback at Beverly Hills!
The food was great! The lasagna I got was amazing! Service was definitely a bit slow, but they were nice! The atmosphere was lively and great! Definitely would come here again.
The food was amazing and very flexible with ordering. The restaurant had a lot of vegetarian options. Portion size was adequate.

name: Café Amici Beverly Hills
address: 469 N Doheny Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: Superb food and service in a down to earth atmosphere. Simone provided awesome service and was very accomodating.

When I and my party arrived we were seated promptly and given menus + water in short order. We ordered within 10-15 minutes of being seated, but had to order both our appetizer and entrees in one go. The service was pretty fast and the wait staff seemed to be in good spirits. We received our entree which was a margherita pizza (which I unfortunately didn’t take a picture of) and it was pretty good a solid 3/5 in the flavor department. As for the entrees:

Chicken and mashed potato with lemon and capers:
This actually tasted quite nice, but the piece of chicken and overall portion was so small for a dish of that price. 4/5

Lasagna:
The lasagna came out piping hot and was promptly devoured because it tasted so good! A bit heavy on the salt, but no complaints beyond that! 5/5

Bolognese:
Really good portion size, bolognese sauce was full of flavor! 5/5

Risotto al funghi:
Probably the largest portion size of any item my party ordered, but this had no flavor. It’s as if the salt and seasonings were used on all the previous dishes and nothing was leftover for this. 1/5

The food overall was really good, the service fast, and despite the prices being so expensive we ended up paying less than $200 for our 4 entrees and pizza. Thanks for the meal!

Ok these pics didn't do it justice cuz we're all hangry and had 0 patience

cozy Italian place to dine in and we're happy to find some place like this in BH. Super satisfied with the food, staffs, and romantic ambience!
Looove this place! The food was delicious (delizioso!) and we really enjoyed the breeze and atmosphere on the back patio at the historic hotel. Our server, Simone, was absolutely amazing.

This hidden gem is one of my favorite Italian resturaunts. The burata and spaghetti arbiatta never disappoint ! The selection of the wine is really great as well. And don't forget the desert my fav is the cannoli ! The service is even better , Yelena is one of the servers and she is so sweet and personable ! Thank you Yelena for always a good time :)

name: Maude
address: 212 S Beverly Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90212, USA
reviews: We loved our Maude experience. The dishes were so well presented, flavorful, interesting and ultimately filling. The small format boutique setting was wonderful and we felt we had all the attention in the world, yes didn’t feel smothered. The surprise for dessert was a great twist and perfect way to wrap the evening.

Very creative menus, and a great progression among the courses. We for sure experienced several new flavors. Dishes were technical yet approached and plating was beautiful. We tried the reserve wine pairing which complemented the dishes perfectly. The space is beautiful and cozy and the staff makes the experience very warm and comfortable.

Disclaimer: this review is for an experience several years ago. I think about this meal often, and it is one of my favorite restaurants of all time. The dishes are the perfect mix of inventive, creative art, texture, and taste. The wine pairing was exquisite, and this is still some of the best service I've ever had, including higher-rated Michelin star restaurants. Have you ever left a restaurant and wondered when you're going to experience something like that again? This is the place, and the answer (so far) is no. Why do I still think about garlic leek soup? Because of this meal.

Terrible Michelin restaurant I never been before!!!!! They should take off the star for service！Waiting for 30mins later for our reservation，A green coat lady（Jessica）took us to waiting room(dessert room），after waiting for 30 mins，without asking, They start the course in the waiting room!!!!!! So rude!! If you guys want to start it you should ask first!! We are not come to have dinner in the waiting room!! of course I refuse it, the green coat lady turn Poker Face in 1 second! Excuse me？ You should not do this job!!!! If you can not control your face! I had very bad experience for this restaurant ever! If you want to go to Michelin 1 star restaurant they have so many choices in LA!!! Don’t waste your money and time!

Amazing experience! The food was super fresh and some ingredients were directly plucked from the flower in front of me. The pigeon was to die for and the abalone was the best abalone I’ve ever had the pleasure of eating.

For dessert you go to a different room which had a very different ambience.

Loved the creativity of all the different foods. Would definitely come again to try out another tasting menu in the future!

name: lorenzo California
address: 9529 S Santa Monica Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews:
Five star for delicious food, quick serve and clean European style shop.

One of the best sandwiches shop I’ve experienced.

Cotto sandwich has rich truffle flavor and the bread is authentic European style.

Pasta is excellent with meat balls.

Will be back!

Is it Wednesday yet? I look forward to the specials at Lorenzo's like I do to any major Holiday. The sandwiches and fresh pastas are addicting. Ingredients could not be more premium or fresher and simplicity is really key here. Call ahead to place a to go order or give it 20-25 minutes as we know perfection takes time. Service is the friendliest in all of BH and the vibe is a bustling neighborhood spot.
Cute little underrated authentic Italian sandwich shop. Pricey for a sandwich until you take a bite- and it becomes worth it. Very delicious and high quality, highly recommend.

I would like to think I'm a bit of a sandwich connoisseur so I'm always on the hunt for the best of the best. I decided to try lorenzo out after a friend of mine said it was the best sandwich she's had in Cali.

I ordered the Cotto.  The first thing I noticed when biting into this sandwich was strange sensation like there was wax paper attached to the bread. It was very odd and I didn't get used to it until the sandwich was half done.  So I can't say I was a fan of the bread. However the inside was delicious. Perhaps a little too much brie.  Because it was so heavy on the cheese the sandwich was very filling and could have easily been two meals.

I'm going to give this place another chance as I want to try one of their other sandwiches now.  Maybe the bakery that bakes their bread just had an off day.

Don't count on eating inside here as there was only three little tables with a couple of seats each cramped into their tiny eating area.  However, a couple were available when I was ordering my food to go.  It took about 10 minutes for them to fulfill my order after ordering it.

Tasty Italian sandwiches in Beverly Hills. The owners are from Florence and you can tell it has some similarities to the famous sandwich shop there. The bread is very rustic, crunchy exterior and soft and airy interior. Meats and other ingredients are also really fresh. We got the Lorenzo and the Capriccio which were both delicious. The lemon mousse also was fresh and not too sweet.

Limited seating but easy to take on the go. The prices are on the higher end but honestly, not as bad as I thought and appropriate for what you are getting.

name: Polo Lounge
address: 9641 Sunset Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews:
I had the pleasure of dining at the Polo Lounge in Beverly Hills Hotel recently, and it was an absolutely delightful experience. The ambiance of the restaurant was elegant and inviting, creating a perfect setting for a memorable meal.

The food at the Polo Lounge exceeded my expectations. I ordered the Benedict egg with salmon, and it was cooked to perfection. The combination of the creamy hollandaise sauce and the flavorful salmon was simply divine. Also,  blueberries lemon pancakes, which were a delightful burst of sweet and tangy flavors. Each bite was a true delight for the taste buds.

I would also like to extend a special thanks to Salvador, our waiter at the Polo Lounge. He provided exceptional service throughout our meal, going above and beyond to ensure that we had a wonderful dining experience. His attentiveness, knowledge, and friendly demeanor truly made us feel welcome and well taken care of.

Overall, my experience at the Polo Lounge in Beverly Hills Hotel was nothing short of exceptional. The delicious food, elegant ambiance, and outstanding service provided by Salvador made it a truly memorable dining experience. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a top-notch dining experience in Beverly Hills.

Polo Lounge in the renowned Beverly Hills hotel was our destination for Father's Day with my wife and friends. Our favorite waitress, Michelle, who we know from a popular jazz location in the area, invited us to this tropical haven. We were seated outside in a booth often reserved for celebrities, surrounded by lush greenery and warm smiles. The live music was nice and inviting. The food was exceptional, particularly the tender steak and delicious scrambled eggs. Wifey enjoyed the chicken and waffle, complimenting the juicy chicken. Our drinks, lemon drops, whiskey sour, and espresso martinis were also impressive.  Chef Joshua and his team provided attentive and accommodating service, making our experience truly memorable. Thank you, Polo Lounge, for a phenomenal experience.

A surreal experience to say the least. This iconic venue has been featured in so many movies I’ve seen growing up. Truly a pleasure and it lived up to the expectations. The service was impeccable. The aesthetic pleasure was unmatched. We had breakfast right after flying into LA, first stop. The fresh orange juice was wonderful. Eggs, hash browns, bacon and the bread were amazing. It’s relatively well priced given the history of this place. I will be returning many times again and recommend you try as well! They also are very accommodating, I had set a reservation for 10:15am and because of the marathon going on at that time I was going to arrive late. When I called to let them know, they were very understanding.

The only thing you’ll definitely enjoy and it’s a must is bread basket 🥖

The menu offered a delightful array of American classics with a modern twist, and each dish was a culinary masterpiece. The ambiance, with its soft lighting and live piano, created an intimate atmosphere that made the evening truly special. It’s no wonder this place is a favorite among celebrities; dining here made me feel like one too. ☺️

The service was impeccable, with attentive staff ensuring every detail was perfect.

My favorite breakfast spot in Beverly Hills! This restaurant consistently delivers incredible, flavorful food. I absolutely love it and definitely recommend making a reservation to experience breakfast at the Polo Lounge.

name: Matu
address: 239 S Beverly Dr Suite 100, Beverly Hills, CA 90212, USA
reviews:
We ordered the Matu set for 2 (in my opinion is the winner of the sets) and every single dish that came out was amazing. All the meats were cooked perfectly pink in the center and even the braised beef cheek melts in your mouth.

Side dishes of bone tallow fries and creamed spinach wow. Fries were crispy and tasty - wish it was a bigger portion. Creamed spinach was so rich in cheese that you can barely taste the spinach.

The ambience is a little too dark, which I get for a cozy feeling but the sound proofing can be better cos it’s hard to have a conversation.

We brought our own wine, corking fee $40. Had a great experience here but they took my wine into the back and put it into the decanter, as it is a bottle we brought, would have preferred if they had poured it in front of us. Otherwise it was a great meal and food was delicious. We did the matu dinner which is a 5 course meal and definitely worth it especially if you’re a first timer. Highly recommend. Great atmosphere and everyone who we interacted with was very nice!

Went here for a solo birthday dinner. This was some of the best food i have ever had! Had the 3 course menu, everything was so delicious, and the service and ambiance were phenomenal. If you want to treat yourself to a wonderful and intimate dinner with friends or loved ones, would very much recommend. and all their meat is halal! Very hard to find luxury and fine dining like this with halal meat, very thankful!

what a sandwich! probably the best steak and cheese sandwich i've ever had. they use the highest quality vagyu beef, and comes in a bu  that is sessame seed covered. i opted in for the hot green pepper and it made all the difference. amazing sandwich comes with potatoe crisps that were fried in wagyu fat. simply delicious

Matu was an excellent choice to have our steak dinner! Their grass fed NZ Wagyu was simply delicious and outstanding.

Tried out the 24 hour bone broth
Hand cut steak tarts Japanese accent
Miatke mushrooms
Rib eye  steak cooked on wood
NY steak cooked on wood
Pomme puree

Very chic and romantic Resturant loved the vibe and its bar.

Food was outstanding

Definitely a must visit for steak

name: La Dolce Vita
address: 9785 S Santa Monica Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews:
Absolutely amazing, show stopping, incredible. The name is perfectly fitting with all the leopard print and velvet decor. This is surely my new favorite restaurant in Beverly Hills. The wait staff seem like they majored in the service industry. If you want to impress out of towners, your parents, a date, or just want to be surrounded by people straight out of magazines this is the place.
The food not to mention is divine and worth every penny. Especially the tuna tartare, the pastas, and the spumoni. The cocktails were perfect too.

The EDDC kicked off 2024 at La Dolce Vita in Beverly Hills.  Not a very large space but the three of us fit comfortably at a small table/booth.  Ambiance was a little dark for our late night repast but well attended by a diverse and talented crowd.

We started things off with a negroni, chocolate martini, and a 50-50 martini along with the mozzarella di buffala and the shrimp fra diabola.  The blue prawns were cooked perfectly with just the right amount of heat from the calabrian chili.  Drinks were sturdy and the 50-50 side car was a nice touch.

A caesar salad prepared table side was next followed by main dishes including spaghetti and meatballs along with the bone-in veal parmesana.  The veal was delectable and overshadowed the spaghetti despite the later being impressive in it's own right.  We ended the night with a neopolitan style dessert balanced between pistachio, chocolate and cherry gelato.

Overall, a solid start to 2024 and an enjoyable night out at an aspirant for top Italian restaurant of the year.
