I have known about La Dolce Vita for quite some time given that it was a former frequent stop for Frank Sinatra and many other Golden Age of Hollywood celebrities. I work very close to the unassuming building so I have been driving by it for many months but finally got the opportunity on Saturday to stop in for dinner. As mentioned the restaurant is very unassuming from the outside, I didn’t even know it was a restaurant until I paid attention to the small sign out front. Inside is a different story though, it has old world charm and is filled with dark red booths, low lighting, and is complete with a classic East Coast style bar in the front corner. Our server and the rest of the staff we encountered were very polite and all of our items arrived quickly from the kitchen. They don’t have a dedicated parking lot, however street parking is easy to find in this part of Beverly Hills or at worst there are a few expensive parking garages close by as well.

All of our dishes were fantastic. We started off with the Shrimp Fra Diavolo, which is prawns cooked in a delicious marinara, and the Clams Oreganata, which are Littleneck clams baked with bread crumbs on top. The clams were warm and tasty and although not many in number, the flavors were truly great.  For our entrees we chose the Branzino Piccata, this was my favorite dish of the night mainly because of the piccata sauce and how well the fish was cooked, and the Lemon Bucatini, which was light and packed with lemon flavor. It was a great summer dish.

Overall a wonderful classic Italian dinner in a beautiful part of town. We both had a great experience and would recommend to anyone for any occasion although it would be especially a great call for a date or business dinner location.

We were warmly greeted by Nicole and an old friend Ashley when my wife and I first walked in acknowledging that it was my sweetheart’s birthday. This was  our very FIRST visit to this restaurant.  It was however all down hill from there. Bread was brought to the table and unfortunately the busboy knocked over the table lamp which crashed and broke my water glass saturating the entire table in front of me. Accidents do happen but instead of changing the table cloth they put two napkins over the saturated area which remained soaked throughout dinner. The table side Caesar salad was delicious. When my wife’s pasta dish came to the table I had to wait 10 minutes for my entree (a $96 bone in veal chop parmigiana) to come. The server we had was very nice and had warned me of how big the veal dish was. He said I would have another dinner tomorrow. He was right.  The veal was excellent and I ate only half. We asked to take home the leftover pasta and veal. A doggy bag was brought to our table before dessert. When the dessert was delivered I truly thought at least a candle would accompany the chocolate tart to celebrate my wife’s birthday(acknowledging the event when we checked in)but sadly it was not the case. We paid the bill and left somewhat disappointed. What then made the entire situation even worse is when walking to the car I realized that the half of my veal dish was missing from the bag. I quickly went back and after searching was told it was probably given to someone else. (Nice surprise) The manager offered to “fire up” another one while I wait but I declined to wait around. He then said he would make a note in the system so that on the next visit I would get the replacement. Based on the evening’s experience I am truly not sure there will be a next time.

Happy to return to this institution especially now with the new management. Food is beyond amazing and the service is excellent. It felt amazing to see this place alive and well. Food was tasty and I highly recommend the table side Cesar salad and the meatball spaghetti! Will absolutely return!

name: Lawry's The Prime Rib
address: 100 La Cienega Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90211, USA
reviews:
Lawry's Prime Rib is a classic Los Angeles steakhouse that delivers a memorable dining experience, and I had the pleasure of celebrating my birthday here tonight.

The star of the show is, of course, the prime rib – carved tableside and cooked to perfection. But don't miss out on the decadent mashed potatoes, the addictive Yorkshire pudding, and the delicious croutons!

The service is top-notch, and my servers Dea and Jorge were some of the best I've ever encountered – funny, friendly, and always attentive. Overall, Lawry's is a great choice for a special occasion or a night out to enjoy some iconic LA fare.

They forgot our cocktails twice. The server wasn’t really interested in our table it felt like. The fish cakes were delicious, we really recommend those. But the meat was far below what we are used to. I am used to more French and Dutch steak and this wasn’t super good. It was really below average. The scallops were delicious though. It was really amazing.

It was good. I would go back. I would recommend getting the Lawry's cut or lower and adding on more sides or appetizers.  The Brady cut had a big bone and a lot of fat. Which in all seem like a smaller cut choice.  Still happy.

I wanted to treat myself for my birthday to the California $60 prime rib. I had it delivered and was horribly disappointed.
The cut looked nothing like the photo on their menu! It was paper thin and mostly composed of fat! I removed the fat and took one mouthful of the dry lean part and was ill. I could not keep it down. It tasted horrible. The burned Yorkshire pudding and completely stale bread did not help as they were inedible.
I used to love Lawry’s, I’m out $95 without having been able to eat a thing. Never again!

Service is super interactive & phenomenal. they make the salad in front of you, cut the rib in front of you.

There’s valet parking on site, which was only $11~ and limited street parking. Please reserve in advance to avoid any inconvenience! Went on a weekday and they had a full house.

Prime rib was flavorful and melted into your mouth. The mashed potatoes and corn paired perfectly with the steak.

Even if you prefer steak cooked traditionally on the grill, this spot is a great intro for prime rib!

name: CUT Beverly Hills
address: 9500 Wilshire Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90212, USA
reviews:
Reviewing restaurants and food can be a challenging task, as opinions can vary greatly and personal experiences play a significant role. Upon arrival at the restaurant, one is immediately struck by the beauty of the hotel, with its elegant chandeliers and inviting atmosphere. The valet service, while attentive, may come across as overly eager to park cars in prime spots, which may not always be necessary. Upon leaving, I handed $100 bill with my ticket and the polite gentleman thanked me and walked away. I did not ask for my car to be taken care of or parked in front. I wanted my change but none was given. So much for a Porsche!

The restaurant itself is tastefully decorated but may be considered plain by some. The food, however, is exceptional, though the prices may not be suitable for everyone. A basic dinner for two resulted in a bill totaling $1000, which may be considered steep compared to other high-end establishments such as BOA Steakhouse or Mastros, where a similar meal may cost $400-$500, including luxurious items like black caviar. For 2 People!

Despite the high prices, the quality of the food and the exceptional service provided by the servers were highlights of the dining experience. However, the cost of items such as a $50-$75 old fashioned cocktail may be seen as excessive when compared to other establishments. It tasted just as bad as Crown Apply Royal on ice which is usually $12-$15 dollars!

While the food was enjoyable, the overall experience may not justify the steep prices, leading to a decision not to return in the future.

I heard this restaurant a while, finally we made it, it was my family dinner, also celebrated my husband, me and my daughter’s birthday together, because we wouldn’t meet on mine and my daughter’s birthday this summer, so we decided having a fine dinner for three of us. We had prime filet mignon, Australia waygu filet mignon and New York strip, started with butter lettuce salad and tuna tartar, side order were truffle fries and creamed spinach, every dish was amazing, especially tuna tartar, it’s memorable taste!! I finished my dish which is rare to me. After ordering our dessert, our server delivered three sweet dishes with candles, that was really touching and surprising! My husband loved the banana cream pie, he said it’s the best one he ever had 😁 The chocolate soufflé was very satisfying, and a dish with five different sweets was neat like jewelry. We went across street of Rodeo drive for a walk after finishing dinner. It was a super great experience for us, thank you !

I need more stars for this restaurant!!!! We had reservations at Cut for my husbands birthday celebration. But as usual, we prefer bar/lounge to eat….so always keep that in mind regarding my reviews. So instead of going to the restaurant, we went to Cut Lounge. Cut Lounge has the same menu as well as a bar menu. Both rooms in the restaurant and the lounge are beautiful. However, the restaurant seems a little bit more sterile and not as warm as the Lounge. The photos here are of the lounge.
Regarding the food, which is the same for both places… I literally need to go back and give my other reviews of steakhouses one less star because there was nothing better than what I ate at cut. My steak was literally the best steak in the universe. I had the Australian Stone ax Wagyu, 6oz filet which was literally the best steak I’ve ever tasted in my life. Every single thing we ate was beyond five stars. I cannot explain how delicious this meal was. It was definitely pricey, but well worth it !!! if you want to have mouthgasm after mouthgasm go to Cut. In addition, if you end up in cut Lounge, the bartender Jeffrey is stellar. He had such wealth of knowledge about different alcohol…. Different cuts of meat. He was amazing. Overall 10 stars.
Here’s a little more detail about the side dishes… The onion rings which are only on the Cut lounge menu are so good and light It’s like eating heaven. The burrata toast was beyond belief. The oysters 👅we ordered two orders because they were so delicious. We had the butter lettuce salad, which was the best salad I’ve ever had in my life… 😳😍😜the carrots 😳😳😳💃🏿incredible…And the steaks could not be better literally I never thought a steak could be so good. I know I sound redundant, but I’m still amazed.😍😍😍 and then to top it all off the desserts were off the chain. I was in a state of heavenly oral fixation bliss after that meal.😜👅💗😳💃🏿

Reason for visiting: brother's birthday

Date/time of visit: Friday night, ~7:15 PM

Parking: valet only; didn't see any parking on the street. Valet is shared with Beverly Wilshire; the entrance is on El Camino and is a bit hard to find so drive slowly if possible. Probably easier to look for entrance to Beverly Wilshire hotel. Valet is $10 with validation at the front; $20 without.

Party size: 5; 3 adults, 2 teens

Environment/ambience: busy; restaurant is up the stairs to the left of the Wolfgang Puck picture under the hostess. Reservations are probably required (I did not make reservations myself) and upscale dining. Dress code seems to be casual though. No TVs around. Busy and loud. Pretty cool art around the restaurant.

Service: fantastic; came around often and provided suggestions. All servers were great; friendly

Food: we shared the 22 oz  Prime Ribeye and Wagyu Porterhouse (medium rare). Also had the truffle fries, Mac 'n' Cheese, Samurai Sword, From The Hearth bread, complimentary bread, Oysters, Baked Alaska and Banana Cream Pie desserts. Everything was great, cooked as requested without mistakes. Only drawback for banana cream pie dessert is it lists creme brulee as well but not really a full portion creme brulee; it's really a taste of creme brulee and not really 2 in 1 dessert. BUT everything tasted great!

Cost: $1100 for 5 (including tip); 2 teens

Would I go back (yes/no): 95/5
Loved our dinner at The Cut.  Amazing menu and great staff.  Our server, Mario was outstanding.  My wife had the bone in ribeye and I had the salmon.  Everything was cooked to perfection.

name: Beverly Bar - Beverly Hills Restaurant
address: 434 N Camden Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: Just recently had a great experience at The Beverly Bar! First time eating here very cute space well designed, lighting was perfect it set the ambiance. Here are some pics my fave would have to had been the Rock shrimp and Tuna Tartare! Our waitress was so sweet definitely coming back!

Amazing wine bar and great selection. I loved the crispy tuna rice and the mushroom truffle pizza. Fried chicken sandwich was also good!

They have lots of vegetarian options and good quality food.

We got the spicy tuna & crispy rice, hamachi crudo, avocado hummus, chopped salad, burger, and butter cake. I would go back and order the spicy tuna and avocado hummus again, maybe try something different too.

The chopped salad didn't have a ton of flavor. The burger was decent, but the bread was a bit soggy. The butter cake had good flavor but was a little hard and too sweet for me to have more than a couple bites.

Service was slightly disorganized with multiple people helping out our table and not knowing what we'd already ordered, but they were super friendly and attentive.

It was fantastic! We stopped by the Beverly Bar with my friend for Martini Monday 🍸🍸. The drinks were deliciousss! I tried “Beverly Cosmo” and “French Martini”. Will come back for those for sure! We ordered spicy tuna and crispy rice, hamachi crudo, Mushroom and Truffle pizza, steak tacos (they were bomb) and lovely dessert -Warm Butter Cake (which takes 45 mins to bake) so order in advance -it was super sweet for me though. Will try smth else next time)) Food was amazing, with great presentation, lots of flavors. The place was cozy with perfect personnel, starting with the lovely host, sweet waitress, bartender)) We will come back for sure! Thanks for great Monday dinner and Martinis 🍸😋

I went out with my girlfriends last night and had a blast! The food was delicious! We ordered so much and my top favorite was the FIG AND FARRO SALAD. The service was also attentive and quick and the ambiance is private and comfortable. We laughed the entire night and enjoyed desert at the end. Get the the CHEF’S BERRY SUNDAE. You won't regret it!

name: Circa 55
address: 9876 Wilshire Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: Hosted daughter’s college graduation luncheon at Circa 55 and it was AMAZING!!! I worked w/ Annette to plan all the advance details and she was truly fabulous!!! The day of the event, Sergio, Jeff & team executed and made the event so special and spectacular!   Very highly recommend!!

11/30/2023 The CIRCA 55 is situated inside the Beverly Hilton that was broken ground  in 1953 and open to the public in 1955. The ambience is excellent. The Golden Globe Awards ceremony was held at the hotel year over year since 1961.

The Veranda is not perfect. For example,
It has been using a wrong cup for cappuccinos that ruined the taste. As a matter of fact, I enjoyed a cup of cappuccinos made by a new specialty coffee machine at one Marriott namesake hotel last night. One glass of Moet & Chanson Imperial Brut Champagne costs $32, plus tax and tip. It is not for most patrons to visit. Also, the appetizer missed a sauce cup. I decided not to ask.

I've been to Circa 55 several times, but yesterday was my first networking event at the location. The staff and catering were lovely. The tray pass servers for the event were so warm, especially Frank.

The highest rating is for the service - thanks to Edwin. Noteworthy are the lamb chops. Those were impeccable! Although my companion never enjoyed anything less than medium, she enjoyed medium to rare chops! Delightful. Beef tartar was ok, the color of the meat was dark due to either some spices or keeping it on ice. I don’t recommend the tartar. Atmosphere is not bad, but nothing special. Come here for food, if you stay at the hotel.

As good as expected in such a storied establishment. Whether sitting outside by the pool or inside, the attention to detail is evident everywhere. Plenty of options in the breakfast buffet but you have to spring for the top tier version to get access to everything. Impossible to complain about the service, one gets pampered here whether one wants it or not.

name: South Beverly Grill
address: 122 S Beverly Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90212, USA
reviews: Loved this restaurant, service was perfect - attentive and almost old fashioned but with upbeat feel. Food was delicious and high quality! Best steak I’d had in a very long time. Great wine selection. Buzzy vibe and interesting mixed crowd. Would highly recommend.

Whether you are working on a new deal, grabbing a bite with friends or planning a romantic dinner this place has something for you.

Start your meal with an expertly crafted drink brought over from the bar, order some tasty sushi to start the night, and try the amazingly well prepared Dover sole. But make sure you leave room for a slice of key lime pie.

Just make sure you have a reservation or you will be on the outside looking in.

Everything was amazing. We stopped here while visiting Beverly Hills.  We did not have a reservation but were graciously seated. The atmosphere is subtle with a hit of elegance, and the service was excellent. The food & drinks were amazing! A great visit.
This restaurant bar is great. The food is tasty, the service is very good and it has a good atmosphere. It's only super busy. Highly recommended. Dave at the bar is great!
One of the must try restaurants in LA. They have great food and great drinks. We always order the spinach and artichoke dip and the sushi. For the main course, the French dip never disappoints.

name: La ong Beverly Hills
address: 9632 S Santa Monica Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews:
We stumbled upon a charming Thai restaurant near Rodeo Drive, though it took us a while to locate it as the sign wasn't very visible. After circling the block a few times, we finally found it, and the food was absolutely worth the search! Plus, the service and ambiance were superb, adding to the overall delightful experience.

Must order: crab fried rice!

This might be my favorite thai restaurant!

We ordered the dishes that were recommended to us by our server, which were the sea bass and the crab fried rice.
Both were incredible delicious and I can't recommended the 2 enough.

SO good!

I highly recommend the sea bass curry & mango sticky rice. The sea bass curry is lime-y, filling, and one of the best dishes I've had. The mango sticky rice is light and the perfect way to end the night.

Everyone was super nice and it's a cute spot to dine with friends!

* Papaya Salad is fresh and invigorating.
* Crispy Pork Belly has an amazing contrast between its crispy skin layer and its melting tender meat under the skin.
* Sea Bass Curry also shares this amazing combination with a rich flavor of curry.

La Ong Thai restaurant in Beverly Hills, great first time trying this place.
From the wonderful ambiance to the food, every dish was a master piece.
Starting with chicken sate with pickled cucumbers,Tuna steak with peanut chili sauce, crispy pork with watercress, to the green curry with eggplant and Thai basil and noodles on the side.
The presentation and the flavors of every dish were excellent.
The service was great.
I would highly recommend this restaurant.

name: Novikov Beverly Hills
address: 257 N Canon Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: I couldn’t be happier when I heard that Novikov finally opened in Beverly Hills. If you know any of the Novikov restaurants, you know that have exceptional customer service and food always taste amazing. They have brunch menu, which you get to pick a starter and the main course. Even tho Novikov is Russian corp, the restaurant is Italian. Also they do have purse chairs which every restaurant in Beverly needs.

I recently visited Novikov and was very impressed. The service was excellent, with friendly and attentive staff. The food was delicious and looked great.

The cocktail menu had a lot of great options. The best part was the Napoleon dessert, which was a perfect end to the meal.

Overall, Novikov offers a fantastic dining experience with great service, tasty food, and amazing cocktails and desserts. Highly recommended!

Nestled in glamorous Beverly Hills, Novikov Restaurant & Lounge offers a chic and luxurious dining experience with a unique Mediterranean twist. From the moment you walk in, the stylish and cozy ambiance sets the perfect scene, whether it's for a romantic dinner or a lively celebration. The menu is a culinary adventure, with highlights like refreshing New Zealand Salmon Tartare and the indulgent Bluefin Tuna Tartare with Gold Oscietra Caviar. The Tagliatelle Wagyu Bolognese and creamy Risotto with Asparagus and Black Truffle are must-tries. The service is top-notch, with attentive and knowledgeable staff who make great recommendations. Their cocktails and extensive wine list perfectly complement the flavorful dishes, and desserts like Tiramisu and Hazelnut Profiteroles offer a sweet finish. Overall, Novikov Beverly Hills blends elegance, fantastic food, and great service for a truly memorable dining experience.

We have been here for 4 nights straight and we loved the atmosphere and the food.
Michael was amazing and caring server , loved his attention to details , also Isaak is amazing bartender and super fun! Check out this new hot spot , see you here :)

We came to this restaurant as a group of four. They didn't bring us one of the appetizers, they mixed up the steak for one of us, and they took a very long time to take our order. We sat for about half an hour before we ordered. I didn't like the meat. I liked the cocktail and truffle risotto, so 3 stars.

name: Il Tramezzino
address: 454 N Canon Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: Nice restaurant that offers a wide range of salads and paninis. They also have some low sugar beverages, like lemonade or iced tea, with refills included. Food was good and waiters were nice, the only negative aspect is the high prices, but you can expect that since it's close to Rodeo Drive.
food was great, i got a chicken special panini with no sundried tomatoes. finished it in less than five minutes because it was that good. owner helped out with customers and was so nice.

Used to be one of favorite panini spots, the chicken special was always on fire, used to be great late night. Get the pickles and try their special avocado sauce. Unfortunately the quality of panini has gone down a little hopefully they will bring it back up again.

LOVED our meal here!!!
The food was so incredible. I’ve never had pasta that tasted so good. It came out so fast.
I ordered the Penne Lorenzo but split it in half to share with my dining mate and the portion ended up being perfect! You get a lot for a modest price.
Our waiter was so incredibly kind and very attentive. He made my night with our conversation!
We sat outside and it was a wonderful atmosphere. You’re right by Rodeo Drive and in the heart of Beverly Hills. It was a great dining experience through and through.

This is a great lunch spot! They offer amazing paninis with a great variety of meat, cheese and veggie options. Paninis are certainly their specialty, and it paired well with the tomato soup.

They also have a ton of salad options. I believe they offer around 24 different salads. As you can see in the picture, they do not hold back on the protein. II Tramezzino’s pasta is also quite good, but I definitely prefer the paninis.

I will be coming back here again as there are a lot of items l’d like to try.

name: The Roof Garden at The Peninsula Beverly Hills
address: 9882 S Santa Monica Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90212, USA
reviews:
Nothing really fancy about the food, went here for the ambiance and vibe. Perfect for brunch dates or lunch dates.

We have not really got a chance to try their entree as we are already full from the starters we ordered. We split everything and there was four of us with quite an appetite so they probably have a huge serving.

Definitely make a reservation as they tend to be fully booked.

The Scallops and Peach Cream Brulee are delicious. We would like to see more options in the handcrafted signature cocktails menu.  As expected, the service is refined and attentive.  We are locals, and there are many dining/cocktail experiences nearby, the Roof Garden is a favored location.

Relaxing place for a quick light meal. It’s next to the pool and the atmosphere is very nice. It’s mostly reserved for hotel guests, but sometimes they make exceptions.
We tried The Impossible Burger, it was very good and the fries were delicious.

It’s mostly a positive experience here at the Peninsula. All the dishes were good except the hamachi and the Wagyu. The hamachi was a bit over cooked so for a fatty fish it was quite dry. The wagyu flavour was very interesting. It almost reminded me of Cantonese bbq pork. A bit of sweetness and char. We ordered medium rare, but pretty sure was medium well or more. Again for a fatty piece of meat it was quite dry. But all the appys were very well and the whole sea bream was fantastic. Drinks well. Love the service. Prices not too crazy.

Swanky yet cozy, a hard combination to achieve but attained here. Brimming with beautiful and well dressed people. Service was good as well. Food and drinks were decent and nicely presented. Just wish they (& other establishments actually..) would seat bigger parties near best views in the house.

name: Jon & Vinny's Beverly Hills
address: 456 N Bedford Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews:
The food is excellent. A slightly different take on the traditional pasta dishes. Pasta was perfectly al dente with very delicious sauce. The pizza was ultra thin and tasty. Shaved zucchini salad, and gem lettuce were very different and yummy.

Only complaint is, the tiramisu had too much coffee for my taste.

Overall the food was awesome.
The reason for 4 stars is the portions are very small for the amount they charge and the 18% service fee etc.

Recommended by friends to come here. A must visit when you come to LA according to them. Pasta was delicious and nicely Al dente. The house salad and Gem lettuce was great. The chicken wings were too salty. The place is a tad too cramped  and crowded. Service is good.

I absolutely love the minimalist ambiance of this restaurant. The food is not only beautifully presented but also delicious. However, I was a bit disappointed with the portion sizes, both for the food and wine, considering the price. On the bright side, the customer service was exceptional. Our server was incredibly friendly and accommodating, making us feel like valued guests. Overall, despite the small portions, this restaurant offers a great dining experience with its stylish atmosphere and tasty dishes.

Great new restaurant location with great pizzas, a good selection of breakfast and dessert items. I ordered the Chai tea and Polenta with a fried egg. The Polenta was great and the egg was cooked perfectly. My Chai tea had enough water for two small mugs. The tea itself was a 3/5.

Love the place and the staff are friendly.
We ordered
- burrata (8/10)
- calamari (6/10) oily
- pizza (10/10) LOVE IT!!! ✨✨✨
-chicken cutlet (9/10)

name: Nusr-Et Steakhouse Beverly Hills
address: 184 -88 N Canon Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: Heard so much about this chef so finally made it here today and discovered for myself! All the staffs are so so friendly Tamara is so sweet ! ! The lunch special is a bargain at $39  for 3 courses! Love the lychee Martin ! The ice cream & pistachios baklava is imported from Turkey! Perfect with the Turkish tea!

I made reservations for a surprise bday diner and everything was great the service is top tier.  Everyone is beyond attentive .
The food is delicious cooked perfectly and super tasty.
Both our steaks were amazing we also got sides and the Nusr-Et salad 🥗 highly recommended .

The lunch special was tried, previously dinner steak tried.
Lunch special was great, overall. The portions are smaller than normal menu, of course. But the pricing is just right.

Will try again.

Wow, wow & WOW!!! Best dinner experience hands down Turap!!!
Food super yummy high quality.
Everyone was fantastic the manager checked on us multiple times, our waiter her name is Tamara and she exceptional.
Highly recommend the team, the food the ambience are over the top

We went for lunch during Dine LA, and the whole place had only 3 tables filled. The salmon quinoa tartar was out of this world, the New York steak and fillet mignon with mushrooms side were amazing. The baklava was so so. The tea was very good.

name: Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse
address: 133 N La Cienega Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90211, USA
reviews:
Great experience here. Good quality food and pretty fine. Dining came in with a few guys and I did to the salad bar and the other guys had the meats.

Salad bar options were great. Lots to choose from hard to not to get too full off of it. I enjoyed the stew with rice, and got the sea bass. It was amazing very buttery and soft just melts in your mouth. It's a pretty small portion now so I can. I hurts when you get it up at like $5 a bite.

Reason for four stars: We were told it would be 16 different servings of meat, but only about 12 came out, and we had to ask for more of the specific ones. Also, they kept bringing back other ones which is kind of tricky because it seems like they want you to get full on those. So that' kinda wasn't
cool.

Inside was very  warm, and staff was very friendly.

Wow! What a FUN night! We really enjoyed it! One thing though, make sure to request the cuts and meats you want for the “full” experience. You may not get every cut of the full 16 if you don’t ask. They just seem to bring out what they have ready. Maybe it’s because we came at 9:30pm… but they will make it fresh for you if you ask. Also, the desserts are not covered in the “16” cut experience, so just keep that in mind, though we got our desserts covered ;)

I think if the restaurant worked on a pamphlet that spoke about what the 16 cut experience is and what it includes, it would solve a lot of the misunderstood descriptions from the waiters

I recently visited this restaurant in Los Angeles with my family for dinner, and it was a great choice. The salad bar had an excellent and extensive selection. As for drinks, they had a wide variety of options, and they were delicious. Finally, the meat dishes were fantastic. I always order my meat medium-rare, and it was cooked perfectly to my liking. It was some of the best meat I’ve ever had. Overall, it was a wonderful experience, and I look forward to visiting again.

My husband and I went for the first time last night (7/13/24) for my birthday and WOW 10/10 experience. From the meats to the salad bar to the cheesecake dessert, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. But our amazing server Theron made the experience 10x better. He was fun, personable, and overall EXCEPTIONAL. He loves the restaurant and his love for it, the food, and the patrons radiates off of him. Due to Theron's fantastic service, the friendly hosts, and great food, we plan on coming back next month! And probably every month!

We had the best experience eating there. The staff made our family dinner top tier. Moises the manager went above and beyond to make  sure we  had excellent service.  This was by far the best dining experiences we've ever had. We will see them in a few weeks...

name: Tempura Endo
address: 9777 Santa Monica Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews:
Service is very good and the cooking technique is superb.

The only tempura I do not enjoy is the squid which is flavorless and the fermented yellowish thing on top tastes very fishy and stinky.

Other than that, all tempera are very well made. The coating is thin and crispy and The ingredients are fresh. I admire the chef’s skill!!!

I also love that they used seasonal ingredients such as matsutake.

After I finished the meal, I feel full but do not feel overwhelmed by greasiness because the food were properly fried.

I wish they had more sake options.

Tempura were all excellent. My favorites are corn, snow crab leg, shrimp, scallop w/ caviar and curry anago. Ootoro in the sashimi was a bit chewy, but after telling the waitress, chef was nice enough to give me a torched one which was much better. It’s on the expensive side but both service and taste were superb. I would recommend it ;)

To eat here was a culinary experience, esp if one loves tempura. Decor is quiet elegance with clean aesthetic. Service is stellar where your sake glass is never empty. The menu is carefully prepared by 2 chefs served one piece at a time. The amalgamation is flavors slowly wakens the palate from salad, corn, slowly graduating to sashimi, beef cooked on hot stone. All items are served with specific instructions ie no salt, white salt, green salt, or tempura sauce (w shredded daikon). Certainly worth a trip esp for special occasions ie my friends birthday!

Great omakase. Went for their first seating while they were still setting up and was cool to see. Service was five stars. My favorite was the corn actually😂. So unique and tasty. They did a nice cake for my husband for his birthday. Great meal, will be back.

A legit taste of tempura to tie me over until my next visit back to Japan. Super courteous staff. Very intimate. Every dish was delicious (the corn and wagyu were my favorite).  Worth the price and will definitely be back.

Other reviews mentioning lack of wifi and similar complaints seemed silly to me. They clearly don't understand what this experience is supposed to be about.

name: Loukà Beverly Hills
address: 340 N Canon Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: Amazing service and food. This is a must for anyone looking for authentic Greek food with a nice ambiance. The servers are so friendly and the gentleman Constantinos working there made the experience fantastic! My family cannot stop talking about how great the moussaka was. The best we have had in a long time!!!

Best food best fishes best manager costo who welcomes you with open heart and always inform you what’s good for your taste . It’s my go to place of all time highly recommended it and not to mention the best healthiest soup ever
Make sure to try their their barbounia you won’t regret it

We sat at the bar and there was only one other couple at the bar. It still took ten minutes before someone offered us a water. We asked some questions about the menu and the bartenders weren't very helpful/knowledgeable at all. The food was decent but pretty small portions.

I went there for the first time tonight, with my daughter and a friend and this was one of my best experience ever. Starting with the manager Costa that was very nice and even gave us a tour of the restaurant and the fabulous vine selections. He took care of us from the beginning till the end. We also had a lovely waitress Ourania who introduce me to a wonderful red wine from Greece. She was polite, gave us a great service and very professional. The food was so delicious and so delicately presented. We even had the chance to meet the chef David who came at our table. Last minute my daughter decided to come and i called to see if i could add 1 more person to our reservation and Marvin, the assistant, i believe made it possible. Everyone was so nice and made us feel welcome. AMAZING RESTAURANT. A GEM FOR SURE.

Very good cocktails. Attentive staff. My order was wrong but the other 7 people I was with got theirs fine so I’m chalking it up to a fluke.

The pita and bread dips are amazing. The feta dip is a little spicy which is cool. Then there’s also a feta whip with some of the dishes, which is a nice touch.

Outdoor seating is well-heated so you can sit there on cold days.

name: Caffe Roma
address: 350 N Canon Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: This restaurant falls into the average category for me. The lobster was disappointingly subpar. While the services were commendable, the food didn't live up to the overall dining experience. It lacks that spark, although it does succeed in filling you up.

Don’t be mislead by my rating system, realistic 5 star visits are rare and it isn’t that this restaurant was ‘bad’ … I am just not a fan of inflated prices based solely on location.

The fare was enjoyable although walking distance from Rodeo Drive, I expected a little more. Dining outside near the road deflected my focus away from the fact that I have had better food at half the price. Had this not been a birthday trip for my girlfriend, this review would have been a bit harsher.

A bit more research could have possibly led us to a better venue but unfortunately, we were a little too close to hangry stages to continue that route. All in all, I do not regret the choice but I do not think I would return.

My family used to go here a decent amount when I was younger. I had always loved it, decided to come back after having not gone in probably 15 years or so.

The food overall was very solid, but the service was slightly slow. The pizza funny enough tasted just like I remembered it, in a good way.

It did seem a bit empty, I don't know if it was just the time of day/week we chose to go, but it does feel like they need to invest a little into updating the place here and there. My wife was thinking it'd be cool if they had like a little Italian market in the space, kind of like Bay Cities.

Either way, looking forward to coming back again.

I came on a Tuesday and there was a salsa lesson in progress. The festive ambiance definitely was a good pairing to the drinks and food I had. The pizza was simply good. The lentil soup had a good balance between thin, tasty, and crunchy taste. The music got me to dance several songs.

We had dinner at the Roma in Beverly Hills last night and it was excellent Italian food! 2 hours free parking is just a block up un N Canon Dr, additional time is $2.50/hour which is not bad for Beverly Hills. They have gas heaters for the folks sitting outside and the temperature inside the restaurant  was ideal. Food was excellent, we had Pasta, Chicken and a pizza. While everything was really good, we'll certainly return for the Pizza, tastes just as one would expect it in Italy. Location is great! As it was a pleasant December evening we went for a short stroll over to Rodeo Drive which is less than 5 minutes walking distance to admire the X-Mas decorations and lights. Prices are decent considering the location. Once again, pizza was hands down the best I've ever eaten in Los Angeles.

name: goop Kitchen
address: 345 N Maple Dr Suite 100, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: I order from Goop Kitchen often, maybe 50+ times. When I first started everything was amazing. As they’ve gotten bigger I’ve noticed things perpetually getting worse: quality, portions. I ordered 3x this week, I know crazy and each portion of salad was pretty small but tonight’s salads were about 1/3 full. When I tried contacting to ask why, request refund or replacement it was rejected since I had received my order. Hope they go back to how they were in the beginning considering this salad was $27.

Ok, I wanted to hate this place so badly (sorry Gwyneth) but I can’t.   Everything I’ve had is fresh, ultra flavorful and absolutely gorgeous!  I mean, look at how pretty this salad is!  I always get the Cobb, and when they have the curried squash soup I jump on it.  It’s a touch pricey, but the quality is worth the extra bucks.  Portions are filling, and I always feel satisfied!  Thanks for making me a convert!

My family ordered from goop Kitchen tonight. This is my second time trying the food. I ordered a winter salmon bowl and it was very good. I definitely recommend it. It was a good portion. I love eating light and healthy. They have other great options. I hope to visit the location on one of my trips to LA.

Wow! Super impressed! Had a last-minute large order that needed to be redirected and GOOPS team went above and beyond. Shoutout to GOOP's customer service team and Doug in Beverly Hills for the support. Everything was fantastic, especially the Teriyaki Chicken. Huge thank you! Highly recommend, great food and great customer service.

The Teriyaki Bowl with salmon is my favorite meal of all time. Fresh broccoli, avocado, kale, ginger, and the minimal/ light sauce combine to make the perfect dish! Their soups are out of this world too. Thank you for the long hours, effort, and energy you all put into this concept; it’s a dream come true!

name: Kazan Beverly Hills
address: 111 N La Cienega Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90211, USA
reviews:
Michelin rated 2021, 2022, & 2023.....this is a high end ramen shop located on La Cienega Blvd in Beverly Hills.

All the noodles here are made fresh in house in the front of the shop on display.

The signature #1 truffle soba reminds me of the famous truffle Michelin rated ramen in Tokyo.   This is what I've had the several other times I've visited.  Today I came in specifically to try their new tsukemen (dipping ramen) Ise.

It's described as spicy yet sweet dipping ramen with noodles served on the side.  The noodles are wide and flat....very fresh too!  They also provide a side of truffle oil and green onions so you can customize your bowl.  The soup was much thicker and more intense than a normal ramen broth.  It coats the flat noodles very well.  They also give you a pretty good portion of the pork charshu.

I really like this place but it is a very expensive bowl of ramen for $38.  If the price was more reasonable, I would give it a 5 star.  Even with the price at $38, I still come back.  Food is delicious!

Modern ramen shop with a noodle lab boasting high-end bowls of slurpy goodness. The broth is layered in silky umami flavors. Noodles were cooked perfectly. Price point is a bit steep but that's to be expected.

After reading reviews, Michelin Recommend from 2021-2023, and many different trophies. I was expected this place to be a 5 start ramen shop. However, it’s disappointed. For a bowl of ramen $38 plus tax and tips, I would expect it to be nearly perfect. Chicken wings are dry not juicy. Only one server runs the entire restaurant so there is no service at all to check if the food is ok or anything else needs to be attentive. No water refill, no one came to our table to check on us. Only one staff works in the kitchen and one staff works in the back of the kitchen. After waiting for 20 mins to get our chicken wings and another 15 mins to get three bowls of ramen. The noodle texture is lack of Gluteniness of noodles. It doesn’t taste as good as it should be as home made noodles. The only broth tastes the best it’s the creamy broth. Salt and soy broth are both little too salty. Chicken thigh it’s full of sake taste and I can’t taste any chicken flavor from it. The texture of the chicken also not juice at all. Honestly, a place like this should have a lot better quality of food and service to present.

Overate ramen! Too much truffle oil and it breaks all the taste. You can name that “innovation” but for a person who eat ramen all over the world like me, it’s really “overdose”. Lamb ramen, it’s a joke with this price! I really don’t mind to pay $70/bowl of ramen, if it’s good! But not in this case! Taste-it first pls! Bright side: they have a very good serveur, he is very kind, attentive and charming. That’s why even can not finish any bowl of ramen, still appreciate him with a good tip, cause it’s not his fault at all.

It’s a unique take on ramen, good depth of flavor, great noodles, but for me the truffle dominates and the richness of the soup is too buttery.  Like it for something new, but I prefer a more traditional take. I like truffle and I have had a dozen bowls in Tokyo.  I was expecting the price, but at the end of the night it felt too steep.

name: Tagine
address: 132 N Robertson Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90211, USA
reviews: I am Moroccan and I loved everything we had! Lovely cosy restaurant with great service and amazing waiter Ossama who took extremely good care of us all! Had a mix of several starters and everyone was happy! We will be back

This place is by far the best restaurant in the area and I won't be exaggerating saying it's the best in LA. My family is Moroccan, so I know Moroccan food by heart. This place is authentic and keeps high standards for flavors and quality. The food is just so amazing it reminded me of my grandmother who passed away 20 years ago. I almost went to the kitchen to check if she is there. The vegetarian options are amazing and I'm craving them all the time! The house mezze platter is so good and rich. It's so called simple food but the flavors are so sophisticated and perfect. The baklava is great and the tea is nothing You've ever tasted. Just so amazing. The staff are so welcoming and warm, service is amazing, and we just come back over and over again as it is a gem, an absolute delight.

Just ate here last night and it was amazing. The food was outstanding. Service was great, atmosphere was intimate and relaxing. It was a chilly evening in their garden patio, so I had the mint tea and it was the best mine tea I've ever had. Planning for when I can go back again. Thank you for an amazing evening!

I really wanted to like this place. I love Moroccan food and was excited to try this place since I read many positive reviews on Google and Yelp. Perhaps it was an off night. Servers were very nice and patio in the back had its charm; however, the food was not to my taste. I tried the chicken bastilla which was a bit dry and did not taste fresh. The lemon chicken tagine was ok but was not what think of when I think of tagine, the chicken tasted like it was cooked separately from the sauce  and then sauce added right before serving. Lastly, the baklava was very dry and rather tasteless. I’m afraid I won’t be back.

My husband and I had the 9-course tasting menu to celebrate our 20th anniversary. The service was excellent and very friendly. Most of the food was delicious, especially the lamb. The scallops were the only disappointing dish. We will return to try individual entrees, but the tasting menu is not the best value for us. Thank you for a very pleasant time.

name: Continental Kitchen
address: 8300 Wilshire Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90211, USA
reviews: The service is  with a smile and such friendliness. You feel like you've been a regular for years. The food was delicious and portions were large. It definitely is going on our list to return

Oh my god! This place is incredible!!! We brought our old blind dog inside and the staff brought fresh grilled chicken to him! The food- amazing! The homemade sauces are the best!!!
I cannot express enough love to this restaurant. I WILL be coming back! 5 stars! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Umm...yes! I got the California Burger, and the burger itself is seasoned so well and the whole plate was delicious with fair prices. The free cucumber water is a nice touch to an overall five-star experience.

I will definitely be back.

I had the fresh juice with beets, etc., brown rice with tofu, and chocolate cake. I can't say anything negative about tofus as they are my favorites I can eat every day.  I therefore conclude that the food was ok. The chocolate cake was really very sweet, similar to those that were in the frozen sections in the groceries.

Continental is a cozy and welcoming family-owned restaurant owned by Ana and Vrej. They are one of the sweetest and most genuine people I've ever known. Whether you're looking to work on your computer, catch up with friends, or simply enjoy a delicious meal, they have it all. The prices are definitely reasonable (especially considering its prime location) and the variety of comforting healthy choices on the menu. Highly recommended.

name: Croft Alley Beverly Hills
address: 9433 Brighton Way, Beverly Hills, CA 90210, USA
reviews: 1 had a terrible experience at this coffee shop. The service was extremely slow, taking 15 minutes to deliver a coffee to the table. I ordered a regular latte with almond milk, which cost $7.66—a ridiculously high price. To make matters worse, the coffee was burned and tasted awful. I’m surprised this place is so busy. This was my first and last visit, and I do not recommend it. If you want good service and quality coffee, avoid this place.
Food is excellent. Takes a hit on the wallet. But the food is very good.  They also serve all day breakfast.

MANDATORY 18% TIPS BUT POOR SERVICES?!?!?!‼️⁉️🆘🆘
We came around at 11:30am and the restaurant was pretty empty (not a busy time). Still, our order took a long time to arrive. While we were waiting, nobody served us any water. 😓When the food arrived, the yogurt was spilled and there were only two sets of utensils for four people. When we asked for more utensils and water, the Mexican waiter looked really impatient and impolite. The look he gave was absolutely offensive.🤔When we were finished, the same waiter came with a big attitude, banding forks and knives against the plates and murmured in his mother tongue we couldn’t understand. Overall, I just want to say. If you charge a mandatory 18% “gratuity charge” beforehand, then you should act like you deserve it. 😥😥

We have been travelling for 5 weeks around the USA from Australia and I can honestly say this was the best coffee we have had to date.  Thank you so much Croft Alley and also do yourself a favour and try the waffles , you will not be disappointed...... simple but perfect !!!

I’ve been coming to this restaurant for many years. But I won’t be coming back.  The portions have gotten smaller and smaller. You pay close to $30 for a meal that does not fill you up. To make matters worse, they add an 18% gratuity before tax. What are they adding this gratuity for, I really don’t know. You order the food at the counter. All in all, you do not get value at this place. There are plenty of restaurants in the area that give you a decent plate of food without forcing an 18% gratuity down your throat.
